summary: Light, Bright, Eclectic 3 Bedroom Apartment in Central NE Portland.
space: You have your own private entrance to this light-filled basement apartment.  All three bedrooms are artfully decorated with sustainably sourced furniture and decor and include dressers and closets. The Singer Room has a queen bed.  The Venice room has a double bed. The Rose Room has a single bed.   Apartment features a well-equipped kitchenette with toaster oven, microwave, induction hot plate, electric tea kettle, blender, rice cooker, and french press (perfect for all the Portland coffee you will be drinking!).   The kitchenette also comes with a small dining table, and in lieu of a living room, all bedrooms are furnished with desks and chairs to allow guests to have privacy to relax. Bathroom has a tiled walk-in shower stall with fluffy towels included.

transit: The red and blue max lines are fifteen minute walk away.  The Trimet buses (77, 17) are two short blocks away.  Car2Go cars are regularly seen in the neighborhood.  Uber and Lyft are both readily available.

interaction: You will probably not see me or if you do I will be busy with one project or another. If you need help, have questions, need advice...please ask. I am very approachable, and I am available for questions and directions when requested, and quick to respond via text. I live in the upstairs apartment in the same house, both apartments have private access.
house_rules: Check-in after 4 pm Check-out at 11:00 am  Feel free to contact me if other arrangements (bag-drop, etc) are needed. Non-smoking inside the unit, 10 pm quiet time.

summary: Rest and rejuvenate from your adventures around PDX with a comfortable stay in my little black house. Convenient to all the things: Downtown, Convention Center, Inner N/NE/SE neighborhoods (Alberta, Mississippi, Williams, Belmont, Hollywood, Hawthorne, SE Industrial, etc.), restaurants, bars, gourmet groceries, dispensaries, food carts, a sauna/soaking spot, movie theaters, bus lines, and the MAX.
space: Modern, light-filled, and centrally-located. The little black house is a perfect place to start or end your adventures for the day.  Your bedroom is private, quiet, comfortable, and conveniently located to the shared bath. It's the perfect size for a solo traveler or couples and features a plush mattress with crisp, clean linens. If you have work to do or feel like lounging, you're welcome to make yourself at home in the main living/dining area. Listen to records, read the Sunday Times (delivered every week), have a snack or enjoy a cup of coffee using your favorite brewing method (pour over, french press, and aeropress are all at your disposal).  Is the sunshine calling? Take your coffee or brew to the backyard for some chill time, or enjoy a slow stroll through the tree-lined neighborhood to one of several nearby brewpubs, cocktail lounges, coffee shops, or restaurants. Rough day out in the world? Charlie, the resident cat friend, will instantly cheer you. He's snuggly, sweet, and lo

Convenient to all the things: Downtown, Convention Center, Inner N/NE/SE neighborhoods (Alberta, Mississippi, Williams, Belmont, Hollywood, Hawthorne, SE Industrial, etc.), restaurants, bars, gourmet groceries, dispensaries, food carts, a sauna/soaking spot, movie theaters, bus lines, and the MAX. Listen to records, read the Sunday Times (delivered every week), have a snack or enjoy a cup of coffee using your favorite brewing method (pour over,
transit: The house is just a short walk to multiple bus lines that will take you directly downtown. The MAX (light rail) station is a 15 minute walk away and will take you all over the metro area and right to the airport for less than $3. You can get to just about any of Portland's hot spots (Tasty & Sons, Katchka, Screen Door, Salt & Straw, and Voodoo Doughnut) within a 5-10 minute Uber/Lyft ride from the house.  If you feel like staying local, there are lots of bars, restaurants, coffee shops, etc. within walking distance.
access: You'll have your own key to the house and will be free to come and go as needed.  Aside from your bedroom and the bathroom, you'll have access to the kitchen & living/dining room. The backyard, which includes a patio table, charcoal grill, and fire pit, is also available to use.  During quiet hours (10pm-8am), the backyard is closed for guest use. Guests staying a minimum of three nights are welcome to utilize the house laundry facilities.
interaction: I've lived in the city for 13 years and am happy to recommend things to eat/see/do that are off (or on) the beaten path. I work during the day and am often out and about on the evenings/weekends. Of course, you are welcome to come and go as you please.  If I know of a cool band playing, a quirky local event going on, or a new restaurant/bar in town, you can bet I'll let you know about it. I love meeting and talking with fellow travelers! That said, I'm not at all offended if you need/want a little more quiet and privacy during your visit.  When not at home, I'm a text, email, or phone call away.
house_rules: - Please don't handle or play the musical instruments. - No smoking inside the house of any kind.  - Beyond those accepted as part of your initial reservation, NO ADDITIONAL GUESTS OR VISITORS allowed on premises.  - Do not leave fire pit or grill unattended and please extinguish completely when finished. - Backyard is closed to guest use during quiet hours (from 10pm - 8am)

summary: • A unique COED, hostel-style room with both a queen-size bunk bed (double occupancy) AND a single-size bunk bed (single occupancy).  • NOTE: This is NOT A PRIVATE ROOM. If you are not interested in sharing a room with other travelers please do not book this listing.
space: READ FULLY BEFORE BOOKING • This listing is for the TOP QUEEN bed only. • Each listing is for ONE BED ONLY and NOT THE FULL BUNK NOR FULL ROOM.  • A booking for 2 guests will share ONE queen bed in the bunk.  • NOTE: Additional cost for second guest in the queen bed.  • NOTE: This is not a private room. *Other guests may book the other three beds in this bunk-room and share the accommodations with you.   There could be anywhere between 1 to 6 guests in this room at a time. 4 is more typical.  • Close to everything: See neighborhood description. • On the bus line • This room is on the main floor and is just off the entry way near the front door. It is an east corner room facing NE Broadway St. (main thoroughfare).  • This house has a total of 7 rooms; two-story Craftsman home/guesthouse. **Additional rooms available** Check out our other listings through our profile page. **AFTER BOOKING REFER TO YOUR AIRBNB CONFIRMATION EMAIL FOR INSTRUCTIONS & ACCESS INFORMATION.

transit: Close to several bus lines, as well as the red and blue max lines at Lloyd Center. - The big internet search engine (which shall be unnamed) is great for directions to/from our place.  1734 NE Broadway - TriMet (Portland's public transit) has an app that you can install on your phone that will allow you to purchase transit credit and have it loaded on your phone (there is a $5 minimum charge through the app). (website hidden) - A 2 hour ticket cost $2.50  - An all day ticket is $5.00 (buses take cash only and don't give change)  - UBER is now available in Portland!! YAY! - For the classic cab we recommend Radio Cab: (phone number hidden) and they also have an app. (website hidden) Portland also has both Car2go and ZipCar if you have memberships to either/both.
access: • Our house is set up for self check-in, so please review the house manual and house rules for all the info. **Please be sure to read both completely before your arrival and let us know of any questions you may have.  • Although self check in is available, it is helpful for us to know what time we can expect your arrival. Please shoot us a message on the app when you know your ETA then... The front door has a code lock. The combination will be provided in the reservation confirmation email from Airbnb after booking. • You will have access to your room and all communal areas. The only areas off limits are other private bedrooms. Otherwise, please feel free to be at home here in the common areas. • The toilets upstairs and down are available for anyone in the house. The showers in the bathrooms are reserved for the floor that your room is on... Downstairs guests use downstairs showers and upstairs guests use upstairs showers. • There is no curfew. You may come and go as you please with r
interaction: SPECIAL OFFER:  We offer each of our guests one complimentary INTRODUCTORY coaching session with either of us. You can speak with us about it during your stay, message us via the app, or email us: (EMAIL HIDDEN) (Ian) or (EMAIL HIDDEN) (Sharmil) to set up an appointment. Sessions are generally an hour long and can be done in person during your stay, or via phone/video chat if we don't have an opportunity to meet with you while you are in town. And, if you are interested but want to know more about what we do, we are happy to answer any questions.  Ian & Sharmil live at our Pine St location, but Sharon, Sharmil's mother, lives upstairs and will be often on hand for any questions, advice, or emergencies (or for a motherly hug).
house_rules: FIRST THINGS UPON BOOKING:  1. Please read the HOUSE MANUAL and house RULES that are in your Airbnb confirmation email.  • You might need to look in your spam folder if it's not in your inbox and/or use a computer vs the app to access the manual as it doesn't alway work on mobile devises.  • Our address, all house access info, instructions on finding your room, WIFI codes, etc as well as conduct expectations are all listed there. • They will guide you around the house in the event of self-check in.  • **Please prepare in advance by familiarizing yourself before your arrival and letting us know of any questions you may have.** WALKING LIBERTY ~ HOUSE RULES Many of the house rules would be considered commons sense to some and yet, we have found it prudent to be specific.  If these seem straight forward to you then wonderful! You will have a very easy stay. If these seem challenging or irritating then you may prefer accommodations elsewhere.  ~ This is a smoke and drug free house.  • If y

summary: This quiet, relaxing, one-bedroom apartment is full of natural light and comfort feeling of home. Located in Sullivan's Gulch with many great feats of Northeast Portland. Perfect for the creative type needing an aesthetically pleasing environment.
space: I have taken the time over the last few months to create the space I have available for you in my residence. Being an artist, avid traveler, and a Southwest native, I have put much thought into creating a warm and inviting space that is a collective of what I've acquired throughout my adventures over the years. I'd like to say I've got eclectic taste that has influenced curating a hip spot that you'll want to return to over and over again. The natural lighting on both sunny and overcast days makes the space very photogenic, in addition to its functionality. Kick your feet up and make yourself at home. The couch is big super comfy for a third guest.

transit: The light rail (Lloyd center MAX stop) is a 10 min walk. There are many bus options and you can bike downtown in about 15 min. Uber and Lyft are readily available in Portland.
access: You can enter the apartment through either the front door or back door.
interaction: I travel often, but will be able to greet you upon check-in, and depending on the length of your stay, upon checkout as well.  The apartment is private and you may or may not have interaction with any of the neighbors at all.
house_rules: No parties. No smoking. Please be respectful of the space. If there are any issues, questions, or concerns, do not hesitate to give me a call. Thank you. :]

summary: My home is a great central base for exploring Portland. Minutes walk to MAX (Red line to/from airport and several lines into parts of the city). You'll have a great bed, WiFi, ping pong, and private back yard with a gas grill. Come relax and explore the city from Hollywood!  My suite is on the second floor, so I'm happy to give you reign of the main living area while you are here if you prefer more privacy for movies, lounging, etc.. Enjoy!
space: My 1924 updated Craftsman is a very clean, comfortable place to call home base during your stay. As I bought the house in November it is still a work in progress, so I continue to invest to make it better with each stay and your feedback. Looking to create an updated mid-century modern feel, but mostly just clean, minimalist, and comfortable.  Clean sheets and high quality linens, washer/dryer and all the amenities. I have separate living quarters on the 2nd floor with my own half-bath, so I am happy to give you majority run of the 1000 sq ft. main floor during your stay if you prefer. Im not insulted! You should be comfortable! Watch a movie on my 60" TV, enjoy some PlayStation4 (if I am not using it upstairs anyway... Dibs!), play some guitar (electric and acoustic), piano, drums, ukulele, or listen to music, cook, or just hang out in the sunny back yard with a game of ping pong. Weber gas grill for your use. Reliable WiFi and a very comfortable bed make this a relaxing place to stay

transit: MAX to downtown is about a 7 minute walk, and then about a 20 minute ride for $2.50. Or take the city bus that stops right in front of the house to the gorgeous NW 23rd neighborhood! Easy access to I-84 and I-5 highway to get where you need to go. Off street parking available. Easy 20 minute drive to/from the airport.  Bus #12 on Sandy Blvd within minutes walk takes you downtown directly, or #77 to the beautiful NW 23rd neighborhood, which stops directly in front of my house.  Note: day passes for bus and tram are $5.00 and are valid for both, as well as the new light rail trains. Buy once and travel all day. To get to the house by car from the airport: drive west on I-84 and take Exit 2 for 43rd St. Turn right off the off ramp onto Halsey and then left onto 47th St. Just a few blocks to the corner of Broadway and 47th, where my house is located. Free street parking. From the airport with MAX light rail: Take the red line directly from the airport (the only line that runs from PDX) to
access: Just provide me a 4 digit PIN for the keyless entry and access is a snap. Please try to be relatively quiet after midnight and make sure to lock the door and close windows when you come and go. Free parking on the street (Broadway or 47th).
interaction: Happy to point you in the right direction if you are looking for some suggestions around PDX. I work in the city, sometimes from home, but happy to leave you to your own thing while you stay. Some guests like to cook or BBQ together, and I am happy to share a table if you'd like.  My suite is on the 2nd floor, so you are fully able to enjoy movies on a 60" Samsung tv on your own in the living room, listen to music, play some guitar, drums, or piano, and just enjoy the stay. Your call! I'm not insulted if you just want to quietly relax on and watch Netflix. :)
house_rules: Quiet hours after midnight, please - earlier if outside out of respect for my neighbors. Smoking is allowed outdoors. Please do not bring additional friends or guests into my home without permission first - this is a matter of security and unfortunately something that has come up a few times with previous guests. No pets, I'm afraid. As long as you wash up after yourselves you are of course welcome to cook and grill to your heart's content!

Note: Can fit 6 adults with an available air-mattress for use in the nursery bedroom.

summary: This full-floor suite with separate living, bath, and bedroom areas comes with your own private deck tucked into the forest.  Perfectly situated close to the city center,  Forest Park, NW 23rd restaurants and shopping, yet quiet and secluded.  You’ll love your stay because of the design touches, location, coziness, and views.  Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
space: Our 3-level contemporary home is comfortably modern, close to the city yet tucked away on the edge of Forest Park. The suite we make available is approximately 800 square feet of space perfect for living, sleeping, and relaxation. Our home is filled with tree-filtered natural light and has been furnished with both design and comfort as priorities.  The bedroom features a comfy Parklane queen size mattress with premium linens, comforter and pillows (down or down-alternative available). There's also a small refrigerator and a Nespresso coffee maker. The living room welcomes you with a plush sectional, HD AppleTV with Hulu, HBO, and Netflix. The deck off of the living room is a prime spot to relax and relive the day's adventures. The bathroom has a spacious toilet/shower area with separate vanity. We provide towels for your use during your stay. Shampoo and soap are also available.  Wireless internet, Sonos sound system, and easily-accessible power outlets allow you to have a mobile offic

transit: We recommend you reach our home via car.  There's plenty of street parking and parking permits are not required. We're about 30 minutes from PDX airport. Taxis, Uber, and Lyft are all available in Portland and can all pick up/drop off at PDX. Public Transportation - Our home is located approximately half a mile from Bus Route #20. Please note that the walk from the bus is quite steep.
access: The suite is located on the lower level of the house. You'll share the main entrance with us and then head downstairs to your space. This space will be your private oasis. We live on the main and upper levels of the house and will not occupy your space during your stay.
interaction: We love independence when we travel, and we'll assume the same of our guests. We are happy to help you navigate Portland and the surrounding area, either on or off the beaten path. Please don't hesitate to ask.
house_rules: - Quiet hours 11pm-6am

summary: Our place is in the Heart of NW Portland, Rose Garden, Japanese Garden, Forest Park, Pittock Mansion, Pearl District, NW 23rd Ave, and Providence Park. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).
space: This 700+ sq ft rental is the entire top floor of the house. It is a very open floor plan with high ceilings. There is a mini bar that includes a mini refrigerator, microwave, and bar stools.  The entire space was recently remodeled and finished in September 2016. Everything in the space is brand-new.
description: Our place is in the Heart of NW Portland, Rose Garden, Japanese Garden, Forest Park, Pittock Mansion, Pearl District, NW 23rd Ave, and Providence Park. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids). This 700+ sq ft rental is the entire top floor of the house. It is a very open floor plan with high ceilings. There is a mini bar that includes a mini refrigerator, microwave, and bar stools.  The entire space was recently remodeled and finished in September 2016. Everything in the space is brand-new. Enjoy the top floor all to yourself or taking in the views from the deck. The bathroom is down one level at the top of the stairs. Guests can choose to mingle with us on the main floor if you'd like to chat or get tips from Amy on all of the fun things and trendy eats on the Westside. If the Eastside is more to your liking John can offer tips on finding a great city park, a great brunch spot or info about the Columbia Gorge. Most times we will be
access: Enjoy the top floor all to yourself or taking in the views from the deck. The bathroom is down one level at the top of the stairs. Guests can choose to mingle with us on the main floor if you'd like to chat or get tips from Amy on all of the fun things and trendy eats on the Westside. If the Eastside is more to your liking John can offer tips on finding a great city park, a great brunch spot or info about the Columbia Gorge.
interaction: Most times we will be here to greet you and show you to your "stairway to heaven". We will be around to help with directions and suggestions. Might even be available for trips to and from Pdx just ask!
house_rules: - We have 2 super friendly cats who roam the house.  They will most definitely want to check out your room, so make sure you close and lock the door if you are not a cat person. - There are many steps in your stairway to heaven.  You will have the entire 3rd floor to yourself, and you will have the best views in the house -Please leave shoes at front door. We have new hardwood floors. - Please Do Not park in the driveway. You can park across the street just past the mailbox. There is also a spot just up the hill on the left side.

space: A perfect room for one or two travelers in my Arbor Lodge bungalow home.   This bright light room looks out onto my back yard and garden.  The sliding glass door opens onto a deck and into the tranquil back yard.  There's a grill and outdoor eating spaces as well. I have a large vegetable garden, figs, plums, raspberries, blueberries, asian pears and plums.  My home is comfortable and clean and when you stay here you have access to the entire house.  We are conveniently located to many trendy neighborhoods in Portland.  Public transportation (Portlands Max line) is a few minutes walk from the house. There are bicycle pathways all around us and if you are driving easy access to the freeway and within minutes of downtown Portland.  The Mississippi and Albert Arts districts are within easy access, as are many wonderful restaurants, and events.   Hiking, skiing , the Oregon coast are all within an hour from my home.   I have lived in Portland for over 15 years , am an active outdoors perso

summary: Located in the Arbor Lodge neighborhood of Portland Oregon, our comfortable home offers a private comfortable King bedroom (with extra single bed) & full private bath on the 1st floor.  Close to all our fabulous city of Portland has to offer.
space: *No cleaning fee* Your spacious private room on the 1st floor includes a pillow-top KING bed, a comfy twin bed, a cozy chair, room for your suitcase, with lots of hooks and a closet for your use. Room is a spacious 13' x 11'. Your full private bathroom with tub and shower is just outside of your door. Hair dryer, shampoo/conditioner, liquid soap, hand cream, bedding, towels, etc are all provided.  Two robes area also provided for your use. --- *If more space needed, we have another listing for our basement apartment  - includes queen bed, bath, kitchen, etc.  Details here: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/2569391

We have a wonderful gas stove, microwave, toaster oven, vitamix blender, food proc
transit: For public transit, the Max line train is a short 1/2 mile walk (12 minutes) from our home and can take you all over Portland.  This same Max line goes to and from the Portland international airport (the Max terminal is outside of baggage claim), so if you don't have a car, there is no problem using mass transit to easily reach our home.  Also within a 1/2 mile walk is zip car options (if you're a member of this car sharing network).  We are also within the Portland metro parking area for Car2Go (if you're a member of this car sharing network), so you can usually find these within a block.
access: You are welcome to store your perishables in the fridge.  We have a wonderful gas stove, microwave, toaster oven, vitamix blender, food processors, etc that you are welcome to use for cooking or just heating up your leftovers.  There is also a coffee maker with coffee you can make or a selection of teas (there is also a great coffee shop on the corner- Sexy Coffee).  If you like, you can watch TV with us in the living room - we take our TV viewing very seriously, so we have a large TV with surround sound. A cozy dining room room is also available.  Our real treasure is our backyard.  It is somewhat of an urban farm and we welcome the chance to give a tour and talk about our plants and landscaping. On the patio is a table, chairs, chaise lounges, and BBQ to use (seasonal).  In the summer, we will have a badminton net set up, for a rousing game or two.
interaction: We respect our guest's privacy, so this is as much or as little as you like. Almost any time of year has so many options for things to do and it is just a beautiful city.  We welcome the chance to host visitors in our home and will tell you all about this fabulous place.... if you ask.  Our amazing city of Portland, Oregon is a wonderful place to live and we like to say it is like being on vacation every day.
house_rules: We are very easy going and just ask that you respect us and our home.  Only rules are no drugs, no smoking inside (smoking outside on the patio - away from house door- is fine), no outside guests, and no pets.

summary: This private basement space has a sitting area, lots of books and magazines to review, a desk, and a small refrigerator for drinks and snacks. The bedroom is a comfortable size with egress window and closet. The bathroom is brand new with an amazing shower. Kid and family friendly.
space: Our house is in a great North Portland neighborhood, and only 10-15 minutes to downtown or other great spots.  From our house you can walk to great restaurants and bars. If you have a third person, a comfy camping mattress is available.  If you have kids: We have two small children and know that traveling with little ones can be hard on everyone. We have a pack and play available and sweet camping mattress for bigger kids. We have tons of kids books and space for them to play.  Harpers playground, one of the best play areas in the city, is one block away.

summary: Located in the Arbor Lodge neighborhood of Portland Oregon- our comfortable home offers guests the entire finished basement: queen bed, living room, full kitchen, full bath, pool table, ping pong. Close to all our fabulous city of Portland offers.

summary: LOTS of room!  The perfect place for a solo traveler (be sure the number of guests is accurate in the RSVP). The guest room is located on an isolated basement level.  You'll have your own bathroom and tons of space to spread out.  The room offers terrific peace and solitude.
space: I travel a lot for my job.  So, I am extremely sensitive to providing a great space for travelers.   I live in a simple, but spacious house (2100 square feet) in a quaint and quiet neighborhood in "NoPo."  The guest room is located on a private floor in the basement of the house (1000 square feet).  You'll have your own bathroom as well as a living room space.  This equals a whole lotta room to spread out.   Unfortunately, the space and bed are not ideal for anyone over 6 feet tall.  The garden in the backyard is tranquil and the front deck is lovely on a sunny day. I have made some nice upgrades recently -- new lighting system, a small fridge, TV and now Apple TV with free HBO available. The house is cozy, laid back, and as stated above - simple.  I offer a no frills space - no kitchen and no microwave.   Internet/wi fi access is offered. Street parking is also available. I think you'll be hard-pressed to find a place as spacious and private in a shared house as this one.  Please take

access: You have an easy back door access to the space (it's much more than a "room").  Laundry room is also downstairs, but I will make sure it is not in use during inconvenient times.   Small fridge and coffee maker are available for your use.
interaction: I tend to let the guests have their peace.  You'll hardly know I am around if you wish.
house_rules: No smoking, No drugs, No exceptions.  Yes, pot is legal in Oregon, I appreciate your observance of this statute. No visitors in the house.   No overnight guests.

summary: This is a large 1 bedroom home that has a full kitchen, dining room, bathroom, and living room.  It is adjacent to Arbor Lodge Park and has a great backyard for grilling.  It is within walking distance to local restaurants, bars, and groceries.
space: This large ranch style home features an open living room and dining room area with lots of natural light. The dining room has a large expandable table that can seat up to 8 people. The bedroom has a very comfortable queen bed and the living room couch can fold out to sleep an additional 2 guests. There is a full kitchen, complete with a dishwasher, 5-burner gas range, and double oven.
description: This is a large 1 bedroom home that has a full kitchen, dining room, bathroom, and living room.  It is adjacent to Arbor Lodge Park and has a great backyard for grilling.  It is within walking distance to local restaurants, bars, and groceries. This large ranch style home features an open living room and dining room area with lots of natural light. The dining room has a large expandable table that can seat up to 8 people. The bedroom has a very comfortable queen bed and the living room couch can fold out to sleep an additional 2 guests. There are lots of great bike routes that you can use as well, including Willamette Boulevard which is a scenic bike ride up to St. Johns neighborhood.

summary: Our comfortable 1940's Cape Cod has been completed updated and is ready to host you in Portland! Make yourself at home in the clean, tranquil basement suite with queen sized bed, seating area and breakfast nook. The Arbor Lodge neighborhood has great old-Portland flair with easy transit access (downtown in 15 minutes), many great restaurants and cafes, and lovely parks to enjoy. We look forward to having you as our guest!
space: The basement suite includes a large room with queen sized bed and organic cotton sheets, comfy seating area and breakfast nook with a proper Stumptown coffee pour-over set up.  Your bathroom is directly across the hall - freshen up in the cool blue space stocked with soft towels. Our laundry room is located in the basement too, which guests are welcome to use. We'll occasionally be downstairs, but otherwise the basement is a very private space for our guests. Very light sleepers, please note that our forced air heater is in the basement and during cold weather it will kick on and run at intervals between 7:30 am and 10:00 pm.

transit: Walk, ride, train or ride share easily right from our front door. The MAX (Trimet train) stops just 100 feet from the front door. Or cruise the bike lane directly in front of our home. Plenty of free on-street parking available. Highway access is a breeze - we're right off the Rosa Parks exit. The Columbia George is about a 45-minute drive from our home. The Oregon coast is about an hour and a half from here by car.
access: Guests are welcome to use our well equipped kitchen for meals. Feel free to eat el fresco on our back patio!
interaction: We're happy to be as personal or private as you'd prefer. Please let us know if you'd like our help discovering our favorite spots in town. However, feel free to explore and discover on your own, if that's your style!
house_rules: Please contact us to discuss accommodations for your pet.

summary: Enjoy a private 3-room suite: living, bedroom & bath, in lovely 1910 Craftsman home. Residential, centrally located NE neighborhood. Close access to public transit or walk to great shopping/food districts.  Explore like a visitor, live like a local!
space: Make yourself at home in your spacious suite on the 1st floor of our 1910 Craftsman, rich with character and warmth.  Centrally located in one of Portland's vibrant, close-in residential neighborhoods, you'll be blocks away from restaurants, shops & parks and just 10-15 minutes from the airport and/or downtown.  Your cozy, private accommodations will be the perfect landing pad to relax in during your visit! You will share the front door with us, and once inside the lobby you'll find the French doors to your suite. Your living room has soothing earth tone faux finish walls, hardwood floors, coved ceiling, bay window, table for 2 and comfy furnishings including a futon couch that folds out to a full sized bed (for up to 2 more guests, extra charge). Enjoy your kitchenette with mini-fridge, microwave, electric kettle, 1-cup drip coffee maker and basic kitchenware. Sit by the window and admire the front gardens, do the crossword puzzle with a cup of tea & conjure up your plans for the day.
description: Enjoy a private 3-room suite: living, bedroom & bath, in lovely 1910 Craftsman home. Residential, centrally located NE neighborhood. Close access to public transit or walk to great shopping/food districts.  Explore like a visitor, live like a local! Your living room has soothing earth tone faux finish walls, hardwood floors, coved ceiling, bay window, table for 2 and comfy furnishings including a futon couch that folds out to a full sized bed (for up to 2 more guests, extra c
transit: We're in a central spot where you can walk to coffee shops & restaurants! We're also mere blocks away from several bus lines that will take you pretty much anywhere you need to go.   There is a convenient bicycle rental place a few blocks away, if you want to explore on 2 wheels. You can park your bikes right inside our entry lobby, for safety.  If you have a car, Portland is a very easy place to navigate.  We're 10-15 minutes from the airport and about an hour 1/2 to the coast or Mt. Hood (opposite directions!). There are lots of great day trips to be had!
access: You'll have access to a lock box on the porch that'll contain your key. It unlocks the front door of the house (which we also use) and also unlocks the inner doors to your private 3-room suite. The fully furnished south end of the furnished front porch is all yours to enjoy! The rest of the house & the backyard is our living space and will be off limits to guests.  Street parking is usually available right out front but if not, there should be plenty of parking within a one block radius.
interaction: One of us may be around to greet you as you arrive but we are active, working folks so we may also be out and about, depending on when you get here. We will be on the premises during your stay, living in the rest of the house.  We will be readily available by text, email or phone for any concerns that come up but it's our intention to be respectful of your space & to be as minimally invasive as possible during your stay. Of course, if you're interested in chatting and our paths do happen to cross, we'll be delighted to visit with you as our schedule permits, to answer your questions or give you the inside scoop on our favorite Portland haunts! We have 2 indoor/outdoor male cats - Smitty & Jonze - that are very friendly. They will likely be interested in greeting you when you're in the common space. Your private accommodations aren't accessible to the cats unless you invite them in. They're allowed outside and have their own door back into our part the house, so you never need to worry
house_rules: To give us enough time to prepare the suite for our guests, our check in and check out times are 3pm and 11am, respectively. If you would like to make arrangements to drop off your luggage early, send us a message and we'll try to make it work. This seems obvious but you ALWAYS have to lock the front door of the house when you come and go.  Try to be gentle when closing the door - it's old and noisy. We want you to really make yourselves at home in the Sweet Suite!  Please feel very free to talk, laugh, play music and have friends over. Quiet hours are between midnight and 8am.  Smoking weed in your suite or on the front porch is fine with us:) Tobacco smoking (even tobacco vaping) is NOT allowed inside but you can smoke on the front porch as long as the windows are closed. Linda gets migraine headaches that can be triggered by strong perfumes, body sprays (like AXE) and other heavy scents.  Although the Sweet Suite is private, these scents have a way of lingering and we need to clean

summary: It would be a joy to have you as a guest in my extra room on the edge of the Alberta Arts district.  Relax in a space filled with lush plants and local art.  Enjoy a beverage on the porch and watch the sunset or the hummingbirds in the feeder.
space: This private room has beautiful wood floors, a north facing window, and a small closet.   Homemade quilts adorn the bed.  It is a part time artist studio and part time weekend getaway. There is a small collection of books you are welcome to enjoy during your stay.  Coffee and tea will be provided.

I am also able to offer suggetions on food, sight seeing, transportation and any other fun stuff I can share about Portland. transit: Located a short 15 minute drive from PDX with ample street parking.  Two major buslines are within 3 blocks of the home and can connect you with the lightrail and/or take you right downtown.   Easy connections to bike friendly streets and a very walkable neighborhood.
access: You will have access to the kitchen, living room, upper porch and backyard.

house_rules: I ask that we interact with respect, kindness and clear communication.   My neighbors are great folks and I ask that you honor quiet hours after 10pm. Smoking is allowed on the upper porch or in the backyard. Pets and additional guests who are not listed on the reservation are not able to be accomodated.

summary: This private cozy cottage is in a quiet neighborhood with it's own outdoor patio space, sleeping for three and all the convenience amenities.  Close to downtown, Emmanuel Hospital, and restaurant and entertainment districts.
space: This private, stand alone cottage has all the amenities, fresh surfaces and great ambiance!  Cable HDTV, wi fi, desk/work space. Living room sofa opens to twin bed.  Kitchen with dining area has full size stove, fridge, microwave; assorted dishes and cookware.  Separate bedroom has queen bed.  Bathroom has shower.
description: This private cozy cottage is in a quiet neighborhood with it's own outdoor patio space, sleeping for three and all the convenience amenities.  Close to downtown, Emmanuel Hospital, and restaurant and entertainment districts. This private, stand alone cottage has all the amenities, fresh surfaces and great ambiance!  Cable HDTV, wi fi, desk/work space. Living room sofa opens to twin bed.  Kitchen with dining area has full size stove, fridge, microwave; assorted dishes and cookware.  Separate bedroom has queen bed.  Bathroom has shower.  Guests have access to the entire cottage and the surrounding yard and patio.  They use the driveway to walk back to the cottage, but should not park there.   Hosts are available by phone/text for directions, advice, recommendations, and tips for experiencing Portland and Oregon. Our charming cottage is located just off Martin Luther King Blvd (MLK) in walkable  close in N.E. Portland neighborhood near restaurants and cafes. Trendy Alberta St. and William
transit: Easy access to PDX airport and major freeways: I-5,  I-84 (Columbia Gorge), and Hwy 26 (Mt Hood, Oregon coast).  Street parking available.  TriMet bus stops for downtown Portland are 2 blocks away on MLK.  This bus also connects to Max Light Rail service to downtown, the Portland Zoo, Japanese Gardens, and Arboretum, or the airport. There are  designated bike routes in the neighborhood and throughout the city.
access: Guests have access to the entire cottage and the surrounding yard and patio.  They use the driveway to walk back to the cottage, but should not park there.
interaction: Hosts are available by phone/text for directions, advice, recommendations, and tips for experiencing Portland and Oregon.
house_rules: The cottage is in a quiet neighborhood and we request that you keep the noise down after 10 pm.  Our tenants in the front house are friendly and cool, but please respect their privacy.  If you have questions or need help, call me. Please smoke outside.   We love dogs and they are allowed on a case by case basis and with the understanding they are well behaved and that owners pick up after them.  The yard is fenced, but not secure for a motivated dog.

summary: Our house is in a great walking neighborhood near downtown Portland known as the Alberta Arts District. Easy access to public transportation, close to the airport and plenty of cafes, restaurants and unique shops nearby.
space: The house is 1250 sq ft cottage built in 1927 that's charming and homey on a quiet street. The yard is private with nice landscaping. There are two bedrooms upstairs and an office downstairs with a single fold-up bed. There's one bathroom that is compact, clean, and modern with a jacuzzi tub. There's internet access along with a 42" flat-screen TV, Apple TV and stereo. The house is nicely decorated with original artwork including paintings, drawings and prints.

summary: This is a wonderfully private and comfortable room with a very comfortable King bed.  Located in the middle of NE Portland.  Great access to all of Portland.  This is really a wonderful place to stay while getting to know Portlandia.....
space: I have a total of five rooms, each listed separately in this unique mixed-use building where I also live and work. You will enter via a private, secure, gated entrance off of MLK at NE Failing street and follow the stairway up to the second level. This is the mid-size of the three rooms. Each room is newly refurbished and furnished with beautiful, responsibly sourced tropical salvage out of Indonesia and locally re-purposed wood/trim doors and windows. Your private room comes with a window, a wall-mounted flatscreen t.v., free wi-fi an armoire, an ornate sink carved out of stone, down pillows, down comforters, a KING sized posturepedic mattress and zen colored walls that might just make you think you are in... Bali?

transit: Whether you are a new or seasoned Portland visitor, you will know that getting around the "City or Roses" is a breeze. This mixed-use airbnb space is just minutes from the pulse of Portland. Five short, walkable Portland blocks west, you will find the N Williams neighborhood...a mecca of great food, local craft brew, New Seasons Market, boutiques and you name it. N Williams is also the bike superhighway in Portland and within 15-20 minutes you can hop on a bike and be in the heart of downtown or Portland's Pearl District. N Mississippi and NE Alberta neighborhoods are also just blocks away.  Bike rental is available close by at Everybody's Bike Rentals and Tours If you have a car, neighborhood, street parking is available and easy to find. If you prefer to let others navigate, we are near several transit stops where Portland 's Tri-Met buses will take you into downtown in a matter of minutes for a mere $2.50 per adult.
access: Guests have access to the following shared spaces: A green space/rooftop deck, a small guest lounge/sitting area indoors with small library, complimentary Nespresso and fridge. Guests also have complimentary access to a shared washer and dryer, bathroom with separate shower room. Detergent and shampoo provided at no cost. Since this is a mixed-use space, on-site or next door you will find several amenities close to home including a bakery, restaurants, a salon, barbershop as well as massage and acupuncture by appointment.
interaction: I suspect and hope to have interaction with my guests since I live and work onsite too. As a busy entrepreneur and visionary, my work often takes me on the road so you may also be interacting with Chali, a friendly face who helps me manage my airbnb bookings, as well as the housekeeping.
house_rules: Be respectful and courteous to others.    Smoking is Allowed on the deck...please be careful with butts and do not leave them around! Quite hours are from 10PM to 9:30AM We are 4/20 friendly.... Pets must be leashed when coming and going from guest rooms and they must not be allowed to sleep on the beds.

summary: This beautiful art filled Alberta home is prime location to enjoy portland or to stay in and enjoy a beer or a glass of wine on the friendly front porch or tranquil, secluded back yard. Meanwhile the lively, tasty scene is just two minutes away!
space: This home was built in 1912 and had a major renovation in 2009. It is a quiet, tranquil location where you can escape the hustle and bustle of urban living. The house is a 2 bedroom 2 bath (bedrooms and one bath are on the second floor; kitchen, dining, living, music room, and bathroom on the first floor) with an amazing back yard and deck. Including a great front porch to lounge the day away. An incredibly comfortable inflatable mattress is available if desired to accommodate up to six people.

transit: Buses all around town can be reached in a quick walk from the house. It is 10 minutes from the Airport and 15 from Downtown via car. One would only wonder why you would need to leave the neighborhood as so much is available by foot.

house_rules: This is a quiet neighborhood and your respect of the neighbors and the environment is necessary. No parties or loud events are allowed on this property. But with that said we want you to enjoy yourself.  No smoking is allowed on the property at any time, and your full deposit will be retained if this rule is violated. We do not take responsibility for your children or property during your stay. Please close and lock doors and windows while you are away.  We are sharing our art with you and wish that you respect it appropriately.  Garbage is collected every other week, so please separate your glass into the green bin, all other recycling (paper, plastic, cans, etc) go into the Blue bin. Table scraps go into the compost bin.  Please be mindful of the next guests and let us know if any issues arise, if any of the supplied amenities are used up, or there is anything else that needs to be addressed. Two keys will be in the lockbox, please only take one. The second key will be a spare and is

summary: Come stay with a friendly couple and two loving pit bulls in a close-in, remodeled home surrounded by beautiful, edible gardens.  Centrally located between Historic Mississippi, Alberta Arts and North Williams Districts and only 3 miles to downtown.
space: Enjoy your stay in Portland by coming home to this beautiful space shared by a couple (Trish and Tad) and their two loving and energetic pit bulls, Mabel and Andre. MUST BE OKAY WITH DOGS to stay here. The space is cozy but modern with a remodeled interior, gorgeous kitchen (may be partially under construction) and SHARED BATHROOM.  Gardens fill the front and back yards, and guests are free to sample whatever edibles might be in season.  The guest room is now in the BASEMENT (new photos to come soon) which offers more privacy and cooler temps in the summer months. We have a very high quality queen size latex mattress that would fall more on the firm side of the spectrum.  There is closet space and all the amenities you would need for a short stay.  As above, the bathroom is shared, though this has never posed a problem in the past as we are quite low-maintenance.

transit: The #6 bus line has a stop 1 block away on Failing and MLK (look up details on the Trimet website).  Otherwise, if you have a car there is free, ample street parking.  If biking is your mode of transport (easy to rent from multiple shops), we have a bike rack on the porch.  Arrival from Portland International Airport: 1. If taking public transportation (60 min, $2.50, very easy): - Board the MAX Red line to City Center/Beaverton TC. - Get off at Convention Center station (~28min) - Walk east on Holladay (the street the MAX runs) to Grand Ave, then turn right (south) until you see the bus station on the east side of the street. Less than a block. - Take the #6 bus line north to Failing/MLK (~8 min) - Walk east on Failing to Grand Ave, turn left (north). My house is the second home on the east side of Grand. 2. If taking a taxi, it should cost about $35 and take ~20 min.  Traveling from my house to downtown: 1. Walking to the Pearl
access: Guests will have access to the full kitchen, front-loading washer/dryer, wireless internet, expansive back yard with a beautiful deck for relaxing in the sun or grilling on the BBQ.
interaction: Trish or Tad will likely be present upon check in to provide a house key and tour. If we are not available, we can provide a key through a lock box. Our schedules are generally pretty busy, but we're happy to share a meal, chat over morning coffee, or simply provide recommendations and let you enjoy and explore Portland on your own.
house_rules: 1. If you are uncomfortable interacting with dogs (especially pit bulls), I might suggest booking elsewhere 2. We keep the house clean and tidy, and hope our guests will do the same.  We'd appreciate if shoes can be removed at the front door.  3. If we're working the next day, we generally try to keep the volume down after 10:30pm but you're free to come and go as you please.   4. Sorry, no smoking or pets allowed.

summary: Relax in this 100 year old open concept home. Fir floors throughout with modern lighting, travertine floors, a spacious kitchen and tranquil yard. This is a very walkable neighborhood.
space: Our home is ideal for a couple or a small family. The main bedroom upstairs has a king bed. If you have 3 or more people staying we can set up an AeroBed (air mattress) in the main floor bedroom otherwise, this room will be blocked off. The living room has 2 couches but neither are pullout sofas.
description: Relax in this 100 year old open concept home. Fir floors throughout with modern lighting, travertine floors, a spacious kitchen and tranquil yard. This is a very walkable neighborhood. We are across the street from Irving park which has tennis courts, kids park (with water feature in the summer), basketball courts, baseball diamonds and a soccer field. Whole Foods is 8 blocks east and New Seasons grocery store is 8 blocks west. Coffee shop
transit: Our long driveway parks 2-3 vehicles depending on size. Public transit, Trimet, is very easy to navigate. We are close to several bus lines: 24 (Fremont, is on the corner but only runs weekdays), 6 (3 blocks west on MLK), 8 (8 blocks east on NE 15th). Zipcars are on Fremont and 14th (7 blocks east). The Max and Street car are a mile away (south on 7th).

summary: Welcome to our brand new guest house! Modern, light and airy, our place is located in the heart of NE Portland, and is within a ten minute walk to an array of restaurants, food carts, grocery stores, public transportation, bars and shops.
space: Our brand new guest house is adjacent to our home. It sits quietly in the back yard and above our painting studio. It's an open, airy and modern loft-style home with reclaimed fir floors, shelving, vanity, and doors. The reclaimed Doug Fir wood was sourced locally and has the beautiful patina of time. The queen size bed has a super comfy natural latex foam mattress and in the loft there is a fold out sofa with a full size memory foam sleeping pad(Please note that the loft is not an appropriate sleeping area for younger children due to the stairs and railing). The loft also boasts wonderful views looking out over the neighborhood and is a wonderful spot to chill out with a book or watch a movie. The art collection includes works created by the two of us(we are painters/photographers) and by other local artists. You are also welcome to come visit the art studio downstairs. The kitchen is fully loaded with brand new appliances and cookware and each guest is treated with coffee, creamer (d
description: Welcome to our brand new guest house! Modern, light and airy, our place is located in the heart of NE Portland, and is within a ten minute walk to an array of restaurants, food carts, grocery stores, public transportation, bars and shops. Our brand new guest house is adjacent to our home. It sits quietly in the back yard and above our painting studio. It's an open, airy and modern loft-style home with reclaimed fir floors, shelving, vanity, and doors. The reclaimed Doug Fir wood was sourced locally and has the beautiful patina of time. The queen size bed has a super comfy natural latex foam mattress and in the loft there is a fold out sofa with a full size memory foam sleeping pad(Please note that the loft is not an appropriate sleeping area for younger children due to the stairs and railing). The loft also boasts wonderful views looking out over the neighborhood and is a wonderful spot to chill out with a book or watch a movie. The art collection includes works created by the two of u
transit: We are within walking and biking distance to Williams Ave, Mississippi Ave, Fremont Ave and Alberta Street, and approximately a 15 minute bike ride to downtown Portland. There are several bus stops close by and parking is always available on the street in front of our house. A great bike rental shop is within walking distance as well.
access: Guests have full access to the house and the backyard. Guests are also encouraged to visit the painting studio.  Please note *** This not an anonymous vacation rental experience. It is not a hotel. The house is in our backyard and you will encounter us from time to time as we go about our daily lives which is part of what makes Airbnb so special. Our home is your home! We are avid travelers as well and love to hear about your adventures here in Portland/Oregon.
interaction: We are returning Super Hosts to Airbnb after a short hiatus to build our new guest house, please see our excellent reviews at the bottom of the page for our other listing.  Check in time is 3 pm and check out time is 11 am, but we try to be as flexible with guests if they need to arrive or leave earlier or later. One of us will always be there to make sure your stay is comfortable, but we do our best to give guests the privacy and space they need. We have lived in Portland for a combined 35 years so we are full of recommendations for places to eat, activities, bike rides and must sees. We are always available by phone/text to answer any questions or help out if needed.
house_rules: • Check-in time is 3PM. Like most places, no drugs, smoking, parties, extra guests, or pets. Quiet hours are from 10pm to 8am. Be respectful of the space and our neighbors and we will all get along beautifully. Please remove shoes when entering the house. We would also prefer that people refrain from frying meats on the stove (fish/bacon) out of respect for our vegan and vegetarian guests.

summary: Come stay in our wonderful home! It is a separate apartment that takes up the upper floor of a big old house with windows on every side and lots of charm. The back deck faces east and is a nice place to enjoy a cup of coffee in the morning. The neighborhood is great - we're close to everything!
space: The apartment feels big and cozy at the same time. Big windows in each room let in lots of light and the east-facing porch off of the kitchen is great for morning coffee. All of the rooms are a nice size - there is a bedroom with built-in desk space, a living room with a large sectional couch, a nice bathroom and a big kitchen with a gas stove and some very cool old wallpaper!

summary: Stay in our backyard cabin in Portland's fun Mississippi / Williams neighborhood.  Walk to locally-owned restaurants, cafes, breweries and artisan shops. Easy access to public trans. Rent bikes close-by. Short drive, bike or bus ride to Downtown. LGBTQ Friendly.
space: The 220 sq ft cabin is new (2014) green eco-friendly construction with locally harvested sustainable blue pine floors and trim and reclaimed vintage doors and fixtures.  The queen bed comfortably fits a single traveler or couple, or two friends who don't mind sharing a bed.  Bathroom has step-in shower, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, towels and hair dryer. French press, electric water kettle, and mugs are provided for you to make a quick cup of coffee or tea before going on your daily adventures. Mini-fridge keeps drinks or leftovers cold. Large windows look out onto rambling yard with a mixture of woodsy NW native plants, berries, fruit trees, vegetables and a rotating cast of local birds, squirrels, raccoons and opossums.
description: Stay in our backyard cabin in Portland's fun Mississippi / Williams neighborhood.  Walk to locally-owned restaurants, cafes, breweries and artisan shops. Easy access to public trans. Rent bikes close-by. Short drive, bike or bus ride to Downtown. LGBTQ Friendly. The 220 sq ft cabin is new (2014) green eco-friendly construction with locally harvested sustainable blue pine floors and trim and reclaimed vintage doors and fixtures.  The queen bed comfortably fits a single traveler or couple, or two friends who don't mind sharing a bed.  Bathroom has step-in shower, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, towels and hair dryer. French press, electric water kettle, and mugs are provided for you to make a quick cup of coffee or tea before going on your daily adventures. Mini-fridge keeps drinks or leftovers cold. Large windows look out onto rambling yard with a mixture of woodsy NW native plants, berries, fruit trees, vegetables and a rotating cast of local birds, squirrels, raccoons and opossums.
transit: From PDX Airport: 20 min cab ($35) or 65 min public transportation combination of light rail and bus ($2.50). Bus Lines: major bus lines are within a few blocks of our house, which can get you downtown in 20 minutes or connect you to other buses to get you all around the city. Plan your trips online with Portland Trimet Trip Planner.  Parking: there is free street parking on our block if you have your own car. Bicycles: Our house is located on a Portland bike route which makes biking around the city a snap.  Bring your own bike or rent one nearby at Everybody's Bike Rentals.
access: You are welcome to share our covered back patio.
interaction: We'd love to get to know you and tell you about our city.
house_rules: - No smoking (of any kind) in the cabin or on our property - No additional guests on our property unless you run it by us first - No gatherings or parties - Clean up after yourself and leave the place in the same condition you found it. This includes cleaning dishes, bagging up trash, and cleaning up any spills, tracked mud, etc. - Respect our neighbors and neighborhood. Keep in mind we live amongst families and working folk who like to get a good night's sleep (ourselves included) so keep it down after 10pm - Outdoor grill is not for guest use

summary: We love our home. The light enters from all directions, with gardens on both sides of the home. We are located in historic Piedmont neighborhood, on a quiet street. Easy access to downtown, the Alberta Arts Dist.,and pub. transport.
space: Our home is spacious, comfortable, with easy access for outdoor living as well. Here you can be with a group of 8 and have private areas to be by yourself in the garden, sitting rooms, porch or deck. In the summer there are berries to pick and the oldest rose garden in Portland to walk to. We are close to the upcoming Williams corridor, the Alberta Arts District and Mississippi. Peninsula Park is just blocks away, as well as a local McMenamins pub. Our local Farmers Market is 5 blocks away every Sunday where you can partake of great local food and music. We do have 2 super friendly cats who will stay put, be cared for by our neighbors, but otherwise the home is all yours as we will be on vacation. Our kittys are friendly will not be a nuisance to any children. We will be sure to have someone here to let you in and you will receive our guest guide so that you can feel at home here in Portland for your visit.

transit: Walking, biking, easy public transport on buses, or the Max line, Zip cars and Car2go are popular short term rentals.
access: You will have the entire home. We do have cable TV, but will turn off On-Demand portion of cable.
interaction: Even though we are not here we will be available to you to answer any questions you might have.
house_rules: We have a couple of house musts: Please take your shoes off when you enter the home, so as to preserve the beautiful floors. We also want you to know we have 2 friendly sweet cats. They can be cared for by our neighbors, so as not to burden you. Absolutely no smoking of any kind whatsoever in the house. We do live as neighbors with others and ask you to keep sound down outside after 9pm. Even though we have a cleaning fee, we ask that you leave the house as you found it, orderly, relatively clean and neat. Please put your linens and towels in the washer and turn it on (we will take care of the drying), and make sure all dishes are clean and put away. Thank you and enjoy your stay!

summary: The Space The room is sweet and with a queen bed. Our home is a 1923 bungalow, with charm. Enjoy our cedar hot tub in the backyard. We are close to EVERYTHING! Also we can accommodate 1 or 2 extra people in a different small room for an additional fee, just inquire.
space: Our home is a 1923 bungalow, with charm. With a big open front area and then small rooms throughout. Your private room with Queen bed is cozy and sweet.  We have another small room that we call the den, it can accommodate 1 or 2 more guests traveling with you. Just ask. Our room is upstairs but we will be sharing a bathroom, also small but very functional :) Our kitchen is well equipped with dishwasher, gas stove, and a Vitamix, ready to create some rockin' smoothies.  Enjoy our cedar hot tub in the backyard, there will be robes ready for you! We also enjoy watching movies in the living room with our projector, expect an invitation to come hang out. Guests have always mentioned how well they sleep and how much they love the location!

access: We have a great projector/movie watching zone with large screen for those nights you want to stay in and be mellow. Plus a Tea + Coffee Bar and use the full kitchen, including the Vitamix and hot tub! We also have a piano and guitar that guests are welcome to play.
interaction: We work outside of the home most days, but typically enjoy our mornings here. We work long hours and but when we can love to be home to cook dinner. We want your stay to be comfortable and will be available for any questions or ideas on Portland.
house_rules: We want you to feel at home and comfortable here. Really all we ask is that you treat our home as you would want your own guests to treat your home. We will be respectful of your personal space and comfort and expect that you'll do the same for us. Check in is after 1pm and check out before 11am. We can always make special arrangements if needed. No Shoes Please. This helps keep our house clean. If you would be more comfortable pack slippers, socks or flip flops to where. If you forget we have ones you can use. Kitchen. We welcome you to use our kitchen. We are a small operation and therefore we cannot offer maid service for the kitchen privileges. To keep everything running smoothly please consider the following guidelines: If you use the kitchen to prepare food, please leave it the way you found it. Including, but not limited to, putting dishes in dishwasher, washing pots & pans and putting them away, wiping down counters or any soiled surfaces.  Bathrooms. We have only one bathroom

The space includes a well-stocked kitchen, dining area, living room, private bedroom and bathroom with washer/dryer. Perfect space for a couple, business traveler or small family! Pet Friendly!

summary: 2 bedroom day light basement apartment with separate entrence. Spacious bedrooms and bathroom just 4 blocks from all the popular restaurants and shops in the Alberta Arts District. Short drive to downtown PDX. Fantastic transit and bike score!
space: Our space would be great for a couple, group of friends, small family, or single traveler! We have free street parking available and we are so close to both Alberta and Mississippi streets, which offer many great food, drink, and shopping options. We will welcome you to the home and give you the tour and any important information you may need to know. You will then have your privacy for the remaining of your stay, but we will always be available for any questions or recommendations! We love people and our city so feel free to ask away!

transit: Convienent public transit all around. The bus stops 2 blocks away from our home to get you anywhere in the city. We are a quick and easy 15-20 minute drive from PDX airport. We provide a cruiser bike for our guests to borrow during their stay to explore the nearby areas, upon request. If there is space in the driveway, you may park there to unload your car, but please find parking on the street for the remainder of your stay.
access: Guests will have access to 1 fully furnished bedroom, 1 living room/bedroom, 1 spacious master bathroom (with double sinks), washer and dryer, kitchenette (including coffee maker, mini fridge, and microwave), and backyard! If we are not home to greet you upon your scheduled arrival, we will send you the code to our lock box key, which will gain you access to the home.
interaction: We will be available throughout your stay to answer any questions you may have or to offer recommendations. We live in the upstairs unit, but your lower level apartment is completely private with your own private entrance.
house_rules: No smoking in the home, but you can smoke in the backyard or anywhere outside the house. Also, please be mindful of turning off lights when not occupying the space.

summary: This comfortable and eclectic home is located right in the middle of the vibrant Alberta Arts district, short walking distance to some of Portland’s best restaurants, coffee shops, boutiques, and bars.
space: Built in 1908, this classic Craftsman Four-Square has been lovingly restored and updated. There are comfortable spaces for reading, relaxing, playing games, and reading. There’s a washer and dryer in the basement and space for two cars in the driveway. The house has high speed internet (no cable) and is stocked with books and games for rainy days.

Our neighborhood is a foodie paradise—in addition to many excellent restaurants, the Alberta Cooperative Grocery is one block away and the gou
transit: The house has a driveway long enough for two cars and there is plenty of street parking for additional cars. Downtown is a quick ride on the #8 bus which stops one block away at Alberta and 15th. East Portland and Mississippi District can both be reached on the #72 which stops on Alberta and 18th, just a block and a half from the  Portland has just introduced BIKETOWN! BIKETOWN is a easy way to use bikes for a day or just a couple hours with a pick up station located close by simply go to the bright orange station, (There's one on NE MLK and Emerson) use a credit or debit card to secure your bike and go. You can drop it off at the same place you picked it up or use the built in GPS to locate a drop off close to your final destination. 2.50$ for a 30 minute ride which will get you downtown and beyond or 12$ for an entire day of adventures. And Car-To-Go is plentiful in the area if you'd like to rent a car for a short trip.
access: Guests have full access to the house but not the studios in back.
interaction: I am easily accessible by phone for questions or assistance.

summary: You will love staying in an original Sears Kit House 1913 Craftman Bungalow. Colored plaster walls and ceilings, wood floors, mood lighting, modern amenities.  It is very private, tastefully decorated with original artwork, and resides in a quiet neighborhood in the middle of a very busy city!   Find tranquility in the Japanese-inspired garden.  Walking distance to Alberta St, foodies galore, shopping.  Use the full kitchen, including condiments, complimentary coffee! Great house for toddler too
space: Our 1913 Craftsman bungalow welcomes you with its warm feel of home. Natural woodwork everywhere, colored and Venetian plaster walls and ceilings everywhere.  Superb deck right off the kitchen, irrigated garden with gravel paths. summary: We have a very cozy house that is perfect for a family looking for a place to stay while exploring our beautiful city. We are on a bus route, which makes traveling easy. There are tons of eating/drinking options within walking distance. We are situated near Alberta, Dekum Triangle, and Killingsworth restaurants and bars.
space: The main level of the house is all original 1912 construction and gives off a wonderful charm. On the main level is a living room, dining room, kitchen, full bath, and two bedrooms.  The second level of the house is newly remodeled this year. It has a office, tv room, and a master bedroom with a walk in closet and a 5 piece bathroom.  There is an unfinished basement with washer and dryer.  The backyard has a wonderful patio with a large seating area, and is fully fenced.

summary: Come warm up and enjoy heated travertine tiles in kitchen, bath and entryway. Private entrance and full gourmet kitchen. Enjoy this incredible neighborhood with a near perfect walk score and return to your cozy lair to recharge.

description: Stay in my wonderful little house - walkable to the hip Alberta Arts District and Dekum neighborhoods, with easy public transit access downtown. The room is perfect for a single traveler or a couple. Welcome to Portland! The room is quite small at a mere 80 sf. There are two options for sleeping - a twin daybed or a king bed (please specify with me when reserving). Although the room is small, you should find that is has everything you need while visiting Portland The house also includes a shared living and dining room, kitchen, bathroom and backyard patio for your enjoyment. Please make yourself at home!  That said the basement, the owner's room and the garage are not accessible for guests. The house comes with a TV in the living room. We don't have cable but use Apple TV to stream content. If we cross paths, I can offer you suggestions of places of interest, the best restaurants and bars, etc. I am a working professionals and gone during the week on typical work schedules.  I typicall
transit: Street parking is readily available. The  bus is a quick 5 minute walk and the house is located near numerous bike boulevards.
access: The house also includes a shared living and dining room, kitchen, bathroom and backyard patio for your enjoyment. Please make yourself at home!  That said the basement, the owner's room and the garage are not accessible for guests. The house comes with a TV in the living room. We don't have cable but use Apple TV to stream content.
interaction: If we cross paths, I can offer you suggestions of places of interest, the best restaurants and bars, etc. I am a working professionals and gone during the week on typical work schedules.  I typically leave my pup Mason at home during the weekdays he does really well with guests and he'll likely win your heart.
house_rules: I love pets, but they are only allowed on a limited basis and with an extra fee. Please no smoking inside house and if you do smoke, please be aware of any open windows or doors. I am a working professional and like to keep a calm, quiet house, I ask that you respect that as well. If you're looking to go out on the town and party back at the house, this is not your listing. No parties or overnight guest without the permission of the host. Please feel free to enjoy your time in the house, but I ask that you clean up after yourself and leave the house as clean as you found it, as it is my home. Feel free to cook a meal or two, with access to the fridge, stove and cookware, but again please be respectful and clean up after yourself. There is only 1 bathroom in the house and most of the time you'll be sharing it with one other person, please be respectful of not occupying it for too long. And lastly, please close and lock all windows and doors when you leave.

summary: This is a great clean, thoughtfully furnished house in Alberta Arts. Tucked on 16th Avenue it's two blocks from Alberta, walkable to everything. Your room is private, near the rear of the house and looks out to the backyard. It has a nice queen sized bed.
space: The house was built in 1912, and has maple hardwoods running through the main floor. It's light and bright, thoughtfully decorated. Pretty open layout in general, with a functional kitchen for cooking if you'd like. Tall ceilings make it feel spacious. The room is one of my favorites in the house with south and west facing windows, it gets the afternoon sun.

house_rules: The only strict rule is to clean up after yourself. Generally I go to bed around 11ish, so I ask that you don't make a ton of noise past that time. If you get home later than that just try and generally be respectful of the space.

summary: Come stay in our spare bedroom! We live one block off popular Alberta street, with shops, restaurants, and bars. With easy access to one of the hippest neighborhoods, regular bus routes to downtown and SE, this room is a great base for your trip.
space: My boyfriend and I own this house and have a friendly, quiet, social roommate. The location is perfect--a block away from the hip Alberta Arts district where you can find food, wine, beer, music, knitting, a dispensary, and much more. The house is three bedroom and 1.5 bathroom. The street outside is a little busy, so you'll get a little traffic noise. People from San Francisco usually laugh when I say this, because it's not that bad to them. Our cat's name is Bisous. He's a handsome beast and is passively friendly. He'll likely want to sit next to you on the couch. But don't worry--he's hypoallergenic. He doesn't produce the protein humans are allergic to (true story). Our dogs, Kobe Beef Dog and Nimbus the Pup, will insist on sitting right next to you and playing with stuffed animals. They're extremely friendly, once they bark their welcome to you.  You'll have access to the yellow room, the full bathroom upstairs, and the entire main floor. We also have a deck, a fire pit, and a gri

access: You'll have access to the yellow room upstairs, the bathroom upstairs, and the entire main floor, plus the backyard with the fire pit, grill, and deck.
interaction: We'd love to hang out and host a game night to introduce you to people from the area. But this is entirely up to you. We like to go hiking and city exploring, so if we're all up to it, let's get out and explore.
house_rules: No smoking and avoid eating our roommate's food. He pays an exorbitant amount shopping at absurd places.

summary: Our charming turn of the century home has contemporary accents and furnishings. It's filled with local artist's works, which gives each room its own personality. Mississippi, the Convention Center, Adidas, Emmanuel Hospital, etc. is awesome for business travelers and culture-seekers.  Hwy access, bridges, 2 parks & community center are right here.
space: We have two bedrooms available to choose from. This posting is for the back bedroom. We occupy the upstairs bedroom and office.  Your room is on the main level on the south side of the house. summary: Guest room with private bathroom on the 3rd floor of my cozy modern condo. Perfect home base for travelers ready to explore Portland. Everything you could need is within 3 minute walk of my place, including public transport. Pets welcome.
space: It's a really nice modern 3-story town house built in 2008 designed with Japanese influences. The first floor is a mudroom and attached garage, the second floor is a kitchen, living room, patio, and half bathroom with hardwood floors. The third floor is carpeted two bedrooms and two bathrooms, one of which will be your space.  Within 1 block: Grocery Store, Dry Cleaner, Coffee Shop, Fantastic Breakfast Restaurant, Bar, Nike Store, Marijuana Dispensary, and Public Transit Access. Within short walking distance (less than 10 mins): literally the best restaurants in all of Portland, a 25 acre public park, MAX lines, The MODA Center, the Lloyd Center shopping mall, Wonder Ballroom, Whole Foods.

As long as you're friendly and respectful, you're welcome to u
transit: Public transit: Located 1 block from the 6 bus which runs North/South on Martin Luther King and offers accessibility to everywhere in Portland. The MAX is super close too which can get you anywhere. The Uber wait is also only about 3 minutes on average and because of the central location won't cost you more than $15 to get to most of the popular Portland spots. If you are driving, you have an attached garage so parking is a non-issue and you are within a few minutes of freeway entrances to the i-5, i-84, and i-405.
access: As long as you're friendly and respectful, you're welcome to use the whole place except for my bedroom/bathroom.  If I am not present, you are more than welcome to lounge on the couch in the living room and watch the big screen TV or play some XboxONE or use my Netflix.  If I am present, I do reserve the right to ask you to not hang in the living room if I am in need of some personal space. Feel free to use the Kitchen and anything in it, just be sure to clean up and use the dishwasher. You are also welcome to play with my sweet puppy Morgan!
interaction: I am a pretty sociable guy but also very capable of being invisible if that suits you, but I will be present in the house when you rent it. If you're the private type, the living room will be our only potential interaction between checking in and out. If you're the social type and we get along, who knows maybe I'll even show you some of my favorite spots personally.  I am happy to provide a variety of recommendations on where to eat, shop, explore; I know this city like the back of my hand and have my thumb on the pulse of what is happening here...
house_rules: I say "Smoking Allowed" but not in the house, it is only available on the patio which is attached to the living room. As long as your pet is friendly (my dog is super friendly with all) you're welcome to bring them. It's all about respect. I am a very friendly, approachable, and willing to help guy. As long as you're aware that you are entering into my home and respectful of me, my dog, and my stuff, there won't be any issues.  Our bedrooms are in somewhat close proximity, so I will ask that if you are coming/going late, or a night owl, that you are very quiet between the hours of 1 am-7 am.

summary: Welcome to the largest room in the house. Privacy offered by curtains all around. Essentially you are staying on the bottom level of the house. Residents ONLY upstairs (our rooms). Uber comfy pillow top bed and Big screen TV, DVD player, Wifi, Chromecast Device & HDMI cable for your relaxing pleasure. Guests have their own shelf in the bathroom.  Guest Cabinets in kitchen are on the right hand side-cups & pans.  Shelf for food.  Easy to get to from the airport. Close to public transportation.
space: This space is the living room in a classic older Craftsman home. The room is large with high ceilings, a ficus tree and a uber comfy Queen size pillow top bed.  **Please note there is not a door however curtains all around offer privacy. *** It is a big old house, it gets drafty and the sound carries.  The curtains on the window facing the street are made for light and noise control. This room is good for couples, solo adventurers and business travelers.  There is a blow up mattress with foam topper available if need be.
