summary: Our place is close to the trifecta of Portlandy-Portland charming neighborhoods including N. Williams, N. Mississippi and N. Alberta; plus downtown, the Pearl, NW 23rd, the Convention Center, and more.  You’ll love our place because of it's feel, light and arty ambiance, cleanliness and terrific location.  It's perfect for for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. A shared washer and dryer (brand spanking new) are just up the stairs for your use.
space: Your space includes the front bedroom of our four-bedroom house. Your room comes with it's own private bathroom with tub/shower. It connects right to your bedroom and access from the second door can be locked off so you can truly create your own little suite.  (The back bedroom is also available for guests).  Outside your door, find shared living, dining and kitchen, with an inviting front porch for the summer months. We do have a little terrier mix. He's super in to people, but be prepared for a short ice-breaking period.  Heidi works from home and is in and out during the day. You can set up camp on the dining table if you have work to do yourself. The kitchen should have everything you need, or walk to one of 30 bars, coffee shops and restaurants within a 1.5 mile radius.

summary: We love our location with easy access to all the bars, restaurants, organic grocery stores & amazing shops of Williams and Mississippi. The large common area, modern kitchen, spacious bedrooms and relaxing charm will make you feel like a local! Our recently fenced side yard gives you the space and privacy you need to expand your stay. Enjoy our home while we enjoy the sights and sounds of Europe - our co-hosts will make sure you have everything you need for a great trip!
space: Our three bedroom, two bathroom spacious craftsman bungalow includes original 1909 fir floors in the living room and dining area with period charm in architectural features. description: We love our location with easy access to all the bars, restaurants, organic grocery stores & amazing shops of Williams and Mississippi. The large common area, modern kitchen, spacious bedrooms and relaxing charm will make you feel like a local! Our recently fenced side yard gives you the space and privacy you need to expand your stay. Enjoy our home while we enjoy the sights and sounds of Europe - our co-hosts will make sure you have everything you need for a great trip! transit: We chose this house due to its great walkable location. N. Williams Ave. is two blocks away, and the heart of N. Mississippi Ave is half a mile away. Our street is very bike-friendly and nearby N. Williams Ave. and N. Vancouver Ave. are excellent bike streets. Nearby NE Martin Luther King, Jr. Blvd is a major thoroughfare with excellent bus routes. The Portland Streetcar is about a ten minute walk away for easy mass transit access to downtown and the Pearl District. There is plenty of safe street parking near our house, and a car will provide  easy access to downtown and the Pearl District by way of the Fremont Bridge. NE Fremont Ave. is also a major thoroughfare that makes driving across town to southeast Portland relatively painless. Portland has Über and Lyft, but our standard taxi companies (particularly Radio Cab) are also excellent. Tell any Taxi driver to take MLK to/from the airport, as it is faster and more direct than taking the highway.
access: Guests will have access to the entire house, including our three TV's (one is a 65" 4k Ultra-HD Smart TV with a PS4 and cable (including HBO). There are 10 different taps on the kegerators (8 on CO2, 2 on nitro). If there happen to be beverages in the taps, guests can help themselves, but we do not guarantee that there will be anything in the taps, as this is not a service or good we provide for profit. We have a private fence and paver patio with a stretch of grass in the backyard and guests are welcome to make use of the yard, patio, and BBQ (please clean up after yourself).
interaction: We will be out of town while you stay in our home but are available via Airbnb app or phone.
house_rules: Guests must abide by all local laws, including noise ordinances. Though our house is reasonably private and located on a corner lot, excess noise from speakers or other amplified devices must be avoided. There may be home brewed beverages in the kegerator taps. If the taps are left unlocked, guests may help themselves to the contents of the kegs (growlers and growler fillers are available, as well), however guests may not adjust the gas lines/regulators/CO2 tanks. Likewise, guests must clean any messes made by the service of the beverages before any damage is done to the wood floors. We are non-smokers. Guests should avoid smoking indoors. Our outdoor tables and chairs are acceptable places for smoking. Yes, this includes cannabis. While our guests are welcome to enjoy the legally-available medical or recreational marijuana laws in Portland, please do so in the backyard or on the porch. Edibles and other smokeless cannabis products may be used in the house. We love our neighbors and th

summary: This house is a floating home on the Columbia River! It's located 10-15 minutes from the Portland International Airport, 10 minutes from NE Portland's Alberta St. Art District and only 20 minutes to downtown Portland. This is a wonderful space for families, couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and furry friends (pets)!  Come refuel and relax; snuggle up in front of the fire sipping some coffee/tea or melt worries away in the hot tub overlooking the water.
space: It is cozy yet spacious year round. Summer all the windows and doors are open to the River and the wildlife- osprey out fishing, the heron that comes to the dock nightly. Fall is delicious and always an Indian summer, long nights by the outdoor fireplace. Winter comes and the doors and windows close but the melody of the rain on the metal roof and on the water is sublime, the marina is quieter and the hot tub is a coveted place to watch the salmon run and the sea lions come up the river and surface. The gas stoves in the master bedroom and living room make the ambiance a totally different space. Come enjoy it year round.

interaction: We (Me or Mady and Kessey, my assistants) are always available via text and sometimes I am around to meet and show the house features myself. I travel a lot and enjoy having the home be enjoyed by everyone. It has always been a dream of mine to share this home for families and friends to gather rest and relax. Thank you for making that dream a reality!
house_rules: Check in and out is flexible depending on if another geust is arriving. When we have back to back reservations check out at 11 is firm and check in is at 4pm. We love for you and yours to enjoy the place summer and winter as each season has its charms! We found that summer time the river swimming on the lower deck and hot tub kept people entertained and I. The winter-  it's quiet peaceful  sleeping the views of the marina and Yahats, fireplace tea, board games and family time. Overall we want to you want to stay as long  as possible and already plan when you are coming back!

summary: I typically only host when I am out of town which is usually on the weekends. I have a cat, Mimi, who can be a lover, but who can also be sassy and mean. There are tips to have a more comfortable stay, which I include on a cheat sheet for all my guests (and revise as I get more feedback and host more people). If you understand the temperament of cats, and want a basic apartment to stay in in Portland, my place is worth considering.
space: I typically only host on Friday and Saturday nights. I live in NE Portland by the Rose Quarter. There are bars, bicycles, parks, public transportation options, movie theaters, restaurants, and shopping spots near me. My favorite restaurant in Portland is 8 blocks away and is called Blossoming Lotus! I live with my cat who I brought back from Alaska. She is all white and her name is Mimi. Because of her being a cat with white hair, there are sometimes Mimi hairs floating around/ stuck on furniture (though I will try and clean it up as best I can and of course sweep). She is not a lap cat, and only likes to be pet minimally. She has been known to bite and scratch, but she is usually good about giving a warning.  I am willing to host someone for a couple of days, typically only on the weekends. If I am out of town, you would have my entire apartment to use, as long as you don't mind taking care of Mimi too. She is easy to care for- food, full water dish, litter box. It may sound obvious,

summary: Your room is the master, with a super comfy king bed & french doors.  Our home is a beautiful craftsmen with cove ceilings, intricate flooring, and gorgeous windows. There are 3 wonderful women who live in the main house. The location is a beautiful and peaceful neighborhood that is central to many parts of Portland. Business travelers find the location quite convenient to the Convention Center & the Lloyd Center. The cherry on top is the spacious master bath with a large Jacuzzi :)
space: This is a beautiful historic home with some fun and modern updates. We love the fine craftsmenship of the house. and we take joy in our living space. Your bathroom, shared with one housemate, is the master bathroom - which is spacious, light filled, and has a large jacuzzi available for use! In addition to the three friendly ladies, there are two cats who mostly live upstairs and rarely enter the Sea Charm room. The listed room is the my room and is available when I (the owner) am out of town. You'll have a large comfy king bed and french doors to the backyard deck. The house is a shared, two-story, older house, with three women living in it as well.  Therefore we provide earplugs for light sleepers. We've indicated that there is "free street parking on premises," because we often get this question. To clarify, there is plenty of free street parking available in our low-density residential neighborhood. :) Our business guests often enjoy walking to the Lloyd Center or Convention Center

transit: This is a super convenient location in many respects. It's very central for traveling by uber/lyft or your own car. If you like walking there are many cute areas within 2 miles, and downtown is about 2.5 miles. It's easy to take the bus or to walk 1 mile to the MAX. The city's bike share program also has a station just a few blocks away!
access: In addition to your room and bathroom, you'll have access to the kitchen, dining room, living room, laundry room, and backyard.
interaction: As my room is available while I am traveling, you will be provided with the information from Nicole, my lovely housemate who serves as the guest liason. You can contact me as a back up! You may cross paths with me or the 3 roomies while you are here and/or guests we have over, but it's also quite possible the house will be quiet and you may not meet any of them! If you see us, please say hi! We respect your privacy, and we appreciate when guests acknowledge us and are cordial with us in our home. Also, if you need anything immediately, feel free to ask any one of us.
house_rules: -There is a space heater for your room which you can use as needed. If a guest desires to adjust the central heat, follow the instructions on the furnace control. - On Fridays Check ins, your room will typically be available at 4:30pm, though absolutely feel free to drop your bags, relax, and use the spacious bathroom anytime after noon! If you need earlier room access on a Friday check in, message me and let me know! Happy to accommodate!

summary: Our Home We live in the sweetest little duplex in the beautiful historic Irvington district. We're smack in the center of town only minutes in any direction to major shopping streets, award winning restaurants, coffee shops, and entertainment. Our home, built in 1912, has all the vintage charm and character that you expect in this historic neighborhood.  Come stay with us and enjoy all that this beautiful city has to offer
space: We love our cozy little home filled with vintage finds, plants, and art. Being an interior designer, I am constantly moving around furniture or bringing in new finds which make our space unique. When you're here, you'll feel at home.
description: Our Home We live in the sweetest little duplex in the beautiful historic Irvington district. Our home, built in 1912, has all the vintage charm and character that you expect in this historic neighborhood.  Come stay with us and enjoy all that this beautiful city has to offer We love our cozy little home filled with vintage finds, plants, and art. Being an interior designer, I am constantly moving around furniture or bringing in new finds which make our space unique. When you're here, you'll feel at home. Our open concept kitchen is available for use at any time! We have lots of cook ware, cups, plates, and cutlery for all your culinary needs.  Coffee and teas are complementary so feel free to enjoy some local loose leaf blends from Jasmine Pearls or fresh roasted beans from various roasters around town.  Our bathroom is shared. We have a
transit: We are less than .5 mile to the MAX station at Lloyd Center and one block from the bus stop which makes public transportation the ideal means of getting around town. Everybody's Bike Rental is close by if you want to get around like a local as well as BikeTown bike share on 15th and Broadway. Lyft and Uber are also great alternatives as well as Car2Go and ZipCar. We are less than 5 minutes to downtown, Hawthorne, Alberta, and Mississippi neighborhoods and about 15 minutes from the airport. We have lots of street parking and two private spots for your car as well. Irvington is a very walk able neighborhood with lots of historic homes to see so don't be afraid to explore by foot!
access: Our open concept kitchen is available for use at any time! We have lots of cook ware, cups, plates, and cutlery for all your culinary needs.  Coffee and teas are complementary so feel free to enjoy some local loose leaf blends from Jasmine Pearls or fresh roasted beans from various roasters around town.  Our bathroom is shared. We have a beautiful vintage soaking tub for showering or a nice bath!  Our living room, sun room, and backyard/front patio are available to you anytime before 10pm when we request a quite time on the property.
interaction: We have 3 wonderful pets living here with us. An 7 year old pug named Cookie, a 10 year old Pug/Beagle mix named Fiona, and an impossibly tiny 3 year old orange cat named Katensia. The dogs love company and will definitely appreciate a little love but our cat is a shy girl so it's best to let her come to you.  We are glad to provide suggestions for activities around town, local eats, sight seeing opportunities, and what ever else you might like some help with. We are a Lesbian couple so you must be LGBTQ friendly.
house_rules: - We have a puggle and a cat so unfortunately we can't have any more pets in the home.

summary: Offering my big, sunny, hardwood-floor, Irvington neighborhood bedroom. Lots of places to walk to and plenty to utilize in the apartment during your stay! My schedule varies - I will either sleep in the living room, with a friend, or be traveling.
space: I may or may not be coming in and out of the apartment during your stay, including using the kitchen and bathroom, depending on my travel schedule. However, I will never enter the bedroom while you're there! Sometimes when I have guests staying in the bedroom I will crash on the couch and snuggle with the cat. Kitchen: I provide coffee and tea - though I drink them straight so you'd need to buy your own sugar or cream :) and you are welcome to the spices, olive oil, condiments in the fridge, and other cooking basics you see. Food and wine in the fridge and pantry is off-limits but I will leave you room for groceries! You'll find ample cookware, bakeware, and barware. There is no dishwasher so I do ask that you do your own dishes. Bathroom: Full shower and bathtub. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash provided along with towels and a hair dryer. Bedroom: Comfy queen mattress, two side tables, iPhone 5 charger, air purifier which doubles as white noise if you're like me and sleep better t

transit: Public transportation is easy! I am on two bus lines and am close to a light rail station. I provide you with a transit map upon check-in. Portland also has major cab companies as well as Uber and Lyft. There are many car rental options and I have had good experience with Budget and Enterprise. You are welcome to free nearby street parking in this residential area also.
access: Well, yours and the cat's anyway. You're provided with one set of keys and there is a buzzer system for letting in your travel partner if needed. You'll have use of the entire apartment, it's just that we may be sharing it. I will not enter the bedroom without your permission during your stay. Nice front courtyard area for sunny lawn-sitting.
interaction: *Please do not mention Airbnb to neighbors. If anyone asks, just say you are guests of Paige's. It's easier on everyone this year. I will meet you here upon arrival to show you around, give you keys, and answer any questions you have about the neighborhood or any of Portland's surrounding areas! If I'm not able to meet you at the time you check in, I will leave you keys and be available to message. I hike and camp a lot in addition to hitting the town so am happy to share tips for good places to go!

Lots of places to walk to and plenty to enjoy in the apartment during your stay! transit: Public transportation is easy! I am on two bus lines and am close to a light rail station. I provide you with a transit map upon check-in. Portland also has major cab companies as well as Uber and Lyft. There are many car rental options and I have had good experience with Budget and Enterprise. You are welcome to free nearby street parking in this residential area also.
access: The full apartment will be yours for the time you book! Well, yours and the cat's anyway. You're provided with one set of keys and there is a buzzer system for letting in your travel partner if needed.
interaction: I will meet you here upon arrival to show you around, give you keys, and answer any questions you have about the neighborhood or any of Portland's surrounding areas! I hike and camp a lot in addition to hitting the town so am happy to share tips for good places to go. *Please do not mention Airbnb. If anyone asks, just say you are guests of Paige's please.
house_rules: This is a very quiet and peaceful building. NO parties are allowed, and so you won't be bothered! Please be quiet and respectful of neighbors. So far I have neither had nor made any noise complaints. It's an old building with only a neighbor above and below, but no shared walls. I think you'll like it!

summary: This fabulous listing is located in the basement of a beautiful century-old home in Portland's Historic Irvington District. A private garden entrance leads to a large studio that accommodates 1 - 2 people. It is truly Portland at your door.
space: The studio is large yet cozy. The space includes a sitting area, comfy queen bed, plus a kitchenette and dining spot. The room is bright and has natural light that comes in through three windows. Serene and private, guests have a private entry in a lush garden setting. The property has rare and interesting plants sited throughout the garden which was designed by a locally renowned landscape architect. The neighborhood is eclectic, diverse and historical. Walk to everything!  Many of my guests have attended events at the Convention Center and have enjoyed my location for quick access to the center via Portland Streetcar. The room has been inspected by the City of Portland to make sure smoke detectors work and that there are multiple exits in the space in the event of an emergency--Passed with ease and the inspector complimented the studio and said, "This space is lovely."   The expression, "location, location, location" applies to my listing. Check out my guidebook for a mere sampling o

summary: Private bedroom and bath and shared kitchen, in quiet historic NE Portland near Irvington Park. Close by live music venues, public gym with drop in rates, great restaurants, craft beer halls, public transportation.  Street parking + Car2Go.
space: We have a large bedroom on the first floor with a private bath in large dutch colonial family home. The room has a queen size bed. If you don't want to share a bed with your traveling companion, there's a futon with  that can be pulled out.  This is the main room we rent out.  We also have another bedroom upstairs (not yet in the photos) with a double bed. This upstairs bedroom is available for stays in conjunction with renting the downstairs room. We have three adults, two friendly dogs and one cat here. Our home is a safe space for LGBTQ community, Muslims, Mexicans, disabled, and all minorities. If you you have a problem with that, kindly seek housing elsewhere. There is a fenced in back yard, and dogs that get along well with others will be welcome for short stays on a case by case basis. Washer and dryer in the basement.  Kitchen available for preparing light meals.  Although we are middle-age hipsters. We keep the place clean. You would feel comfortable having your mom stay with

transit: We live a short distance from the Fremont, Mississippi, and Alberta shopping areas - as well as the Lloyd and Convention centers. It's about a 12 minute walk to catch the Max train which will get you downtown and to and from the airport - among other destinations.  There is also the Tri-met service. Portland is also a Car2Go town. Rent a smart car for 13 cents/min. Drop it anywhere. Sign up for that before coming to town. And if you have your own car, there is ample parking out on the street. It's never a problem.
access: Guest enter through the front door. Our dogs will bark when the first time they meet you but will settle down. They are harmless. Feel free to come and go anytime. If you are having a big night of it, tip-toe in after hours.
interaction: This is a very large house. My cousin Scott and his wife live upstairs and one of them may greet you. They help us out a lot when we are travelling.  They both work a lot. You might see them in the kitchen, but they are out of the house most of the day.  The guest bedroom is the only bedroom on the first floor.  We have an extra guest bedroom upstairs, but we rarely rent that out. You will be the only AirBnB guest. The living room, kitchen, front and back porch are shared spaces.
house_rules: We ask that you be responsible for your guest.  Responsible drinking, not a problem.  Please no late night loud sing-a-longs. The kitchen available for quick meals. We might consider children for short stays.  But we aren't set up to supervise children. Sportsman, please keep your unloaded firearms in your suit case.

summary: Historic NE Irvington Craftsman Style Home built in 1914 Room rental-perfect for the woman traveler/visitor. Quiet residential neighborhood conveniently located near the  MAX train, bus stops, Lloyd Center Mall/Theatres, stores on Broadway St. on the Inner Eastside. Easy access to downtown, the Columbia Gorge, drive North into Washington. Walking, biking and public transportation all make it easy not to need to rent a car. There are many wonderful restaurants, cafes, shops to easily walk to!!
space: The room is located on the NE corner of the second floor with cross ventilation, the sound of the wind in the trees at night and a view over  my neighbors lovely garden. There is a full size bed  perfect for one traveler. Due to the shared bath I take female travelers only. Our location is ideal for easy access to the downtown, the Convention Center-for those who are here on business, for relaxing and enjoying all the city has to offer. We are 9 bock North of the 7th st. MAX station which can take you anywhere you want to go without having to rent a car at all! The neighborhood is called "Historic Irvington". You can find shops, bookstore, restaurants and public transportation all within an easy walk!

transit: Broadway and Weidler St.s offer bus transportation 1 block south you can catch the MAX trains into town, up to Washington Park to see the International  RoseTest Gardens, the Zoo, The Japanese Garden and Forest Park which is full of easy walking trails. 1 train stop over the river is the famous Lan Su CHinese Garden. From there you can walk into the Pearl for more shopping, theatre, galleries. The Union Train Station is a few stops away on the greenline. Car rentals are possible in various locations around the neighborhood as well.
access: Guests have use of the room and a shared bathroom through the hallway all on the second floor. There is a back yard that can be a place to relax as well. Breakfast can be reserved upon request and requires an additional fee if you are interested. Please give your host 24 hours notice and list any special dietary concerns at that time.
interaction: I live and work in my home and can offer suggestions for dining, maps, special sites to see etc. Again, if you are interested in breakfast I would need  to know 24 hours in advance or with you reservation. This is an additional fee of $15.00 per person. Thank you!
house_rules: I can provide guests with a back door key to come and go easily. After 10pm. the front door is locked for the night. It is easiest to lock the back door once you are in for the night. No Smoking on the premises....indoors or out... Keep food tightly wrapped if you have it in your room. Hot pot in the kitchen is available for tea and coffee.

summary: Typical craftsman style house with lively garden in quiet neighborhood. Cafe 26 across the street, Bridges restaurant (1 block). Multiple eating places within blocks, also bus routes, streetcar and Light Rail (3/4 mile). Separate entrance, open space (about 1300 sq.ft.), recent renovation by top-class designer. Brian and Swapna are retired professors, prejudice-free, with progressive attitudes, immigrants from Ireland and India. We have a house full of books and art.

The room is on the second floor on the opposite side of the house from our master bedroom so we rarely see guests upstairs. Nearby are many parks for hiking and swimming; as well as downtown St Johns. Adventurers welcome!

summary: My place is in quirky St Johns, just a few minutes walk from the neighborhood's main street and a short drive to downtown Portland. St John's boasts two local movie theaters, boutique shops, an active farmer's market, a wide selection of restaurants, several parks and one of the most beautiful bridges in the world. The house itself offers bungalow charm and plenty of outdoor space. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, families (with kids), and furry friends (pets).

summary: 2 bedrooms, full kitchen w/w&d, close to Expo Ctr, Hayden Isl., downtown St. Johns; easy access to U of Portland or downtown. Convenient to most of the city if you avoid peak commute times (mostly driving north on I-5 between 2:30 and 7 p.m. M-F).
space: It's not in any of Portland's trendy neighborhoods, but it is a clean space with w/d, full kitchen and easy access around North and close-in NE Portland. The Expo Center, Hayden Island/Jantzen Beach, P.I.R., Portland Meadows, Kelly Point Park, Pier Park, Kenton, St. John's, Smith and Bybee Wetlands (I know, you're thinking "it's Portland, it's all wetlands"... touche).   It's actually a duplex with a mirror image of the townhouse on the backside. You might hear folks through the walls upstairs (as you would at a hotel) or see folks walking around the building. It's cool (say hi, they're very nice--update: now it's me, shhh be cool). I've replaced the fold-out couch with something more comfortable for sitting. It's still suitable as a sleeping spot for one adult.
description: 2 bedrooms, full kitchen w/w&d, close to Expo Ctr, Hayden Isl., downtown St. Johns; easy access to U of Portland or downtown. Convenient to most of the city if you avoid peak commute times (mostly driving north on I-5 between 2:30 and 7 p.m. M-F). It's not in any of Portland's trendy neighborhoods, but it is a clean space with w/d, full kitchen and easy access around North and close-in NE Portland. The Expo Center, Hayden Island/Jantzen Beach, P.I.R., Portland Meadows, Kelly Point Park, Pier Park, Kenton, St. John's, Smith and Bybee Wetlands (I know, you're thinking "it's Portland, it's all wetlands"... touche).   It's actually a duplex with a mirror image of the townhouse on the backside. You might hear folks through the walls upstairs (as you would at a hotel) or see folks walking around the building. It's cool (say hi, they're very nice--update: now it's me, shhh be cool). I've replaced the fold-out couch with something more comfortable for sitting. It's still suitable as a sleeping
transit: The townhouse is close to a bus stop but otherwise not convenient to public transportation UNLESS you have a car. The Expo Center MAX station/park and ride is about 2 miles away. It's an easy drive or bike ride BUT there are stretches without sidewalks. One bus line picks up nearby but that stop is near the western end of the line; a second bus line picks up about a mile away. Bike enthusiasts who bring or rent a bike will love the flat terrain of St John's (unless you're a freak who can't live without hills, in which case whatever, enjoy Alameda ridge and your well-defined quads). With Uber, Lyft and cabs you can get around pretty inexpensively without your own vehicle, just remember that when you arrive.
access: You'll have the run of the place, although please don't actually run on the stairs. W/D, full kitchen, WiFi, a couch, 2 bedrooms and even a TV with a remote control (there's an HDMI cable there if you want to watch your Netflix or Hulu through the TV). It has HBO for most of 2016. The day before your arrival I'll give you the combination to a lock box so you can check in at your convenience beginning at 4 p.m. and check out at your convenience by 11 a.m.
interaction: I live in the unit behind this place (we will share a firewall so if you hear noise just send me a message--"dude!" is fine). You'll get a detailed message with check-in information, address, etc.  from me the day before your arrival. Unless I mention a delay, you can check-in anytime from 4:00 p.m. on.  Don't hesitate to ask me anything that will help you plan your visit. There's now an iron & ironing board, and hair dryer on site, along with full pots and pans set (dishes, glasses, flatware).
house_rules: My hope is that folks will realize that it's not filled with antiques or collectibles so they can relax and not worry about... it. Oh, but please no religious sacrifices, virgin or otherwise, inside the house. Addendum: in the spirit of not changing the character of the neighborhood, please refrain from making excessive noise outside (either the front porch or the side patio) between midnight and 6:00 a.m.--1:30 a.m. and 7:00 a.m. if it's the weekend.  Also no hate crimes. Please don't commit any hate crimes.

Fee will be applied if there are more individuals without approval.  2 night min stay Nov & Dec.

summary: Sunny and spacious private bed and shared bath in charming, stylish 3 br townhouse. Welcome! We are walking distance from charming Downtown St. Johns which has movie theaters, health food grocery, cafes, restaurants and bars. Cathedral Park is just beyond downtown, with beautiful views of the Willamette, Forest Park and the St. Johns Bridge.  House is new, with hardwood floors, modern stainless steel appliances, beautiful houseplants, large, spacious windows, and gas fireplace.
space: We have the best of both worlds...a newer townhouse in an older established neighborhood. Main floor is a "great room" so it's very open, has hardwood floors, lots of windows, and a wonderful, fully stocked kitchen where you can cook and enjoy living and lounging in one room!
description: Sunny and spacious private bed and shared bath in charming, stylish 3 br townhouse. Welcome! We are walking distance from charming Downtown St. Johns which has movie theaters, health food grocery, cafes, restaurants and bars. Cathedral Park is just beyond downtown, with beautiful views of the Willamette, Forest Park and the St. Johns Bridge.  House is new, with hardwood floors, modern stainless steel appliances, beautiful houseplants, large, spacious windows, and gas fireplace. We have the best of both worlds...a newer townhouse in an older established neighborhood. Main floor is a "great room" so it's very open, has hardwood floors, lots of windows, and a wonderful, fully stocked kitchen where you can cook and enjoy living and lounging in one room! Guests are welcome to use the fully stocked kitchen to make meals as well as the refrigerator and pantry to store food in. The shared bathroom features a shower and bath. The backyard patio is also available to guests and has a bbq, table a
transit: We are within 5 minutes walking distance of 4 major bus lines: #4, #44, #75, and #16. The #16 gets you downtown in under 30 minutes, and the frequent #4 can take you downtown and almost any part of the east side. For the airport MAX (Red line), #4 or #75 are great connections. Unfortunately, St. Johns is out of the Car2Go service area, but Zipcar and Uber are great options too. It you're driving, downtown Portland is 15 minutes by car, over the St. John's bridge, and the airport is about 30 minutes.
access: Guests are welcome to use the fully stocked kitchen to make meals as well as the refrigerator and pantry to store food in. The shared bathroom features a shower and bath. The backyard patio is also available to guests and has a bbq, table and garden. Guests are welcome to lounge in the living room by the fire place and browse the our book and record collection. Our washer and dryer are available for laundry use for free (one load per day please).
interaction: We are usually around in the evenings, and by phone/text during the day. If you need something or have a question, don't hesitate to ask!

summary: Sunny, relaxed space in the best hood in Portland. Big, friendly home (big kitchen). You never need leave St Johns with theaters, markets, restaurants, dives, vegan & live music. But downtown is just 20 min away over the St Johns bridge.
space: Welcome to Casa Buchanan in the St Johns neighborhood of Portland. The house is sunny and quite large (3,000 sq ft over 3 floors). It's clean and well maintained. The carpets have just been cleaned! Large, sunny living room, and 3 full bathrooms, a full dining room an large kitchen with all you need to prepare a great meal or bake cookies.  Your room is small, sunny and cozy. Comfy full-sized bed. Tv with cable and a small walk-in closet.  Don't even pay attention to the street view - I just looked at it for the first time. I don't even know where that old beater truck filled with crap is!  But feel free to find it when you arrive for extra points.  Please note: 24 hour's advance notice is preferred and often needed.  We are a home with nice people (30s - 50s) who will happily show you where to play disc golf or the best bike route or how to find the artsy part of town... We sometimes share meals (esp around the holidays when I cant stop cooking) and often share stories and beers. And

summary: Cheery, light infused home filled with oil paintings by host. Located in quaint and charming St. Johns with restaurants, shops and parks all within walking distance.
space: Hello, I'm your host Suzy, a long time St. Johns resident and artist. My charming 1925 bungalow is filled with light and art. You'll have a private room on the main floor of the house to relax in and access to laundry facilities downstairs. Enjoy complimentary tea or Stumptown coffee in the morning.

summary: Welcome to Chateau Midway in the St. Johns neighborhood of Portland. Enjoy a lovely queen bedroom with TV and a private bathroom on the main floor of our 1942 ranchalow. Guests also have use of a shared living room, dining room and kitchen. We are just minutes from downtown St. Johns, Cathedral & Pier Parks & University of Portland. PDX airport is a straight shot on Columbia Blvd to our home. We hope guests who book our room are looking for a quiet, calm retreat in the midst of our busy city.
space: In addition to the bedroom and private bathroom guests are welcome to use the main floor living room, dining room and kitchen. Although we need to pass through these shared areas occasionally, we will mainly be in our downstairs quarters. We ask that guest don't do any cooking in our kitchen, but they are welcome to use the coffee maker, refrigerator, freezer and microwave as needed to make and store beverages and snacks. I'll have plenty of coffee, tea, instant breakfast items and condiments available for you.

summary: The 14 x 17 bedroom is sunny, warm and welcoming. A haven from the world and your respite between Portland fun and frolic. Enjoy a private living room is all yours. The living room has cable, comfy sitting spots, a futon couch that sleeps two.
space: It's a big, 1920s home with lots of light, wood floors, shared space and a small front and back yard. An excellent house for entertaining, cooking and chilling. In addition to your large room, you have full run of your own living space.  You are welcome to relax, even party a bit - as long as you keep the noise level down. (so party like a 40-year old vs a 20-year old).    The bedroom sleeps two in a full-size bed, and the living room futon will sleep two as well.

summary: Cozy basement bedroom with private bathroom. Enjoy kitchen, living room, porch and back yard access, while being only 2 blocks from the MAX light-rail and multiple bus lines.  Kenton is also walking distance to multiple bars, restaurants, and parks.
space: The room is fairly large (actually larger than either room on the main floor) and gets good natural light when the blinds are up.  There is a separate entry to the house that accesses the room so you can come and go at will without disturbing me.  There is the ability to sleep up to 3 in the room if the available air mattress is used.

summary: Your cozy private guestroom and bathroom is in a modern craftsman reproduction home. Located on a very quiet street in the Kenton neighborhood, with access (walking and public transit) to a variety of cool restaurants, bars, parks, and a coffee shop.
space: Your space is in a large private bedroom on the second floor that has a pleasant view of our garden.  Your bedroom is located at the end of a hall, which enhances your privacy.  The bedroom is furnished with a full size bed, dresser, and closet space is available. It is a great room to listen to the rain, read, hangout, or quietly sleep.  Next door to your bedroom is a private bathroom that only you will have access to.

summary: This cheery house is great place to spend a weekend in Portland.   The bedroom has a comfy queen bed plus there's a large sofa in the living room if needed for a third guest.  Full kitchen for your use and there's a private back patio with a gas BBQ.
description: This cheery house is great place to spend a weekend in Portland.   The bedroom has a comfy queen bed plus there's a large sofa in the living room if needed for a third guest.  Full kitchen for your use and there's a private back patio with a gas BBQ. I am available by phone or email anytime.  There will be a lockbox on the door for you to access the house.   You'll be on a quiet neighborhood street but just a few blocks walk to restaurants, coffee, groceries and light rail.  Light rail or city buses will have you downtown in about 35 minutes.   The airport and downtown are both about 10-15 minutes away by car.

summary: Super chic basement apartment with two full beds and one sofa bed. Private bath and private entrance from the back of the house. Lovely back patio. Walking distance to shops and restaurants on Denver Ave and just a few blocks to the MAX.
space: Stylish Private Basement Apartment  - "The Red Room" has a full size bed, TV with AppleTV, papasan chair, and plenty of books to read. It also has a mini-fridge and microwave.  - "The Music Room" has a full size loft bed with a sofa bed underneath, guitars on the wall, lots of books, and a piano you're welcome to play.  - Full (very small) bathroom with sink, toilet, and small shower. - Back porch with grill, fire pit, and plenty of seating that you can share with us and our dog, Lady.

summary: Perfectly located 1000 square feet basement studio apartment with private entrance, your own outdoor space and real beds! Five blocks from light rail, and great Kenton neighborhood restaurants. 4.5 miles from downtown Portland, 40 minutes from Columbia River Gorge and an hour and a half to the beach. Small kitchen (microwave, toaster oven, coffee machine and refrigerator). Private outdoor space includes table and chairs and a fire pit/grill.
space: High ceilings, carpet and real beds make this basement studio apartment feel like a real home. There is a small kitchen (microwave, toaster oven, coffee machine and studio refriderator).  Guests will have access and private use of an outside area with a table, chairs and fire pit/grill. Family room has TV with Amazon Prime and Netflix.

summary: 10 mins walk to MAX, cafes, restaurants, shops, library and nightlife in historic Kenton. Convenient and family friendly, Kenton is the full package, with no traffic and plenty to do!  Feel free to make an inquiry,  I'll get back to you right away.
space: Make yourself at home in one of Portland's best neighborhoods. Kenton is easily accessible by MAX, bus, bike or car and ideally situated for day trips to Mt. Helens, Mt. Hood, Astoria, and the Oregon Coast.
description: 10 mins walk to MAX, cafes, restaurants, shops, library and nightlife in historic Kenton. Convenient and family friendly, Kenton is the full package, with no traffic and plenty to do!  Feel free to make an inquiry,  I'll get back to you right away. Make yourself at home in one of Portland's best neighborhoods. Kenton is easily accessible by MAX, bus, bike or car and ideally situated for day trips to Mt. Helens, Mt. Hood, Astoria, and the Oregon Coast. You'll have the 2 bedroom house all to yourself. Amenities include a full kitchen and appliances, coffeemaker, dining room for entertaining, an endless supply of books, games, and dvds, Adirondacks on the front porch, rain shower, extra toiletries, and luxury Aesop soap. I'm passionate about Portland and can provide maps, restaurant suggestions, biking directions, and more, but the entire home is yours for the length of your stay. Kenton has everything you need to experience Portland. Picnics in Kenton Park, espresso and pastries at Posie
transit: The Yellow line MAX, #4, #35, and #75 buses are all within 5-10 minutes walking and there is easy on-street parking in front of the house. The street is a designated bike boulevard with low traffic for safe riding if you prefer to go by bike. Airport taxis are about $25 and the ride takes 15 minutes; Uber and Lyft are available too. Kenton is just off the Marine Drive path so you can even bike to the airport! I'm happy to provide maps and recommendations for getting around so just ask.
access: You'll have the 2 bedroom house all to yourself. Amenities include a full kitchen and appliances, coffeemaker, dining room for entertaining, an endless supply of books, games, and dvds, Adirondacks on the front porch, rain shower, extra toiletries, and luxury Aesop soap.
interaction: I'm passionate about Portland and can provide maps, restaurant suggestions, biking directions, and more, but the entire home is yours for the length of your stay.
house_rules: Absolutely no smoking. Pets are welcome. Same day bookings, please message me for late check-in instructions.

space: There are in ceiling speakers in most rooms. Its in a quiet residential neighborhood with easy access to downtown Portland and Vancouver WA.

summary: Relax in our comfortable, cheery private room with shared bathroom. Just five miles from downtown, we are close to the Yellow Max & bus. Free wifi, Netflix, Hulu & Amazon make this a great place to unwind. LGBTQ & 420 friendly. A dog lives here. A cat used to if you're allergic to either it might not be the best fit.
space: Our cozy private Sunnyside room features: : Euro-top, Queen-sized bed : Down pillows for back, front, and side sleepers : Seasonally adjusted down duvet for year-round comfort : Extra blankets and pillows available : Bathroom with beautiful antique clawfoot tub and shower : Bathroom is shared with up to 2 other Airbnb guests staying in another private room on the same floor
description: Relax in our comfortable, cheery private room with shared bathroom. Just five miles from downtown, we are close to the Yellow Max & bus. Free wifi, Netflix, Hulu & Amazon make this a great place to unwind. LGBTQ & 420 friendly. A dog lives here. A cat used to if you're allergic to either it might not be the best fit. Our cozy private Sunnyside room features: : Euro-top, Queen-sized bed : Down pillows for back, front, and side sleepers : Seasonally adjusted down duvet for year-round comfort : Extra blankets and pillows available : Bathroom with beautiful antique clawfoot tub and shower : Bathroom is shared with up to 2 other Airbnb guests staying in another private room on the same floor : Programmable keyed access to the home for easy in and out 24/7 : Lock on the bedroom door for your peace of mind : Free high-speed wireless Internet  : Covered front porch or backyard for enjoying cannabis/legalized recreational marijuana We live on the floor located above this room and work from home
transit: Bus:  4 and 75 are less than a block away and the Yellow Max line is only 6 blocks from the house.  All will take you downtown in about 25-35 minutes. Car:  Parking is free and easy curbside at the house. We are in the Car2Go zone and several Zipcars are in the neighborhood making shared transportation readily available. Airport:  From the airport, take a taxi for $20-30 and spend 20 minutes or take the Red Max train from the airport to the Rose Quarter and change to the Yellow Max train to Kenton Station then walk to the house.  It usually takes 1-1.5 hours and costs $2.50.
access: : Programmable keyed access to the home for easy in and out 24/7 : Lock on the bedroom door for your peace of mind : Free high-speed wireless Internet  : Covered front porch or backyard for enjoying cannabis/legalized recreational marijuana
interaction: We live on the floor located above this room and work from home so we often run into our guests. However, there are many times when schedules do not align and we miss our guests entirely but are always available for questions and recommendations. Do note that you might run into another Airbnb guest staying in their own private room on the same floor and sharing the bathroom with you.
house_rules: : No shoes inside the house.  There's a shoe bench near the front door for easy storage and on/offs.   : No smoking inside the home - space is available outside on the front porch or in the backyard. : No food in bedroom.   : Use coasters.   : You are free to come and go, but should always be respectful of others who might be sleeping.

summary: With two security gates, hot tub, meditation gardens, blazing fast WiFi and private hiking paths, this is the perfect getaway for the elite, security-minded traveler. For travelers who'd like to explore Portland's famous foodie scene, this 7-acre retreat is only five minutes to the 21st and 23rd street corridor, seven minutes to the Pearl, and ten minutes to downtown. It's the best of both world's in this hidden gem of a house: Get the privacy you crave while still being close to the action!
space: This secured, private home is located on seven acres of beautiful, forested grounds, just five minutes from The Pearl district and ten minutes from downtown. This is a true oasis for those who prefer luxury, privacy, and ample room to roam.  HIGHLIGHTS:  --------------------------------- -- Secured entrance with two private gates and security cameras. -- 2600 square feet between two stories. -- Large, open floorplan in the kitchen, living and dining room -- Jacuzzi nestled in the woods for up to five people.  -- 5 minutes to the famous 23rd street corridor! -- Less than 7 minutes to The Pearl district!  -- Ten minutes to downtown Portland! -- Ten minutes to Nike and Intel!  -- Miles of hiking and biking trails. -- Inside fireplace. -- Dog-friendly (subject to additional charges and breed restrictions) -- Blazing fast Wifi for working, creating and planning. -- Complete and fully stocked kitchen with all the gadgets. -- Washer and Dryer for guest use. -- Parking for up to six cars. Plea

interaction: We understand our guests' need for privacy, and as such, will stay out of our guests' hair. However, should you need us we are just a phone call away.
house_rules: -- Most importantly: Please let us know you've taken the time to read through and agree to our rules at the time you inquire about our house. We can not rent to people who have not assured us they will take amazing care of our amazing home. Each of these rules has been put in place due to experiences with past guests - please don’t take offense to them; each is for the protection of our guests and home. Thank you. -- Please no smoking of any kind in the house. The covered patio has ashtrays. There is a $500 fine for in-house smoking.  -- Please inspect the house upon arrival for anything we need to tend to, and please inform us via Airbnb message.  -- Please leave the home in nice order when you depart. No need to strip beds or do laundry, but please make sure all dishes have been started, trash has been taken out and the house has been picked up. Failure to treat our home respectfully will result in an Airbnb investigation and additional fines.  -- Master trash cans are located outsid

summary: Large, private apartment in the lower level of home above Forest Park with panoramic views. You’ll enjoy a covered deck with its view of the Tualitin Valley before a day of exploring Portland or a drink at sunset.  The whole lower level will be yours: private entry, large bedroom, full bath, private deck, living room & kitchenette (fridge/microwave). Space is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers (easy drive to Nike & Intel), and others who enjoy a quiet neighborhood.
space: 180 degree view. Sunset over the coastal mountains. Five miles to downtown Portland. Enjoy your own floor! 1200 sq. ft. of living space includes private entry, large bedroom with walk-in closet, full bath with shower, private deck,   sunken living room and wet bar with mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker. There is also ample space to lock up bikes or other outdoor equipment you do not want to store in your car. You may also request an air mattress if you have more than 2 guests.

transit: A car (Uber & Lyft is available) is a must for this neighborhood. Not far from downtown Portland, you will drive through lovely Forest Park to the top of the ridge. The home offers an amazing view of the Tualitin Valley and coastal mountain range. There is no public transportation to this neighborhood.
access: Private entrance with 24 hour access to 1200 sq.ft. of living space.  Though hosts will be on site on the top levels of home, the lower level is all yours. Host may or may not be there to greet you, but instructions for entry will make your stay easy and on your own time. Ability to use stairs is a must for entry.
interaction: Happy to provide guests with restaurant, hiking or sight-seeing recommendations. Sometimes a glass of wine or a cup of tea may be in order!
house_rules: - Entry way is only accessible by stairs.  While the whole bottom floor is your guest suite, we do live in the two levels above and look for guests who enjoy a quiet night. No parties and no smoking. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 pm to 8:00 am. The space is designed for two people. If you need, extra sleeping space such as an air mattress can be arranged for an extra fee. Any additional guests above two must be approved before the stay. Thanks!

summary: Ranch style bungalow in North Portland's evolving Portsmouth neighborhood.  Bright private bedroom and separate dedicated guest bathroom. Conveniently located near Downtown Portland, Historic St. John's, Historic Kenton, and just a few blocks from University of Portland
space: Charming and modest size bedroom with comfortable medium firm queen size bed.  Plenty of natural and electric lighting.  Dresser, closet, and desk for your use.  Thermostat control for the heating in room.  Private bathroom with tub/shower.  You are able to use the living room, kitchen, and back patio.
description: Ranch style bungalow in North Portland's evolving Portsmouth neighborhood.  Bright private bedroom and separate dedicated guest bathroom. Plenty of natural and electric lighting.  Dresser, closet, and desk for your use.  Thermostat control for the heating in room.  Private bathroom with tub/shower. transit: Portland Airport is a 20 minute drive away and would cost $30-40 via cab. Portland has Cab services, Uber, Lyft, Zip Car, Car2Go, light rail, public bus and streetcar. Our Trimet public bus and light rail is easily accessible and several major bus lines have bus stops just a few blocks from my home.   I-5 N and S are just a couple miles away.  I-405, I-205, Hwy 26 and I-84 are all within 10-15 min away.  Portland is also a bike friendly city and has bike lanes on most major roads.  Free parking on street in front of the house.
access: Keyless entry into shared living room/kitchen. Private areas of residence are closed off.  Access to backyard, guest bedroom and bathroom.
interaction: You will definitely see me as we do share the living room and kitchen. However I am gone quite a bit as I'm  pretty social, volunteer, and have family in the area. I'm happy to chat or give you space as needed.  I'm always available for questions via text or phone.
house_rules: I do have an indoor cat so no guest pets allowed.  Licorice is friendly and likes to be pet. No smoking inside the home or the front porch/yard.  I do have a patio in the private backyard with seating and ashtray. No illegal downloads on our internet service Absolutely no illegal drug use or underage drinking.  Marijuana is legal in Oregon.  You are welcome to smoke on the back patio only.  Kitchen – Feel free to use any dishes, microwave, toaster and coffee pot. You are welcome to store food in the fridge or the guest cupboard (upper left of the stove).  You will also find the coffee and tea in the guest cupboard.  Please clean up after yourself.  Only turn on the dishwasher if it's full.  Living Room – Enjoy watching HD TV with Xfinity cable.  There is a DVD and VCR.  You are welcome to watch movies in the tv stand drawers or the bookshelf next to the fireplace.   Backyard – Feel free to enjoy the backyard including the propane grill.  Be sure to turn the tank off when not in use.  Q

summary: The perfect place if you're visiting The University of Portland. Our beautiful, private studio is located on a quiet street just a short bike ride or walk from campus. The North Portland location also provides easy and quick access to the airport, downtown, and other iconic Portland neighborhoods.
space: Built in 2013, the vaulted ceilings and clean architectural lines of the studio make it feel comfortable and spacious. Reclaimed wood accents throughout provide a modern aesthetic. Large windows provide tons of natural light with custom window shades for privacy. Tucked away in a quiet neighborhood between St. Johns and Kenton, you’ll find close and easy access to many restaurants, coffee shops, food carts, breweries, parks, iconic landmarks and more.  The one-room studio is perfect for a single, couple or even 3 people with a second bed in the loft. The main queen size bed is comfortable and folds up into a cabinet on the wall to save space. The loft is accessed by a wall-mounted stainless steel ladder and has a comfortable twin size mattress. It makes for a great reading nook even if you don’t plan on sleeping up there. Both beds have quality, comfortable linens and pillows. The kitchen is well stocked and has 2 mini refrigerators for your perishables. There are two countertop induct

The loft is accessed by a wall-mounted stainless s
transit: Public transportation is within walking distance and makes getting around the city easy without a car. If you don’t have a car and desire one, there’s always a Zip Car or Car2Go close by. Uber is also available and just a short wait in our neighborhood. Parking is never an issue with plenty of free street parking on the side of our house. We’re less than 7 miles to downtown and 9 miles to the airport. The area is relatively flat which makes traveling by bicycle popular and easy.
access: The studio is in the backyard of our main house. Access is provided through a locked gate on either side of the house. Keys will be provided at check-in. As a courtesy to our neighbors, we prefer guests to use the south gate for entry and exit at night.
interaction: We’re more than happy to provide recommendations of things to do in and around Portland. We’ll respect your privacy and stay out of your way unless you need something from us. We are non-discriminatory and LGBTQ friendly.
house_rules: - Quiet hours: 9pm-7am -NO smoking on property (inside or outside) -NO fires

summary: Spacious and clean two bedroom apartment available in inner north Portland. Two blocks from Columbia Park, close to the University of Portland, Kenton, Williams and Mississippi Ave. hotspots. Also, 10 minutes from The Pearl District and downtown. Quiet and stress-free!
space: Bright and open two bedroom apartment in a quiet area of north Portland. Easy living and easy access to the rest of inner north, east side, downtown, and northwest Portland.
description: Spacious and clean two bedroom apartment available in inner north Portland. Two blocks from Columbia Park, close to the University of Portland, Kenton, Williams and Mississippi Ave. hotspots. Also, 10 minutes from The Pearl District and downtown. Quiet and stress-free! Bright and open two bedroom apartment in a quiet area of north Portland. Easy living and easy access to the rest of inner north, east side, downtown, and northwest Portland. The apartment has a private entrance and is all for you! We generally leave our guests alone to relax and enjoy the city. However, if there is an issue on the property or if the guests need help or advice, we are usually available to assist. Se habla español. Estamos aquí para ayudarles! Portsmouth is close to all of the amenities, activities, and great food that Portland has to offer. But, it's quiet and relaxed when you are ready to get a good night's sleep in preparation for the day ahead. Conveniently close to the University of Portland and St. J
transit: Several bus lines are within walking distance of our property and the MAX train line is less than a mile away. There are also plenty of bike lanes and routes from our neighborhood to the rest of Portland.

summary: Prepare yourself for a one of a kind retreat in our charming home.  Located between historic Kenton and St. Johns, you'll be nestled in what feels like a storybook illustration.  Our little oasis also provides a modern touch.
space: This is a one of a kind handcrafted vintage space.  Originally built in the 20s, a sculptor came through in the 70s and created a Tolkienesque masterpiece.  You'll find quality masonry work around the exterior, stained glass windows, intricate wood paneling throughout the house, massive stone sculptures in the yard, & cobblestone pathways.  The entire property is surrounded by Doug Firs and many other trees.  It really is it's own private magical beacon. If you're looking for a fresh/hip neighborhood where you can walk out of your front door and be centrally located, this may not be your top pick.  We offer a more off the grid experience.  There are charming shops, restaurants, coffee houses, a theater, dive bars, co-ops, food carts, parks and beaches scattered throughout this neighborhood.  So if you're looking for a more humble experience in Portland, you have found it. Please understand that we live here so the house comes with it's imperfections and all of our belongings.  (We don'

summary: North Portland 2 bdrm/1 bath one-level house uniquely situated between Univ. of Portland and St. Johns. Access to buses and Car2Go, only 15 minutes to downtown by car, 35 min by transit. St. Johns has a small-town feel w/ bars, coffee shops, movies.
space: The house is a small two bedroom, one bathroom post-war "ranch" of sorts. It has wood floors, a galley kitchen, and washer/dryer just off the kitchen.
description: North Portland 2 bdrm/1 bath one-level house uniquely situated between Univ. of Portland and St. Johns. Access to buses and Car2Go, only 15 minutes to downtown by car, 35 min by transit. St. Johns has a small-town feel w/ bars, coffee shops, movies. The house is a small two bedroom, one bathroom post-war "ranch" of sorts. It has wood floors, a galley kitchen, and washer/dryer just off the kitchen. The whole joint is yours! You will be renting my whole house, so I will not be around to let you in or check you out. I will on occassion swing by to get something I may need, but the times I have done this my guests are usually out and about town. I live in the Portsmouth neighborhood, which is flanked by University Park to the south and St Johns to the west. It is a mix of white collar professionals, students and blue collar workers. This part of town has historically been working-class, but with the influx of new Oregonians that demographic is changing.  Housing in this area is still one o

house_rules: There are a few things I expect from guests, but they aren't what I would call hard "rules", more like "expectations" or "hopes." I "hope" guests respect that this is my house, that I live in the rest of the week, and I would hope they treat it as such. I "hope" that when guests are getting ready to leave they do a decent job of picking up and putting things away like dishes/glasses, separate recyclables from trash and pile the sheets/towels on the washer/dryer. I do not expect my guests to vacuum or do the wash, but please leave it in order. Thanks. You can smoke if you like, but please do it outside. You can use an empty beer can or whatever for the butts, and toss when done. If you're pounding lots of beer, keep in mind that bottles and cans are worth money! There is a .05 cent return for empties, which I usually leave out on the curb on garbage day for certain folks to swing by and pick up. If possible, keep a separate grocery bag of these items, but that's up to you, I usually go

summary: Warm and inviting, this two-story "skinny" has everything you need to relax in comfort.  Sun-filled rooms with whimsical touches throughout and an outdoor patio perfect for grilling.  A calming and peaceful retreat!
description: Warm and inviting, this two-story "skinny" has everything you need to relax in comfort.  Sun-filled rooms with whimsical touches throughout and an outdoor patio perfect for grilling.  A calming and peaceful retreat! You have full access of the entire house, front and back yard, and driveway for off-street parking, except for one small room that I have designated for my personal use.  I do still live at the house during the week, so some drawers and closets are marked as “homeowner’s” as they are my personal belongings.  You are also welcome to store bikes, suitcases, etc., in the garage. You will have the home completely to yourself, but I am readily available and nearby if any problems should arise.  As a Portland native, I am happy to share my recommendations for fun around town! Located in Portsmouth, you’re smack dab in the middle of two great historic neighborhoods: St. Johns to the west (about 2 miles away) and Kenton to the east (2.5 miles away) St. John’s was once a separate to
transit: There are two bus lines (the 4 and 35) within a couple blocks from the house, but I recommend that you have a car.  Buses may take a while to get into town.  There is plenty of free on-street parking as well as a private driveway for your use.  There is an Enterprise rental car company about a mile away.  Car and ride share services like Car2Go, Uber, and Lyft operate in the area.  Please feel free to bring your bikes along too, Portland is a very bike-friendly city!

summary: Colorful & cozy upstairs apartment in old North Portland farmhouse! Friendly neighbors, walkable neighborhood. Private entrance, 1 large bedroom + 1 sitting room/2nd bedroom, separate kitchen & bath, wifi + cable! Great base for NW sightseeing, hiking, biking, work, cafes & micro brews! LGBTQ friendly of course!
space: Our 2 story farmhouse was originally built in 1900! It's shaded by a beautiful giant cedar tree and surrounded on 3 sides by a big yard, with gardens, flowers and berries in the summer! A separate entrance leads up to the upstairs "flat" which has an eclectic collection of art, one main bedroom and 1 additional room for reading, looking at maps, watching a TV or an extra bedroom. If you are traveling with kids, we now have 1 children's mattress, (with comforter and linens of course), a Pack 'n Play for babies, a children's dining chair as well as booster seat for use in the kitchen, toys and other toddler furniture. The kitchen is well furnished with most appliances you will need plus I usually leave some food, beverages and a few treats to welcome you. The bathroom is spacious and we supply a few essentials like shampoo, body wash and epsom salts for a relaxing bath! The sitting room/occasional bedroom has books, 2 comfortable chairs and an ottoman/table for planning your adventures o

The kitchen is well furnished with most appliances you will ne
transit: Besides rental cars, taxis, Lyft and Uber, GetAround, there are also Spinlister, Everybody's Bikes and a few others for bike rentals. Tri Met buses stop regularly 1 block North and 1 block South of our house and both quickly connect to the Max Light Rail system which can take you into downtown Portland, East, West or South of town! You can also take your bike on the bus or light rail!
access: I will meet you when you first arrive to give you the keys, introduce myself and give you a quick tour of the place. Your entrance is the 2nd door to the right across the front porch. Once in, the stairwell leads to the upstairs apartment. You can also visit and use the back yard if you wish and even pick some fresh lettuce or berries (in season) from the garden, though it's a little more inviting in warm weather..you can get to the back yard by going around the South side near the garage/studio. If you need a place to store and park your bikes or sporting equipment, you can use our garage! We'll give you a key to use while you are here.
interaction: We love meeting fellow travelers and sharing an occasional meal, a beer or glass of wine! We are in the backyard a lot during the warm weather and tend to eat meals out there whenever possible. Please feel free to say hi or let us know if you'd like to hang out! We love talking to people and sharing stories, but you won't see us much unless you have a question or a need in which case, we are happy to be of service! Nolan works full time in downtown Portland and Mary is an artist and the main Airbnb host!  Let her know if you want to do some drawing, painting or collaging together! Our front porch, backyard and garden are all great places to relax in the summer so feel free to enjoy them!
house_rules: Hi there! We are pretty easy going folks, but we do have a few rules so everybody knows what to expect. Thanks for understanding!  All guests must provide their name, address + picture ID upon arrival. Please be quiet after 10PM and close the door to the upstairs in the evening after 8 because noise tends to be amplified in the stairwell. No pets or smoking (indoors). Smoking outside is fine (of course), but please be respectful of "down winders". Please park in front of the house or nearby. There is plenty of on street parking. You may call or text Mary or Nolan anytime for assistance. Thank you!

summary: Bright, light, clean and well maintained condo near St. Johns Bridge and Cathedral Park.  Close to Willamette River, buses, shopping. Ten min. from Sauvie Is. wildlife area, 15 min. from center of Portland.  One block from sometimes noisy RR track.
space: You will enter at the ground floor, then go up a flight of stairs to the second floor where there is a kitchen/dinette, living room, and a half-bathroom. A second flight of stairs leads to the third floor, where there is the master bedroom, a smaller bedroom (not being rented), and a full bathroom. There are lots of windows with views of Forest Park, the St. Johns Bridge, and a very interesting half-completed boat across the street. Please note: The condo is about one block from a small railroad owned by the Port of Portland and used to transport new cars that arrive at the docks. Sometimes the train can be noisy, even in the middle of the night!

transit: You can get on the bus at the stop near the Safeway store, about a ten-minute walk from the condo.
access: You will have access to all of the condo except the small bedroom on the third floor and the garage on the ground level.
interaction: We love our condo, and we want you to be able to enjoy it! Please let us know if you need any help or information. I can be reached at (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).
house_rules: We have a "no shoes" rule-- please leave your shoes at the entry on the ground level. No smoking. No pets. We have neighbors in the adjoining condo and in the unit below ours. Please be considerate of them and avoid excessive noise. When you are not home, please close the windows on the second floor and   close and lock the sliding glass door. Please turn off the stove and any other electrical appliances when not in use. If you use any dishes or kitchen utensils, please wash them. Please let us know if you need any help or information. We love our condo, and we want you to enjoy it!

summary: This private  apartment and urban retreat has its own entrance through the garden that is secured behind a combination-lock gate. Intentionally designed private studio a few steps from Cathedral park and a 5 minute walk to St Johns village. St. Johns is a popular destination for both locals and travelers alike that is only a 10 minute drive from downtown Portland. Host is a Chef and may be available to provide breakfast, lunch or a picnic to-go for your PDX fun! * ALL are welcome! *
space: This private apartment is located on the ground floor and is accessed through a gate with combination lock. Your space opens onto a lovely edible garden. The apartment features a comfy queen size bed,a desk, wireless internet, and a private bathroom with bath/shower.  There is a wet bar, mini-fridge, an electric kettle (with a variety of teas) and local Portland coffee for the coffee pot. Wireless internet is available for your electronic devices and two USB plugs for recharging are built into the bedside table. This great space was crafted by Karen Shaw Designs. Being an Airbnb host has been an honor and is a responsibility I take very seriously. I relish having created a space that is both a container and catalyst for creating memories. Diversity Friendly and Welcoming!

Wireless internet is available for your electronic devices and two USB plugs for recharging are built into the bedside t
transit: Street parking is a plenty and zone permits are NOT needed (not always the case in other parts of Portland.)  There are 2 bus lines to and from St. John's and it only takes 25 minutes by bus. The app "Moovit" is good for public transportation.  Downtown Portland is about a 10 minute drive. A lot of people choose to utilize Uber of Lyft if they do not have their own transportation.
access: The entrance is on the right side of the home through a wooden gate with a combination lock. In addition to the full first floor apartment, you are also invited to share and enjoy the garden. If you choose to stay more than a few days, (or if you have a laundry emergency) we can talk about using the washer/dryer.
interaction: Having stayed at Airbnbs, I know that sometimes I have wanted to interact with the Host and on other trips I checked in and checked out without ever seeing the Host.  I do live on the property on the 2nd and 3rd floor so we will leave interaction up to you!   With a background of working in high-end hotels I am more than happy to be a resource for you and would love to share my favorite spots in both St. Johns and Portland ... so just reach out if you would like to! I am only a call, text, or knock away.
house_rules: -- Shoes off inside please : ) -- We do have neighbors so please be respectful and mindful of noise.  -- Please Turn OFF all lights, AC, and other electronics to both be environmentally friendly and to conserve energy - Smoking is allowed outside ... away from your front door would be preferred ... the red chair would be perfect. -- LGBT and Diversity friendly!  - Have fun and be yourself!

summary: Bright and clean private bedroom in St John's in N. Portland. Right on busline. Close to the Univ of Portland and minutes to downtown by bus, car or bike. Short distance to airport. Walk to movies or food.  Popular coffee shop right next door.
space: Bright and clean private bedroom with queen size bed in St John's in N. Portland. Right on busline. Close to the Univ of Portland and minutes to downtown by bus, car or bike. Short distance to airport. Walk to movies or food.  Popular coffee shop right next door. Small local bar across the street. I recently bought this home. I have been a guest through AirBNB and am excited to begin my adventure on the other side as a gracious host.  My home is on a short dead end street just feet from Willamette drive which has a great running route.  Blocks from the St John's bridge and beautiful cathedral park. Close to the heart of St. John's and walkable to the St. John's beer porch and food carts, movie theater and restaurants.   This is a great up and coming neighborhood with lots to do. NW Portland's alphabet district and Forest Park are both a short drive or bus ride over the beautiful St. John's bridge.  My home is only four minutes from the University of Portland campus.   Parking is free a

transit: Parking is free and easy curbside right in front of the house.  University of Portland is a 4 minute drive away.  NW Portland alphabet district is a 10 minute drive. Downtown is accessible via bus in 45 minutes, a 10-15 minute drive, or a $12-15 Uber. The airport is approximately a  25 minute drive or $35-$50 dollar cab fare. Public transportation takes about 75 minutes.     From the airport Board MAX Red Line to City Center & Beaverton TC, get off at Rose Quarter TC MAX Station.  Transfer here to bus 44-Capitol Hwy/Mocks Crest to St Johns, get off at N Willamette & Edgewater.  House is a few feet away right next to Cathedral Coffee.  Public transportation tickets can be bought at the kiosk right in the airport. One ticket can be used for both the Max and the (website hidden) or Trimet app for smart phones are a great way to easily navigate the Portland public transportation system It is only a 45 minute drive to the beautiful Columbia River Gorge.
access: There is a full bathroom close to your room on the second floor that you may have to yourself or may be sharing with another guest.   If you need two bedrooms, see my other listing for reservations. You are free to use the living room, kitchen and back patio.   There is a TV in the living room with access to Netflix and HBOGo.  Wireless internet is also available for your use.   I provide towels, shampoo, conditioner and soap in your bathroom.
interaction: I work full time and stay very busy.  I hope to meet and spend some time with you but its possible we won't get to encounter each other.   I want you to have the best experience while you're here and if I'm not home, I will still be readily available to answer any questions or issues you have.
house_rules: Please remember that this is my home and respect it as your own.  I ask for no smoking or partying and that you remove your shoes in the house. Please clean up after yourself in the common areas. Come and go as you please but respect quiet hours 10pm-7am.

Blocks from the St John's bridge and beautiful cathedral park. Close to the heart of St. John's and walkable to the St. John's beer porch and food carts, movie theater and restaurants.   This is a great up and coming neighborhood with lots to do. NW Portland's alphabet district and Forest Park are both a short drive or bus ride over the beautiful S
transit: Parking is free and easy curbside right in front of the house.  University of Portland is a 4 minute drive away.  NW Portland alphabet district is a 10 minute drive. Downtown is accessible via bus in 45 minutes, a 10-15 minute drive, or a $12-15 Uber. The airport is approximately a  25 minute drive or $35-$50 dollar cab fare. Public transportation takes about 75 minutes.     From the airport Board MAX Red Line to City Center & Beaverton TC, get off at Rose Quarter TC MAX Station.  Transfer here to bus 44-Capitol Hwy/Mocks Crest to St Johns, get off at N Willamette & Edgewater.  House is a few feet away right next to Cathedral Coffee.  Public transportation tickets can be bought at the kiosk right in the airport. One ticket can be used for both the Max and the (website hidden) or Trimet app for smart phones are a great way to easily navigate the Portland public transportation system It is only a 45 minute drive to the beautiful Columbia River Gorge.
access: There is a full bathroom close to your room on the second floor that you may have to yourself or may be sharing with another guest.   If you need two bedrooms, see my other listing for reservation of the second room. You are free to use the living room, kitchen and back patio.   There is a TV in the living room with access to Netflix and HBOGo.  Wireless internet is also available for your use.   I provide towels, shampoo, conditioner and soap in your bathroom.
interaction: I work full time and stay very busy.  I hope to meet and spend some time with you but its possible we won't get to encounter each other.   I want you to have the best experience while you're here and if I'm not home, I will still be readily available to answer any questions or issues you have.
house_rules: Please remember that this is my home and respect it as your own.  I ask for no smoking or partying and that you remove your shoes in the house. Please clean up after yourself in the common areas.  Come and go as you please but respect quiet hours 10pm-7am.
