summary: Sweet Siskiyou Suite is close to parks, restaurants and dining, art and culture. You’ll love the location if you enjoy easy access to downtown, NE eateries, bars, and more. For trail enthusiasts, you are a 10 minute drive to Forest Park, largest urban park in the United States. We are single, couple, and family friendly.
space: We have a bright master bedroom in a private upstairs that accommodates 2 (in a king) or 2 in twin beds. The room sports an alcove area in which a twin fits comfortably, connected to a larger area in which a king fits comfortably, as well as a private bathroom with a double headed shower. We are situated in a quiet area, close to parks, coffee shops, brew pubs, great restaurants, and more. Bus access is easy; This is a great running and walking neighborhood. If trail running suits your fancy, I can be your #1 resource for trail running and/or hiking in Forest Park, one of the largest urban forest reserves in the US. Shared kitchen, wi-fi, outside deck with private backyard. Laundry services upon request. We are 7 miles from the PDX airport and will provide pick-up/drop-off for a small fee when possible.

summary: Welcome to our home in the beautiful, historic Irvington/Alameda neighborhood. 2 comfortable rooms for up to five guests. 2 Queen-sized beds with single futon Large shared bathroom. Close to downtown & Alberta Arts district. Bus is just 2 blocks.
space: A nice place to rest after a busy day; when you are ready to enjoy some peace and quiet. This listing combines our two guest rooms. Perfect for a larger family or friends; up to 5 guests. Includes two queen sized beds & one single futon convertible couch. Two shared bathrooms. Use of the common areas: kitchen, living & dining rooms, front porch, back yard, Netflix on the big screen TV.  Complimentary coffee or tea, homemade muffins or Pop Tarts (Airbnb's original breakfast food)  & fruit to get you going in the morning.

transit: We have plenty of free street parking. The bus stop is just two blocks away to get you anywhere around town. A cab from the airport is a short 15 minute ride. Portland is a bike friendly city and a great way to get around. Bring your own, use ours for free or rent one locally. Need a car? If you can drive a stick shift, rent ours @ Turo. Ask for the link or search "Toyota Echo 2005, Jill's around town car". Affordable, clean, manual transmission, no air.
access: One of us will be here to greet you, give you a tour, help get you settled and provide a key to the front door.  Your stay includes a private bedroom and shared bathroom. You are welcome to use the kitchen and hang out in the common areas with us. If you need an iron (check), a washing machine (check) or something else, we will do our best to accommodate.
interaction: We will be in residence during your stay and generally be available to help make your stay a pleasant one. If that includes getting to know one another, great. But above all, we'll respect your privacy.
house_rules: This is our home. We expect our guests to be respectful, considerate and leave things the way they find them. We take our shoes off at the front door, so you may want to bring a pair of slippers. No unregistered guests or food in the room. And please respect other guests by checking your noise level.

summary: Architect-designed basement apartment with walk in private entry in upscale Alameda neighborhood. Radiant heated floor; very cozy. Half a block from a well-stocked corner store. Three blocks from artistic & trendy Alberta Street. Walk to grocery stores, restaurants, a movie theater, outdoor hot tub/sauna business, art galleries, parks and more. Free on-street parking.
space: Welcome to the Balongo Inn! Balongo is the word for twins in Luganda, and this is a home with 7-year old twins! Boys! The parents of those twins (your hosts!) are Kendra & Thomas Lwebuga. Thomas was born and raised in a village community in Southern Uganda. He now works at Nike, Inc. Kendra hails from Seattle and now works as a licensed architect – from home, so you will see her around the house and garden most of the day. In 2009, we completely remodeled our 1924 Portland Bungalow. Drawing on her European travel experiences, Kendra designed the basement apartment to be warm and cozy by integrating radiant heat in a brand-new custom-colored concrete floor.  If you’ve never experienced the luxury of a radiant floor, treat your feet in the cold months! It’s such a delight to feel warm concrete underfoot in the winter! The private entry to the Balongo Inn is generously sized and slopes down gently from the sidewalk. A large covered entry welcomes you and keeps the rain off as you key in y

transit: Street parking is free in our neighborhood.
access: The private guest entrance is from the Prescott-side (see photos). Kendra will send you the entry code a couple days before your arrival date, and if you arrive between 3:30pm-8pm, she will greet you and show you around upon arrival. If you have a car, you can park on the street directly in front of our house on 30th Avenue. Street parking is free.
interaction: We want you to have a fantastic stay in Portland! Upon your arrival (if it’s between 3:30pm and 8pm), Kendra will greet you and show you around. We have lived here since 2004, and we are happy to help with directions and restaurant recommendations! We live upstairs, so you will hear us when our boys come home from school (around 3:30pm) until the boys go to bed (8pm). Our bedrooms are up top, so at bedtime, the boy noises will reduce substantially. Feel free to text or call with any questions or concerns during your stay here.
house_rules: - No smoking anywhere on the property. - We cannot accept mail or packages for guests. - We live upstairs! You will hear us.

summary: Extremely spacious, comfortable and clean private downstairs apartment with one bedroom, a beautiful bath and almost full kitchen. An excellent place to launch your daily adventures in the North Portland area and beyond; we are great for visiting family and friends in St. Johns and University of Portland neighborhoods.
space: Wonderful, clean, comfortable, spacious downstairs apartment with large bedroom in a pleasant setting. Air conditioning is available. There is an almost full kitchen (no stove), electric kettle, small fridge, microwave & toaster oven. We have found that it is best for a couple, or if you need two beds, there is a very comfortable futon in an alcove off of the living room. You will hear some noise from us upstairs, although we try to be as quiet as possible.  Good restaurants,  coffee shops and excellent grocery stores nearby.

transit: Many of our guests have been using Uber or Lyft to get around. There is an Enterprise car rental in walking distance (save the airport tax!).   You can get downtown in 15 minutes or so without getting on the highway. We are 20 - 25 minutes from PDX airport and no highway travel is needed.  There are many driving routes to our location. Car2Go and ZipCar is  also in the area. We are served by three bus routes - 75, 44 and 35. 35 will get you all the way downtown in about 30 minutes. Also, there is a newly launched bike share program: Biketown PDX (URL HIDDEN) -
access: Guests have private access, easy on-street parking. Wi-Fi and very basic cable tv. Shared use of washer & dryer, outside gas and charcoal grills.
interaction: We are usually available, but you have a private entrance so we don't see you too often. In the summer we have lots of grilling sessions and evening fires for socializing by. You will meet our dog, Izzy outside occasionally- but she generally leaves you alone!
house_rules: Quiet time is 10 pm to 7 am. Unfortunately, no pets - we already have one! No smoking (anything) in or near the house - if necessary you can go to the back of the back yard where there is a nice chair to sit in. No large gatherings. Please wash up your dishes before you end your stay.

summary: This adorable 1920's 2 bedroom, 1 1/2 bath duplex is all yours to enjoy.  I have created a quaint, inviting & funky space for your enjoyment. This spot is just steps from MAX & within walking distance to the North Mississippi district.  Peninsula Park is a block away in case you want to bring your 4 legged friends!
space: This little slice of heaven will entice you to kick your feet up, pop open a cold microbrew, settle in & call it home.  Take a fabulous location, with layers of awesome DIY projects (completed with local recycled products), an injection of boundless hospitality & infused with a dose of outst&ing local wine, microbrews, cheeses, breads, snacks & munchies & you’ll have our place.   Our goal is to provide you with an experience that makes you come back for more.  Simply tell us what you need & we'll take care of the rest.  If you want privacy, space, alone time - no problem!  On the flip side, let us know if you want to experience the real Portland & discover the hidden gems (such as where to find local dinners made by Naomi Pomeroy, personal tours of the distilleries, wine tours at the best wineries, deals on the best vintage goods, views of the city that only locals know about, a bike to ride down Burnside with the Zoo Bombers, an appointment with the best tattoo artists, a trip to the

transit: Both bus 4 and bus 44 stop at the corner of North Rosa Parks Way and North Albina (which is 50 feet from the house).  They run about every 15 minutes and are available  from 5:00 am to around 1:00 am.  If you prefer to take MAX, just walk west on North Rosa Parks Way, cross I-5 and you can pick up the Yellow line which will take you to other MAX lines, downtown and the streetcar.  It's easy, it's safe and it runs about every 15 minutes.
access: Reservations include • A private driveway for your car • A fully furnished living room (with an awesome fireplace & big old flat screen television).   • A complete dining room (plates, silverware & napkins included)  • A fully furnished kitchen with all the pots, pans, utensils, dishes, glasses, cups, toaster, etc.  • The basic food & beverages such as:    - Various local microbrews    - Some local wines    - Coffee, cream, sugar, tea, honey    - Snacks (which typically include some local cheeses, hummus, bread, olives, muffins, etc.) • Washer and dryer • Towels, wash cloths, shampoo, blow dryer and various toiletries. • Air conditioning • Porch with tons of fresh flowers • Fresh flowers throughout the house • WIFI • 2 bicycles
interaction: I leave plenty of maps, information on public transportation, information about events taking place in the city and anything else you might need. I can give you the space you desire or I can provide you with some companionship, contact with others in the city, suggestions on activities and things going on in Portland and surrounding area.
house_rules: Here are the basic rules.  1.  Don't steal our belongings. 2. Don't let anyone inside the house you don't know.  3. Help yourself to toiletries in the medicine chest above the sink (not inside the cabinets) 4. Please don't snoop through drawers. 5. Don't have parties on the property. 6. Don't use illegal substances on the premises. 7. Be respectful of our belongings and property.  Remember this is our home. 8. Don't leave a mess behind. 9. Give us advance notice if you need an early check-in/check-out time.  We will do our best to accommodate you. 10. Keep the doors and windows locked. 11.  Don't rearrange furniture or relocate our belongings without asking. 12. Let us know if you want a homemade breakfast cooked so we can plan ahead. 13. If you want an early check-in please be understanding that the property may not be ready as we only have a 3 hour turnaround time.

You will have your own private bedroom with a full size bed, full-length mirror, natural lighting as well as access to the downstairs.

summary: The Lady Den is for gentlemen too! A gorgeous room with south-facing windows. Pinball machines, orange cat, super cool house, amazing garden, awesome front porch=the ultimate Portland experience. A stone's throw from Alberta Arts and North Mississippi, and just down the street from incredible beer and food, it's a perfect headquarters for exploring the city by bike, by foot, or by car! Super private, you get the upstairs to yourself, since we sleep out in our backyard tiny house in the summer.
space: The Lady Den is the ideal room for the book nerd, writer, rockhound, and nature lover. Since we stay outside in our backyard tiny house during the summer, you get the upstairs to yourself for a very private stay. The room features SUPER comfy full-size bed and window AC unit to keep it cool on hot summer nights. The Lady Den is an ideal writer's retreat--it's a gorgeous space to work in with lots of light and a huge, wonderful desk, and it's the only inhabited room upstairs (we sleep in our backyard tiny house).

transit: We're just two blocks from NE MLK, where buses run frequent service to the rest of the city. The neighborhood, with beautiful, quiet streets, is extremely walkable. We're also just a few blocks from N. Vancouver Ave, a biking thoroughfare, and our neighborhood has a biking score of 80. We're about a mile from the MAX (lightrail). If you're exploring by car, we're about a mile from the I-5 and just blocks from North Lombard Street, which can take you straight out to the Columbia River Gorge!
access: The Lady Den, on the second floor, is yours in all its lovely glory. You have the whole upstairs to yourself, since we sleep out in our garden tiny house when we have guests. The bathroom is located downstairs, and you'll share the bathroom with other airbnb guest(s) if the main floor bedroom is rented. Our beautiful gourmet kitchen is perfect for the cook, and you're welcome to help yourself to anything!
interaction: While we have guest  we sleep in the tiny house in our backyard, and use the basement bathroom. We'll be in and out of the kitchen and main house areas, and are friendly/enthusiastic Oregon lovers who are happy to give you tips for exploring this wonderful place.
house_rules: We ask that guests respect our no-shoe policy, so you may want to bring slippers for your stay.  We try to use mostly natural products, and ask that you do the same while staying here (ie, please don't spray Axe body spray all over our stuff).  Although the bathroom does have a tub, please do NOT take baths--it leaks if filled with water. Showers are just fine!

summary: Our beautiful home in the Woodlawn neighborhood is your headquarters for exploring beautiful Portland! We're an easy walk, bike, bus, or MAX ride from N Mississippi, Alberta Arts, and all the rest that Portland (and beyond) has to offer.
space: We have poured our hearts into our beautiful home, and are so excited to share it with you! Our space reflects our many interests: music, books, botany, rockhounding, and Oregon, among others. The house is full of comfy hangout spaces, natural light, and plants. Drink coffee on the front porch overlooking the garden; explore our fabulous record collection; pet our sweet cat. Walk up the street to Breakside brewery to fill your guest growler with local beer, and spend the evenings cooking in the gourmet kitchen. Around sunset our neighborhood smells overwhelmingly of cookies (seriously. There's a cookie factory about a mile away).
description: Our beautiful home in the Woodlawn neighborhood is your headquarters for exploring beautiful Portland! You are renting the main two floors of the house, which has two bedrooms (the "Steely Den" downstairs, with a queen bed, and
transit: We're less than a quarter mile from the Dekum Triangle, which features a fabulous brewery, several coffee shops, two (!) pizza places, a bike shop, bars, and an amazing market/cafe. It's a 30-minute walk or 10-minute bike ride to the Alberta Arts district or North Mississippi Avenue. We're about a 15-minute bike ride from downtown, and are right on numerous bus lines, and very close to the MAX (lightrail). It takes about 30 minutes to bike from our house to Southeast Portland or St. John's.  There is ample free on-street parking in front of our house, and our neighborhood is quite safe.
access: You are renting the main two floors of the house, which has two bedrooms (the "Steely Den" downstairs, with a queen bed, and the "Lady Den" upstairs, with a full bed) and one bathroom (on main floor), with a shower and endless hot water. Both bedrooms have window air conditioner units for hot nights.   Our lovely kitchen features all high-efficiency, stainless steel appliances. Our front porch looks out over the front garden, and is a fabulous place to drink coffee and watch the many bikes and dogs go by. During your stay, the main house and front porch are yours exclusively. We stay in a tiny house in the backyard and use the facilities in our separate basement apartment. We ask that guests respect that we keep the backyard as our private space.
interaction: We love the Northwest, and are happy to share our enthusiasm for this special place. We enjoy getting to meet guests, but are busy and won't intrude on your privacy. We're always just a text message away if you need anything.
house_rules: Since we have a no-shoes policy in the house, we recommend bringing slippers for your stay.  If you smoke cigarettes, please smoke on the front porch or sidewalk, and dispose of butts in the outside trash.  We try to use mostly natural products, and ask that you do the same while staying here.  Although the bathroom does have a tub, please do NOT take baths--it's a decommissioned jet tub, and it leaks if filled with water. Showers are A-OK.

house_rules: Please treat our home like you treat your parent's home, with love and respect.  No pets without approval.  The master suite is off limits, owner only.  No SMOKING inside, outside is ok.  PARTIES?  Let's talk...we have kids, the three twin beds upstairs are in a giant playroom-kids love it.  We have games, toys and the TV with DVD, cable, and Wii.  Our swim spa is lots of fun, our kids use it to swim.  Adults love to relax in it.  Kids need to be watched closely in the water (obviously) and a liability waiver is required (provide at check in).  There is also a playhouse, a large deck, and a fire pit.  Our neighbors are amazing-they respect us and we respect them.  If you are planning a party we need to alert them, so just be honest and let us know what you need.

space: I lived here for 6 years but moved out and turned it into a guest house in order to keep up with the mortgage/bills as the house is almost 100 years old and needs constant attention. So it's not designed to be a fancy "vacation home" but rather like staying at my house while I'm away nearby. 4/20 friendly but please have the air cleared on the day of your checkout in consideration for the next guests/children. summary: Rest and relax in the guest bedroom. No frills but clean and cozy. My cute little bungalow is located in a lovely old Portland neighborhood. There's lots to do nearby and it's easy to get around, as I'm close to highways, main thoroughfares and public transit.
space: Your private room has two windows for plenty of natural light. Rest up for your Portland adventure on a comfy, full-size bed. The room is stocked with clean linens, towels and also includes a dresser and small closet for storage. Make yourself a cup of coffee or tea from the comfort of your room using the Keurig brewer. The house features a larger living area and clean bathroom. During the warmer months, the backyard is perfect for lounging and soaking up the abundant sunshine. I'm happy to provide you with suggestions and directions for getting around Portland. A small, friendly dog named Oliver lives with me. He's a sweetheart but might bark a little bit when you exit the home. He hates goodbyes!

transit: There are several major bus lines just a few blocks away from the house. You can hop on a Trimet bus and be downtown within 30 minutes. Use your smartphone to buy a digital transit pass and board with ease.  I'm near the 8, 75, 17 and 6 bus lines.
access: Guests will have access to their own private bedroom. Everything else is a common area, minus my bedroom.  I don't typically allow guests use of the kitchen stove/oven but can make exceptions if discussed beforehand.  There's plenty of street parking for your vehicle. WiFi is also included.
interaction: I work often, have a busy schedule and generally keep to myself so there is a chance we won't see each other. I'm happy to help point you in the right direction if needed. If you need anything during your stay, I'll always be available via phone or text message.
house_rules: Check-in and out times can be flexible. Let me know when you think you'll be arriving and departing so I can plan accordingly. Please remember to always lock the door behind you and be mindful of noise (for my neighbors' sake) after 10pm. Small, friendly dogs only. As much as I love them, my house is just too small for larger dogs.  You are welcome to store leftovers in the fridge. The kitchen is not available to use for cooking and my microwave is currently not working. Sorry! My home is open to all people. I do not tolerate or condone any prejudice, racism, homophobia or violence of any kind in my home.  Thank you!

summary: Our time-capsule subterranean suite features a private entry, knotty pine bar & lounge, plus NEW bedroom/bath. We are conveniently nestled between the Woodlawn Triangle and Alberta Arts shops, carts and cafes; steps from the bus to MAX and downtown.
space: We remodeled last year and included new appointments throughout our swingin' basement AirBnB pad! It's centrally air conditioned and heated comfortably accommodating two. The keyless private entry and stairs will lead you into our original FAB 1950's Madmen lounge living room. It's a fun space. Plus, local PDX fabulous shoe stores Imelda's and Louie's chose the Knotty Grotto this year for their holiday photo shoot. This room has always been the favorite spot in our home with our guests. We hope you will agree and enjoy yourself in this space.  It is appointed with new leather sofas and period accouterments scoured from Portland's many mid-century collectible stores.  Please browse our eclectic assortment of art books and other reading materials. Loads of games are stashed in the old TV cabinet. Get comfy, have a beer or glass of wine and spin some vinyl on the turntable. Surprise! No television. But we're not complete luddites; Great wi-fi is available for your portable devices. The ki

transit: We are conveniently located for walking or biking  to local dining and shopping with only a 10 minute drive to the heart of the west side downtown hub. The #8 bus picks up and drops off on the corners directly across the street from our house. It goes downtown through the historic Irvington neighborhood on 15th Ave, past the Lloyd Center Mall with a stop at the The Rose Garden Transit Center. This is a major MAX transfer station which includes ALL lines, plus bus and street car accessibility, your transportation key to the entire city with a $5 one-day pass.The airport is a 15 minute drive.  The closest MAX station (yellow line) is Killingsworth Station, 1.5 miles away.
access: There is a private entrance to your living space and the basement apartment is exclusively yours.  The side door accessed from our driveway (please park there) through the rear gate will lead you in. Keyless entry enables you to come and go as you please. The garden in the enclosed private backyard is yours to enjoy. For bicyclists: We have a covered shed beside your entrance, equipped with locks and cables, for you to store your ride with confidence. You can take the train to StumpTown with your bike, auto-carry, or pedal your way here AND have a safe place for your steed to stay while you are at the Knotty Grotto.
interaction: We live upstairs and are available to you as needed or wanted, but respect your privacy.  We are here for you with advice and tips, restaurant and venue recommendations, directions, or assistance. It's entirely up to you how much contact you need or want from us. We  want our guests to have a great time staying with us in Portland. Also, we are bicyclists and very pro velo. If you wish, we can give you some ideas on where to go and getting around PDX on your bike.
house_rules: Non-smoking adults only. No pets. Come and go as freely as you please at anytime of the day or night, but we live upstairs and are respectfully quiet after 10PM and ask the same of you. Please leave your shoes and rain gear in the hall outside your suite.  Treat it like your own place, providing you treat your own place well.  Be very nice to it, in any case.

summary: A classic old Portland house, located in the Woodlawn neighborhood in upper Northeast Portland. Just blocks from the popular Dekum Triangle with notable restaurants, unique neighborhood amenities, and beautiful parks. Thoughtfully furnished and styled with a mix of modern and vintage decor. Very family friendly as well with kid's room, toys, high chair, baby gates, etc.
space: Our home is a classic old Portland house, built in 1923. It includes modern decor and a mix of vintage touches throughout. We recently finished our basement as well that includes a bedroom with a very comfortable queen size bed and a beautiful new bathroom right off of the bedroom. The bathroom features custom white oak counters, and a walk in rain-shower. The basement also includes a new den that has a sleeper sofa that can be used, an office with a custom white oak standing desk, laundry room with washer, dryer, sink, and folding station. The basement has a separate entrance that leads to the backyard as well. Since our basement was recently renovated, we are still in the process of furnishing it (please forgive the sparseness!). transit: Portland is easy to navigate by car, TriMet Bus, TriMet Max train, Portland Streetcar or by bicycle. We are located right near the TriMet bus stations, a few miles from the NE Killingsworth MAX train station and only a 10-15 minute drive from Portland International Airport. It is under $20 to use Uber to get from the airport to the house. Broadway cab company is also a popular taxi choice for getting to and from the airport. Our house is a quick 10-15 minute drive from the heart of downtown Portland.
access: Guests have access to the house through the front door, back door, and basement entrance. When you first arrive please enter through the back door as the lockbox (with keys inside) is on the back door. Go through backyard gate to access backdoor. During their stay, guests have access to the entire house, backyard area with BBQ, fire pit, urban vegetable garden, and blueberry bushes scattered throughout the front and backyard.  Guests will have access to the house by 3:00PM on the scheduled day of check-in. On the day of check out, guests are asked to check out by 11:00AM.
interaction: We are a family of four. Myself, my husband, and our two daughters (4 years old and 1 year old). We live in this house so when we are renting it out we are out of town. When we will be renting out just our basement in the near future we will available for guests in-person. You may contact us by phone, text or email while we are away. When we are home, we enjoy meeting our guests and chatting about unique spots to explore in Portland and outside the city. We are happy to provide recommendations for food, activities, and information about the city and the surrounding areas. We are also more than happy to give you your privacy to relax and enjoy a cozy, restful getaway.
house_rules: - No shoes in the house. Please remove upon entering. Check-in is after 3PM -No smoking in the house or on the property. -No guest pets are allowed in the house or on the property. -Please respect neighbors and avoid creating excessive noise. -Please leave the house and property clean and tidy. -When checking out, please make sure the door is shut and locked and close any windows. -Return any objects back to where you found them. Please take care with the books, ceramics and objects in the house. -During the winter, leave the thermostat at 68 degrees upon check out. -Please ensure that the key is returned and secure before checking out. -If any damages occur during your stay (spills, stains, etc.), please let us know as soon as possible. But, most importantly, relax and enjoy your time!

summary: Our cottage, in one of Portland's trendiest neighborhoods, abounds with creativity and cozy comfort. Your air conditioned private room is bright, comfy, and ready to support your time in Portland. We look forward to being your hosts and helping you have wonderful Portlandia experience
space: Welcome to our artsy collage!  Our home is a small one story filled with our art and colorful Navaho rugs, with Wayne's sculpture, paintings,  and Kaya's pottery.  Our home is filled with plants and is warm and cozy all winter! In the spring and summer you will enjoy the garden and patio!  Your room has an excellent quality firm Queen bed with all organic cotton sheets and decorated with our hand-painted furniture. It is quiet and a lovely space to come back to after tramping around the city or hiking in Forest park.  Wireless internet and complimentary herbal teas and french press coffee is available in our handmade pottery mugs. Your room has AC in the summer. We are dual citizens and lived in New Zealand for 12 years and in an international community.  We bring that spirit into our home and we both enjoy meeting new people from all over the world.

access: You have access to our kitchen for light food preparation, garden, living room, shared bathroom, laundry and all the amazing cafes and hot spots in our trendy neighborhood. We have tons of maps and Portland area information plus we love helping people figure out where to go and how to enjoy the area!
interaction: We love chatting when it happens. If there is time to share a cup of tea we always enjoy that too. If you prefer total privacy we of course, respect that as well.
house_rules: No cigarette smokers inside or out please. Cannabis ok outside.  Please drink in one of the nearby breweries, rather than here. Not required but we appreciate a shoe-free house. Our house is perfect for you if you are quiet, however we do love if you play the piano or your guitar !

summary: Welcome home! Our carriage house has a huge outdoor space with a covered fireplace and grilling area. Also the grounds contain a small pond, two chickens, and several fruit trees!  We are close to 42nd street which has several nice bars, pizza joints, and ice cream shops. Additionally we are near Alberta Street with its many restaurants and shops.  Feel free to use the outdoor space as we have croquet, bocci ball, football, and a frisbee!
space: The place is located on the second story of our carriage house. There is one bedroom and one pull out couch in the living room. Under the house is a garage that you are more than welcome to park your car in! Inside you will find a fully stocked kitchen and bathroom complete with towels, soap, and shampoo.

space: This is the lower unit in a 2-unit duplex. Private entrance, kitchen/bathroom/living room/bedroom.  There is a comfy queen-sized bed in bedroom, and a full-sized air mattress in living room. summary: The Rainbow's Lair is a cozy sanctuary nestled in a quiet neighborhood in NE Portland. Located just minutes from the PDX Airport, Portland area attractions and within walking distance to the Beaumont neighborhood coffee shops, bars, and restaurants, this quiet space can be your home base as you enjoy all Portland has to offer. Enjoy the entire main floor of this charming Portland Bungalow. Cozy when it's grey, and dancing with rainbows in the sun, it's the perfect nest, whatever the weather.
description: The Rainbow's Lair is a cozy sanctuary nestled in a quiet neighborhood in NE Portland. Located just minutes from the PDX Airport, Portland area attractions and within walking distance to the Beaumont neighborhood coffee shops, bars, and restaurants, this quiet space can be your home base as you enjoy all Portland has to offer. Enjoy the entire main floor of this charming Portland Bungalow. Cozy when it's grey, and dancing with rainbows in the sun, it's the perfect nest, whatever the weather. You are welcome to use the kitchen during your stay. Help yourself to coffee, tea, oatmeal and whatever else you might find. The washing machine located in the room next to the kitchen is not available for use. The backyard, located outside of the kitchen door is private, but feel free to enjoy the side yard, there's not much to it at the moment. Please use the door in the living room to access the side yard. You are welcome to text me with questions. I may not always be able to respond right away,

house_rules: As part of the management of a Type A Accessory Short-Term Rental we must keep and maintain a guest log book that includes the names and home addresses of guests, guest’s license plate numbers if traveling by car, dates of stay, and the room assigned to each guest. The log must be available for inspection by City staff upon request. By booking the Rainbow's Lair, you agree to provide this information upon checkin. If you'll be checking in via text to get the key code, you can text this information in exchange for the Key code, or if we meet you in person, you will be asked to provide this information upon receiving the key. Thanks! Leave your shoes at the door.  If you use the kitchen, please clean up after yourself. Only registered guests please, no visitors. Absolutely no drugs. Please enjoy your visit! Thanks so much!

summary: A quiet, cozy home that's a convenient hub to the whole of Greater Portland  and beyond. We have two bedrooms, a comfortable living room, a full-on kitchen for cooking enthusiasts, and a small bathroom.  Our home is clean and lovely!
space: Master Bedroom: We have a very comfortable queen size bed and a great room with natural light from the sliding glass door that opens to the backyard. 2nd Bedroom: If needed for a bed, we have a very comfortable queen sized, futon mattress.  If not needed for a bed, the futon is used as a couch.  In this room there is a sitting chair and quite a bit of room to unpack your clothes.   Living Room:  You are welcome to play the instruments in our living room!  We have an upright grand piano, guitar and several other small string instruments.  Kitchen:  A cook's dream kitchen in many respects.  Feel free to use our Vitamix, Juicer, Bread Machine, Espresso Machine, Crock Pot, Rice Maker, the list goes on!  Granite counter-tops, lots of light, dishwasher, plenty of space to cook.  Far left counter has an iPod/iPhone player & charger (also with an aux 1/8" cable for other devices such as computers & tablets) for adding music to cook by. transit: The three best ways to get around are car, bike, and public transportation. Driving Around:::: Most guests seem to seem prefer driving because our location is such a great hub, as described in the overview and in more detail in the first house manual.  Just be wary of rush hour traffic on I-84 and I-205 and I-5 as Portland's population and popularity are growing! Also to note, Portland has great car rental options if you need it with Flight Car (it's the Airbnb of car renting!), Car 2 Go, Zip Car, and the many other usual car rental businesses. Public Transportation:::: Getting around the city by public transportation is relatively easy from our home.  We live a couple blocks from the 71 and 72 bus stops, and the southbound 72 bus takes you to the nearest MAX station in 10 minutes.  MAX is Portland's mass transit rail system and it will take you all over Downtown Portland.   If you want to be on foot and check out Downtown Portland for the day, the MAX is a really great resource! Bikin
access: Guests have access to most of the house.  The only room which is quasi-off limits is our third bedroom and music room.
interaction: Your Hosts:  We will be totally out of the house for your stay, but we will either welcome you in person and give you the keys, or provide you with all the necessary arrangements to let yourself into our home.
house_rules: Please do not bring your pets to our home.  Shoes off, and please be mindful not to scratch the beautiful wood floors.  Please be respectful of utilities; conserve electricity and water when possible.  Also, thank you for not smoking in the house, or consuming large amounts of alcohol on the property.  Please contact us IMMEDIATELY if there is an emergency during your stay.

summary: Enjoy privacy and quaint Portlandia vibes in this spacious and comfortable apartment, 10 minutes from the PDX airport. You'll find comfortable beds with 100% cotton sheets, blackout curtains, TV w/Netflicks, fireplace, jetted tub, local coffee, & washer/dryer. space: An old historic craftsman style bungalow, you have access to the entire main floor, the back patio and the washer and dryer in the basement. The main floor has a main bedroom with a queen sized bed in it. You will have your own closet to hang your clothing etc. There is a spacious dining room (with a fish tank...please throw a nibble to the old man in the tank) a living room, a kitchen, a bathroom and a study with a TV and stereo.  I have a small dog that lives here part time so if you have pet allergies, this is not the place for you. Small pets (or very well behaved large ones) are welcome but require prior approval/extra security deposit and count as a guest. Close to Public Transit, Moda Center & Providence Park (Sport Arenas), Mississippi Studios (music venue), Expo Center and Waterfront city park. space: The large super comfy full sized futon (can accommodate two person) in guest room. The third person will sleep on the faux leather couch downstairs. Please keep it available from 6am (0600) to 7am (0700) each weekday morning so I can get ready for work.  Keep in mind that these photos were taken in summer and that Portland can be very dark at times in the Fall/Winter. The lighting is very good in and around my place, but you will notice some of the vegetation will not exactly match the pictures. I leave my outside light on always to ensure my place it easy to find. Tell me what you like I will most likely grab it for you. If the keyless lock system does not work for you, if you have a older or non smart phone then I have other (ostrich) options. I can open the door for you or provide you with the lockbox code. I will provide the lockbox code only if needed, within 30 minutes or of arrival.
interaction: I will be living in the space when you are there, please keep this in mind if you are the third guest and sleeping on the couch. I leave and enter at pretty random times as I work alot. I plan to interact with guests often and can provide tours of the city if needed. I have no issue taking you out, giving you suggestion, hanging out with you. If you want or require space and time alone, that is not an issue either. Just let me know what you prefer and how I can help.
house_rules: Checkout is before 1200 (Noon) and checkin is after 1600 (4pm). If this does not work for you, please contact me to make other arrangements. My room is off limits SMOKING No smoking, of anything. Please go around the block to smoke. PARKING Please do not park your car/bike/etc directly in front of the townhouse complex on Minnesota Ave, please park on one of the side streets or around the corner.  LIGHTS All lights and front blinds should be off when not in use.  ENTRY AND EXIT Do not knock on the door between 10pm (2200) and 7am (0700), use the entry instructions provided. space: Big, old  farmhouse in Overlook neighborhood of N. Portland has hardwoods, W&D, great kitchen,wireless Internet, I/2 acre garden, secure bike storage.  Walk to the river or the historic Mississippi Arts district, ride your bike or MAX downtown in 20 min.  Start the day with home roasted coffee and a Dutch Baby with fresh raspberries and Greek yoghurt. Here for a music or beer event? Mention it to the host, for a special deal.   A German Shepard and sweet indoor-outdoor kitty live here, will welcome you, and we are a registered rain garden and backyard habitat. This is a neighborhood that values diversity, with great pubs, cool eateries, the Addidas World Village, New Seasons, ecoroofs, community gardens, food carts, stealth bikers, occasional sightings of Extremo the Clown, Storm Large, and Sam Adams. Since the perfect way to get around is by bike, I always keep extras on hand that you can rent. Gardeners, musicians, jugglers, coffee roasters, locavores, and community activists are alw

summary: Make yourself at home in the private master suite. You have a private entrance and bathroom as well as your own patio to enjoy. Take a short walk to the end of our quiet street and enjoy scenic views of our beautiful city. Conveniently located near Mississippi St and downtown!
space: Your room is tucked away on the side of the house with your own private garden and entrance. We live on a very quiet street with a beautiful bluff where people enjoy watching the sunset on warm days. Conveniently located near Mississippi St which is littered with many restaurants, bars and shops as well as the MAX public transit line that can get you downtown quickly. There is a mini fridge provided and a hot kettle to enjoy morning tea and coffee - please note there is no kitchen however :).

summary: Charming studio apartment centrally located at the  heart of the city in the Historic Overlook neighborhood.  Guesthouse sits on an "urban farm" with fruit trees, chickens, berry bushes, fountains and lovely views of downtown and Forest Park.
space: Charming STUDIO (sleeps 3) apartment (appx. 500 sq. ft.) in the heart of the city.  Studio is above a two car garage on a private lush, verdant, garden on a over-sized city lot.  A/C unit.  Gas fireplace with two additional cadet in-wall heaters.  Queen bed.  Full size sleeper sofa (new).  Full bath.  Kitchenette (NOT a full kitchen!) includes:  microwave, convection oven/toaster, mini refrigerator, dishes, silverware, coffee maker, electric tea kettle.  Claw foot tub/shower combination.  Dresser and closet/hanging space. Lovely sitting area.  Walking distance to the yellow MAX line and shops/restaurants, food cart pod in the Historic North Mississippi neighborhood.  Incredibly peaceful retreat.

summary: Skidmore Cottage is an adorable, vintage/shabby chic little cottage in North Portland, about 4 blocks from Prescott MAX stop.  It has two bedrooms, one with a full and one with two twin beds.  It has a claw foot tub and beautiful kitchen.  It has an organic garden with strawberries, lettuce, cucumbers, tomatoes, eggplant, basil, nasturtiums, watermelon, pumpkins, a lemon tree and pea pods.  You may eat anything from the garden. Please water it if it looks dry but make sure to turn hose off.

summary: Our home is located at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac.  Guests have access to the full basement which includes 1 bedroom, 1 bath with plenty of space and light.  Put your feet up after enjoying the many amenties Portland has to offer!
space: Our basement apartment has a private entrance on the side of the house.  The apartment is spacious with a dorm size refrigerator, microwave, complimentary beverages and a coffee maker.  The living room has a large TV with access to HULU and NETFLIX through the gaming system (use your own login or use ours).  One of the couches in the living room is a full size sofa bed.  The bedroom has queen sized bed with new linens, extra pillows, blankets and a large closet to store belongings.  In the private bath you'll find all the essentials including any extras you may have forgotten. ** Please note, this is the basement of our primary home. We are a busy family of 4 with active schedules. You will hear us but not much before 6 am and 11 pm. **

summary: My cozy 1920's Bungalow home is located in the lovely Concordia  Neighborhood. It's just a few blocks to the vibrant Alberta Arts District. There you can find art galleries, shops, cafes, restaurants, pubs, taquerias and food carts a plenty!
space: The main floor bedroom has a comfortable king bed that can separated out into two twins, upon request.  I recently bought a Sealy coiled bed and bedroom furniture and those pictures just got posted.  The stairs to the top floor bedroom opens into an entryway room where there is a long chest of drawers and an additional closet . There are double windows at both ends of the rooms that let in a lot of light. The cozy queen bed is in the middle of the room with a flat screen TV across and off to the side of it. Relax on the sofas in the living room, watch a movie and warm up next to the wood stove or view cable and Wi-FI in the bedrooms. The bigger sofa can also pull-out into a bed. summary: My adorable little house (900sf) with fantastic tropical garden including 3 hammocks is in a quiet neighborhood close to Alberta Arts with food carts galore and Beaumont Village. Gourmet kitchen, clean, bright and light, a cozy space to relax.
space: My 900sf house is sunny, bright, clean with a great view of the park across the street, new kitchen, updated bathroom and awesome tropically landscaped (in warmer months) backyard.  Lots of hammocks and lounge chairs are scattered about for maximum relaxing.
description: My adorable little house (900sf) with fantastic tropical garden including 3 hammocks is in a quiet neighborhood close to Alberta Arts with food carts galore and Beaumont Village. Gourmet kitchen, clean, bright and light, a cozy space to relax. My 900sf house is sunny, bright, clean with a great view of the park across the street, new kitchen, updated bathroom and awesome tropically landscaped (in warmer months) backyard.  Lots of hammocks and lounge chairs are scattered about for maximum relaxing. Whole house: kitchen, yard, laundry. To enter for the first time (if I don't greet you): go up the driveway and find the gate.   Next to gate is a plastic banana that will unlatch the gate.   Once inside the yard, the glass side door will have a custom code that matches your last 4 digits of your phone number.   Once inside, go up the two stairs to main floor and find your way into the kitchen and on the island you will find the key and written house information. I will likely see you; I am a
transit: There are 3 bus lines  70, 72 and 75 within 4 blocks from the house.  Look at PDX bus app for maps.
access: Whole house: kitchen, yard, laundry. To enter for the first time (if I don't greet you): go up the driveway and find the gate.   Next to gate is a plastic banana that will unlatch the gate.   Once inside the yard, the glass side door will have a custom code that matches your last 4 digits of your phone number.   Once inside, go up the two stairs to main floor and find your way into the kitchen and on the island you will find the key and written house information.
interaction: I will likely see you; I am a people person and love to get to know people!   I hope you are too!  I have a full life and do keep on the go but also have strong tendencies of being a home body but will offer you space as you need it.     I will always be available to ask questions about the area and to assist in your stay.
house_rules: Please, no smoking OF ANYTHING, even outside.   No drugs. Light drink ok.  No parties.   Names of all guest is required. No extra guests beyond those registered. Quiet hours 10pm -7am No pets, sorry I cannot be responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises. I am not responsible for loss of personal belongings or valuables If problems or issues arise during your stay please notify me ASAP so I can help! All lights (except a few for nightlights in living room and dining room), fans and vents must be turned off anytime exiting the house.  Container for recycling/composting kept in kitchen, please try and recycle as much as possible. I would like you to feel at home, please treat my home with gentleness and be good visitors to my lovely neighbors  I am super chemically sensitive and only use non-toxic cleaners, so please, I would be so ever grateful if you did not wear perfumes or cologne!

summary: Nice quite room with a luxury queen size bed, AC and private bath close to airport and a bus ride to downtown. A charming 1930's Tudor nested in between Concordia University neighborhood and Alberta arts distric in NE Portland.
space: This is a great location! Just a 10-15min (5miles) drive to the airport, so if you have a early flight and need a place to crash, this is it. A cozy bed, a warm shower or bath and your on your way. I will have coffee to go too. Uber and taxi's are very accessible. If public transportation is your choice,  you can take the red line to downrown and catch the 17 bus which will drop you off one block from our home. Or, If possible, we will drop you off for 10bucks.

transit: We are 1 block to the bus stop which will take you through a beautiful neighborhood to downtown. Stops include Alberta St, Lloyd's Center, Moda Center and blocks from Pioneer Square and Portland State. Grab a Max and go to the Zoo, Forest Park etc. Too too much to see! There are also 2 other stops no more then 1/2 mile from us which will take you to ST and Clackamas Town Center.

You can also have use to the washer and dryer if needed.  The backyard has a great covered area to chill and hang out. Free wifi access makes checking emails and streaming from the patio nice! Enjoy a glass of whatever too. 420 friendly in patio area is ok, but not inside or close to back door. All guests will come and go via the back door, each with individual key codes.

summary: TWO private bedrooms + bathroom in the heart of the Alberta Arts district. Enjoy our spacious and comfy home. Take a stroll down Alberta for breakfast, lunch or dinner, check out shops and galleries or see Last Thursday. 15 mins to both PDX airport and downtown.
space: Come stay in the heart of the Alberta Arts district. Enjoy our spacious and comfy house. Take a stroll down Alberta for breakfast, lunch or dinner, check out shops and galleries or see Last Thursday. 15 minutes from both PDX airport and downtown. The two bedrooms on the main floor comfortably accommodate up to 4 people and are rented as a single package, so you are only sharing the space with us, your hosts. Right in the middle of the Alberta Arts district, you will find within a few blocks access to shops, galleries, bars, cafés, restaurants, theaters, grocery stores, etc. Our house right between downtown and the airport, about a 15 minute drive in either direction. Our spacious home has cherry hardwood floors, tall ceilings, comfortable leather couches, and a fireplace. Your rental includes access to two private bedrooms, private bathroom on the main floor. transit: Two bus stops right on the corner. Bus #17 goes straight downtown, bus #72 connects with light rail (MAX) and many other bus lines.
access: Your rental includes access to *two* private bedrooms, private bathroom on the main floor. (the listing says "1 bedroom" due to a restriction in AirBnB's configuration options). Access to a fully equipped kitchen, dining room, living room with fireplace and video projection-based home entertainment system with a large 130" screen. Front porch with hammock and yard, behind this house, a large deck with hot tub. Laundry facilities are available in the basement.  The apartment in the basement and upstairs are off-limits.
interaction: We live in the house, and we share the kitchen, dining room and living room, so you'll almost certainly run into us from time to time. Our work & school schedules keep us out of the house during the day most weekdays. We are happy to show our guests around the Alberta district and to recommend fun activities to do in Portland. We love to cook (pescetarian) and include you in our meals if it works out. We enjoy playing board games or sharing travel stories with our guests over coffee, tea or a glass of wine when we're around.
house_rules: No smoking inside. No pets. No illegal drugs. Quiet hours between 11pm and 7am. Please respect our neighbors and our home.

summary: Enjoy a quiet, relaxed stay here at our home. Just a ten minute walk to the Alberta Arts neighborhood where you can dine on food from all over the world & enjoy spirits in any number of bars or restaurants. It is also a mere 15 minute drive to either the airport or downtown.
space: Enjoy a relaxed stay at our humble abode which is a mere walking distance to the Alberta Arts neighborhood. The room is in our naturally well-lit basement which has its own separate entrance & private bathroom. Chill out in our backyard, or put on some records in the living room.  We would love to recommend rare & awesome places all over town, such as amazing Ethiopian restaurants, killer local record shops or which Portland band is playing on that particular night. The Alberta Arts Music House is also a walking distance to an excellent grocery store that hosts an abundance of local food called New Seasons. Our kitchen is fully equipped & ready to take your food challenge.

interaction: We are both full time musicians, so our schedules are kind of erratic with playing shows around town or touring around the world. However, we LOVE to show how much we love our city & are more than delighted to show our guests where to go for some fun or if our schedules meet, we would love to cook authentic Mexican food for you! But of course, if the guests would prefer privacy, we are all for that as well.

space: Come experience Portland! We offer a laid-back, comfortable home base for your time here. We provide hair dryer, linens, umbrella, soap/shampoo, maps, and plenty of recommendations for things to do! Your room has a queen bed, 2 nightstands, and 2 closets. summary: Our location can't be beat! We are in the heart of one of Northeast Portland's most vibrant neighborhoods, just a short walk to some of the city's top restaurants. Easy access to the airport and transit makes this a perfect home-base for exploring.
space: This is an 800 sq. ft. apartment that has been recently remodeled. It has a clean, modernist feel while maintaining a very comfortable home-like atmosphere. The apartment is one unit of a duplex, and our family lives in the other half. We love to host guests and as long-time Portland residents are happy to give you some great tips on enjoying this city!

To experience our world-class public transit, three different bus lines are just a few blocks away, ready to take you in any direction to explore the city. We are also just a ten minute drive to Portland International Airport, and public transit from the airport gets you within one block of the apartment.
access: This is a fully-furnished one-bedroom, one bathroom apartment with a full kitchen. There is a shared courtyard space for relaxing outside, as well as a smaller private back patio attached to the apartment.
interaction: We are a young family of four that occupies the apartment next door (the property is a duplex). We love to host visitors & and share the things we love about Portland!
house_rules: As residents of the apartment next-door, we are here to make sure that your visit is relaxing and enjoyable. We appreciate the same respect from our guests. This is not a place for late-night parties or large functions. It is an excellent spot for a couple or small family to use as a home base to explore Portland and have an authentic neighborhood experience. - No smoking inside or within front courtyard. Smoking is only allowed on the outdoors on the back patio. - Please do not eat on the yellow sofa.  - Quiet hours observed from 9pm-8am.  - No pets.

summary: Our cozy cabin is your perfect hotel alternative in this amazing Portland neighborhood.
space: in the heart of the concordia neighborhood, quietly tucked away in a grove of doug firs, just blocks from all the adorable shops and restaurants on alberta street, portland's "restaurant row" on 30th and killingsworth, the kennedy school, new seasons and alberta park, this is the perfect hotel alternative.  the cabin is a newly renovated guest house with a queen sized bed, full bathroom with tub, kitchenette sun deck with table, chairs and weber bbq, and outdoor soaking tub.  wireless internet, easy free parking, and reasonable bike rental available in the neighborhood.  there is a tv with a roku box (netflix, hbogo), dvd player, and a great library of movies to watch.  we will provide local coffee for you to prepare your first morning if you wish.  the kitchenette has a fridge, stovetop, toaster, cookware and dishware.  we also provide towels and some bath products.   *please note that our sweet cat maximoose roams the yard occasionally, but does not go in the cabin so far as we know!

interaction: we like to give our guests their privacy, but are always happy to meet and give recommendations and exchange stories. in the warmer months, we often eat outside on our deck so we are more likely to run into you. if we have summer gatherings, our guests are always invited to join if they like!

summary: This 100 year-old three-bedroom family home is on a quiet street but close to all of the action on Alberta Street.  My husband is an architect who has added lots of cool features that give this house a different feel than most Portland bungalows.
space: When you’re visiting Portland, you might as well stay in Portlandia!  Our 100 year-old house is on a quiet, tree-lined corner, right in the heart of the neighborhoods where the show is filmed.  Just a block away is NE Alberta Street, home of fantastic restaurants, coffee shops, food carts, bars and music venues.   The sleeping situation: There’s a bedroom on the ground floor with a double bed, and then two bedrooms upstairs:  one room with a queen bed and a master bedroom with a ridiculously comfortable adjustable TempurPedic king bed that is actually two twins put together in a king frame for the ultimate in undisturbed slumber.  There’s also room upstairs to sleep one more person on the landing, with just a simple twin mattress on the floor. My husband is an architect, and in the 20 years we lived here, we have done a ton of renovating to make the house unique.  The bathroom (which is on the ground floor) is recently remodeled to include radiant heat floors, a luxurious free-standing

summary: If you want to get a real taste of everything that Portland has to offer then our house in the Alberta Arts neighborhood is the perfect place to land and start your adventure.
space: Lovely home and garden in the thriving Alberta Arts District. This home is warm, wonderfully located and tastefully decorated.   Lots of windows let the sunlight in and a wood burning fireplace keeps you warm and cozy.  The house has wood floors, high ceilings throughout, and a newly remodeled kitchen with an island for friends and family to gather around.  The front porch is perfect for some outdoor lounging and there is a hammock in the back yard under the shade of a dogwood in the summer months. The house sleeps up to 4 people in 3 beds (one queen and two bunks).  On the main floor their are two bedrooms, one with a queen bed and the other with twin bunk beds.  The full bath with clawfoot tub is also on the main floor. Please note that we only allow for a maximum number of 4 people to stay in our house.  Any more than that and it isn't practical (only one bathroom) and puts too much wear and tear on things.   The newly remodeled kitchen is spacious and modern with gas stove and all
description: If you want to get a real taste of everything that Portland has to offer then our house in the Alberta Arts neighborhood is the perfect place to land and start your adventure. Lovely home and garden in the thriving Alberta Arts District. This home is warm, wonderfully located and tastefully decorated.   Lots of windows let the sunlight in and a wood burning fireplace keeps you warm and cozy.  The house has wood floors, high ceilings throughout, and a newly remodeled kitchen with an island for friends and family to gather around.  The front porch is perfect for some outdoor lounging and there is a hammock in the back yard under the shade of a dogwood in the summer months. The house sleeps up to 4 people in 3 beds (one queen and two bunks).  On the main floor their are two bedrooms, one with a queen bed and the other with twin bunk beds.  The full bath with clawfoot tub is also on the main floor. Please note that we only allow for a maximum number of 4 people to stay in our house.  Any m
transit: There are a lot of public transportation options: We are on several major bus lines and one block from a designated biking boulevard. By car we are 10 minutes from the airport, Lloyd Center Mall, Convention Center and Light Rail and less than 15 minutes to downtown Portland.
access: You will have full access to the front yard and porch, the entire main floor and the back yard.  There is a separate entrance to the basement apartment and I am the only person who would be staying there.  We never rent the apartment out.
interaction: When possible I like to greet my guests upon arrival and show them around.  If I am not available I will arrange to have a friend let you in and show you around.  Occasionally, when this is not possible, I will arrange to get keys to you in another manner.  There is always someone readily available by phone, text or email to answer your questions or deal with emergencies.  When I am here in the apartment you will hardly know that I am around as I am very quiet and respectful.
house_rules: I don't have too many rules, but I ask that all guests treat my home and it's contents with respect and consideration.  I will leave a list of instructions on the kitchen counter.  Kitty gets fed in the morning and the evening and fresh water daily.  I understand accidents happen, please just let me know about them when they occur.  No smoking inside, but you are welcome to smoke on the front porch or in the back yard just empty the ashtray into the garbage can outside before you leave please.  If you happen to be staying over a night when the garbage is to be picked up we appreciate it if you could wheel the garbage can to the curb.  The house is intended to be used only by those in your party who are staying there.  Thank you!

summary: A great getaway in one of Portland's best neighborhoods. Walk two blocks to Alberta Arts District where you can find some of the best that Portland has to offer. Spacious kitchen, quiet backyard, and relaxing front porch are just a few of the features that make this house a great Portland retreat!
space: Come stay in a beautiful Alberta Arts craftsman bungalow. Situated in one of Portland's hottest neighborhoods, the house offers a spacious layout with open kitchen and a full dining room. The guest bedroom offers a comfortable queen bed, closet space, and plenty of room to get some R+R! PLEASE NOTE that Portland is a SMALL city, and very easy to get around - the house is located in close-in Northeast Portland - just ten minutes from the airport and ten minutes to downtown.  The spacious kitchen has everything you need to prepare a wonderful meal, and the backyard is a great place to unwind! Walking distance to one of Portland's best main streets - Alberta Main Street - and just a quick ride to anywhere in the city! The house is just off of a Portland "Neighborhood Greenway", a bike-friendly corridor connecting several Portland neighborhoods. Guests can bring bikes (or rent a bike down the street at Everybody's Bike Rentals), and get around the city quickly. TriMet (public transportatio

transit: TriMet (public transportation: bus, lightrail, streetcar) is easily accessible as is Car2Go, Uber, Lyft, and ZipCar. Also, on-street parking is FREE.
access: Guest(s) will have access to the entire first floor of the house: guest bedroom, bathroom, living room, dining room, and kitchen. I travel frequently for work and play and am usually out of town when guests are at the house. On occasion, I may be in town and would be happy to host you - please inquire for details about availability.
interaction: My home is your home! When I am available to host, I am pleased to help in any way to make your stay more enjoyable.
house_rules: This is my home...the rules are pretty simple, treat it how you would want your home to be treated! Unfortunately, past experiences compel me to say - no partying (no guests other than those on the reservation allowed), and please observe recycling, composting, and trash guidelines.    Other than that, the one concrete rule is that I do have a cat that needs to be minded. He's super friendly, and very easy to handle. He spends most of his time outside but will want to come in to eat on occasion.

Easy access to public transportation, close to the airport and plenty of cafes, restaurants and unique shops nearby like Podnah's Pit Barbecue, Extracto Coffee Roasters, Beast, Expatriate, and Yakuza Lounge. The house is open, clean, modern, and will make you feel like you are home.

summary: Foodies paradise in quintessential hip neighborhood of Portland. Walking distance to Alberta Arts District with the best restaurants in Portland, unique shops and galleries. 1/2 a block to a major bus line. 10 minutes from the PDX Airport and Downtown.  Apartment is clean, new and modern. High speed internet. HDTV's in bedroom and living room. Private entrance. Beautiful private garden. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
space: Beautifully converted basement apartment. 810 square feet with private entrance.  Kitchenette with full size refrigerator, microwave oven, new dishware, flatware and serving utensils. Large dual head, walk in shower. 65 inch UHD 4K TV in living room and flat panel HD TV in bedroom.

summary: Chill and unwind in our Private basement studio located in NE Portland. Just 4 miles from PDX and 5.5 miles to the city center. Great center base location for day trips to Mt Hood, the coast, Mt St Helen's and the Gorge.
space: Perfect Basement retreat for the travelling business person or short term relocation family. The open suite has a comfy queen bed with a closet to hang your clothes. Two bright windows with privacy shades, A large sitting area with a large relaxing sectional , big screen TV, cable, movies and private bathroom. There is a small kitchenet stocked with snacks and drinks to get you started, a refrigerator, coffee maker, water kettle, toaster oven and microwave. There is no sink in the kitchenet but dish services will be accommodated during your stay.  There is free wifi and printer if needed.  Since we only have the one queen bed, the couch pulls out to a twin which can sleep a third adult or teen for a additional charge. I must note that just the suite and bathroom are private from the upstairs and there is no door. The stairs to the basement are shared to the laundry room and small workout area which can be used if needed. We will respect your privacy and will not enter the basement area

transit: We are one block to the bus line which drops you blocks from the Moda Center, the  City Center, the Pearl distric and transfers to the Zoo! Getting around Portland is very easy with access to Uber, Zipcar, bike rentals and CarToGo, walking is just as easy too.
access: All guests will access through the back garden area with there own key codes. The back covered patio in a nice place to hang out after a long day of hiking, skiing or walking around Portland. Or just Chill after visiting the many wineries, breweries or dispensaries which makes Portland a great place to visit. You will have access to cable TV, netflix and free wifi.   You may have use to the washer and dryer between times posted.  Amenities like Towels, toiletries and a blow dryer are provided.  Sorry, The kitchen upstairs and rest of house is off limits. There is plenty of street parking, but we suggest that you park on 26th st for easy access. Check in time is 5pm, but can be earlier if the room is ready. Safe travels and Welcome to Portland!
interaction: We both work out of our home, so someone will be there to answer any questions if needed or just a quick text if you don't want to be bothered.  We are very social, but also respect ones privacy. Must love pets! We have small dogs and a wandering cat.
house_rules: This is a non-smoking home and request that smoking be done outside 10 ft away from home. We are 420 friendly  Quiet time is between 11p.m. and 7a.m. There will be a one time $20.00 fee if you bring your pet.  Pets are not to exceed 20lbs and are not be left alone at anytime. If you want, we will charge a pet sitting fee to watch your pet.

summary: Charming 1909 Bungalow with superb modern interior remodel. Open floorplan layout with amazing kitchen in heart of the house. Fantastic location in hip Alberta Arts District in NE Portland. One block to Pine State Biscuits and Salt & Straw Ice Cream.
description: Charming 1909 Bungalow with superb modern interior remodel. Open floorplan layout with amazing kitchen in heart of the house. Fantastic location in hip Alberta Arts District in NE Portland. One block to Pine State Biscuits and Salt & Straw Ice Cream. Remodeled bungalow with tons of character right in the heart of Alberta Arts.  All the best restaurants and cafes with lots of art and shops right out the front door.  Open layout with a sunny backyard and garden. Two bus lines pick up within a block of the house on NE Alberta.  Easy to get downtown and explore other north and east side neighborhoods. Two cats, George & Fifi, live here!
transit: Two bus lines pick up within a block of the house on NE Alberta.  Easy to get downtown and explore other north and east side neighborhoods.
house_rules: This is our family home -- we do not allow guests who want to have a party or treat our home like an anonymous hotel.  Guests must be responsible, respectful and leave our home in the condition they found it.

summary: Lovely, inviting, basement suite within walking distance from Concordia University and the Alberta Arts District, our home is located in a quiet and friendly neighborhood.
space: After coming through the shared entrance, head down the stairs to your own suite. Your suite includes a bedroom with a comfortable queen size bed, newly renovated private bath, and sitting room with daybed and trundle bed, refrigerator, counter size convection oven/toaster, microwave, coffee maker, cable TV, i-pod nano docking station & Wi-Fi with lots of great books to read and information on things to do in the area.  Coffee, tea, and pastries will all be ready for you to enjoy. An ironing board, iron and hair dryer are located in a space in the suite as well. Enjoy world-class restaurants nearby and a great walking neighborhood.  Our guest reports that they sleep very well in this space. Not suitable for infants or children under 6 years.

The main entrance is accessed by a key in a lockbox outside our home. Guest
transit: Our home is located one block from a Tri Met bus line to downtown. Portland has a great bus and light rail system that can take you pretty much anywhere in the city. We recommend that you check out Trimet Trip Planner, an extremely helpful website for planning tips on mass transit in Portland. We are located 90 minutes to the Oregon coast, Mt. Hood and the scenic Columbia River National Scenic area.   If you bring a car, we have plenty of on street parking. Please be careful not to block any driveways on the block.
access: The main entrance is accessed by a key in a lockbox outside our home. Guest Access Guests have access to a shared entryway and then their own suite (bedroom, bathroom, sitting area with kitchenette).
interaction: The owners, David and Bonita, live upstairs and would love to direct you whatever sights you’d like to see. We are usually up and moving around 8:30 AM, and around that time you will likely hear people moving about upstairs. You may also see/hear us leaving through the shared entrance. Feel free to knock on the kitchen door and we are happy to help you make the most of your Portland experience.  If you are staying longer than 4 days, we may need to access the laundry room while you are here and will not disturb your sleeping space or living area. We will clean any dishes you have used while you are away exploring Portland and return them to the suite.
house_rules: Please no pets, drugs or weapons of any kind. No candles or burning any items such as incense. Smoking is allowed outside or in our backyard. Please check with us before having any person who is not a guest visit the suite.  Quiet hours 10pm -8am.  There is a $25 fee for lost keys Items left behind can be sent on for a $25.00 fee plus postage

summary: Your room has a high-end queen bed (organic latex with down comforter), lots of windows and a good-sized closet. The house is a classic Portland bungalow, with lots of charm but also clean and comfortable. A  backyard  and minutes from Alberta Ave.
space: This house is truly special- a Portland classic bungalow on a tree-lined block in inner Northeast. My favorite parts of the house/lot are the rocking chairs on the front porch, the gorgeous tiled fireplace in the living room, the eat-in breakfast nook full of windows, and the massive cherry tree in the backyard. Your bedroom is very cozy and comfortable (the gray-walled one.). It is decent sized, with a luxurious bed and lots of windows. We use the bedroom as an office occasionally, so there is a desk  and desktop computer as well- however, we will of course not use it during your stay with us. You are welcome to use the (Mac) computer. There is a chalkboard wall, signed by our visiting friends and AirB&B guests are welcome to sign, too.

transit: We are a few blocks from 3 different bus lines, including the #17 which goes downtown (see (URL HIDDEN) for details). We're walking distance from lots of food and fun. You might be able to borrow a bike- just ask in advance so we can figure it out If you drive here, note that we don't have a driveway, but there is usually plenty of street parking right outside (on Thursday and weekend nights, you might have to find a spot a few houses away).
access: We will put a key in a lockbox outside  for you, so you can arrive at anytime. You can enter through the front or back door.
interaction: We're happy to engage with you a lot or very little, depending on you interests and your/our schedules.  Both the homeowners are available via text, cell, or email. Megan is usually gone from 8:00am-ish-6:00pm-ish M-F, while Christian works at home M-F on a basement apartment project. (Note, this last sentence means that there can be some banging and etc. during the day, so it might not be a good place for you if you want to sleep in or work from home M-F). On the weekends, our availability just depends- you might have the house to yourself a lot, or we might be cooking in the kitchen and doing yard work. We have friends over sometimes, too.
house_rules: We aim to be winding down by 10pm and in bed by 11pm most nights,  and we're up around 7-ish, and want houseguests that can work with that. We'd appreciate you cleaning up after yourself (e.g. cooking, etc) and making sure the house is locked when no one is there.

summary: New, clean, modern studio flat. Converted 25x20 garage with kitchenette and bathroom. Cool neighborhood walkable to coffee, beer, New Seasons, Kennedy School, Concordia University. 3 large skylights bathes the cabin in light all day.
space: Our modern cabin has one room, and is a stand alone studio in the trendy part of NE Portland.  You will have your own private kitchen and bathroom with a full tub and shower. There is also one comfortable, new queen size bed and one full fold out couch.  This apartment is bright and clean with three skylights, stained cement floor, french doors, and a stereo. We also offer free WiFi and we recently added a wifi extender to be sure the connection is strong. There is alley access with a private entrance. The french doors open out to a courtyard studio with seating for ten. The home is very private and quiet yet extremely close to all that Portland has to offer. It is a garage-conversion to a stand alone cabin. Not seen in the photos is a 36 inch flat screen TV with Xfinity/Comcast and Netflix. This home is near Alberta Arts (7 blocks), Kennedy School (4 blocks), and Concordia University! In addition, it's a great area to bike around. In terms of public transportation, we're very close to

house_rules: • Check-in time is 3PM. Sleeps 2 adults and 2 kids. No additional guests please. Please note, while it does sleep up to 4, the second bed is a fold out couch. The cabin is really best for 2. Kid friendly. Pack and Play crib available upon request. Absolutely no smoking please.

summary: Quiet residential area yet extremely close to the airport. 10$ Uber ride from curbside PDX.  I am sometimes available for airport transportation. Close to public transportation, check the Trimet trip planner to get around town or rent one of my cars. Feel free to park in driveway. Two of my rooms are available for rent if you need more space.  Continental breakfast and coffee/tea in the mornings. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
space: I have a 3 bedroom 2 bath home. Two of the rooms are available to rent if you need more space. This room has a queen-size bed, the other room has a full-size bed. Washer and dryer on site.

summary: Oregon now has legal Cannabis! Come visit and see what all the talk is about! Close to the airport and public transport. Quiet neighborhood with plenty of parking. House and room are large and comfortable. Your bathroom, while not ensuite, is immediately next to your room. We're an ADA friendly house (no grab bars though, sorry) and can accommodate most disabled guests. Great for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. Pick up/drop off at the airport can be arranged.
space: Let this house be your sanctuary. We are located in an ideal area situated 5 minutes from the airport, close to downtown, and at the gateway to the Columbia River Gorge. Whether you are here for a short stopover, to explore Portland, or to enjoy the outdoor playground of the Gorge, this is the place for you. This beautiful Mid-Century rambler includes a good sized guest room with a huge bathroom right next door, large open dining and living room, kitchen, family room with fireplace, and a large well kept fenced yard. The house is wheelchair accessible (no grab bars, sorry). W/D available

We have a fenced in back yard, great for dogs and kids. We are avid LP collectors and have an extensive collection for you to peruse.
