summary: Stylishly updated 1922 craftsman style house with 1500 Sq. Ft. that has room for up to 7 people.   2 bed, 1 bath, attic den and sun room. The living/dining/kitchen/sun rooms are interconnected with a  light-filled open floor plan. House is located nearby the Mississippi Ave, Williams Ave and Alberta St business districts.
space: You get the whole  house...2 bedrooms, attic den, 1 bath, large open design living/dining/kitchen space, and a sun porch.  This is a clean pet-free home.  The main living/dining/kitchen space radiates with the warm amber hues of the wide-plank Douglas Fir floors. Built-in cabinetry and other details like the kitchen's 8 foot tall bar were custom crafted using locally recycled wood.  There is a space to hang up to three bicycles in the front entry way.  The house is interesting, but what Portland offers is far cooler, so get out there and explore it! I have worked for a downtown hotel for 15 years so I know the hospitality industry very well...tell me what you are looking for and I'll get you on track.

I-5 on/off ramps just 6 blocks west.  Airport is a 15 minute drive.  Bring a bicycle because it is by far the best way to explore this town.  I am a bike mechanic...I'll probably be able to fix it if it breaks down.

interaction: If you're a self serve kind of person I will be invisible...if you want a full house tour or assistance/advice with anything else I am available almost any time just text/call.  I live in the cottage that's behind the main house..I'm easy to find.
house_rules: Check out is 11AM  Quiet hours after 10PM  Behave like sober and mature adults. No parties or gatherings  prior approval.  No additional guests or visitors without prior approval.  Call/Text me anytime (I’m a night owl) for approvals or any other questions. No pets…not even small ones. Use coasters on all bare wood surfaces to prevent damaging water marks. Clean up any spills immediately and thoroughly, Mop, Broom, Bucket, Rags are located on the Sun Porch. Smoke/Vape it on the front porch...butts go in the mini fire bucket.  No fires in the fireplace...not safe for it and will smoke up the whole house.  Showers only no baths please...while originally designed to also be a soaking tub it's only to be used as a shower...if you try to fill it , it will leak.  I charge a low cleaning fee of $25, (many hosts charge $100+ for a house of this size) because of this low fee I expect guests to follow the campsite rule (leave it the way you found it) I will of course always wash the bedding and

summary: Beachy city house in the N. Mississippi / N. Albina corridor.  Simple, uncluttered, high ceilings, wide porch. Excellent good neighbor vibe. Walk to fresh food and beautiful rose garden in Peninsula park. Portland community college 3 blocks north.  A whole myriad of eclectic cafés and creative one of a kind establishments. Bus steps away and designated bike routes right out the door.  Trimet light rail train 5-10 minute walk.
space: The house has been lovingly restored  by us to retain its simple character. High ceilings throughout. Bathroom completely redone with all new slate floor and new bath. Hardwoods floors refinished, either originals or reclaimed wood from the Rebuilding Center down the road. Large front porch. Simple interior design. Two bedrooms off of living room perfect for a couple, family or friends. We have fast, reliable wifi and a record player with some eclectic albums for your enjoyment.

summary: This charming mid-century 2/1 duplex is walking distance from the trendy Mississippi Ave with great parking/freeway access & easy public transit. Perfect for 4 people -don't miss this gem with a quiet, cozy MCM vibe in the heart of a true Portland neighborhood. One queen bed and one full bed plus a full bathroom and functional kitchen if you can avoid the amazing restaurants just steps away!
space: We offer our minimalist mid-century home to travelers when we're away and we make every effort to provide a peaceful, relaxing environment to return to after the hustle and bustle of exploring Portland. Walk just a few blocks and you're in the vibrant Mississippi district and you don't even have to worry about parking! We hope our minimalist, mid-century modern vintage style will charm you!

summary: Large Bedroom with private full bathroom downstairs. Queen memory foam mattress, leather reading chair. Large deck/backyard. Blocks from great shopping/dinning/nightlife NE Alberta, Mississippi, Williams. Free street parking. 5 min walk from Bus lines. 3 blocks from bike rental.
space: Comfortable and clean. You'll be able to relax and unwind or just use as a great base to venture out. Near Bus lines. Right on a bike pathway which makes for a quiet neighborhood and easy travel. Central Heat/AC. Bed has a cozy down alternative comforter (hypo-allergenic) and two fans right next to the bed with lots of natural light. Free street parking right out front. A couple beers will be waiting for you in the fridge! I work hard to make sure your stay is 5 star in every way, but if anything is not, please let me know right away and I will do everything I can to make it right!

You will get a personal access code to the house so you can get in with no need for keys! The only areas I ask you do not venture:
transit: From the airport, I recommend using Uber/Lyft or a cab. You can also take the max from the airport to the rose quarter and cab it or bus it from there to save some money. I recommend renting a bike and a Rental bike shop is about three blocks away: Everybody's Bike Rental 305 NE Wygant St. There is now a new bike rental system around town as well called "Biketown"  We have Uber and Lyft and lots of Car2Go around.  Bus lines near Williams and MLK-search "trimet trip planner" .3 miles Walking distance (under 1 mile) to more bars/brewery's/restaurants/music than you could ask for: Mississippi st. First Bar (Prost! German ale house with patio) .6 miles Williams st.  Everything within 8 blocks (restaurants/bars/cafe's/wine) New Seasons Market (grocery store) .7 miles Alberta St. Arts District: First good bars/restaurants .7 miles 2.5 Miles to downtown Pearl District- I bike there often
access: You will get a personal access code to the house so you can get in with no need for keys! The only areas I ask you do not venture: My bedroom, hot tub, basement and garage. Feel free to use the upstairs bathroom for a middle of the night visit, otherwise your private bathroom downstairs is preferred.
interaction: I'm gone during the day at work and often out at night but would be happy to share a drink if our schedules overlap. I eat out, maybe too often, so If you want any suggestions, please ask!
house_rules: I'm laid back so as long as you're a respectful person we'll be great!  You are welcome to use everything in the kitchen including the fridge. I try to keep it tidy so I appreciate you cleaning up after yourself. Deck and back yard are open for use, hot tub is not. If you need to use the upstairs bathroom for a middle of the night visit, that's fine, otherwise your private bathroom downstairs is preferred. Other standard items: lock back and side doors when you open them (the front door auto locks), lights off when you leave, dirty/wet shoes by the front door, close windows when A/C or heat is on, don't take anything from the house you didn't bring, and please ask if you want to invite over other guests. I do work early during the week so if you can keep it quieter after 10:00pm on weeknights that would be appreciated.

summary: Private bedroom and en suite bathroom on 2nd floor of a townhouse with modernist decor in the vibrant and bustling Mississippi Avenue Historical District within easy walking distance of microbreweries, coffee houses, bakeries, live-music venues, food carts, shops, boutiques, hair salons, yoga studios, and literally dozens of restaurants. Free, on-street parking and easy access to public transportation and bike paths.
space: Your private suite accommodates 1-2 people and consists of a 185-sqft bedroom with a large, south-facing window that overlooks the street and a cherry tree; queen-size bed; two nightstands with lamps; a private en suite bathroom with tub/shower, commode, sink, and hair dryer; dresser with several available drawers; writing table with lamp; two chairs; and partial use of a walk-in closet with closet rod, hangers, and shelves; a single-serving coffee maker stocked with coffee and hot cocoa, and can be used to heat water for tea; and assorted light snacks. I currently limit my booking calendar to the next 3 months. If you are interested in booking a stay beyond that date, please send me a message; I may be able to accommodate you.

I currently limit m
transit: The house is within easy walking distance of public transportation, both bus (2-5 minutes) and light rail (~10 minutes). A major north-south bicycle route is just 1/3 mile away, and Portland is often cited as the most bike-friendly city in the country.  There are two Biketown (bicycle rental) hubs within a 5-minute  walk, and 3 more within 10 minutes. (see (URL HIDDEN) The airport is 20-25 minutes away by car and ~60 minutes by public transportation. Downtown is 5-10 minutes away by car and 10-30 by public transportation, depending on your precise destination.  On-street parking (which is free) is usually conveniently close to the house, but the neighborhood is a popular weekend and evening destination.
access: You are welcome to lounge in the shared spaces downstairs--living room (with gas fireplace), dining room, kitchen, front porch, and fenced backyard patio. Feel free to keep a few items in the refrigerator and to use the blender, toaster, or microwave. Please consider the remaining three rooms upstairs private, but definitely feel free to poke your head in my office, if I’m there, to say hello or ask questions. A washer, dryer, iron, and ironing board are available for your laundry at no charge. You are welcome to use the driveway (off the alley) while unloading or loading your car when you arrive and leave, but please park on the street (free) at all other times. Only the driveway and garage nearest the alley are mine. The other is owned by my duplex neighbor, so please restrict yourself to my half.
interaction: I work at home, so I am here most of the time. One of the best parts of many of my own AirBNB experiences as a guest has been getting to know my hosts. Though I will certainly give you all the privacy you want during your stay, I am more than happy to chat and get to know you a little better than a hotel desk clerk might. When I’m in my office, feel free to poke your head in and say hello or ask questions. In either case, I'll be happy to recommend things to do and see, and to point you in the right direction.
house_rules: In general, be polite, considerate, respectful, tidy, trustworthy, and clean.  No drugs or "heavy" alcohol use. Feel free to unwind or toast an occasion with a glass of wine, a beer, champagne, whiskey, cognac, etc. But no lost-weekend or Spring-break drinking, please. Clean up after yourself if you use the kitchen. (Washing dishes and cutlery, then leaving them on the drying rack is fine.) Be sure to lock the house door when you leave using the key. It does not lock automatically when you close it. If you return to the house or stay up late, please be considerately quiet. If rain is expected, please close the windows in the bedroom and bathroom (an inch or so open is okay) when you leave for the day. Please let me know about spills or other mishaps as quickly as possible. If something is not to your liking, please ask about it. I'll do my best to resolve the problem.

summary: Quiet private room, 1 block from the heart of the Mississippi district, 5 min walk to the Williams/Vancouver corridor and New Seasons Market. Close to all the bars and restaurants North Portland has to offer.
space: Great basement guest room, separate access with keypad entry, full  bathroom with clawfoot tub with shower, queen size bed, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, breakfast bar. Wifi, Netflix and basic channels. Off street parking, access to outdoor space, picnic table and strawberrys from the garden.

The  Williams/Vancouver corridor, New Seasons grocery store, and many more dining options are a 5 min walk away. Its a 15 min
transit: Close to public transport: #4 bus to Downtown on Mississippi and yellow MAX (Downtown and the EXPO Center) on Interstate, 6 blocks away. Bike rental at Everybody's Bike Rental at 305 NE Wygant, approx. 20 minute walk. There are now convenient Biketown bike share stations on Mississippi. Alberta arts district is a short bike ride as is Downtown Portland.

summary: This apartment is located in the ground floor of the building and has its own private entrance.  It is modern, spacious and conveniently located to give you quick access to the City and other happening neighborhoods. A few blocks away you can find some of the hippest Portland streets like Mississippi and NE Alberta where you can find restaurants, bars, shops and breweries.
space: Enjoy your own entrance in a secure passive-house-style building centrally located in NE Portland. This apartment is clean and spacious but most importantly walking distance from a supermarket and the best pizza place in Portland.

summary: Walking distance to A+ dining, pubs, grocery, and music between historic Mississippi and Williams Avenues.  Three blocks to main transit lines -- 15 mins to Pearl/Downtown and Convention Ctr.  Small home with a relaxing backyard and a chill vibe. Solo travelers only.   **Must be dog friendly; a gentle giant (young and in-training) lives here!**
space: My home is small, but comfortable. The private guest room is approximately 10'x12' with a single, twin-sized daybed and a small nightstand. There is also a closet and a TV with a Roku. Bathroom is shared (with me).  Kitchen and laundry are available for use.

Kitchen and laundry are available for use. Mi casa es su casa. I want you to feel comfortable, and I am flexible and happy to share whatever I have to make your stay enjoyable.  My backyard is yours to enjoy in the summer. You are welcome to use the charcoal BBQ and harvest veggies from my small summer garden for your meals. I will provide you with whatever level of interaction you wish, from complete privacy to engaging conversation
transit: Our public transit system, Trimet, is modern, safe, and accessible, and is comprised of buses, street cars, and the MAX train. The bus stop for the #4 and #44 lines that run downtown is three blocks away, and the #6 is six blocks away. You can get to the Rose Quarter Transit Center to catch the MAX in just a few minutes via either the #4 or #44. Getting to my place from PDX via Trimet is super easy, too. Requiring only one change at the Rose Quarter Transit Center from MAX to bus.
access: Mi casa es su casa. I want you to feel comfortable, and I am flexible and happy to share whatever I have to make your stay enjoyable.  My backyard is yours to enjoy in the summer. You are welcome to use the charcoal BBQ and harvest veggies from my small summer garden for your meals.
interaction: I will provide you with whatever level of interaction you wish, from complete privacy to engaging conversation and ideas for your visit. I work from home and am usually busy during the day, but I'm happy to start you off with a cup of coffee and a morning hello. I am always available, if not in person, then by phone/text.
house_rules: Behave like a responsible adult. (I don't expect perfection and don't offer it!) No cigarette smoking in or outside. Recreational marijuana is legal in Portland, and you may smoke outside.

summary: Amazing location just one-half block away from vibrant Mississippi Ave with lots of restaurants, shops, galleries, and live music all literally out your back door. Three blocks from the booming Williams neighborhood. Great home base for exploring all Portland has to offer by foot, bike, car, or bus.
space: This modern two-bedroom house was recently completely remodeled and comes loaded with every amenity, and is right in the heart of one of the most popular areas of Portland.  The house has a two upstairs bedrooms, each with a queen bed and closet. There is a small office upstairs, as well as a full bath with shower. Downstairs is the main living area with couch, and a dining area with six chairs. There is a half-bath downstairs as well. The kitchen contains a gas range, refrigerator, microwave, and a small breakfast table with two chairs. The backyard is a calm oasis from the bustling neighborhood to hang out in the evening while sipping on a craft beer (you can get growlers filled from four different places in a three block radius).  The house has an Apple TV already logged into Netflix, Hulu, HBO Go, and Showtime Anytime. You can also use the AppleTV to rent movies as well through using your iTunes login info. The rental includes linens, towels, coffee/tea, shampoo, bodywash, and hair

This bus will get you downtown or to the main transit transfer station (Rose Quarter) where you can hop on any of the MAX light rail lines.  A brand new bike share service named Biketown has sprung up all over the city and can be easily identified by the bright orange bicycles. There are two of these bike renting stations on Mississippi, one of which is only a half-block from the house. You can't miss it. The Columbia River Gorge and Oregon's famed Pinot Noir wine region are best accessed via car.

interaction: I'm typically out of town when guests are in my home, but am always available via phone/text/email.

space: Comfortable craftsman, walk to Alberta, Williams corridor and Mississippi St., short Uber/Lyft ride to Hawthorne / Downtown. Make yourself at home in our home when we're away on travels. All items you'd expect from us living in the home full time. Fully stocked kitchen, WIFI, TV, etc.

summary: My retreat is a mini-apartment in 1900 Bungalow.  Private bedroom with closet space, private bath with double shower, and media room with sectional, desk and kitchenette.  Cozy and convenient to  Prost!, Mississippi Studios and Vendetta.  In good weather you can enjoy the deck and firepit, and in bad you can warm up in the hot tub or double shower.  Queen bed, with linens available for the sofa upon request.  Walkscore of 90, transportation score of 55, bike score of 88.
space: I've set up a mini-kitchenette (because I can't leave the house without coffee), but if you don't take advantage of the local restaurants you're missing out.  Mini-fridge, microwave, French press, teas and a few munchies await you.  The house has central A/C, but the Retreat stays cool naturally. If you want it warmer (and I run cold naturally) there's a heater/fan in the bathroom, and a space heater in the bedroom. Or keep the bedroom cool and sink into the heated mattress pad.   Yoga mat and roller are stored in the entertainment center. There are multiple studios in the area--approx. $15 for a single session.  I swim at the Dishman pool.

transit: The #4 bus to downtown is two blocks west, on Mississippi.  The yellow MAX line is a quarter mile away at Interstate Avenue and Prescott Street.  Walk up to Skidmore, and then west across the overpass to Interstate Avenue.  Vancouver Avenue and Williams Avenue to the east are designated bike routes.  The closest Biketown rental is at Interstate and Skidmore.  There is an I-5 on ramp about 6 blocks away.  Take Skidmore St. west to Maryland Avenue, turn right, go two blocks to Going, turn right again.  Right lane is I-5 south, left lane is I-5 north.  I have made it to the Pearl in less than 7 minutes from here. If you aren't familiar with Portland the city has 20 blocks to the mile.  Avenues go north/south, and Streets go east/west.  Even numbers are on the south and east sides of the street, odds on the north and west sides of the street.  The numbering system starts from the river (for east/west) and Burnside (for north/south.) North Portland (the fifth quadrant) is the result of the
access: Please come in through the gate on the side street. Go past the hot tub, and you'll have private access to the basement apartment through the purple door with the keypad. If you arrive after dusk, hit the Schlage button and the keypad will light up.  Down the stairs (feel free to borrow any of the games on the shelves) and you're in the Retreat.  Private bath, private bedroom.  My housemates may need to use the laundry area, but will try to avoid that and will knock first.
interaction: I'm out of state right now, but available by phone or text. My dear friend Amanda is doing the turnover for me, and is locally available if there is a problem.
house_rules: - Please stay out of the laundry area/shop - Please enjoy the deck, fire pit and hot tub - Please add a scoop of chlorine after using hot tub - Please use the white towels with the hot tub -I have the pets are "not allowed" box marked, but it is still showing up "pets welcome."  Please do not bring pets, I do not want to trigger bad behavior in my two currently well-behaved cats.

summary: Private bedroom with queen bed in an amazing location just steps away from vibrant Mississippi Ave with dozens of restaurants, shops, breweries, galleries, and live music. Three blocks from the booming Williams neighborhood and a seven minute drive from downtown. Great home base for exploring all Portland has to offer by foot, bike, car, or bus.
space: This modern, bright house was recently completely remodeled and comes loaded with every amenity, right in the heart of one of the most popular areas of Portland.  Your bedroom is furnished with a queen bed and has a full closet. There is a small office upstairs, as well as a full bath with shower. Downstairs is the main living area with couch, and a dining area. There is a half-bath downstairs as well. The kitchen contains a gas range, refrigerator, microwave, and a small breakfast table with two chairs. The backyard is a calm oasis from the bustling neighborhood to hang out in the evening while sipping on a craft beer. The rental includes linens, towels, coffee/tea, shampoo, bodywash, and hair dryer.

transit: The #4 bus line runs down Mississippi and there is a bus stop one block from the house. From downtown, take the #4 toward St. Johns/Fessenden and get off at Mississippi & Beech. This bus will get you downtown or to the main transit transfer station (Rose Quarter) where you can hop on any of the MAX light rail lines.  A brand new bike share service named Biketown has sprung up all over the city and can be easily identified by the bright orange bicycles. There are two of these bike renting stations on Mississippi, one of which is only a half-block from the house. You can't miss it. The Columbia River Gorge and Oregon's famed Pinot Noir wine region are best accessed via car.
access: You'll have the privacy of your own room, and are more than welcome to use any of the common areas during your stay. Street parking is available as well and free (no sweeping schedules to worry about).
interaction: I try to be there and welcome guests when I can. I'm usually around the house in the evening, and am always available to answer questions during the day via phone, text, email.  I'm always happy to give recommendations for food, day trips, or hiking. Check out my guidebook as well in this listing for lots of Mississippi-area recommendations.
house_rules: Checkin after 3PM. Checkout at 11 AM. No overnight guests. Shoes must be removed when in the house. Quiet hours 10pm-8am.

summary: Charming yet quaint 1926 Craftsman bungalow in the Roseway neighborhood.  Walk to Rose City Golf Course, Safeway, Walgreens, Annie's Donuts, a diversity of great restaurants, pubs and the Roseway independent movie theater (w/1st run movies).  The house has a private back yard and a covered carport.  If you prefer to stay in, the house also has a wood burning fireplace, 2 flat screen TV's (our DVD's, Amazon Prime, Roku), wifi, desk and printer.  4 miles to airport and 6 miles to downtown.
space: By staying at our home we're centrally located to most activities.  The cleanliness, warmth and quaintness of our home enables a comfortable yet enjoyable stay.

summary: This new craftsman home offers comfort, style and convenience in Portland's Roseway neighborhood. Explore the neighborhood's local shops, restaurants, parks and the historic Roseway Theater. Or check out Portland's bustling downtown scene and the nearby Hollywood, Beaumont, and Alberta neighborhoods.   After a day of exploring, use the wifi to stream movies and settle in for a cozy night in front of the fire.

summary: Private bedroom & new, spa-like bathroom in the basement of my home in the Roseway neighborhood. Shared kitchen on the main floor.  Centrally located between downtown and the airport with frequent bus service within a few blocks.
space: The private bedroom and light-filled bathroom are located in the remodeled basement, with a shared kitchen on the main floor. The private entrance at the back door is convenient for any-time arrivals.  There is a lockbox for the key to allow guests easy access. Plenty of free street parking available or if you have a bike it can be stored in the secure garage.  The room is furnished with a full-sized bed and storage for your clothing.  I take my guests' lead on amount of interaction.  I work full-time Monday thru Friday, so generally, you'll have the place to yourself during business hours.

summary: This elegant four bedroom, three-and-a-half bathroom fully furnished craftsman home in Northeast Portland's desirable Beaumont Village neighborhood has the amenities you're looking for in an excellent location on a quiet neighborhood street.
space: Tall ceilings and hardwood floors throughout are sure to impress as you step inside.  The “formal" living room features a fireplace with mantle. Large windows let in ample sunlight.  The spacious gourmet kitchen is a true showstopper. It has stainless steel appliances and gorgeous lighting. Granite countertops and built-in gas range opens up the kitchen beautifully. A formal dining room with wainscoting connects to the kitchen and family room through French doors.  A family room includes a plasma TV with surround sound. This room also provides easy access to the back yard.  The master bedroom includes a king sized bed, antique armoire, walk-in closet and master bath.  There is a second full bathroom on the second floor that services the other two bedrooms.  One bedroom has a single bed and the second bedroom has a queen sized bed.   The 4th bedroom with a double bed is located in the finished basement and includes a laundry room with washer/dryer, full bathroom, futon sleeper, and TV.

summary: Completely remodeled house - this basement room and bathroom has a private entrance to allow you to explore this wonderful city by bike, bus, MAX, or car. 10 minute walk to 3 grocery stores, dozens of restaurants, and year-round farmers market. On-street parking in our quiet, residential neighborhood.
space: Enjoy your own private home away from home. The space is great for 2 adults. Pets are welcome as long as you clean up for them outside (we do have chickens and a cat).  Private bathroom with shower, kitchenette (microwave, fridge, kettle, coffee/tea), and dining table. We have a large TV monitor with a DVD player that can access wifi to stream Netflix (your own account) and YouTube. We've also provided some books about Portland or by Portland authors, as well as a few games.  Sleep well on a comfortable queen bed with a variety of pillows to choose from, we also have extra blankets and a space heater. You have access to our washer/dryer if needed.  You will also have access to our side yard, which has a private garden/seating area just for you. We are planning some landscaping changes in 2016, so things may be under construction during your stay.

transit: Our home is located just a short drive to the freeway allowing for convenient access to the airport (15 min.), downtown Portland (10 min.), and many other neighborhoods. Using public transportation around the city and to and from the airport is incredibly convenient as the Hollywood MAX (light rail) station and two major bus lines (#77 & #12) are located just a few blocks from our house. Also on/near several bike routes.
access: 24-hour access with a private entrance. There are about 12 stairs to the basement (new wide stairs); you'll pass by our workshop and laundry room to get to your suite.
interaction: The comfort of your stay in our home is very important to us. If you find that something you need is missing, please do not hesitate to contact us directly and we will do our best to provide it. We are constantly improving the suite to incorporate feedback from our guests.  We are also happy to provide you with additional information about the neighborhood and other attractions in Portland.
house_rules: Smoke free home. Quiet hours from 10 p.m. to 8 a.m. Check out is 11 a.m. Pets are allowed, but you must have them leashed outside (no fence) and clean up after them since we have a cat and chickens.

summary: My house is close to Alameda Brewery, Cha Cha Cha Mexican Grill, Albertson's Grocery, Pip's Original Doughnuts & Chai, Fire on the Mountain, and other restaurants and shops on Fremont St. Located 10 minutes from the airport. This is a basement bedroom. We live in the upper level (2 adults and 1 infant), and we have 2 cats. You’ll love my place because of the neighborhood, outdoor space, big bedroom, and friendly hosts (Chilean/American Family). My place is good for couples and solo adventurers.
space: This is a big basement room with a regular twin bed and a trundle bed below. There is a TV (no cable), a chair, and a dresser for your use. Once you go downstairs from main level you will enter the room, there is no door to the basement bedroom There is one locking door in the bedroom that opens to the garage and outside. In the other half of the basement we have the washer/dryer (we need to have access through the bedroom to get to washer/dryer during the day), and bike shop, but it is separated by a wall.

space: Imagine enjoying the comfort and privacy of home in one of the most desirable and convenient locations in Portland. Come stay in our beautifully built to mimic 1912 Craftsman bungalow (main house) and enjoy all Portland has to offer!  We’ve focused on offering you the comforts of home with brand new queen-sized Serta pillow-top mattress, quality pillows, and plush, cotton towels and sheets. You will actually get a good night’s sleep here! Our home offers second sleeping place (futon). The bathroom and stocked kitchen and are ready for a comfortable stay. Enjoy relaxing in our living room, featuring modern appliances, and lots of natural light.  We offer an extra fold out bed downstairs that will accommodate two guests, complete with bedding including sheets and a comforter. There is also room upstairs to set up your pack-n-play or portable crib (not provided). Accommodations: House, 1 Bedrooms + 1 Convertible Bed, Sleeps 3-4, 1.5  Baths, A/C Please contact owner with special requests.

summary: Charming kid-friendly 3 bedroom house in NE Hollywood/Rose City district. This is our home, when we're out-of-town we love sharing our little oasis with likeminded folks who enjoy a local experience when they're on their own adventures.
space: 1,274 sqft and 3 bedrooms 1.5 baths, our home is roomy for a couple but spacious enough to accommodate a small family or group. We're a small father-daughter family. We pride ourselves on being mobile and adventurous but we also love our roots and routines. While we're away, we want to share our home because we believe that's the best way to travel–experiencing the little moments as a citizen rather than just a tourist. We also love Portland and our neighborhood… surrounded by trees and biking lanes and parks. It offers great walking access. You'll be close to food carts, grocery stores (Trader Joes / Whole Foods), neighborhood farmers market, coffee shops, bars, the historic Hollywood movie theater, restaurants, downtown and the river. By car, it's a 12-minute drive to downtown. For sleeping arrangements, please make sure this works for your party: we have 1 king-sized bed, 1 full sized bed, and one twin "kids" bed. transit: Waking distance to the heart of the Hollywood district with access to food carts, coffee shops, bars, farmers market, the historic Hollywood movie theater, restaurants, downtown and the river.  Public transportation access to Max light-rail (green line) and public bus.  We also have Car2go in Portland and you can access cars from our neighborhood. Car2go smart car service that lets you pay as you go. (URL HIDDEN) Additionally we have Uber and Lyft in Portland as well.
house_rules: This our home, when we're out-of-town we love sharing our place with likeminded folks who enjoy a local experience when they're on their own adventures. Portland's a great city and we believe it has a lot to offer.  We value the Airbnb community. We've had only positive experiences and strive to keep it that way. Renters with full profiles go a long way in building trust! We've also found it makes the experience richer for both parties. Communication is especially key before check-in. This helps us answer any questions you might have about the house, the city and parking/key exchange info… it also lets us know how much bedding and towels leave out. One well behaved, small pet allowed. Please leave the house and property clean and tidy.  -When checking out, please make sure the door is shut and locked and close any windows.  -Please take care with the books, ceramics, records and vintage objects in the house that we have lovingly collected. -During the winter, leave the thermostat at 68

summary: The upstairs apartment in our vintage home has two bedrooms to comfortably sleep five, a fully equipped kitchen, a bath with shower, a dining area, a TV area, and also has a small reading room.  From the Cozy Apartment, one can walk three blocks to public transportation that accesses all of Portland, or five blocks to the vibrant historic Hollywood district with restaurants, coffee shops and grocery stores.
space: Location!! Location!! The Cozy Apartment is a quick ride from the airport or train station via auto or public transportation. Several historic districts are within walking distance; and nearby public transportation (light rail and bus) gives access to the entire Portland Metro area.  View the space in the pictures.  We  provide coffee/tea, bottled water, and snacks for you to serve yourselves.

summary: A classic 1914 Portland home with lots of character, updated bathroom, and cosy bedrooms, you're gonna love it! We're in a quiet neighborhood in NE Portland, not far from the airport (12 min) right near the popular Hollywood and Fremont neighborhoods.

access: No keys to lose or to return! This property provides secure, keyless entry with an August Smart Lock. You can lock and unlock the door with your smartphone, using a unique virtual key issued to you for the duration of your stay. No shared space—although some rooms and the garage/basement are locked, you'll be the only ones in the space! You'll have access to the upstairs bedroom, and the entire ground floor (including the bedroom on the ground floor). Kitchen is fully equipped (this is our home, so please be respectful of our stuff).
interaction: We'll be available by phone or email if you have any questions, and have super-nice neighbors if you can't get ahold of us for some reason!
house_rules: - As we live in a quiet residential area, we request that guests turn off exterior lights when going to bed and limit noise after 10 p.m. - Our listing is permitted for six occupants; therefore, we are unable to accommodate additional overnight guests. When you request to book, please let us know if you will be expecting any short-term visitors during your stay. - Please do not use open-flame candles - No smoking on the property. Neither in the house, nor on the front or back porches. - When leaving, please make sure all dirty dishes are rinsed and loaded into the dish washer (please don't start it unless it will finish while you're still here). Leave used towels on the bathroom floor, and put used sheets & pillow cases on the floor next to each bed that you used.

summary: I live in a very safe and quiet neighborhood.  I have a large backyard for the area with a deck and many flowers and plants.  There is a luxury twin aerobed with a mattress pad and a down type comforter. There is a side table many hooks and hangers.
space: The space is decorated with fabrics, a mirror, a rug and pictures. You would have full use of the house, especially to use the kitchen and the bathroom. The wifi will reach the shed.  There is a window with a screen in the shed, which is nice when the days have been hot and the nights are cool.  There is a lock on the inside of the door, even though I wouldn't feel the need to use it.  You can even leave the door open if you want, but who knows about the friendly raccoon or cat that could wander in?  I have slept in the shed myself to check for bugs and noise and such.  It is a cozy little spot for someone who likes the idea of camping, but with a roof overhead and also likes to have a fully stocked home available.  The shed is outside and not nearly sealed.  If you are afraid of lots of blankets or possibly getting chilly at night,  the shed is not for you.  There are spaces between the slats in the door and a space between the roof and wall, which make it cool if it is cool outside.

transit: My place is 2 1/2 blocks from 3 major buslines.  One goes downtown and takes about 15 minutes.  You can also use Uber and Lyft, as they are always lowering their rates.  Some people rent a car from the airport or at a place nearby, if they want to explore the waterfalls or drive to the coast My house is a 12 minute drive to the airport.
access: You will be able to use the whole house except for the basement.  You can hang in the living room, play the piano, watch Netflix on the tv., take a shower and do laundry and whatever any guest who is renting one of my rooms in the house does.  I offer coffee, tea, juice and eggs or oatmeal for breakfast.  I will provide you with a detailed letter about your space and the other areas you can use upon your arrival. There will be a light left on on the deck all night in case you need to come in the house.  The shed has electricity, so there is a light in there and a fan if needed on those hot summer nights.
interaction: I am a driver for Uber and Lyft.  I also give piano lessons.  However, I am always available via text if you have any questions when you are here.  I also provide a list of the good streets and restaurants to go in Portland.
house_rules: I would like for my guests to be quiet before 8am and after 10pm in case other people are sleeping.  There is no smoking anywhere around the house, in the shed or in the yard.  If you want to smoke, you would have to take a walk around the block.  Please do laundry between the hours of 8am and 7:30 pm as I sleep in the basement and go to bed early because I get up early to drive. That means the laundry has to be finished before 7:30pm or left to finish the next day.

summary: My house is close to the Hollywood District in NE Portland.  Very close to bus lines, light rail for easy transport downtown.  I live on a bikeway, so follow the bike path to great destinations! The Hollywood district is a delight of great restaurants, a vintage movie theater, brewpubs, bike shops and more.  Or just relax on the private back porch, BBQ!  Fun amenities include gas grill, ping pong in garage, and basement "fun cave" with records, darts and drums.

summary: I housesit from time to time and thought I would put my small one-bedroom Alberta Arts neighborhood home up while I'm not there!
space: This is my small one bedroom home that I'm listing while I housesit or am out of town. It's in the Alberta Arts neighborhood and in walking distance to a grocery store, bars, restaurants, parks, cafés, and a lot more! There is a bedroom with a queen bed and a couch in the living room that is comfortable to sleep on (or I do have a full-sized air mattress that can be set up in the living room or dining room if you have an extra person). The kitchen is fully stocked - I love to cook so most things you need are probably accounted for but feel free to ask if you have any questions. I don't have a coffee pot but do have a cone and french press.

I don't have a coffee pot but do have a cone and french press. I have a lockbo
transit: There's a bus stop less than a block away and many more within very close walking distance. It's a bike and pedestrian friendly neighborhood and I have a bike that you're welcome to borrow.  Street parking is free and easily available.  It's a 15 minute drive to the airport or a quick cab ride!
access: You can use the backyard (which I will be keeping chickens in by the end of September) - I do rent out a studio in my backyard as well so there might be another guest but everyone has always been super nice!
interaction: I have a lockbox that you can get the key from or I might be able to meet you to let you in if I'm not at work. Otherwise, I'll be available for questions if you need me but won't be on the premises.
house_rules: Have fun and be nice! Smoke outside only please. Otherwise, it is my home so my stuff will be there. I'll clear out some closet space and make sure my kitchen is clean and available for you to use. Please respect it as if it were your own but otherwise enjoy yourself!

summary: I live in a quiet neighborhood in NE Portland. Downtown Portland is a short bus/car ride away and Alberta St. is only a 15 minute walk! There are a lot of great restaurants, music venues, bars and lounges in the vicinity. Foodies welcome :)
space: I have a 3 bedroom, 2 bath space available for guests. The house is 3 levels with 4 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms.  My private space (where I live) is downstairs in the basement. If I am around I will come and go from the basement door and out the back door. The rest of the 3bed/2bath space is available for guests. On the main level there is one large bedroom with a queen sized, four-poster bed, and a medium sized bedroom with a set of bunk beds with pillow-top mattresses. These two rooms share a bathroom. Upstairs there is a Master bedroom with a queen sized bed, complete with a memory foam mattress, and a private bath with a shower and claw-foot tub. There are also large common areas including the living room, dining room, and kitchen, which are all for guest use. Out back there is a yard with fruit trees, a deck and a patio where guests may sit and relax.  There is also a washer and dryer available for guests to use for no extra charge. Please make arrangements with me if you wish to use

transit: If you are driving, please park in the driveway, or directly in front of the house.  If there are no spaces there, please be very careful to not block any driveways and to be considerate of our neighbors.   There is a bus line at the intersection of NE 42nd Ave and NE Prescott St. that takes you to Hollywood Transit Center, where you can hop on a MAX line to take you into downtown. Or, if you don't want to switch, there is the 17 bus line, which is a few blocks away, that takes you directly into downtown. Our neighborhood is very safe, so walking and biking are also a great alternative to public transportation.

summary: Cute house close to Alberta Arts in the Beaumont/Wilshire neighborhood of NE Portland. We are on a quaint tree lined street within walking distance to cafes, bars, parks, etc. 10 blocks to New Seasons Market. On major bus lines that easily take you to the airport or downtown. We have a very comfortable queen size beds will give you a good, restful sleep. Our garden is the perfect place for a cookout or some peaceful relaxation or you can enjoy a movie on the huge tv in our living room.
space: Cozy and comfortable with all of the conveniences! Hardwood floors. 2 bed/1 bath upstairs, finished basement with bed and bath downstairs. Yard and garden for outdoor relaxation. Giant TV in living room, projector with screen in basement. Kitty and chickens on premises that need tending to. Please keep this in mind and make sure you are ok with this when you book.

summary: Very large space, all new and modern 800 sqft basement garden apartment in my house. Kitchen with new granite counters, washer/dryer, nice size den, tv, wi-fi, electric fireplace.  New Tuft & Needle King a queen/full pull out sofa bed and a Queen mattress I can pull out for the den floor for extra guests.  Large tiled bathroom, shower with rain shower head.  7ft ceilings.  Spa amenities! LGBTQ friendly
space: A wonderful basement master bedroom suite separated off from the upstairs with a locked door and I put in a New kitchen with high end granite counters and a lovely outside door with natural stone and more space to garden. It is 800 sqft of open floor plan, built-ins and walk in closet. There are lots of books if you find the time.  Since it is a basement, the ceilings are 7ft,  but be realistic if you are 6-3" it might be tight.   The space is newly remodeled.  Granite counter tops and tile bathroom with rain shower head.  And access the laundry room and i leave detergent and dryer sheets so you can do a load on your stay.  I supply high quality shampoo, conditioner and body wash as well as nice fluffy towels and cotton sheets and blankets.  A New Tuft & Needle king bed, full/queen pull out sofa and a full size mattres I can pull out. Since it is a basement it stays naturally cooler down there.  My house has central heating but there are space heaters with thermostats to keep it comfor

transit: I am very close to the airport.  10 minutes by car or cab, then walk everywhere.  There is a bus 10 minute walk that will take you right down town and other bus options if you want to get to the Maxx train.  I live on the bicycle highway so be like a local and ride around and get to know the city!
access: I have lit side entrance gate.  Guests are welcome to use the grill and sit in the shared garden. I have another Airbnb cottage that shares the garden space.  I often have bikes i can lend out and weather permitting it is great to eat outside.
interaction: I love to offer advice about the neighborhood.  I am very friendly and happy to give you a tour, and I am always quick to respond any needs that may arise, but I find most people are out doing things and are hardly around. I am happy to leave people alone as some have agenda's already set.  I am an easy going, flexible guy.
house_rules: Please contact me before booking an arrival past 10pm. Advise me of arrival time. I love to greet my guests and give a quick tour and maybe offer an idea that may make your stay more comfortable I live in a quiet neighborhood and I usually like people to be polite and    keep the noise down after 10pm,    No smoking of anything in the house.  No parties and please no pets.  I have a wonderful Labradoodle and Mainecoon cat that will be happy to be your pets away from home.   Please help me save water and take reasonably short showers so we all may enjoy a hot shower.  Please take out all garbage.  Strip the beds. Clean all dishes. Thank you and have a great stay!

Located one block from the bus line if you want to explore downtown Portland and beyond! The location is excellent for either enjoying a quiet night with a fire in the backyard, or walking to any of the nearby establishments. Quiet, private room equipped with AppleTV and Wifi.

summary: I live in a quiet neighborhood in NE Portland. Downtown Portland is a short bus/car ride away and Alberta St. is only a 15 minute walk! There are a lot of great restaurants, music venues, bars and lounges in the vicinity. Foodies welcome :)
space: *Please read the entire listing before booking* *The house can only accommodate up to 10 people for insurance and permit compliance purposes. Please do not ask to bring any more than 10 people* I have a 4 bedroom, 3 bath space available for guests. The main house is 3 levels with 4 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms.  There is also a studio out back that has its own bathroom and kitchen. My private space (where I live) is downstairs in the basement. If I am around I will come and go through the basement door and out the back door. The rest of the 4bed/3bath space is available for guests. On the main level there is one large bedroom with a queen sized, four-poster bed, and a medium sized bedroom with a set of bunk beds with pillow-top mattresses. These two rooms share a bathroom. Upstairs there is a Master bedroom with a queen sized bed, complete with a memory foam mattress, and a private bath with a shower and claw-foot tub. transit: If you are driving, please park in the driveway, or directly in front of the house.  If there are no spaces there, please be very careful to not block any driveways and to be considerate of our neighbors.   There is a bus line at the intersection of NE 42nd Ave and NE Prescott St. that takes you to Hollywood Transit Center, where you can hop on a MAX line to take you into downtown. Or, if you don't want to switch, there is the 17 bus line, which is a few blocks away, that takes you directly into downtown. Our neighborhood is very safe, so walking and biking are also a great alternative to public transportation.

summary: The "Frere (rhymes with air) House" is a gorgeous 1909 Victorian that will take you back in time.  Used in several projects, the feature film "Untraceable" and considered for a "Grimm" episode.  Music lessons by a Pro make for an unforgettable trip.
space: Note from the Host -  "I am ecstatic to now be a Superhost!  If you are a first time airbnb user, please fill our your profile completely and as detailed as possible and let me know about your trip to Portland - are you visiting for the first time?  Who will you be bringing with you?  Are you attending classes, visiting family, working?  Hosts like to know as much as possible about their guests and so they can be sure to accommodate you in every way.  Many of the Portland airbnbs are shared dwellings like The Frere House.  Your room is private with a nice sized shared bath.  You are also welcome to make yourself at home in the communal living, dining and kitchen."  Kathryn, your friendly Airbnb Host    "Wow!" is the common thing heard when folks enter the wainscoting filled entry way.  The house has a "vibe" that is difficult to put into words.  "Cozy" is a good one.  "Homey" is another.  "Unique", "Beautiful", Original" are a few others.  The main floor has a vintage kitchen with a on

transit: Three short blocks in two directions will put you on a bus to anywhere you need to get to in Portland.
access: The front door has an access code for guests to come and go.  The back door leads to a deck where guests are welcome to sit and sip a beverage, eat and relax.
interaction: The owner lives in the house and is available for questions and help when and if needed.
house_rules: Please have each checked in guest read The Frere House Rules. This is a smoke, pet and shoe free home.  The 100 year old floors have just recently been re-done and cannot accommodate heels, wheels or animals.  The results of no shoes make for a comfortable tidy house at all times! No excessive drinking, no drugs and no parties.  This home cannot accommodate events or groups of over eight people. No smoking of any kind in or on the property.  This is a strongly enforced rule.  The dryness of Portland makes it especially vulnerable to fires so no candles, cigarettes or anything burning or with a flame is not allowed. This house is meant to be a calm, safe and creative space to stay.  Noise should be lowered after 10 pm to respect neighbors and other guests.   No outside guests allowed onto the premises without prior approval from management.  No over night stays for anyone other than the checked in guests.   This address cannot be used to receive mail of any kind. The Wifi password is On

summary: My place is close to coffee shops, restaurants, bars, Whole Foods, Irving Park and lovely walking neighborhoods and is very close to the popular N Mississippi Ave shops and the Alberta Arts dist. You’ll love the warm and inviting art-filled house, airy kitchen, cozy breakfast nook, leafy and private yard, hammock, fire pit and the very private guest room. My place is ideal for the solo traveler coming to town for work, creative projects or adventure or for couples exploring the area.
space: In the DIY spirit of Portland, I'm calling this the "Makers Room". Everything in it was made by someone I know, right down to the bed-frame and dresser, built from walnut trees felled and milled by my Grandfather from the family farm in Minnesota.. no kidding. The books on the shelf all by friends as is the art on the walls. And I'm also very proud of my drywalling job..

access: While you're here I'll consider you a short-term roommate. The kitchen is available as long as you clean up after using. You're welcome to lounge in the hammock or use the second desk in my office. I work in a studio located in the side yard and hope to maintain a productive, creative vibe and as such, think of it as a good place to start and end your days while you visit Portland.
interaction: I'm happy to make suggestions of places to go and share a meal if I'm cooking. I tend to stay busy however and assume you will be as well.

summary: The Bike Shed is a confluence of a love of small spaces and a celebration of our favorite transportation method, the bicycle.  The Bike Shed is a brand new space that we built just for you!   Located two blocks from Alberta Street, The Bike Shed is a short walk from many of Portland's well known eateries, including Salt & Straw ice cream, Bollywood Theater, and more!  Bring your bikes or rent some close by.  The Bike Shed is on a bike boulevard and is an easy ride to downtown.
space: The Bike Shed is a 650 square foot backyard cottage.  It gets it's name from the fact that it's attached to our actual bike storage shed, and the myriad of bike-themed artwork throughout the dwelling.  Don't worry-- the space is far from a shed, and more of a high-end miniature house. The space fits 3 people comfortable.  Upstairs is a loft space, with a queen bed, closet, a lounge area, a small desk, and a TV.  Downstairs has a kitchen / living area, bathroom, and a small bedroom with a twin xl day bed and another TV. The kitchen is equipped with high-end compact appliances, including a dish washer, an induction cooktop, a european convection oven, toaster, refrigerator and microwave.  The dining table has a lovely window bench seat.  Plenty of dishes and cookware are provided. The kitchen / living area opens up to the outside through a large 3-panel glass door onto a back-yard deck. We built the Bike Shed with the environment in mind, and is certified by Earth Advantage.  Many of the

Upstairs is a loft space, with a queen bed, closet, a lounge area, a small desk, and a TV.  Downstairs has a kitchen / living area, bathroom, and a small bedroom with a twin xl day bed and anoth
transit: You can get to a lot on foot-- including 3 grocery stores (Alberta Coop, New Seasons and Whole Foods). The Bike Shed is on Going Street which is a bike greenway.  It's about a half-hour ride to downtown or to South-East highlights (Hawthorne street, etc).  If you don't have a bike, there are places nearby that rent them. There are two nearby bus routes: the 72 on Alberta St & NE 21st and the 8 on Going St and NE 15th ((SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) 'TriMet' for routes and times). If you are driving, the 5 or 84 highways are accessible within a 10 minute drive.  It's about a 15 minute drive to the airport, and 15-30 minutes to downtown depending on the time of day.
access: Guests have full access to the entire building, with the exception of the part that we actually use as a bike shed for our bikes!  The yard and deck are spaces that are shared between our family and you.
interaction: We live in the bungalow on the same lot as the Bike Shed.  We respect our guests privacy, but we are available if you need us.  The yard and backyard deck is a shared space so you may see our family with kids playing outside.
house_rules: People who smoke are unfortunately not welcome to stay here.  We have found it to be too timely between guests to remove smoke smell from everything with a cloth surface.  We want to be sure all guests to have a clean and fresh Bike Shed to stay in.  Thanks for your understanding. If the house smells of smoke upon your departure your security deposit will be forfeited. This is a family friendly neighborhood and home.  Late night noise should be kept to a minimum.  No parties please.

summary: Antique charmer close to Alberta Street restaurants, bars, a Food Coop, a community garden, Rerun Thrift Store, Whole Foods, New Seasons, Irvington Park, & Mothership Music.  We have a wonderful front porch to relax on, sweet plants, flowers, and herbs all around the house, a record library, shelf of graphic novels, a spacious private room, and a neighborhood where many edible/ medicinal goods can be foraged in the spring and summer. Great for couples and solo adventurers.
space: Room includes a deluxe queen size bed, desk workspace, and two windows with lush greenery just outside of them.

summary: The Alberta Vinyl Den is a remodeled basement pad in the heart of the Alberta Arts District, Portland's coolest neighborhood. Guests will be within walking distance of great shops, coffee houses, restaurants and bars.  AVD is a special haven for music fans, with a customized record collection set out and a personal record player, along with guides to local record shops and music venues. The den is less than 2 blocks from Salt & Straw Ice Cream, and Little Big Burger.
space: The Alberta Vinyl Den is a basement apartment that has a private bathroom with a shower. There's also a backyard to relax in when the sun is out. We set out a dozen LPs from our massive vinyl collection based on each guest's musical tastes to listen to during their stay.

summary: My place is close to downtown, Forrest Park, NW Portland, Starbucks, Vinotopia, Washington Park, and the zoo. It's also close to Beaverton and 15 minutes from the Nike World Campus. You’ll love my place because of the light, the comfy bed, the coziness, the neighborhood. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids). There are tons hiking trails near by including those in Forrest Park, Portland's 5,200 acres urban forest. Wireless printer and desk.

There are tons hiking trails near by including those in Forrest Park, Portland's 5,200 acres urban forest. Wireless printer and desk. The living room has a beautiful of a portion of Forrest Park. You will have access to all rooms in the home. I will be available by text, phone, and email during your stay. Forrest Heights is a beautiful neighborhood, well kept, with it's own Starbucks, Vinotopia, Natural Market, and hiking trails. There is public transportation close by. There is a cat in the home. She is sweet and would love you to play with her and pet her. She's great company!
transit: There is public transportation close by.
access: You will have access to all rooms in the home.
interaction: I will be available by text, phone, and email during your stay.
house_rules: Please remove the sheets that you use and run the dishwasher when you leave. Please put all used towels and wash cloths in the basket in the master bedroom.

summary: Spend your Thanksgiving or Christmas holiday in this 5000+ sq.ft. elegant Lodge. Just minutes away from the Pearl District, this home features panoramic views, an expansive wood burning fireplace, and a full gym that makes this the perfect retreat.
space: Stunning custom home w/unparalleled finishes and a thoughtfully designed floor plan with lodge style great room offering exposed beams, rich wood floors & custom cabinetry, granite, gourmet kitchen, formal dining room, and ample outdoor living space. During the summer months, the patio couch can convert into an outdoor bed; setting the stage for a magical evening under the stars. True master suite on the main takes advantage of the views.  Lower family room, wet bar parlor and luxuriuous "man" cave. Complete w/home gym.

summary: My place is a quick walk to the shops and restaurants of NW 23rd and 21st Avenues in the Alphabet District. Forest Park and a walkway on the Willamette also have easy access. You’ll love my place because of the open space, the windows and lighting, the bed, and the ample parking. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and furry friends (pets).
space: The rental is the second floor of a house from 1905 that was most recently owned by a pair of artists who kept their studio and gallery on the first floor. The rooms are large and the space feels larger because of the high ceilings, skylights, and a large Norman window. I encourage you to spend time in house planning your days, cooking, or just hanging out and relaxing.

transit: Closest bus stop is a 5 minute walk, closest streetcar is the stop on 23rd ave and about 15 minutes walking. Parking is free and plentiful (!) all around the house (although you may be tempted to park on the bridge nearby, that is a ticketable offense). A cab/uber downtown runs about $10 and takes about 10 minutes. If you decide to rent bikes (suggested), I have a garage in which you can store them. I have decent maps for all the neighborhoods and Forest Park.
access: You'll have access to the whole second floor except the loft.
interaction: I'll be around (and sleeping in the loft) unless I let you know otherwise. During the school year I often don't get home until late evening. I'm happy to give you recommendations and I have a full binder of neighborhood info for you to look through. I like talking with my guests and if it's in the cards I'd enjoy grabbing a meal or shooting a game of pool.

summary: Only for adventurous minded groups who would like to stay in downtown Portland in an empty brick warehouse that was originally built in 1911. The location is in the heart of the City with dozens of restaurants and the Timbers stadium at your door.
space: The 10,000 square foot warehouse has indoor parking on the first floor for 10 cars and your gear can be hoisted up to the second floor in the hydraulic car elevator or by stairwell.  The open space is outfitted with 4 King size hotel beds in a shared space with a 5th King size bed in a separate room.  There are 2 bathrooms and a shower with functional kitchenette. The dining table seats 8-10 for group meals. This is rough space that has been glammed with comfortable sleeping tents and a common area with outdoor furniture.

Only a few blocks to trendy NW 23rd with dozens of restaurants within walking distance and very close to the MAX station. 2 Starbucks within a block for your internet access and morning coffee. 4 blocks to the access of the Arboretum and over 30 miles of hiking trails in Forest Parks.

summary: This cool and hip one bedroom centrally located in alphabet district is perfect for those wanting to explore the best of PDX! Steps from great restaurants, cafes, shops.  10 minute walk to downtown.  Feel what it's like to live in the city!!
description: This cool and hip one bedroom centrally located in alphabet district is perfect for those wanting to explore the best of PDX! Steps from great restaurants, cafes, shops.  10 minute walk to downtown.  Feel what it's like to live in the city!! No access to wash/dryer in building.   Very friendly hostess on site available for questions about things to do, places to see and eat at in Portland.  Main host available around the clock via email, text and phone.   This apartment is 1 block from Trader Joes, 2 blocks from Freddies (Oregon's most popular grocery/department store), 3 blocks from 23rd (the nob hill of Portland), 5-10 minutes walk from Pearl District and downtown.   Make yourselves at home.  Feel free to use all kitchen appliances.  Coffee in cupboard, coffee filters and manual drip coffee maker open to guests.   Living room has a brand new couch that turns into a full size bed.

summary: Your private room in our 1905 Craftsman is only steps away from NW 23rd Ave. where you will find an endless amount of restaurants, bakeries, coffee spots and unique shops. Across from Wallace park and a couple blocks from Forest Park, with miles of forested hiking trails, streams and views.  I am happy to help you with your visit and yet you will have all the privacy you want. It is a full size bed. You will pass through our common entry way to access your room. Limited shared kitchen use.
space: It is a historic, cozy room with a full bed and a nice cross breeze or fan to use if interested. There is cable tv, a desk, wardrobe, dresser and attached full bathroom.

summary: Behind a locked gate, this funky, hidden Victorian offers quiet comfort and a private courtyard in center city -- plus our famous homemade fruit salad (and more) for breakfast every morning. Close to Crystal Ballroom, Trader Joe's, the Max train, & Good Samaritan Hospital. Great for couples, solo adventurers and business travelers.
space: This is a funky Queen Anne Vernacular house built in 1900, with double-hung windows, hardwood floors (outside of the carpeted bedroom), very high ceilings, and amazing molding. We're slowly restoring it but it's not a showplace yet, so I hope you don't mind some chips in the paint and scratches on the floor. If you've owned an older house, you'll understand.
description: Behind a locked gate, this funky, hidden Victorian offers quiet comfort and a private courtyard in center city -- plus our famous homemade fruit salad (and more) for breakfast every morning. Close to Crystal Ballroom, Trader Joe's, the Max train, & Good Samaritan Hospital. Great for couples, solo adventurers and business travelers. This is a funky Queen Anne Vernacular house built in 1900, with double-hung windows, hardwood floors (outside of the carpeted bedroom), very high ceilings, and amazing molding. We're slowly restoring it but it's not a showplace yet, so I hope you don't mind some chips in the paint and scratches on the floor. If you've owned an older house, you'll understand. In addition to your room, you have use of the kitchen, large bathroom (with two sinks, glass bricks, and shower/tub), TV room, front/dining room, laundry facilities and the courtyard (with wrought iron furniture and a grill). Wifi, games, and lots of interesting books (especially on Daoism and palindrome
transit: The Max train and streetcar line, city buses, the train station and the Bolt bus station are all nearby.  Can't promise this but we may be able to pick you up from the Max stop (about 10 blocks away) or the train/Bolt station (both about 15-20 blocks away) if we're not too busy. There is a "Biketown" bike rental station a block away, too. There is no parking spot, and to be honest this is not a great place if you have a car. All of the parking spots in this neighborhood have parking meters, but we have a guest pass you can use on the side streets (but not 21st or 23rd, and only in marked areas. Be sure to communicate if you have a car.) Radio Cab is nearby and arrives quickly, as does Uber and Lyft of course.
access: In addition to your room, you have use of the kitchen, large bathroom (with two sinks, glass bricks, and shower/tub), TV room, front/dining room, laundry facilities and the courtyard (with wrought iron furniture and a grill). Wifi, games, and lots of interesting books (especially on Daoism and palindromes).
interaction: Homemade fruit salad (plus cereal, toast, yogurt, juices, coffee, etc.) every morning. The hosts live upstairs and are happy to share information about Portland and fun activities nearby. We also have stayed in B&Bs where hosts were "too friendly" and respect your privacy.
house_rules: - Quiet hours 10pm to 10am. - Bike rental (Biketown) nearby - No torrent or unlicensed downloads on the wifi. - No smoking inside - extra bed is a single mattress on the floor in the room. It gets pretty crowded with it in there!!

summary: I've lived in my apartment for over 10 years. It's a beautiful 1920's vintage building and I love how quiet it is in the heart of bustling northwest Portland.
space: Renting a great little guest room in my garden apartment in the heart of Northwest Portland. This centrally located building is 2 blocks from 2 bus lines (#15 and #77), and 3 blocks from the streetcar.  Nestled in the back corner of this classic 1920's courtyard building is my multistory, 2 bdrm, 1 bathroom apartment. I am currently renting a 2nd story guest room (one, full-sized bed) with a southern view of my patio garden. This is a shared bathroom situation. My bedroom is directly across the hall, but with the doors closed this is a pretty quiet room. Though it's rarely needed here in Portland, my apartment does NOT have air conditioning. The room has west and south facing windows and gets a good breeze overnight. There is also a fan for your use if wanted.    Though it's located just off the bustling and trendy Northwest 23rd Ave this is a relatively quiet apartment (aside from my neighbor occasionally singing along as he plays his guitar, the chirping of the birds, and the bark of

house_rules: 1. Please no overnight guest.  2.  No smoking inside the apartment. Smoking is allowed out on the back patio or in the alcove outside the front door.  3. If you'd like to open a window on the first floor please place a screen in front of it so the cat doesn't get out.   4.Whenever leaving the apartment please shut and lock all windows on the first floor. The front door locks on its own.

summary: Yes, the entire apartment is yours and yes, it comes with Artificial Intelligence.  Permit the robot hostess of your stay, Alexa, to serenade with your favorite music, describe weather conditions, list the best-reviewed venues, talk you through tying your shoes, etc. And if Alexa just doesn’t get you, text Trevor the human local and he’ll tell you what’s what. To get you started, there's complementary local beer or kombucha (non-drinkers gladly accepted) provided.
description: Yes, the entire apartment is yours and yes, it comes with Artificial Intelligence.  Permit the robot hostess of your stay, Alexa, to serenade with your favorite music, describe weather conditions, list the best-reviewed venues, talk you through tying your shoes, etc. And if Alexa just doesn’t get you, text Trevor the human local and he’ll tell you what’s what. To get you started, there's complementary local beer or kombucha (non-drinkers gladly accepted) provided. It’s Portland’s famous Nob Hill, aka the Northwest District, aka the Alphabet District (the alphabetized streets inspired the character names of the Simpsons).  Don’t bother renting a car here.  The Red Max Line zips straight from the airport to this, the oldest and first excessively gentrified neighborhood of Portland.  We boast THE BEST walk scores in one of America’s most walkable cities.  Allow gorgeous imitation architecture of art nouveau/victorian eras to catch your drunken eyes as you stumble between some of Portland’
house_rules: Do what you will, if it harms no one.  Bring a one-night stand, conduct a seance, puke in the bedroom…only please respect our neighbors and remember to pay for clean up and damages.  And if you see Carrie Brownstein or Cheryl Strayed or Chuck Palahniuk visiting a friend, please don’t embarrass yourself.

summary: Beautiful remodeled, clean home just half a block off NW 23rd Ave & 2 blocks to NW 21st, where you have your choice of shops, bars & restaurants.  Get the safety & comfort of a neighborhood, while just a short walk/streetcar ride away from Pearl district, downtown & easy access to explore the rest of the city.  The neighborhood provides access to the largest forested park in US (amazing hiking trials), Rose Garden, Pittock Mansion & more. Spacious, bright, comfortable home w/all the amenities.
space: Full of old charm, tastefully updated with dark hardwoods, period lighting and tall ceilings. The home offers lots of space to spread out. There is a large bedroom, with incredibly comfortable king temperpedic bed. Off the bedroom is a full bath with oversized soaking tub and separate shower. There is also a second bedroom that can be used as an office or second bedroom, with access to an additional half bath is located in the living area. Relax in the comfortable living room with 50 inch TV. Enjoy diner in the  dining room, with seating for six. Our favorite feature is the gorgeous wrap around kitchen. There are so many restaurants near by that you may not want to cook but if you do, the kitchen is fully stocked with just about anything you could ever need and has brand new appliances. You will have access to our brand new washer/dryer for doing laundry, as well as the   iron/steamer. Enjoy a cup of coffee or a glass of wine on the front porch or in the privacy of the backyard. transit: No need for a car.  You are walking distance from just about anything you could need, including grocery stores, coffee shops, restaurants, bars, tourist attractions and shopping. There is a streetcar stop a block away and it runs throughout the central portion of the city. You can take the streetcar to the max station that runs throughout the entire city, into the suburbs and straight to the airport. There is bike share available all over the city, as well as several bike rental shops in the neighborhood and it is a very bike-friendly town. Car-2-go, Zip car and several similar services are available. Plus, uber, Lyft and cab service is available to take you wherever you need to go.
access: You will have access to the whole home, including the washer and dryer in the basement. Guests can access the back yard and front porch, as well.
interaction: We would be happy to pass on recommendations for your stay in Portland. We have spent most of our lives in Portland and know it well. There are an unlimited amount of restaurants, shops and bars within walking distance, as well as many of the top sightseeing destinations. We would be happy to help you see the Portland that we know and love.
house_rules: No smoking, vaping, or cannabis use inside of unit or on property grounds.

summary: This spacious one bedroom is right in the heart of Knob Hill. Safe and quietly nestled in between Twenty-First Street and "Trendy-Third" Street, two bustling options filled with shopping, Portland's finest coffee, restaurants and ice cream shops to choose from. summary: An Alphabet District space that is close to shopping, the MAX, offices, PSU, and the PAM. Security building. This is a good place to stay if you want to be in NW PDX and choose among lots of restaurants, movie theaters, retail boutiques, thrift shops, and taverns. Even the grocery stores here have beer bars, in case you forgot that you are in the micro brewery capital of the world.
space: A bedroom decorated in tranquil dove gray with east-facing windows and blackout curtains if you don't want to wake up with the sun. summary: Stay among the cafes, breweries, art galleries, shopping, forest hiking, and public rail system that defines the NW neighborhood. This one bedroom apartment perches above the historic alphabet district.
space: Natural light filters through top-floor windows to fill this warm space and high ceilings. A private veranda provides stunning views of the "urban-hood" below, Mt. Rainier (Seattle), Mt. Saint Helens, Mt. Adams, and the tree-studded silhouette of Forest Park. Less is more, using minimalist furnishings and creative lighting to invite the atmosphere and surrounding environment as the main features of the apartment. There is ample, FREE street parking - a rarity in this densely populated neighborhood.
description: Stay among the cafes, breweries, art galleries, shopping, forest hiking, and public rail system that defines the NW neighborhood. A private veranda provides stunning views of the "urban-hood" below, Mt. Rainier (Seattle), Mt. Saint Helens, Mt. Adams, and the tree-studded silhouette of Forest Park. Less is more, using minimalist furnishings and creative lighting to invite the atmosphere and surrounding environment as the main features of the apartment. I love my neighborhood and my apartment, and I can provide excellent recommendations no matter your agenda - from beer and wine sampling, to cycling and hiking, to shopping, to live music. I am selective to whom I and when I rent this space, but when I have, I enjoy making new lasting friends

space: We are right off NW 23rd Ave, and have a beautiful apartment with hardwood floors, a nice size kitchen, full size tub/shower, and a wood burning fireplace.

We are right off NW 23rd Ave, and have a beautiful apartment with hardwood floors, a nice size kitchen, full size tub/shower, and a wood burning fireplace. Guests have access to the outdoor living areas, laundry facilities, and garbage area. Most common areas have combination locks for easy access. I'm available as much as you need me, and I have friends nearby designated to help out. I love that everything is walking distance! Public transportation is really easy, there's a bus stop 1/2 block away, the trolley is 6 blocks away, car-to-go is 1 block away, and Nike bike rentals are everywhere. Plus uber/lyft are extremely fast, we even have an uber driver on our block.

summary: Open ranch style MCM home. Nicely stocked kitchen, hardwood floors & vaulted ceilings. Space is clean & ready for a short or long stay.  Doug Fir Trees tower over a large corner lot, with fenced back yard. East Portland location makes getting to The Gorge easier, but still very accessible to downtown and all things Portland proper.  Please ask about my availability to host a private weekend dinner party or drop home made meals for you!
space: 3 bedroom, 1 bathroom home. Hardwood floors and vaulted ceilings throughout. Bright, and open layout. Kitchen is updated with dishwasher, oven/stove, refrigerator and lots of kitchen supplies so you can cook at home. There is coffee and everything you need to make a good bowl of oatmeal or cream of wheat for breakfast.  Washer and dryer, stocked with laundry essentials. The single bed is a pull out futon.  House is not child proofed, but has a highchair, and a crib.  The yard is very big, nicely landscaped and fenced, should you have a dog.  There's a fire pit with wood to burn. Depending on the season you are free to pick veggies and herbs from the garden. The television has a Roku, and has access to Netflix, Hulu and HBO. High speed internet, with a nice big desk to sit at should you need to do work.
