transit: The house is central to a lot of cool Portland things. Pretty easy access to highway 84, close to the airport, and a short drive to both downtown and The Gorge.
access: You'll have free run of the house, as there are no other people occupying the property. Anything that is in the house, you're free to use. All I ask is that you respect everything in it as if it were your own belongings, and you leave the house much like you saw it when you first walked in.
interaction: No one lives at the home and you will have the house to yourself. I leave the key in a hidden spot for you find on check-in, so unless there is an emergency, chances are you won't see me.  However, I do work from home 1 mile away and anytime you need me, I'm readily available.
house_rules: PLEASE:  Respect the house as if it were your own. Conserve energy.  Clean up after your pet.  Do not burn wood in the indoor fireplace. Candles are okay.  Do not smoke in the house.  Do not adjust the two white blinds in the front room. They are $2000 blinds that are broken and if you adjust them, they will not adjust back.  (My dog ate the chord and I've not been able to replace them yet!)  Thank you!

summary: Bright, private studio-suite in beautiful Grant Park home. Excellent central location. 650 sq ft of private space. Queen-bed in main suite. Double-bed in adjoining dormer bedroom. Optional extra twin bed in the main suite to accommodate a fifth guest. Private, modern bathroom, bar, kitchenette, dinette and reading area.
space: The Funky Pad Suite has everything you need for convenience, privacy and comfort.   - Main Room with Queen Bed, Sofa, Coffee Table and 40" HDTV with Cable (Digital Preferred/HBO/OnDemand).  - Adorning dormer bedroom with full-size bed. - Kitchenette with small fridge, microwave-oven, traditional coffeemaker, french press and tea pot.  - Foldout table and chairs for comfortable dining & work space.  - Comfortable reading chair. Wet bar.  - Bright, modern bathroom with skylight, vanity and shower.  - Hotel quality towels     - Hairdrier     - Shampoo & bath gel     - Iron & ironing board      - Dinner & glassware     - Portland destination media - Ample free parking right outside our door. - Main Room with Queen Bed, Sofa, Coffee Table and 40" HDTV with Cable (Digital Preferred/HBO/OnDemand).  - Adorning dormer bedroom with full-size bed. - Kitchenette with small fridge, microwave-oven, traditional coffeemaker, french press and tea pot.  - Foldout table and chairs for comfortable in-room

transit: We offer Airport pick-up for $15 each way. (cab fare from our home ranges from $27-$36). Please make airport pick-up arrangements with us in advance.  We offer bike rentals with helmets for $18 per day. There are bike paths that can get you to any part of the city from our Grant Park location. We have 4 bikes of varying sizes, which are all in perfect working order.  We are right on the TriMet 77 & 70 Bus lines and a 15 minute walk to the Hollywood Light Rail Station.  There are usually several Zip Cars throughout the neighborhood.  Click on the Guidebook at the top of the page to see everything you can walk to in the neighborhood.  We are looking forward to hosting you!
access: - Main Room with Queen Bed, Sofa, Coffee Table and 40" HDTV with Cable (Digital Preferred/HBO/OnDemand) and optional twin bed. - Adorning dormer bedroom with full-size bed. - Kitchenette with small fridge, microwave-oven, traditional coffeemaker, french press and tea pot.  - Foldout table and chairs for comfortable in-room dining / work space.  - Comfortable reading chair. Wet bar.  - Bright, modern bathroom with skylight, vanity and shower.  -Hotel quality towels     -Hairdrier     -Shampoo & bath gel     -Iron and ironing board      -Dinner & glassware     -Portland destination media -Free Parking right outside our door.
interaction: I'm usually here if guests need me, and enjoy getting to know our guests. But I also offer complete privacy when that is preferred.
house_rules: Check-in is anytime between 3pm and 10:30pm. If you are going to arrive later than 10:30pm, that's OK, just let us know as soon as you are able. You're always welcome to come by early and drop off your bags. We can ping you if the suite is ready before 3pm upon your request.    Guests can have visitors to the suite, as long as they are known friends/family. All non-paying guests should depart between 10:30pm & 9am unless otherwise approved by us. There is an 8 person capacity limit in the suite at all times. No smoking please. Smoking outside is OK. You are welcome to relax in our backyard.  We allow one pet per visit upon approval, as long as the pet is housebroken and well behaved, and guests agree to be financially responsible for any damage caused by their little friend. We charge an additional cleaning-fee of $12 for pets because we've found post-pet cleanup to be more involved. This fee means you don't have to board your pet, and allows us to provide a hair and dander-free enviro

summary: Enjoy lovely Hollywood/Grant Park neighborhood and easy access to all of Portland! Walk to Farmers Market, parks, Whole Foods, Library, cafes, etc.  Take the train from the airport and walk here. Near major bus lines, borrow adult/kid bikes.
space: Open, airy home with clean craftsman charm. Wonderful access to Portland without need for a car. Living room with fireplace and piano; large formal dining room; barstools and ample counter space in kitchen for social cooking (gas stove); large upstairs master bath and bedroom (walk-in stone tile shower, skylights, double sinks, gas fireplace); 2 first floor bedrooms (guest bedroom & daughter's room with roll-out trundle); 1st floor office with fold-down couch serves as extra bedroom; 1st floor bathroom with clawfoot bathtub; large half basement media/games room and laundry (sleeps a teen or young couple on moveable sectional couch). Fenced yard, seasonal plantings, raised bed garden and trellising, outdoor eating area and play structure.

I have high speed cable internet with protected wifi, tv with Roku (Netflix, Hulu Plus, Plex), and Airplay/bluetooth stereo.
space: I have a great rain garden front yard that takes the water from our fair skies and uses it to feed the plants below. There's a deck out front which is great for winding down and watching the sunsets. Plenty of birds to hear in the mornings and a relatively quiet neighborhood where people walk their dogs.

summary: My place is nestled in North Tabor and close to East Glisan Pizza Lounge, Fillmore, UFO Pizza, Biddy McGraw's Irish Pub, and Seven Virtues. You can walk to Mt. Tabor and Rose City Golf Course. I am sure you will love the neighborhood , the kitchen, the comfy beds, the light, and the coziness. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
space: You’ll love my place because of the modern feel, the crown molding, the original touches in this 1912 farm house and timeless updates. The home is spacious with plenty of comfy places to enjoy reading, having a cup of coffee or a glass of wine and conversing with your friends. We get exceptional sunsets and sunrises. You can even see the sun rise behind Mt. Hood from the upstairs sitting area.  This home is truly a sanctuary in the city and has a few resident humming birds and many other song birds that enjoy the fragrant and colorful flower gardens and trees. This is a home for bird lovers! Enjoy sitting in the sun lit back yard and watching the finches and humming birds go to town on the feeders and flowers!

summary: Master bedroom in charming duplex, close to bus and Max lines, as well as bars and coffee shops along Stark avenue in Montavilla. This neighborhood is experiencing a lot of growth and popularity. Our place is cute, relatively quiet and close to Mount Tabor. Favorite neighborhood spots: Hungry Heart Bakery (amazing coffee, bagels and vegan cupcakes) Vintage Cocktails Observatory and Over & Out (two quintessential bar/restaurants) Roscoes (Impressive beer list)  Academy Theatre (movies)
space: This room and bedroom comes complete with Queen bed, desk, couch and full bathroom with sliding glass shower, towels and other bathroom amenities. Guests are welcome to use downstairs kitchen and back patio.

summary: All of Portland is at your feet during your stay in our cozy downstairs guest suite.  Along with your rooms, you have your own kitchen, bathroom and sitting room with a Murphy bed and futon. Also enjoy the laundry room and access to the back garden.  We are easy walking distance to pubs, cafes, antiques, a local farmer's market, shops, and public transport!
space: The east bedroom is light and sun filled with views of the front garden. You may enjoy a diverse collection of books, magazines, and Portland guides from our extensive library, a desk for writing or work while you are here, a yoga mat and blocks, should you like to stretch at the end of your day, or take a class at a near by studio, and storage for your belongings  during your stay.  We provide fresh towels and toiletries for your visit.
description: All of Portland is at your feet during your stay in our cozy downstairs guest suite.  Along with your rooms, you have your own kitchen, bathroom and sitting room with a Murphy bed and futon. Also enjoy the laundry room and access to the back garden.  We are easy walking distance to pubs, cafes, antiques, a local farmer's market, shops, and public transport! The east bedroom is light and sun filled with views of the front garden. You may enjoy a diverse collection of books, magazines, and Portland guides from our extensive library, a desk for writing or work while you are here, a yoga mat and blocks, should you like to stretch at the end of your day, or take a class at a near by studio, and storage for your belongings  during your stay.  We provide fresh towels and toiletries for your visit. Guests will have their own entrance to the downstairs apartment. We have parking that can accommodate two guest cars. During your stay you will have access to the sitting room with library, vintage
transit: The Montavilla neighborhood is at your doorstep during your stay.  If you plan to venture out to explore more of Portland you are in the perfect position for launching your adventure. The Max, with service to and from the airport, downtown Portland, and many of Portland's suburbs is only blocks away. The city bus stops 10 minutes from our house and runs straight through to downtown Portland from this stop. We are a quick 10 minute drive from the airport, and an easy drive to any other neighborhood in the Portland Metro area.
access: Guests will have their own entrance to the downstairs apartment. We have parking that can accommodate two guest cars. During your stay you will have access to the sitting room with library, vintage record player and radio, the eat-in studio kitchen, bath and shower, laundry area, and the back garden; which is lovely for rest and play in the summer.
interaction: We will try to be home and will show you around. If you need anything we are usually home or a phone call or e-mail away, and will answer your questions about accommodations or the city.  We love Portland, are happy to give you our best recommendations for things to do, and help you navigate as needed.
house_rules: Please be respectful of the other's in the house with you.  No smoking indoors.  Wash any kitchenware that you use during your stay.  No pets, as the indoors of our house is a pet free zone (we do have two garden cats and neighbor chickens).  Music and media volume should be moderate after 9.  When you are through with your stay please place towels in the hamper provided.

summary: This cozy guestroom situated just off our kitchen, has a comfortable full sized bed, and direct access to the bathroom. My wife and I stay in the finished attic, so you can pretty much have the main level all to yourself! We do have 2 goofy dogs, so must be pet friendly. The neighborhood has numerous local gems--only a 10 min walk to Stark St (movies, food/drinks, shops, and quintessential Portland cafe) and we're just steps away from East Glisan Pizza ($1 slices of cheese pizza from 10-12pm!)

summary: My place is 5 minutes from Airport. Walking distance to local tavern, 7-11, Walgreens, Cheveron, Bai yok Thai Cuisine, Subway, Wendy's, Taco Bell and local favorite, Burgerville.  You'll love my place because of the location, and you are welcome to pitch a tent in front yard. My place is good for solo adventurers and furry friends (pets).  More than two people will cost extra, and pitching a tent is encouraged. 2 bus lines to choose from, and light rail station just blocks away.
description: My place is 5 minutes from Airport. Walking distance to local tavern, 7-11, Walgreens, Cheveron, Bai yok Thai Cuisine, Subway, Wendy's, Taco Bell and local favorite, Burgerville. house_rules: - Smoking is allowed outside and not in the home. We have an indoor "Cave" where smoking is allowed due to weather outside. SHOWERS are to be under 7 minutes, due to the cost of water in this city. Treat my home as if it was your home. Be respectful to all living in home. Enjoy your stay.  - When booking, please understand I can fit two in my living room, and several more outside if your own tents are pitched. There will be an added fee for additional guests outside in tents. I'll have coffee in the morning, but won't have a breakfast.  - It would be helpful, when booking to keep in mind that members of the house work nights, and sleep days. Some members leave early for work, and myself would like for you to be checked out no later than 8:30AM Tuesdays and Thursdays only, otherwise check out is 11AM, and if I'm home, I'm flexible with departure time. For future reference I will be having a private room open up at the end of June. This will allow 3 to stay in home.

summary: Very nice home base to stay when in Portland.   Plenty of entertainment if you want to stay in.   Many close-by places to explore!
space: A great place to relax in inner SE Portland.  A private 1600sq ft downstairs suite in remodeled 1955 house with 2 bedrooms, 2 fireplaces, 1 & 1/2 bathrooms, living room, kitchen & game room.
description: Very nice home base to stay when in Portland.   Plenty of entertainment if you want to stay in.   Many close-by places to explore! A great place to relax in inner SE Portland.  A private 1600sq ft downstairs suite in remodeled 1955 house with 2 bedrooms, 2 fireplaces, 1 & 1/2 bathrooms, living room, kitchen & game room. A nice quiet private basement with lots of recessed lighting and 7’ ceilings/6’6 doorways.  Cozy up next to a double sided gas fireplace w/ remote in the living room.  For entertainment there's a 60” plasma HDTV/surround sound system w/ Cable TV, streaming Netflix, and fast guest Wi-Fi access. Opposite this is a small sitting/reading room on the other side of the fireplace.   The kitchen comes w/ microwave, mini-fridge, convection toaster oven, Keurig & electric tea kettle.  Coffee/tea/breakfast bars provided!   Game room houses a new wood stove with foosball, board/card games and fish tank.   Master bedroom includes a very comfy Queensize bed w/ Tempur-Pedic memory foa
transit: Only 1 block from Division Street and bus stop.  Easy accessibility via car, bike, bus or Uber.   Less than 2 miles to Division and Hawthorne's entertainment districts and 5 miles to downtown. From the airport it's about a $20 Uber ride away.
access: A nice quiet private basement with lots of recessed lighting and 7’ ceilings/6’6 doorways.  Cozy up next to a double sided gas fireplace w/ remote in the living room.  For entertainment there's a 60” plasma HDTV/surround sound system w/ Cable TV, streaming Netflix, and fast guest Wi-Fi access. Opposite this is a small sitting/reading room on the other side of the fireplace.   The kitchen comes w/ microwave, mini-fridge, convection toaster oven, Keurig & electric tea kettle.  Coffee/tea/breakfast bars provided!   Game room houses a new wood stove with foosball, board/card games and fish tank.   Master bedroom includes a very comfy Queensize bed w/ Tempur-Pedic memory foam mattress.  Lots of hanger/closet space, iron & board. Guest bedroom includes a fullsize futon w/ new sleeping mattress.   Clean Jack & Jill bathroom with large walk-in shower, bath soap/shampoo, plush bath towels and hair dryer.   Another 1/2 bathroom is also available.   High efficiency front loading washer/dryer incl
interaction: My name is Dave and I own the home and I love living here!  When you arrive I will welcome you and get you settled in.  The entryway to the house is shared on the main floor.  Besides that the downstairs is completely private w/ locking door.  The upstairs living room/kitchen/dinning room is shared w/ 2 people and is accessible if desired.  Upstairs bedrooms/bathrooms are private and off-limits.
house_rules: To keep the space fresh I ask that you follow the Japanese style of visiting etiquette, no shoes downstairs, upstairs not an issue.   Check in time is flexible, anytime after 3PM and check out is by noon unless other prior arrangement has been agreed upon.  Quiet hours are 11pm to 7am however, the place is pretty well insulated so reasonable volume of music or late night movies are not an issue.  Smoking anything allowed in Oregon is fine however all tobacco needs to be done outside.  There's a covered front porch if it's raining.

summary: Enjoy the privacy of this daylight basement apartment with private entrance and separate bedroom and bath in the NE Portland Montavilla neighborhood. The location is close to restaurants, shopping, parks, freeways, public transportation, and a 15 minute drive to downtown Portland.
space: I've decorated the apartment with crafts and art from my travels around the US, Nepal, Peru, Kenya, Morocco, plus other countries. There's even an 8x10 piece of the original PDX Airport carpet! The downstairs has a large living and dining area combined, with a full bathroom, and separate bedroom with a real queen sized bed. The large sectional L-shaped couch is super comfy to sleep on, and there is a high quality queen sized air mattress available for use as well. There is a mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, toaster and other basic appliances and amenities to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Coffee and tea provided.  My house is located in a quiet residential neighborhood with friendly neighbors, wonderful restaurants and bars within walking and biking distance, connection to mass transit, Uber, Lyft, and all major arteries downtown and to the Columbia River Gorge. It is not walking distance to downtown, but a quick 15 minute direct car or train ride.
description: Enjoy the privacy of this daylight basement apartment with private entrance and separate bedroom and bath in the NE Portland Montavilla neighborhood. The location is close to restaurants, shopping, parks, freeways, public transportation, and a 15 minute drive to downtown Portland. I've decorated the apartment with crafts and art from my travels around the US, Nepal, Peru, Kenya, Morocco, plus other countries. There's even an 8x10 piece of the original PDX Airport carpet! The downstairs has a large living and dining area combined, with a full bathroom, and separate bedroom with a real queen sized bed. The large sectional L-shaped couch is super comfy to sleep on, and there is a high quality queen sized air mattress available for use as well. There is a mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, toaster and other basic appliances and amenities to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Coffee and tea provided.  My house is located in a quiet residential neighborhood with friendly neighbors
transit: Public transportation is conveniently located. There is a nearby MAX line to downtown and to the airport, and several bus lines. Uber, taxis, and Lyft are also available for anywhere you need to go. Bars and restaurants on NE Glisan, E Burnside, and SE Stark (between 73rd and 82nd) are easily accessible with a 5-15 minute walk or a 2-5 minute car or bike ride. Some of my favorite bars and restaurants include Hanoi, The Observatory, Vintage Cocktail Bar, Redwood, The Country Cat, and Roscoes. The Fillmore on NE Glisan is a great local coffee joint with a true Portland feel.  Some other nearby points of reference for activities: - Montavilla Community Center and adjoining public pool nearby. - Tillamook Golf Course near 72nd and Halsey (for golf and/or nature walking) - Bike routes throughout Mount Tabor Park only a 10 minute ride away or a 20 minute walk.
access: You will have access to the entire downstairs of my home and backyard. I have Apple TV and guests may watch Netflix, Hulu, HBO NOW, etc. Wifi is available. The password is provided after check-in in the house manual.  Please note that I live in the upstairs of the house. Quiet hours after 10 pm. Occasionally, I may need to access the downstairs, but will notify you before doing so.
interaction: I am happy to meet you. I'm out and about a lot, but feel free to knock on the front door or text me. I love to share all the great things to do in and around Portland.  I'm happy to suggest places to eat, drink, hike, etc.  I have a guestbook and would love to hear about your stay! Please leave me a note about things you enjoyed and anything else.
house_rules: - No pets - Please remove street shoes once downstairs - No smoking or vaping of any kind anywhere on the property, including outside - The host lives upstairs, quiet time after 10pm. - Please strip beds of sheets before leaving and place in laundry basket in bathroom. Place towels here as well. - Place used dishes in the bin provided.  - There are some delicate items in the downstairs and it is not child/baby-proof. Children are very welcome, and please feel free to move something out of reach and take care that all food and shoes remain off the couch, etc. - Wifi is available and password is provided in the house manual

summary: Our patch of Portland is a getaway in the city. A short walk from coffee, boutiques, bars, restaurants and beautiful Mt. Tabor Park. Our home and vintage Airstream is a unique and comfortable option for guests to enjoy Portland.
space: Our home and Vintage Airstream, aka 'The Silver Bungalow' are clean, open and comfortable. The house has three bedrooms (one is a nursery). See our reviews here: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/1022232 The Airstream has 2 twin beds and a new double sofa bed. The nursery in the house will accommodate our air mattress. It's a perfect home for 3+ couples, or a family traveling with grandparents, friends reuniting for a nearby wedding, etc. We have done our best to make sure that you will have all the comforts of home in our Airstream. Three things people like about the Airstream is that she is in excellent and original condition for a nearly 50 yr old trailer! People love the outdoor space and find that they spend much of their time there. They also like that it is self contained and quite cozy.  No one has yet complained, but I imagine two things that people don't like is the small shower in the Airstream and the fact that it is not air-conditioned. These are part of the charm of a 60's Air

summary: I welcome you to stay at my home in SE Portland, Oregon! This is a one bedroom apartment, one of three apartments in an a big, old house built in 1890. This neighborhood is residential with lots of giant trees and lush yards, yet the place is just a few minutes' walk to a beautiful park, restaurants, bars, shops, groceries and public transportation.
space: The apartment is upstairs. It includes one bedroom, a bathroom entered through the bedroom, a living room, a dining room, and a galley style kitchen. Floors are wood, with linoleum in the bathroom and kitchen.  The bedroom has a queen sized bed, with a recently purchased memory foam mattress, a dresser for your use and some space to hang clothes in the closet. The living room includes a loveseat and comfortable arm chair, as well as books, games, magazines, etc. A roll top desk provides space for writing.  Bath towels, shampoo, conditioner, soap, and a hair dryer are all provided. An iron and ironing board are available. The dining room has a small table that seats four people, as well as a desk with a computer 'docking station' that you are welcome to use.  The kitchen is stocked with a french press coffee pot, microwave, full stove, oven, refrigerator/freezer, and all the basics (pots, pans, dishes, utensils). You are welcome to use whatever is there, including any spices, oils or ot

transit: Yes! On bus lines - easy public transport to the airport, train, around town, etc. The city's new bike rental/share stations are within a few blocks on Belmont and Stark. Just ask if you'd like directions.
access: This is my home and I rent out it while I am away; you are welcome to use anything in the apartment. Please make yourself at home.
interaction: I will most likely be out of town while you are staying (you will always have the place to yourself), but I will be available by phone and online for anything you need. I've lived in Portland for 10 years and I've been a regular visitor for the past twenty years. I'll be glad to offer suggestions about the neighborhood, the city, etc.
house_rules: Before leaving, please wash the dishes. I'll take care of cleaning and washing bedding, towels, etc! No smoking anything inside. Feel free to smoke whatever you like outside. No parties or extra guests allowed in the building or apartment. Have a great time, but please respect that other people live across the hall and downstairs. They are aware that renters stay at the apartment. Regular level music and conversation doesn't seem to carry through the spaces, so just be reasonable and all will be well! A $25 replacement fee will be charged for lost keys.

summary: Classic, well-lit, comfortable house in a fantastic location!  Easy walk to tons of great shops and restaurants and Laurelhurst Park.  Beautiful back yard with a deck, water feature, and grill.
space: Enjoy this spacious, classic Dutch colonial home in a fantastic, close-in location.  The overall feel of the home is comfortable, tidy, and bright.  Central AC and a beautifully landscaped yard with a water feature and grill are fabulous in the summer.  Enjoy time at the house with a well-equipped kitchen with stainless appliances, cable TV, wireless internet, piano, a lovely dining room and table for gathering, and a nice selection of games.   The bedrooms, office, and bathroom are on the second floor.  The master bedroom is very comfy and spacious with a queen bed.  The second bedroom has 2 twin beds in the form of a day bed and roll out trundle bed.  There is a third bedroom that functions as an office and contains a comfy futon.  The bathroom is is well-lit with two windows, and has a nice, extra long and deep bath tub.

transit: There is a drive way and parking space available if you feel comfortable backing down a very narrow driveway.  Otherwise, it is rare to not be able to park right in front of the house on the street.  There are 3 major bus lines within a 5 minute walk and the neighborhood is very bike-friendly.
access: You have private access to the main and upper floors.  There is a basement which has a separate entrance and may be occupied by myself or my roommate.   Unfortunately, there is no laundry access.
interaction: Whenever possible, I will greet and orient you on your arrival.  After that, either myself or my roommate will usually be staying in the basement, which has a separate entrance.  We stay in the basement when you're here, but you may run into us in the backyard.  Myself and my roommate are always available by phone or email if anything is needed.
house_rules: Please keep noise levels low between 10 pm and 8 am.  Please, no large gatherings (more than a few guests for a few hours).  Please avoid wearing shoes in the house.

summary: One comfortable bedroom with a twin bed and shared bathroom in a beautiful colonial-style house built in the 1920's. Take a 10 min. walk to Hawthorne or Belmont street shopping districts or relax in our beautiful garden and hot tub.
space: Come stay in our beautiful and sunny guest room in a historic colonial house, where you can take an easy walk through the neighborhoods to some of Portland's best shopping districts or stay in and relax in our backyard hot tub. Enjoy homemade baked goods in the morning and In the afternoon come back from a day of sightseeing to the sounds of harp and violin duets or lessons in the living room.

summary: Sunny, spacious apartment located directly on Hawthorne Boulevard in the fabulous Sunnyside neighborhood!  Airbnb map incorrectly shows location in Laurelhurst neighborhood. Can't be corrected. Please don't let that mislead you. It's Hawthorne!
space: This spacious and sunny 1,000 sq. ft. private apartment is in an ideal location. It is nestled right in the heart of the Hawthorne District and is within walking distance of countless shops, restaurants, and bars as well as Mt. Tabor and Laurelhurst Parks.   Relax with a great cup of Portland coffee or glass of local Willamette Valley wine on the sunny plant filled front porch while you get in some excellent people watching. There is a table with seating for four on the porch for shared meals if you'd like to enjoy those outside.  Inside are hardwood floors throughout and a wood burning fireplace. There is a flat screen television that gets basic channels and is also hooked up to ChromeCast so you can stream movies from your smart phone or laptop. There's also an iPod dock station for your listening enjoyment.   A La-Z-Boy brand pullout sofa bed in the living room with a double size mattress functions to sleep two. Extra sheets, blankets, and pillows are all provided.  The dining area

It is nestled right in the heart of the Hawthorne District and is within walking distance of countless shops, restaurants, and bars as well as Mt. Tabor and Laurelhurst Parks.   Relax with a great cup of Portland coffee or glass of local Willamette Valley wine on the sunny plant filled front porch while you get in some excellent people watching. There is a table with seating for four on the porch for shared meals if you'd like to enjoy those outside.  Inside are hardwood floors throughout and a wood burning fireplace. There is a flat screen television that gets basic channels and is also hooked up to ChromeCast so you can stream movies from your smart phone or lapto
transit: There is free parking all the way around the block. The bus lines are incredibly accessible with bus stops right outside the door and downtown is ten minutes from the apartment. The MAX Light Rail runs from the airport.
access: The entire apartment, all amenities, and total privacy! No areas of the apartment are shared with anyone besides you and your travel companions.
interaction: Ideally I love to meet my guests upon their arrival as it's always a fun experience and I can answer any questions they might have. If this isn't possible I have a lock box that a key can be picked up from on the premises or we can figure out other arrangements.  If people have questions about the neighborhood or city or nearby attractions I am an open book and can always be reached via text during your stay.  I stay in another home and you will have complete privacy during your visit.
house_rules: My cat Stella is on premises and she likes to come in and out throughout the day. Please only inquire about a stay if you are comfortable with cats and would be happy to replenish her food and water as needed. If allergies are an issue Stella's hair is around so it might not be the best fit. Smoking is fine on the front porch but please not inside the apartment.  Also if you are staying for more than two days it would be really helpful if you were willing to water the outdoor and indoor plants. Having fun during your stay is an absolute hard and fast house rule! :)

summary: off the Hollywood Max Light Rail stop in the heart of Laurelhurst, one of the most historic neighborhoods in Portland.  We are close to Hollywood theater pub which plays new blockbusters and indie films. space: You’ll love our place because we are right on the max light rail, so you don't need a car while visiting Portland! You will also love our place, because of our therapeutic hot tub with powerful jets, lovely private patio complete with a gas grill, comfy bed, and all the amenities you need. The suite has a private entrance through the back patio and a locking door to the house.  The suite is also light and bright because of the skylights, and has nice high ceilings.  We will be available to you if you need us or if you just want to socialize.  :) We have two sweet girls, and a sweet older lab mix.  Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

summary: One spacious bedroom with a queen bed and shared bathroom in a beautiful colonial-style house built in the 1920's. Take a 10 min. walk to Hawthorne or Belmont street shopping districts or relax in our beautiful garden and hot tub.
space: Come stay in our beautiful and sunny guest room in a historic colonial house, where you can take an easy walk through the neighborhoods to some of Portland's best shopping districts or stay in and relax in our backyard hot tub. Enjoy homemade baked goods in the morning and In the afternoon come back from a day of sightseeing to the sounds of harp and violin duets or lessons in the living room.

interaction: In the morning we provide homemade baked goods, fruit and cereal and coffee and tea. We've lived in the neighborhood for 25+ years and we're happy to provide recommendations for local business, restaurants, hiking, biking or walking trails.
house_rules: We have one friendly cat (Leo), so please don't bring your pets. Smoking isn't allowed. Cooking in our kitchen isn't allowed.

summary: Located in the beautiful historic Laurelhurst neighborhood steps from major bus lines and central to all things Portland. Your comfortable private room, bath, and complimentary breakfast await! Plus a second bedroom for those travelling together.
space: Enjoy a comfortable queen sized bed with luxury linens and silk comforter, and your private bathroom just to the left.There is ample closet space, all yours, with a luggage rack to make unpacking easy. The living areas on the main floor are all yours as well during your stay, we do not use the front rooms in our daily living.  We have a second bedroom available only to members of your same party.This additional room with comfortable queen bed shares the same bathroom and is an ideal situation for two couples travelling together, or any combination of people in the same party up to 4 people. We will not rent this room to anyone but you during your stay. Although our address is on a busy street, most of the property actually faces a much quieter street. We do have some traffic noise and I provide a white noise machine if that might be an issue.

transit: We recommend buying your tickets through this mobile app:  (URL HIDDEN)  The bus to downtown (which runs every 20 minutes) stops just across the side street from our front door. No changes or transfers--simple! A bus which will take you to the MAX train at the Hollywood transit center is just one block away, or you can just walk .8 mile (about 15-20 minutes)through our beautiful neighborhood to catch the MAX.
access: The entire main floor is your home during your stay. Dan and I are both self employed and work from home, he from his upstairs office, me from my basement studio. We have a large master suite upstairs and when we are not working that is where we spend our time. The kitchen is shared, and you are welcome to hang out there at any time. Please use the fridge for your foodie findings, the microwave or oven to warm them up, the dishes and silverware to serve them, (and the dishwasher afterwards), and the swell little booth to imbibe; but I prefer that full meals not be cooked.
interaction: We are very casual and welcoming. We love sharing our home and our city and want to do everything we can to make your stay enjoyable. One of us will often be around as we both work from home, and though we are busy during the day, if we are here we are happy to be of assistance!
house_rules: -We are a non-smoking household. -quiet hours outside 10:00PM to 7:00AM We love our neighbors and want to be respectful. -unfortunately our home is not set up for pets or children.

summary: Welcome to your new slice of heaven! This one bedroom apartment is spacious and airy with tons of natural light! Comfortable bed and couch. Apple TV with Netflix. Located in Southeast Portland, walking distance to LOADS of fun things on 28th Ave, Burnside, Stark and Belmont. Laurelhurst park is beautiful and right around the corner. Hawthorne and Division are a 15 minute walk away with all the action you could ask for - Powell's books, food carts, thrift stores and delicious restaurants.
space: Corner apartment in a charming old portland style complex with little to no noise disturbance. Perfect for 2 people. Comfortable queen bed, apple TV with Netflix, back balcony and front porch with intimate seating. There is also a quarter washer and dryer machine that you're welcome to use.

summary: Peace & quiet in an urban neighborhood that's walking distance to NE 28th Ave. "restaurant row", public transportation, Laurelhurst Park, Laurelhurst Movie Theater.  The apartment is 650 s.f. w/ 2 windows, 1 out to side garden.  Large back shared deck.  Washer/dryer for use when staying 4 nights or more.  Bicycles for rent.  t.v. connected to Roku player and dvds provided.
space: The private entrance lower level 1 bedroom apartment is a space about 650 s.f.. There is a dining room, large, comfortable bedroom with new queen bed and comfortable sofa with coffee tables, large window with views of side garden, kitchenette with coffee maker, hot water maker, toaster oven, microwave, and small refer for light cooking.  There is no cooktop.  You'll have some things to get started--coffee beans, teas, English muffins, cereal, etc.  This apartment does have some steps down to it, so anyone with problems with stairs with a railing should consider that. Books to read and lots of information on Portland are provided.

access: Guests have their own private side entrance.  They also will have access to the large back deck to use.  It is shared with the guests in the back cottage, but the cottage also has its own private patio.

house_rules: I expect guests to be relatively quiet, neat and who are respectful of my space.  NO SMOKING.  NO PERFUMES PLEASE!! At this time I do not take any cleaning or security deposit so expect guests to leave the apartment in good order per checkout instructions in the information booklet provided on arrival.

summary: Opal 28 is an intimate venue uniquely your own. We are a gem in the heart of NE Portland.  We host weddings, social events and corporate meetings.
space: Opal 28 is an intimate space, an extension of your living room with a vintage and elegant ambiance. The 2,600 square foot space includes two great rooms, a built in bar, and a private outdoor patio. The building originally built in 1908 is conveniently located in inner NE Portland. Includes modern charm in contrast to the rich history of the vintage building.  Stone floor, exposed brick and a built in oak back bar are among a couple stylistic details. The open floor plan is versatile and comfortable offering a myriad of event styles and settings: corporate meetings, parties, fundraisers, bridal showers, rehearsal dinner, weddings, birthdays, conferences, tastings....   Opal 28 comfortably holds up to 125 people for a cocktail party with limited seating or a dinner party for up to 65 people.   We are a full service venue offering catering, bar service, rentals and decor; however, we do welcome outside vendors. We are located in one of Portland's most vibrant neighborhoods with easy acce

summary: Very large and comfortable place to call home in the heart Portland! The Kerns/Laurelhurst neighborhood is friendly, lively and conveniently located. Walk to bars, cafes, restaurants, funky shops, Laurelhurst park and the movie theater. You will have your own private entrance from the covered front porch. The main level has a bedroom with a comfy queen bed as well as a spacious living area. Upstairs you will find a large open loft with 2 firm double beds, 1 twin bed and a private bathroom.
space: On the main floor, there is also a living area complete with a table, chairs and couches. We provide you with a mini fridge, dishes, microwave, toaster and complimentary coffee/tea service. There isn't really a way to "cook" a meal but Portland has so many amazing restaurants that this doesn't seem to be a problem for our guests. Upstairs on the 2nd floor in the loft the other 3 beds are in separate alcoves with small privacy screens. The upstairs space is best suited for easy going travelers who don't require a ton of privacy. The only bathroom is located on the 2nd floor and so this space wouldn't be appropriate for guests with mobility issues. There is an additional seating area upstairs with a 32" flat screen for using your Netflix and Hulu accounts.

On the main floor, there is also a living area complete with a table, chairs and couches. We provide you with a mini fridge, dishes, microwave, toaster and complimentary coffee/tea service. There isn't really a way to "cook" a meal but Portland has so many amazing restaurants that this doesn't seem to be a problem for our guests. Upstairs on the 2nd floor in the loft the other 3 beds are in separate alcoves with small privacy screens. The upstairs space is best suited for easy going travelers who don
transit: Free street parking all around the neighborhood  Trimet buses go downtown and to the transit/train center:  # 19 bus on N.E. Glisan St. is 1 block away  # 20 on E. Burnside St. is 4 blocks away #12 on N.E. Sandy Blvd. is 4 blocks away Enterprise car rental on N.E. Sandy Blvd. is 4 blocks away The airport is a 15 minute car/cab ride from here.  Check out Spinlister bike sharing for bike rentals
access: We live in the back of the house on the main floor and lower level however guests have their own private entrance and there are no shared spaces. We provide: ~ Convenient key-less entry ~ High-speed WI FI ~ Complimentary coffee and teas ~ Fresh linens ~ Body wash, shampoo, conditioner and blow-dryer  ~ Forgotten toiletries ~ First aid kit ~ Iron and ironing board ~ Brochures, walking maps, bus schedules and general information on Portland and surrounding areas
interaction: You can reach me with a text or phone call with any needs or concerns, otherwise I am very respectful of my guests privacy.
house_rules: Smoking and vaping pot or cigarettes is only allowed outside.  Please use the ashtrays and trash can provided on the front porch.  Smoking inside will set off our smoke detectors.  Unregistered guests must vacate premises by 11:00 pm. No third party rentals, at least 1 guest needs to be registered with Airbnb. Maximum overnight occupancy is 4 persons unless we have agreed on a different arrangement ahead of time.  If you would like to add another guest to your reservation after the first 2 you will need to ask me in advance and I will alter the price accordingly. No illegal downloading off of our internet please. No pets allowed on premises. Please observe the 11:00 checkout time and send me a text when you have departed.

We have a very cute and cuddly cat named Cody... but he is usually playing outside or hanging on the deck as to not disturb those who are allergic.

summary: Take the Max from the airport and walk 2 blocks to your own comfortable room. 6 stops to Airport or Downtown, 4 stops to convention center. Cozy queen bed, cotton sheets, wool filled comforter, WiFi, Claw foot tub/shower, private room in two bedroom house.
space: My house has an urban-hippy-chic vibe. I welcome you to make yourself at home here. I provide a comfortable, clean and spacious room. There are two closets with hangers as well as a buffet with two small drawers and a shelf in which to place your clothes if you wish. Mellow Yellow was built in 1910. It is a spacious two bedroom / one bath with high ceilings and wood floors throughout. Your room is the back bedroom upstairs. The house is well built making it comfortable to share space as far as sound proofing. The cleaning products I use contain no artificial fragrance or colorants, including all the hand soaps and laundry detergent. In the shower there are a variety of natural and organic skin washes, shampoos and facial washes for different skin types. We're on a frontage road and yet highway noise is minimal due to a very effective retaining wall when the windows are kept closed. I provide a white noise machine in your room in case you want a little noise. The room is typically very

transit: This location is convenient for the convention center and downtown travelers. It's equidistant from Downtown and the airport. You can catch the Max at the Portland Airport and be in bed in less than 30 minutes. Likewise, Downtown Portland is just a 20 minute ride in the other direction. Bus lines run on Glisan and 60th and will take you anywhere you want to go that Max won't. Bus stops are about 3 blocks away. If you are on foot completely and want a more neighborhood experience this might not be for you. But here you do not need to take a bus to hop the MAX. It's right here!!
access: Please knock firmly when you arrive at my house so I know you're here. The bathroom trash is under the sink on the left. When showering, turn the cold to match the hot then cut it back to your desired temperature. You can cozy up to the cats on their sofa in the communal salon where there is also a table and chairs. You can work on your laptop there. Please let me know if you want space in the refrigerator.  Please play the piano in the salon. It likes that.
interaction: I have a varied schedule and am available for you via text if I am not at home.
house_rules: Welcome to my sanctuary. Kindly observe all house rules. I have three sweet indoor / outdoor cats. They are well socialized and may try to get some love from you, or not. You know how cats are. The cat boxes are downstairs and enclosed by thick black curtains in my private space.  The cats are not allowed in your room, including in between guests. I will respect your space and belongings and I ask the same. I will shut your bedroom door if you leave it open so the cats don't get in. Since this is a trust based service many of the following may seem obvious to you. If so, please book my room :) Unfortunately, this is not always the case hence my spelling things out.  Driveway is reserved for my vehicles. There is plenty of street parking so I kindly ask to park on the street.  It is disheartening that I must say this next item, but alas: DO NOT URINATE IN THE SHOWER. I WILL KNOW AND YOU WILL BE CHARGED $35 DUE TO ME HAVING TO SPEND MORE OF MY TIME CLEANING TO GET THE SMELL AND THE GERMS

house_rules: Shoe-free home. Meat-free home. (except for the cats) I don't mind if you cook meat while I'm gone (if you're booking this listing I will be gone), but kindly dispose of all scraps outside in the large bright green compost container so I don't have to deal with it later. Artificial fragrance-free home. NO cigarettes, cigars or pipe tobacco in house or on property. I will charge the full deposit for smoke damage. YES to 420 NO Parties or unregistered guests. $35 lost key fee. Cat feeding: The cats all eat wet food and they eat two to three times per day. They enjoy fresh water daily. They are indoor/outdoor but ALWAYS indoor when you are gone and at night. They all come running when you tease them with treats in the drawer to the left of the refrigerator. They will come when they hear the crinkle of the bag. If they don't, try in a few minutes.

space: We have a comfortable house in a quiet neighborhood in a convenient  location in SE Portland. The private room has an attached bath, private entrance with convenient parking and private outdoor space. We are 15 min drive from the airport, a short walk to the MAX Station (Public Transportation) and there is a bus stop at the end of the street. The bathroom is stocked with towels and bath items, shampoo, conditioner and soap. The room offers a full size bed, tv with cable, wifi, a desk and chair, and plenty of open storage space. We also supply a couple folding chairs in case you want to spend some time in the private outdoor space.

summary: My place is super cozy and close to Fred Meyer and Gateway Transit Center. You’ll love my place because of the ambiance & the convenience to public transport . There is tons of space and you can enjoy Netflix and Hulu, run on the treadmill or relax in the giant tub with super hot water in abundance! My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids if they are ok with sleeping on the couches). Stay while I'm gone!
space: I have a treadmill and Jillian Michal's DVD for your convenience. Queen sized bed with lots of sweet, high thread-count cotton to snuggle your dreaming body. The place is immaculate!

summary: Take a trip back in time in a historic 1881 sailor's hotel! Lovingly restored former boarding rooms have been updated with modern amenities, including free ultra-high speed wi-fi, reading light and charging outlet, in-room sink, and Shared Bath.
space: The historic guest rooms have been restored to be just as you might have found them in the 1880's, only more comfortable!  Each room has ultra-modem heating, cooling, and fresh air, along with gorgeous views of historic Old Town Portland.  Custom-built beds provide generous storage and built-in lights and electronics charging.  Sinks in each room make it easy to get ready for a night out, or a big day adventure.  Plentiful shared baths are never more than a few steps away.
description: Take a trip back in time in a historic 1881 sailor's hotel! Lovingly restored former boarding rooms have been updated with modern amenities, including free ultra-high speed wi-fi, reading light and charging outlet, in-room sink, and Shared Bath. The historic guest rooms have been restored to be just as you might have found them in the 1880's, only more comfortable!  Each room has ultra-modem heating, cooling, and fresh air, along with gorgeous views of historic Old Town Portland.  Custom-built beds provide generous storage and built-in lights and electronics charging.  Sinks in each room make it easy to get ready for a night out, or a big day adventure.  Plentiful shared baths are never more than a few steps away. The Society Hotel is an oasis from the busyness of the city.  Feel free to wander the historic halls and envision being a guest from decades past, or explore curated artifacts from the hotel.  The rooftop deck is for guests only, and provides an unparalleled 360 degree view o
transit: The Society Hotel is centrally located to virtually all transit in Portland. Trimet, our local transit system is one of the best in the nation, with a $5 daily pass or $2.50 for 2.5 hours.  The fare works for all busses, MAX trains, and street cars.  Bus Lines and Yellow + Green Light Rail (MAX) lines run on 5th+6th Avenues. Additional Red + Blue MAX lines run on 1st avenue. The MAX red line offers a 40-45 minute ride from the airport and the Old Town/Chinatown red line MAX stop is a two block walk to the hotel. The Greyhound bus station is 4 blocks away, and the Amtrak station a block further.  Street parking is hourly pay during the day and is free from 7pm until 8am most nights, Friday and Saturday nights being the exception, as nearby streets are closed to vehicle traffic from 10pm until 4am to allow pedestrian and taxi traffic only.  We also recommend a covered parking garage called Smart Park on NW 1st and Davis, which has some of the best rates downtown. Ride sharing like Car2Go
access: The Society Hotel is an oasis from the busyness of the city.  Feel free to wander the historic halls and envision being a guest from decades past, or explore curated artifacts from the hotel.  The rooftop deck is for guests only, and provides an unparalleled 360 degree view of Portland.  Enjoy craft-made local coffee, pastries, wine, beer, and mixology in the Cafe Society at virtually any hour.
interaction: Our desk staff are all concierges and are available 24/7 by text or phone.  We are Portland experts, and can help you craft the ultimate Portland Experience to get the most of out your stay.  Visit with other travelers in the cafe, or check out feedback from others' adventures on our social media board in the lobby.
house_rules: Guest should expect quiet hours after 11pm.  Access after this time to the hotel lobby, cafe, and roof is for guests only.  This is a non-smoking building, including the rooftop deck.

summary: Centrally located access to Downtown, the Pearl District and all the city has to offer. My place is close to Andina, Barista, Rogue Distillery and Public House, Pope House Bourbon Lounge, Little Bird, Starbucks. You’ll love my place because of the location, the people, the outdoors space, the neighborhood, and the ambiance. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
space: The space is on the 7th and 8th floor to the left of the elevator and looks over the Pearl, bridges, and Union Station to the North and West.   The Master Suit has a beautiful bathroom with walk-in two headed shower and bath, two vanity sinks that make the space that much more relaxing.  The full kitchen is ready for use and the living area is very comfortable and expansive for a downtown apartment at 1730 square ft...  Not too shabby.

transit: You are 4 blocks from the street car that takes you Downtown to shops and dining, and deeper into the Pearl District, and also NW 21st and 23rd popular areas. If you take the MAX train from the airport it will drop you two blocks from your destination.   Uber is $5 for most of the Downtown areas.  If you are looking to visit  Hawthorne, Division, Alberta, or Mississippi areas Uber can be $5 to $15 depending how deep into each area you want to go.   There is a bike rental shop around the corner.  Even if your not into bikes that much I recommend taking a couple hours and riding around the water front to really get a feel for what Portland is all about during the day.  You are literally 2 minutes from the waterfront walkways/ bikeways that take you in a loop over two bridges, a board walk, and waterfront. summary: Small, casual, functional private bedroom with a new full/double bed in a modern high-rise. Ideally suited for travelers without cars* or in wheelchairs, it is only 2-3 blocks' walk to the central terminus for transportation including MAX trains, bus lines, Amtrak, Greyhound and inter-city Bolt Buses.  Walk to downtown, Pioneer Square, the Pearl, even Providence Park. Right across the river from the Convention Center, the Coliseum and Arena.  Convenient train trip from and to the airport.
space: Inside a small 450 square foot 1 bedroom apartment, your bedroom is very small with a brand-new double/full bed. There is space for one carry-on and suitcase in the bedroom,  other items in the living room and toilet articles in the bathroom.

summary: A comfortable, quiet, private bedroom, shared bathroom. Located in the middle of Portland's Washington Park next to the Japanese Gardens! So like a proper Bed & Breakfast you would find in The British Isles or New Zealand.
space: Portland is such a spectacular place to be in the Spring.  The location of my place in Washington Park makes it the center of enjoying the great outdoors right in the middle of the city.  Culture activities are at the best with theatre, music and dance all round the city.  And if you have not tried our beer or visited our wineries it is a special treat!  The room has a comfy Queen bed for 2.  Queen Bed (60inches x 80inches) Queen size mattresses are the gold standard in the industry today. They have a width suitable for sharing, and a length that works for all but the tallest people.  A small,  cozy room you would find in Germany, England or New Zealand. Maximum is 2 people.   If you are looking for more spacious accomodations, private bath, living room and garden terrace check out our Bed and Breakfast Suite in the Park listing(Air BnB #(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN))...upgraded amenities and a very special place on the ground level. We offer a Continental Breakfast, it is really quite deluxe

If you are looking for more spacious accomodations, private bath, living room and garden te
transit: Yes, the bus stops right on the corner! There is a bus every 15-20 minutes that will connect you to the MAX (light rail) or the Portland Streetcar system. TriMet’s Line #63.  The Washington Park Free Shuttle  runs on a one-way loop through the park, stopping at all points in the park, Washington Park MAX Station and most of the attractions in the park. Both MAX stations are served by the Blue and Red lines, and the Line 63-Washington Park/Arlington Heights bus. Operates weekdays. 7am-7pm.   And there is the Line #20 that operates 7 days a week until 1:30am and it is just 2.5 blocks away from the house . There is a bus stop(#1633 and stop #12886) just at the corner with Tri Met.  We are on the #63 Route.    You can connect to anywhere easily in the Portland Metro area via bus, streetcar and light rail.  For those with a car there is plenty of free parking on the street right in front of the house. Blue Star Shuttle operates airport shuttle right to our front door.  Reservations required
access: You will have a comfy, queen bedded room with a view of the garden from the window, shared bath and the breakfast room where our Deluxe continental breakfast is served daily. Use of the kitchen is not permitted. No cooking is allowed in your room or bathroom.  The rest of the house is for the use of the owners and  not for guests, thank you for respecting this.  If you are wanting more space:  access to a garden terrace and a spacious accommodation we suggest that you check out our Bed and Breakfast Suite in the Park, which is located on the ground level with a beautiful garden, private bath, spacious living room, upgraded amenities  and private bedroom.  There are 14 steps down to the suite.
interaction: A lot!  I know Portland so very well and am happy to share any of my insights!  I am very familiar with the sights of all of the Portland metro area. Also,  I have great dining recommendations....just ask!  As for the the wine and beer venues.....Portland is a mecca and I can guide you to the very best.
house_rules: -No children under 10 years please do not make reservations if you are bringing children under 10 years old.  We do not accept them. -No Smoking on the property -Check in 3pm or after and not after 11pm -Check out 11:00am -Sorry late check out is not possible. -Sorry no pets allowed -Early check in is not possible -2 people maximum. -No shoes in the house, there is a shoe basket right inside the front door. -No parking in the driveway. Plenty of parking on the street right in front of the house.   -Shared bathroom. We ask that you keep care of your towels in your room. We do have a guest basket in the bathroom.  Again, this is so like an experience you will have in England or Auckland! -Quiet hours from 11:00pm to 7:00am daily.(low TV volume, quiet talking) -Continental Breakfast is served from 7:30am-9:30am in the Breakfast room. Please let us know what time you would like your breakfast (website hidden) is an idea of what we have served:  Gambas con Mojo Canarias(Spicey, not hot Span

summary: A spacious suite with upgraded personal amenities. We are located in beautiful WashingtonPark next to the Japanese Gardens.  Private bath, bedroom and living room and  garden space. A deluxe continental breakfast included!
space: We have just opened this suite in 2015.  But check out our rave reviews for our other Air BnB unit. Our location is in the middle of one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in Portland!  We are adjacent to Washington Park, Hoyt Arboretum, The Japanese Gardens(closed Sept. 8-March 1),   and the Rose Gardens.  A peaceful beautiful and quiet place to stay! The suite is very comfortable and spacious with private bedroom (one queen bed), private bath and large living room. There is also access to the garden terrace which is right next to the park.  Tom has his garden stuff here and outdoor ceramic studio...but is willing to share the space.   There is a small refrigerator for your exclusive use. For those who want more room and privacy this is the perfect suite. The private bedroom has a Queen size bed 80" x 60".  The suite can accommodate up to 4 people (extra charge for 3rd & 4th person) as there is a sofa sleeper/futon (full size double bed size, 54 x 75 inches,   not a queen!)   in the

access: Guests have access to their full suite, the breakfast room upstairs in the morning only, a separate private outside entrance and sitting area in the garden (accessible Mid-May thru September only). Getting to the suite there are 14 carpeted stairsteps inside the house down from the breakfast room to the suite and 14 steps outside(mid-May thru Sept.) from the garden to the suite. THIS SUITE IS NOT HANDICAP ACCESS FITTED.   Garden access is only open Mid-May thru Sept, in the late spring, summer and early fall. The backyard is the garden and artist workshop for the owner but he likes sharing the space with the suite guests! The upstairs, except the breakfast room,  are for the private use of the owners and not for guests. No cooking in your suite or bathroom.  Use of the kitchen is not allowed.
interaction: We have birds chirping early in the morning.  Your host is an experienced travel professional and a native Oregonian! He is a travel agent with over 30 years experience.  He has been an Air BnB host for 2 years with rave reviews.  Being an Oregon native he can help you in discovering the Pacific Northwest.

summary: This turn of the century vintage chic apartment has many original vintage details. space: This apartment is a very charming, light-filled space with a lovely view. This century-old building is quirky, so I like to greet guests at the apartment whenever possible to get acquainted.

summary: This cozy apartment is on the second floor of a classic Portland apartment building built in 1908. Washington Park/NW 23rd Ave/the soccer stadium are all just a few blocks away. The MAX is just three blocks away for easy airport access.
space: This vintage apartment is a great space to stay while visiting Portland.  You'll notice my eclectic tastes and the space is very comfortable and lived in. Portland is full of older buildings with charm and you'll love resting your head in one of them!
description: This cozy apartment is on the second floor of a classic Portland apartment building built in 1908. Washington Park/NW 23rd Ave/the soccer stadium are all just a few blocks away. The MAX is just three blocks away for easy airport access. This vintage apartment is a great space to stay while visiting Portland.  You'll notice my eclectic tastes and the space is very comfortable and lived in. Portland is full of older buildings with charm and you'll love resting your head in one of them! Bathroom, living room and kitchen are all to share. The guest bedroom is right next to the shared bathroom.  June (the dog) and I stay in the room through the French doors. If you need advice about where to eat and drink, just ask!  Portland has an amazing food scene at all different price points. Goose Hollow and the nearby northwest area neighborhood are great for walking around, enjoying food and drink, with Washington Park just five blocks away (up hill!)  For those coming for a Timbers game, you'll ju
transit: MAX train is three blocks away and Trimet bus routes are very close.  Street parking is available by permit only and there are daily guest permits available at no additional cost.
access: Bathroom, living room and kitchen are all to share. The guest bedroom is right next to the shared bathroom.  June (the dog) and I stay in the room through the French doors.
interaction: If you need advice about where to eat and drink, just ask!  Portland has an amazing food scene at all different price points.
house_rules: No smoking, children or additional pets please. Guests looking for a funky, comfortable and centrally-located place to rest your head between excursions out to enjoy the city, step right up!

space: Great location close to everything portland has to offer and close to bus and Max light rail. There is a small amount of road noise from the highway guests should be aware of, it hasn't been an issue but you should be aware. Otherwise very quiet place and neighborhood.

summary: My place is close to Washington City Park, Japanese Garden, Providence Park (Soccer Stadium), downtown Portland, Pearl District, NW 23rd, easy freeway access and public transportation. You’ll love my place because of The coziness of the cottage and we just finished its renovation so everything is new.  The cottage is a stand-alone located on the corner of the garden.  The windows looked out into a beautiful secluded garden.. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
space: Newly renovated cottage that has a private bedroom, ensuite bathroom, fully equipped kitchen, and living room.  Cottage is separate from the main house so there is a lot of privacy.  Windows look out into the yard for a serene setting.  Very clean, bright, and cozy.

transit: Our home is walking distance to Rose Garden, Japanese Garden, Washington Park, the Portland Zoo.  It is two blocks away from the Timbers soccer stadium.  Downtown and the Pearl are 15 minutes walk.  Portland Art Museum is 10 minutes away. Public transportation is within 5 minute walk.  Trains to airport are also within 5 minute walk.

house_rules: - Maximum occupancy is 3 people, but one will have to sleep in the living room.  No cribs provided. To respect our neighbors, parties are not allowed.  We live in the main house. - We just completed the cottage renovation and I believe anyone who decides to stay there will find it very comfortable.  We are centrally located so no car is really needed.  The Max line from the airport stops 5 minute walk from our home.  Public transportation to any part of Portland is available.  Forest trails are easily accessible.  The location is hard to beat.

summary: Nicely-finished basement apartment all yours Fabulous location for easy access to the best of close-in SE Portland including Cartopia (food cart pod). Pioneer Courthouse Square (Portland's downtown living room) is only 1.9 miles across the Hawthorne Bridge, and the Convention Center is 1.7 miles to the northwest. Walkable and bikeable neighborhood, and a short walk to Biketown rental bike stations.  Both SE Salmon St. and SE 16th Ave. are Neighborhood Greenway streets that allow for safe biking.
space: We live upstairs, and you get the downstairs to yourselves. It’s like an entire apartment, but the stairs are also open to our space upstairs. The bedroom has an inside chain lock for your comfort and to keep sleepwalkers in place. ☺ The nicely-finished basement has 1 large, semi-divided bedroom, full bathroom with a shower (no tub), kitchenette, eating area, and laundry.  You can also use the clear-roofed deck to eat and hang out. The bedroom has a front space with a double bed and a couch with a back that folds down to sleep one (or two small kids). The TV/DVD player is in this room along with a free-standing closet with hangers. There’s also a desk for your use with handy office supplies, bike maps, and other visitor information. There are curtains in a doorway that divides the front bedroom space from the back space, where there is a twin bed. Easily room for 3 or 4 close friends or family and possibly 5 if some are kids. Cleaning supplies are stored on a high shelf, but the space

transit: Walking, biking, and TriMet buses are all good options from here.  Both SE Salmon St and SE 16th Ave are Neighborhood Greenway streets that allow for safe biking. The closest Biketown rental kiosk is at SE 20th and SE Belmont. TriMet bus line #15 is on SE Belmont St and line #14 is on SE Hawthorne St.  SE Salmon St is 3 blocks North of Hawthorne and 3 blocks South of Belmont. Zipcar and Car to Go have vehicles available to rent nearby. On street parking is free.
access: Access is around the back of the house, up the deck stairs, and through the sliding glass door that connects directly to the stairs to the basement. LED rope lights show the way. A lock box makes it easy for you to check in, even if we are not home right then.
interaction: If we’re in the upstairs kitchen as you are coming and going, we are happy to say hi, hear how your visit is going, and offer some suggestions for fun things to do. I work full time, but my partner is retired, so he may be around more during the weekdays.
house_rules: Please observe quiet time 10pm-7am, and we will do the same upstairs. No smoking inside or out No candles

summary: One bedroom in cottage-style two bedroom duplex under bamboo trees, with cozy patio off lively Belmont.  Walk to Hawthorne, Laurelhurst, easy to bus to downtown (7 min. drive).  Room has full sized bed, 2 drawers, closet, desk and shared bath.
space: The apartment is comfy, with  spacious living room, large dining table and good sized kitchen. The floors are bamboo, inspired by the bamboo trees around.  The bedrooms are on the 2nd floor separated by the shared bathroom. I prefer to accommodate 1 guest but a couple would be fine for short stays for an  additional $5 each night.
description: One bedroom in cottage-style two bedroom duplex under bamboo trees, with cozy patio off lively Belmont.  Walk to Hawthorne, Laurelhurst, easy to bus to downtown (7 min. drive).  Room has full sized bed, 2 drawers, closet, desk and shared bath. The apartment is comfy, with  spacious living room, large dining table and good sized kitchen. The floors are bamboo, inspired by the bamboo trees around.  The bedrooms are on the 2nd floor separated by the shared bathroom. I prefer to accommodate 1 guest but a couple would be fine for short stays for an  additional $5 each night. The  kitchen is stocked with Vegan staples (oatmeal, natural cold cereal(s), whole grain breads and crumpets, hummus, peanut butter, jam, almond milk, but I can provide other breakfast food as requested.   Prepare your breakfast in the kitchen and eat at the dining table. Weather permitting, guests are welcome to sit on the small patio which has a very small garden and of course, many bamboo trees. The apartment has wif
transit: Frequent public transportation, reliable cab services and car shares. Parking is available on the street.
access: The  kitchen is stocked with Vegan staples (oatmeal, natural cold cereal(s), whole grain breads and crumpets, hummus, peanut butter, jam, almond milk, but I can provide other breakfast food as requested.   Prepare your breakfast in the kitchen and eat at the dining table. Weather permitting, guests are welcome to sit on the small patio which has a very small garden and of course, many bamboo trees. The apartment has wifi, but if you have to work for long periods during the daytime hours, please plan to go to one of the cafes in the area. Guests can relax in the living room after their long day of events in the evenings. The bookshelf holds lots of interesting fiction and non-fiction.
interaction: You can have your privacy but I am home often. I read and listen to music and work on my computer. My home is small, so staying around the house will be tight and it is best for guests to have daily plans for activities in and around Portland. It is a good option for visiting parents who have children in the close-in Southeast.  I do go to many cultural events and guests are welcome to join me. I would also be happy to refer you to some restaurants. I am relatively new to Portland, but have learned a lot since 2014.
house_rules: I have designed my home to be comfortable and interesting. My furniture, lamps and artwork are important to me. I hope you appreciate them.  Please clean up after yourself after you shower and do not leave dirty dishes in the sink. Wash them by hand and use the dishwasher only to drain clean dishes.  I prefer you eat at the dining table.  Please read the recycling rules I keep posted on the refrigerator. You will read that Portland does NOT recycle prepared food containers regardless if they are made from recyclable materials, including pizza boxes. There is no smoking in the home. A guest can smoke out in the parking lot area or on the street, not on the patio (management rules). Children are welcome but this is a small apartment and only the one full side bed is available. The stairs to the bedrooms are open and potentially dangerous for toddlers.   Unfortunately, I cannot accommodate pets.

summary: This is the master bedroom of my Victorian home. Decorated with a blend of Victorian and Asian furniture and textiles, it has south facing light, a luxurious custom-built bathtub in the ensuite, and a heavenly Queen bed. It is important to note that this listing is ideal for those who seek a luxurious and peaceful sanctuary for their visit. It is not a place for drinkers or those coming and going late at night. Clean and respectful guests only, please.
space: This home is custom remodeled, so there is a hint of modern to the antique. My decorating flare makes it even more rich and unique, making visitors feel like they have stepped into another world. The atmosphere is oppulent, yet cozy.... the floors are heated with radiant heat (the room has it's own thermostat) and there is a heated towel rail in the bathroom. While you do not have the use of the kitchen, I have provided a mini fridge and a high quality selection of herbal teas and coffee for your enjoyment.

Downtown is only 1.5 miles away, the convention center is 1 mile  and the Lloyd Center is a 20 minute walk north. Uber and Lyft make it easy to get anywhere from this central location, and there are the orange "Biketown" bikes every few blocks that are easy to rent by the hour or day.
access: This listing is for the room with ensuite only. No kitchen.
interaction: I live and work in the same house so I am around a lot to answer any questions and make your stay as comfortable as possible.
house_rules: Being a luxurious space, I am catering to adult guests only (sorry, no children) who are relaxed and peaceful. It's a shoes off house and we are considerate of noise levels since there are 2 other people who live on the property and business is also being conducted here.

summary: This trendy and comfortable 1bd is in the heart of Southeast, located 2 blocks south of SE Burnside and 20th. Take a short walk and enjoy the food and spirits this neighborhood has to offer.
space: Enjoy your own one bedroom apartment in a private quiet inner-city apartment building with comfy couches.
description: This trendy and comfortable 1bd is in the heart of Southeast, located 2 blocks south of SE Burnside and 20th. Take a short walk and enjoy the food and spirits this neighborhood has to offer. Enjoy your own one bedroom apartment in a private quiet inner-city apartment building with comfy couches. Entire apartment. Parking is on the street. I am available if you have any questions day or night. Lock box will get you into the apartment upon arrival. One of the best neighborhoods in Portland. All you could possibly want for restaurants, shops, bars and parks all within walking distance. 10 minutes from downtown and a 2 block walk from the closets bus line. The apartment is on the second floor.

Be courteous to the neighbors with their windows open.

summary: Bright, clean, colorful and central!  This apartment is located in a beautiful, historic, Victorian home in the heart of Buckman.  Across from a park/playground/community garden and near cafes, bars, venues & restaurants.  Near buses and bike routes.
space: This Victorian house has tons of charm.  Walk any direction for a few blocks to excellent coffee, beer, wine or food.  Centrally located.  Close to bus lines and bike paths.  Free parking without time limits.  No car is needed if you are focusing on Portland and not going to the gorge or the coast.  For Portlandia buffs--Catnap with Kristen Wiig was partially shot here.  They frequently shot in the neighborhood and across the street at Buckman school.  Great park/indoor pool across the street for kids.  It has a community garden and a killer slide.  We will provide a notebook with recommendations for parks and dining spots.  Wednesdays are cheaper as my husband has band practice from 7-9ish.  Good time to take the saved money and grab a bite or cocktail! We are a family of four.  My husband Michael and I have two boys--9 and 14.  They are very sweet, but you may hear some giggling, voices or footsteps (especially in the morning on weekdays). Please don't feel like you need to tiptoe ar

Across from a park/playground/community garden and near cafes, bars, venues & restaurants.  Near buses and bike routes. This Victorian house has tons of charm. We will provide a notebook with recommendations for parks and dining spots.  Wednesdays are cheaper as my husband has band practice from 7-9ish.  Good time to take the saved money and grab a bi
transit: Walking, bus, or bike is totally doable.  Car would be nice for trips to the Gorge or Oregon Coast. Free parking on street (no time limits) and lots of space since we are across from a playground and fewer people compete for parking which is unusual in close-in parts of Portland.
access: Front door to the left of main door.  Completely enclosed/separate apartment.
interaction: We are a door, phone call, or text away.
house_rules: No smoking inside the apartment at all--cigarettes or pot.  You are free to smoke outside, just make sure to keep the apartment door closed so smoke doesn't drift into the apartment. No candles or open flame inside the apartment because of fire hazards (especially because we have kids!)  We have lots of mood lighting in the apartment, so ambience can be achieved without candles. Front porch is your space, although we will be leaving and exiting through the front door next door. Please don't be super loud on the porch after ten pm out of respect for our neighbors.   We will stay out of your way during your stay. Let us know if you need anything!
