summary: Graphic Designer/ Curator owned home in the heart of hip close-in Central East Side/ Belmont Neighborhoods. Walkable to everything that Portland is renowned for: restaurants, breweries, coffee roasters, and shopping. Minutes from City Center.
space: BR is a large sunny room (12'x16') in graphic designer/gallery curator owned condo located in the hip inner southeast Buckman neighborhood. The room features Queen size mid century modern bed with a brand new firm mattress, a vintage Herman Miller desk, an Eames chair, LCD TV and Roku box. Kickback, relax and watch some Netflix after a long day of discovering Portland! My condo is part of a small complex with a private court yard, from which you directly enter the house. This space is available to use when ever you would like, and is a great place to read (when it isn't raining). Up one short flight of stairs, and enter into a bright, spacious great room adorned by mid-century modern furniture and contemporary art. Home includes WiFi, cable TV (living room only), washer/dryer and full kitchen with gas stove. Rental includes use of this large private room, and bathroom with your own sink and drawer. house_rules: I am pretty easy going. Just asking a few things:  - Please treat my home as you would your own. I have many one of a kind items in the house. Please take a look and enjoy! Respect them like you would your property though. Thank you in advance!  - LGBT friendly. - No smoking in the house, but feel free to puff away in the courtyard. - Please make sure all doors are locked when you come and go.  - Please take your shoes off in the house.  - Please feel free to cook and use the kitchen as you please, just make sure all dishes are at least rinsed and put in the dishwasher.  - Please do not use the record player in the living room. You are more than welcome to use the tuner in the living room for radio or to plug your iDevice into though! Pump up the jams/NPR!  I think that is about it. If you have any questions please feel free to ask.  Best  Nathan

summary: Our home is very walkable, close to Belmont and Hawthorne! It is truly a retreat. Your hosts are Leland and Cedar. We are urban farmers, beekeepers, and we have chickens. There's a conservatory off the kitchen, which is a great place to enjoy the sunshine or rain. Upstairs in the shared bathroom there is a sauna, clawfoot tub, and large shower! Please be aware that we have two dogs and cat that are part of our family. They are friendly. We are white, queer, trans friendly, and anti-racist.
space: We absolutely love our home! It's a 1902 Portland foursquare that has been well-loved and maintained. We remodeled, doubling the size of the kitchen and adding the conservatory.  During the spring and summer our garden is full of blooms and edible plants, as you can see in the photos, but please be aware it doesn't look quite like that in winter!
description: Our home is very walkable, close to Belmont and Hawthorne! It is truly a retreat. Your hosts are Leland and Cedar. We are urban farmers, beekeepers, and we have chickens. There's a conservatory off the kitchen, which is a great place to enjoy the sunshine or rain. Upstairs in the shared bathroom there is a sauna, clawfoot tub, and large shower! Please be aware that we have two dogs and cat that are part of our family. They are friendly. We are white, queer, trans friendly, and anti-racist. We absolutely love our home! It's a 1902 Portland foursquare that has been well-loved and maintained. We remodeled, doubling the size of the kitchen and adding the conservatory.  During the spring and summer our garden is full of blooms and edible plants, as you can see in the photos, but please be aware it doesn't look quite like that in winter! Guests have access to both bathrooms, sauna, kitchen, living room, front porch, back yard, and conservatory.  Our kitchen is well-stocked with quite a numbe
transit: Parking on the street is plentiful. Driveway is reserved (we have a plug-in electric car.) There are bus lines available two blocks North on Belmont. Uber and Lyft are both great ways to explore the city!
access: Guests have access to both bathrooms, sauna, kitchen, living room, front porch, back yard, and conservatory.  Our kitchen is well-stocked with quite a number of implements including a teapot, coffee grinder, french press, high quality stainless pots and pans, double ovens, gas range, microwave, toaster oven, and very sharp knives. You are welcome to share these things, but please make sure to clean up after yourself. We have a vegetarian kitchen, if you choose to cook please respect this. (You can store meat in the fridge, but please take it with you or dispose of it after your stay.)  You will be welcome to help yourself to coffee or tea. Our bedrooms are private spaces. The desk in the front room is Leland's home work space. The basement is kept private, it’s the overflow area and usually quite a mess!
interaction: We both have flexible work schedules. Sometimes we're gone all day and at other times we're home often working on projects.  We'll give you space to do your own thing, but feel free to ask questions. We will chat with you if you have questions about Portland or any of the things we do!
house_rules: - vegetarian cooking only, may store meat in fridge - only registered guests allowed - quiet hours: 10pm to 10am - please take shoes off in entry

summary: Newly remodeled 600 sq ft daylight basement apartment located in Portland's historic Buckman neighborhood. It is comfortable, clean and brilliantly located for exploring the city. Borrow our bikes during the day, walk to a ton of restaurant and entertainment venues, or veg out with the Super Nintendo - it's a great place to find yourself in your own urban, Portland adventure!
space: Our daylight basement apartment includes a living room, full bathroom, and a bedroom with space to unpack and relax for a while. This private downstairs suite has a separate street level entrance. In the living room we have a comfy couch, tv, dvd player as well as a small eating nook. There is a kitchenette with mini fridge and complimentary coffee, tea & snacks. The  bedroom has black out shades as well as a double bed with a real pillow topper mattress. Street parking is usually easy to find with no passes required. If you don't have a car, you can easily walk, take a bus, or the streetcar or MAX to get around the city. We live right upstairs, with an adorable corgi named Lincoln.

access: You'll have the entire basement apartment to yourself! We live upstairs with our cute corgi but you'll rarely run into us and our dog doesn't access that space though you may occasionally hear them walking above.
interaction: We are always available by message on Airbnb or by phone. We will give you access to the suite electronically, your personal key code will be sent prior to check in.  We love our city and our neighborhood. Let us know if you need recommendations of any kind - we're happy to help!
house_rules: Smoking is not allowed anywhere on or near the premises.  Shoes off preferred, shoe stand near front door. There is a zero tolerance for parties.  Please be respectful of our space and home.

summary: A lovely private room with it's own mini-living room in an amazing, warm and welcoming new home in one of Portland's best neighborhoods. Walking distance to beautiful parks, delicious restaurants, fun bars, great groceries, and an historic cemetery.
space: We are the first owners of this 2011 built Renaissance home. It is eco-certified, has great plumbing, air conditioning and heating. Your room is large and has it's own queen sized bed, desk, and couch. A third guest could sleep on the couch or we have an inflatable queen sized bed as well.
description: A lovely private room with it's own mini-living room in an amazing, warm and welcoming new home in one of Portland's best neighborhoods. Walking distance to beautiful parks, delicious restaurants, fun bars, great groceries, and an historic cemetery. We are the first owners of this 2011 built Renaissance home. It is eco-certified, has great plumbing, air conditioning and heating. Your room is large and has it's own queen sized bed, desk, and couch. A third guest could sleep on the couch or we have an inflatable queen sized bed as well. You will have your own large room in the basement level of the home. You have a large half-sunken window that looks out to our garden and tea house.  Right upstairs from your room is a half-bath. On the second story there is a full bathroom that you will share with our roommate(s). We provide shampoo and conditioner, and some nice soaps, towels and little amenities like q-tips and stuff.  Your room has a queen sized bed, a nice little desk, as well as a s
transit: You are within walking distance of Burnside, Stark, Belmont / Morrison, and within close range of Hawthorne & Division.  There are buses on each of those streets that go downtown, or to the new street cars that go up and down the east river bank. Portland is a great place for public transit and even better for biking. We are 3 blocks from Ankney, a bike highway, and there is a great bicycle rental place - Crank- right down the street.  If you have a car2go membership, they are easy to find all around town as well. Uber also operates in Portland. Ask us if you need help getting around. We could even give you a ride if we are free :)
access: You will have your own large room in the basement level of the home. You have a large half-sunken window that looks out to our garden and tea house.  Right upstairs from your room is a half-bath. On the second story there is a full bathroom that you will share with our roommate(s). We provide shampoo and conditioner, and some nice soaps, towels and little amenities like q-tips and stuff.  Your room has a queen sized bed, a nice little desk, as well as a sweet leather couch for lounging on! Our main living room is also available which has Cable TV, HBO and a fireplace.  Our kitchen is very modern and spacious (see photos) you can cook here anytime! We have all the basics (oils and spices) and some cereal and eggs for you for breakfast if you want. We have lots of books if you need something to read, and business class internet (superfast). Tankless waterheater, new washer and dryer, and dishwasher.   We spend a lot of time on our lovely garden that is great for night-time grilling or da
interaction: I am a web designer and work from home. That means I am here almost all the time, but I stay in my office and it is very private downstairs. That being said, I am happy to hang out! We truly enjoy living in Portland and have lots of recommendations for food and activities if you need them.
house_rules: Smoking cigarettes is not permitted on the premises. Period. As of July of 2015, marijuana use is legal in Portland. We are fond of this! We understand if you do not want to be around it, so please be sure to let us know if you are uncomfortable with it and we can be sure to abstain during your stay. Anyone smoking must do so outside (because of our asthmatic kitty). Please remove your shoes when you enter the house. If you want to invite people over, we ask that you run it by us first. Checkout time is flexible.

summary: Beautiful 1896 Victorian house in walkable area. Guest room is on the first floor w/ bathroom (toilet and sink down 4 steps) & upstairs bathroom (shower, toilet, & sink). You will have private use of house less my bedroom , office, and storage rooms. Guests have control of fan and heat with thermostat in the dining room behind the screen and upstairs.  There is no A/C which is usually not an issue in Portland as the house is covered with trees. Please ask me if questions on temperature.

summary: Make yourself at home in the heart of Portland in a bright, clean, and updated basement apartment! Space includes queen bed, kitchenette, bathroom, and cozy gas fire stove! Around the corner from Screen Door (chicken and waffles anyone?) and minutes to downtown. Relax and enjoy this beautiful city!
space: You will be welcomed to your sunny Victorian by gnomes and wildflowers! Relax by the fire or put down your things and go out and explore! We want your stay to be easy and fun, so please contact us if you need anything! Frank and I moved into this house in September and know there are many things to improve, so know we are open to suggestions!
description: Make yourself at home in the heart of Portland in a bright, clean, and updated basement apartment! Space includes queen bed, kitchenette, bathroom, and cozy gas fire stove! Around the corner from Screen Door (chicken and waffles anyone?) and minutes to downtown. Relax and enjoy this beautiful city! You will be welcomed to your sunny Victorian by gnomes and wildflowers! Relax by the fire or put down your things and go out and explore! We want your stay to be easy and fun, so please contact us if you need anything! Frank and I moved into this house in September and know there are many things to improve, so know we are open to suggestions! You will go up the stairs and follow the pathway to your stay! Key lock box allows easy access! Frank and Brooke live upstairs with their quiet dog Hammy. Please ring the door bell or text us if you need anything. Our neighbors are awesome! We say hello when we see them, but never hear them inside the house! Oh yes! The bus can take you anywhere you wan
transit: Oh yes! The bus can take you anywhere you want and is located on the next street over.  Of course, Portland has Uber and Lyft too! Also, bike rentals are available a block away at either Crank or via the BikeTown bike share program! There is plenty of street parking available. While it can get a little tight around dinner time from the nearby restaurants, you shouldn't have to park more than a block away.
access: You will go up the stairs and follow the pathway to your stay! Key lock box allows easy access!
interaction: Frank and Brooke live upstairs with their quiet dog Hammy. Please ring the door bell or text us if you need anything.
house_rules: Our check-in and check-out times can be flexible, message us if you have any extenuating circumstances! Please no smoking in the house.  No bikes indoors please. (Message us if you can't find a secure spot outside) Please keep any pets off the furniture, we have an extra dog bed available :) Mostly, just be respectful :)

summary: Hello there,   Our household is a vibrant and busy one with 2 working female adults (Sheila & Courtney) and 2 awesome, smart, respectful teenage children (Oliver & Addie).   Our beautiful turn-of-the-century home has a living room, dining room, kitchen, main bath w/shower, as well as your room, on the main floor.   We sleep up on the 2nd & 3rd floors & have a private bath.  The main floor shower (shared with you) is used by the teens weekdays from 7:00-8:00...let me know if that's a conflict.

summary: Great location! Easy access to NW Portland, downtown and the west hills. Very walkable! Great space to relax in comfort when you're done exploring.
space: The studio is located in the lower level of our home, under our living space, and is accessed by an exterior stairway. It features a queen sized bed, private full bath, comfortable seating area, kitchenette and bistro table.  The kitchenette has a mini-fridge, microwave, sink, hot plate, toaster, and dish ware. Perfect for snacks and light meals.  The unit has good light and is very clean. You'll also enjoy a private deck with its own seating area.
description: Great location! Easy access to NW Portland, downtown and the west hills. Very walkable! Great space to relax in comfort when you're done exploring. The studio is located in the lower level of our home, under our living space, and is accessed by an exterior stairway. It features a queen sized bed, private full bath, comfortable seating area, kitchenette and bistro table.  The kitchenette has a mini-fridge, microwave, sink, hot plate, toaster, and dish ware. Perfect for snacks and light meals.  The unit has good light and is very clean. You'll also enjoy a private deck with its own seating area. You can expect to find a comfortable, welcoming space where you can spread out, relax and then explore the nearby amenities at your own pace.  If stairs are an issue, this may not be the best choice. The unit is accessed by two flights of exterior stairs, 20 steps. Come and go as you please without worrying about disturbing us as you have your own entrance. Enjoy the ability to wander anywhere do
transit: Both the red and blue line MAX train stops are 2 blocks to the south. It's an easy ride in from the airport, a quick trip downtown or to the Oregon Zoo. If you buy a MAX ticket it is also valid on the bus and streetcar lines. Tickets can be purchased at station kiosks or (EMAIL HIDDEN) Please see the House Rules section for details regarding street parking and parking permits.
access: You can expect to find a comfortable, welcoming space where you can spread out, relax and then explore the nearby amenities at your own pace.  If stairs are an issue, this may not be the best choice. The unit is accessed by two flights of exterior stairs, 20 steps.
interaction: Come and go as you please without worrying about disturbing us as you have your own entrance. Enjoy the ability to wander anywhere downtown with ease while being nestled in one of Portland's most historic and charming neighborhoods. I am happy to advise you as much as you want or just let you be. My goal is for you to be comfortable and enjoy your stay. There is also a hair dryer in the bathroom, and an iron and ironing board in the closet.
house_rules: Check in: 3:00 PM Check out: 12:00 PM If you need to check in after 3PM please let me know in advance so we can arrange a time to get you into the studio. Street parking Monday - Friday for more than 2 hours between 7AM and 6PM, and more than 90 minutes between 6PM and 10PM is by permit only. On Saturdays and Sundays it is 90 minutes between 1PM and 10PM. If you need parking during your stay please let me know at the time of your reservation so we can make arrangements to get parking permits. Permits are $5 per day and you can pay me directly. The City also requires that you provide me with your license plate number. By accessing the WiFi you agree to and will abide by Comcast's Acceptable Use Policy. A copy can be found in the unit or it may be viewed on the Comcast website. We are a shoes-off home, there is a shoe-mat inside by the door.  Access to the unit is via the gate on the west side of the house. Please keep the gate locked. It tends to slam shut so closing it quietly, especia

summary: Ideally located! Steps from Portland Art Museum, Oregon Historical Society, Portland State University, Hair of the Dog Brewing Co, Boke Bowl, Higgins Restaurant & Bar, PSU Farmers Market, and countless options for dining and shopping.  This cozy 1 bedroom apartment features a full kitchen, bathroom, washer/dryer, plenty of natural light, and a secure building. Come experience all that downtown Portland has to offer!
description: Ideally located! Steps from Portland Art Museum, Oregon Historical Society, Portland State University, Hair of the Dog Brewing Co, Boke Bowl, Higgins Restaurant & Bar, PSU Farmers Market, and countless options for dining and shopping.  This cozy 1 bedroom apartment features a full kitchen, bathroom, washer/dryer, plenty of natural light, and a secure building. Come experience all that downtown Portland has to offer! This vibrant area has many shops and restaurants to choose from. The building is located across from the the only major grocery store in Downtown Portland. Just 3 blocks from Portland State University and the Farmers Market. Near the Central Library, Portland Center for the Performing Arts, the Northwest Film Center, Arlene Schintzer Concert Hall. Streetcar stop directly in front of the building. Only a few blocks to the public bus stop and MAX light rail, which you can take to and from the airport.
transit: Streetcar stop directly in front of the building. Only a few blocks to the public bus stop and MAX light rail, which you can take to and from the airport.

This includes the use of marijuana or marijuana extracts. 4) Guests agree to abide by maximum occupancy of unit. 5) Guests agree to observe quiet hours from 9:00 pm until 9:00 am. 6) Guests accept complete responsibility for the unit from check-in until check-out. The registered guest is responsible for the actions of all members of his or her group.  7) Guests agree to return all keys, remotes, and parking passes. house_rules: Extra guests Extra Guests are allowed, up to 3 extras.  Please contact me before hand to approve Smoking Smoking is not permitted in the apartment or on the balcony.  It is permitting 25 feet away from the outside front door entrance.  This is not my rule but the buildings rule. Off-limit areas Please do not go into my bedroom closet.  I have provided a hook on the back of the bedroom door to hang anything you may need too.   Eating areas You can eat anywhere you would like. Cleaning procedures There are two trash cans in the apartment.  One is under the kitchen sink (right side) and the other is under the bathroom sink (right side).  If you need to take out the trash the trash shoot is down the hall way past the elevators on the right side.   Laundry The washer and dryer are located in the closet closest to the front door.  If you have any laundry to do or dirtied anything please just put it in the washer and I will take care of it. Gatherings or Parties I would prefer you not to have

summary: Welcome to our hideout.  Whether you're exploring the magic of Portland, hiking the Columbia gorge, or just want relax and listen to the PNW wind, the bottom unit of this Mt. Tabor mid century chill palace is perfect.  Steps to the quiet trails of Mt. Tabor and a short walk to the exploding food and bar scene of Montavilla, the location is pretty unbeatable.  When you've worn yourself out on food carts and vintage shopping, come build yourself a fire, light the BBQ, and play some records.

summary: We are frequent travelers who enjoy using AirBnB when we travel ourselves, and like to offer a comfortable space for others when we are home.  Private room and bath in our home, in a walkable neighborhood close to good food, drinks, and a park with a great view of the city. Easy access to frequent public transportation into the heart of the city.
space: We are Scott and Suzi and we have an extra room for travelers.  We are located in the Mt. Tabor neighborhood about 3.5 miles from downtown, just one block to 3 bus routes.  Our extra room has a double bed (Full Size) and is next to a bathroom that you would have to yourself.  You are also welcome to use the kitchen.   Street parking is available in front of the house.  This neighborhood has been growing quickly in the last few years! There are several restaurants, bars and coffee shops in walking distance with Division Street and Hawthorne nearby. Mt. Tabor, 10 blocks away, provides beautiful views of the city, a nice walk, run or bike ride.

Private room and bath in our home, in a walkable neighborhood close to good food, drinks, and a park with a great view of the city. transit: Very accessible!  3 bus routes stop within 2 blocks of our house. A ride downtown costs $2.50 one-way or $5.00 all day and takes 20-25 minutes to get downtown. There are bike corridors and bike lanes that will get you downtown and around town easily. There is a new bike share in Portland (URL HIDDEN) but you have to pick up the bikes closer into downtown. Ours is a very walkable neighborhood as well with plenty of coffeeshops, bars and restaurants walking distance from our house. Car2Go is available in Portland and our neighborhood is within the boundary. Uber and Lyft are both available in Portland.  Several taxi companies serve the Portland area.
access: Private bedroom and bath, share the kitchen and living spaces. Street parking. We have a big garden with lots of edibles, and during peak season you are welcome to snack your way around it!

summary: Hello! We are two people and a cat. We love our home and our amazing neighborhood, and we think you will too! Close to Mt. Tabor, Academy Theater, cool restaurants/bars, and bus lines. You will have a private entrance, a mini fridge, and your room will be right next to the bathroom. Our place is good for couples and solo adventurers.
space: Our home is a cute little bungalow built in 1920. At the back of the house is our guest room with its own private entrance in the back yard. Inside we have new futon bed, a tv/blu-ray player hooked up to Netflix, and a mini fridge stocked with treats, and with ample space for you to store your own. In the bedroom closet there are hangers and cubbies for storing personal belongings. Right next to the guest room is a shared bathroom with a full tub. If this bathroom is occupied, there is a half-bath down in the basement, right next to the laundry room, which you are also free to use during your stay.

transit: We are next to several bus stops. The #20 stop is half a block away will take you right downtown. The #19 is five blocks away end will take you downtown via Glisan. The #15 stop is five blocks away and can take you downtown via Belmont and the Mt. Tabor area. The #72 goes north/south along 82nd, and will take you through the Killingsworth and Alberta Arts district. The nearest MAX Light-Rail stop is on 82nd and I-84, just south of NE Halsey St. By riding the MAX you can quickly get to all corners of the city, incluing the airport (Red Line).
access: Guests will have access to their own bedroom, both bathrooms, the kitchen, and backyard. Next to your room is the bathroom. This is a shared bathroom, please respect our personal toiletries. We have marked items with “AirBnb” which you are welcome to use. You will find extra towels and bedding in the closet in your bedroom. Also in this closet are Wii games you are welcome to play, (if you are so inclined) extra hangers, an iron/ironing board, and a space heater if you get chilly.
interaction: We both have varied work schedules (for example, Emily works some nights, but is usually home in the mornings/afternoons. Karl works a typical 9-5 and also has other weekly activites). We may or may not see you much while you are here, but please do feel free to reach out to us if you have any questions.  If we are home/not busy we are happy to provide you with recommendations for things to do in the area!
house_rules: - Guests are free to use the guest room, back yard, kitchen, bathrooms, and laundry room, but we ask that other areas are left for homeowner's use only. - We have snacks and drinks in the guest room for you, but please do not eat any of the food in the kitchen. - Quiet hours for indoor and outdoor spaces are from 10pm-9am.

summary: Beautiful 1905 Portland Craftsman situated in a prime Portland neighborhood (Mt Tabor).  Just 10 minutes to PDX airport and 10 minutes to downtown, you are also close to amazing food and shopping areas on Hawthorne and Belmont.  These are easily accessible by Car2go major bus lines and 7 minute walk to the MAX light rail.  If you choose to relax at home, you can enjoy the views of the city and West Hills from the cozy front porch.

summary: A peaceful, clean, comfortable home that sleeps 4 with ease.  If you're looking to be close to bus lines, the Max train, grocery store and restaurants, look no further.  2 story home with a summer garden in front and all the comforts of home.
space: Here are 3 things people love about my place - It's clean, comfortable and within easy access to the airport and downtown. Here are 2 things some guests don't like - I have a veg-friendly kitchen and I work hard to have less trash and recycling.  Quiet, clean, comfortable newer 2 story, 3 bedroom home 1/2 block from the QFC grocery store.  1/2 block from the Bus 20 line and 3/4 mile from the Max train to downtown and airport.  3 miles to downtown Portland.

transit: Great access to public transportation - see Portland Trimet website!  The Route 20 bus stop is just 1/2 block away.  It is about $27 for a 20-minute cab ride from the airport to my home, or $2.50 for a 40-minute ride via Max train to 60th, then bus 71 to Burnside, and bus 20 to 55th Avenue. Or you can walk 0.7 miles from the Max train 60th stop to my home.  Portland is a very bike-friendly city and you can rent bikes from a place by the waterfront.

summary: My place is close to Apizza Scholls, Sapphire Hotel, ¿Por Qué No?, Albina Press (coffee shop just around the corner), yoga studios for de-stressing, and many other bars/eateries on Hawthorne.  You’ll love my place because of the neighborhood and the super convenient access to public transportation with the bus line to downtown picking up right out front. My place, with an organic king bed, is good for couples and solo adventurers.
space: This is my full-time home, and therefore is fully-stocked, but also more lived-in than an apartment rented purely for vacation purposes. This is a cozy, 2-bedroom bungalow that works best as a one bedroom, as the second is currently used as a dressing area. However, there is room for the air mattress if you request to have it available. For those who need a little extra sleeping space, the reclining couch is actually quite comfortable. The real prize though, is the organic king size bed in the bedroom. Please note, the rooms are small as this is an older house, so there is less free space in the bedroom in order to accommodate the large, comfy bed. Also, the bedroom door has been replaced with a light/sound blocking privacy curtain for easier access.  The living room has a small desk, reclining couch, large coffee table, small electric piano if you feel so inclined, and a large 55" Samsung HDTV with DirecTV service and NFL Sunday Ticket - so you never have to miss a game, even on vacat

transit: You would be hard pressed to be nearer to the bus line in Portland. The 14, which runs straight to downtown, picks up and drops off within a block of the house.
access: The whole house is yours to use during your stay. The garage in back is currently used as locked storage and is not an available space.
interaction: I will likely be out of town during your stay, but I would be happy to meet beforehand if you arrive before my departure. Alternatively, I am available via email for any questions that arise, and will leave detailed instructions regarding any house issues (including how to use the many remotes). Emergency contacts will be provided upon booking. I have lived in Portland for 5 years and I'm happy to offer suggestions for food, activities, etc. Also, there is an extensive collection of Portland Monthly magazines in the living room that have suggestions for fun things to do and see.

summary: Stay in a gorgeous home in the best location in Portland, immersed between the Hawthorne shopping district and fabulous Mt. Tabor Park, and very close to the Division Street dining district! Steps away from Por Que No, Powell's on Hawthorne, Tabor Bread, Apizza Scholls, Albina Press, Ruby Jewel, New Seasons Market grocery.... This beautiful home offers multiple outdoor spaces and an open, spacious living area. It's perfect for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families, and pets!
space: The house has a , stocked kitchen with island that opens into a back family room, basement with big flat-screen TV, living room, dining room, den with another TV, two full bathrooms, a laundry room, a front porch, and a private back-yard with a number of eating spaces, including a large deck on the garage. One bedroom (with a king bed) is upstairs; the other (full bed) is on the main floor.

summary: Pablo Neruda would have loved this room! Filled with his poetry and funky art, it's just his style. It's cozy, clean and quiet, yet is only a three block walk to Hawthorne, one to Belmont, and just five blocks to 196-acre Mt Tabor Park. ¡Bienvenidos!
space: This room has a queen bed and is on our third floor, and our guests say it's the quietest room they've ever slept in. Snuggle in with a down comforter while you peruse the bookshelf and plan your visit. This room shares the third floor with just one other bedroom (a single also available for rent). If you are traveling with others, we also have a third bedroom available for rent on the second floor (queen bed). Our three guest rooms share a full bath on the second floor. The bath has a large claw-foot tub/shower and classic white tile floor. The rooms on the third floor are separated from the second floor by a staircase with a door, and is a pet-free space. This room has its own heating unit and, in the summer, a fan and air-conditioner. This room also has a huge closet under the eaves for personal storage.

transit: We are close to bus lines that will get you downtown in about 15 minutes. We are also walking distance to the Hawthorne District and some of Portland's most popular restaurants: Por Que No Mexican restaurant, Apizza Scholls, Three Doors Down, and Than Thao, to name a few. We live within walking distance to two grocery stores: New Seasons to the south and QFC to the north. Enjoy coffee? You'll have to choose between the three coffee shops, all within a 10-minute walk, or try a different one each day.
access: Join us in the kitchen for tea or coffee. Access to back porch, backyard, and living areas. Ample on-street and off-street parking, and plenty of room in the garage to park your bike.
interaction: We love to meet our guests and guide you in the right direction. My office is at home, so I often have the flexibility to say hello and answer your questions throughout the day.
house_rules: We are a non-smoking household.  We love guests who are friendly, respectful of our home, and self-sufficient. We are the perfect place to stay if you are here on business, for a special event, or on vacation enjoying what our city has to offer!  We would also love to chat with you in the kitchen if you have time for a cup of tea or coffee before we head off to work. We live in a residential area so the neighborhood's quiet hours begin at 10:00 p.m. We have a large driveway, so let me know if you need space for your car. Our goal is that you have an awesome time while you're here, so please don't hesitate to ask if you need anything at all -- including directions to the best donuts or ice cream in town.

summary: A private room with shared bath in a quiet Mt. Tabor neighborhood that's close and convenient to all things Portland. Two blocks to public transportation, and a short bus ride to downtown. Walking distance to Montavilla with shopping, food, pubs and entertainment. Lovely, quiet back yard.
space: A charming 1930s English cottage on a double lot with a spacious back yard in a quiet residential neighborhood. Five minute walk to Portland's 2016 Restaurant of the Year, Coquine. It's also five minutes to historic Mt. Tabor Park, an extinct shield volcano with miles of hiking/running trails and picnicking facilities.  Guests have full access to living room, dining room, kitchen and laundry. Free parking on street in front of house. Convenient to Portland International Airport. Easy access to freeways, buses, the Columbia Gorge and Mount Hood.  Room includes ample closet and dresser space, books on Portland and fresh towels. Our relaxing backyard features a koi pond and gardens.  We are a quiet mature couple with a friendly dog who loves people. We also have a cat but she's shy and seldom seen.

space: Modern, open floor plan with lots of light streaming in through glass sliders and vaulted ceilings.    Gourmet kitchen with comfy sitting area next to a gas fireplace wonderful for chilly evenings.  Master bedroom on the main with attached master bath.  Master bath has two sinks and a large limestone shower with glass doors.  Two additional bedrooms and one full bathroom with a tub/shower and beautiful fir floors upstairs.  Air conditioning throughout.  Large back deck perfect for family dinners and entertaining, complete with a propane heater! 8 person hot tub on a stunning slate patio.  Large backyard with a netted trampoline and gorgeous gardens. Fully remodeled basement with a large flat screen tv, two comfortable couches, & ping pong table.  Two bedrooms with king-sized beds, one bedroom with queen-sized bed, and double sofa bed in finished basement.  Maximum occupancy is 8 people.

summary: Warmth and Comfort.  Sleeps 4+, has radiant floors, tv/WiFi, washer/dryer, private bath and entrance. We are blocks from Hawthorne/Division food carts, Mt. Tabor Park. Transit to downtown. Enjoy home-roasted coffee & our hens' eggs. Fruited backyard!
space: We have a very bright basement suite, where guests will have private parking, a private entrance with a key code lock, a private bath and radiant floor heating. Guests have the entire space to themselves. There is a washer/dryer. There is a small food preparation area with a fridge and toaster-oven. We have a 50 inch TV and Wifi, as well as an HDMI cord to hook up your laptop to the TV. Guests have their own Netflix account.

interaction: We are experienced hosts, as we have hosted home-stay students from Japan, Korea, China and Europe for 10 years.
house_rules: Be gentle on the furniture. We cannot accept pets due to a very shy cat who lives with us. Although the cat is NEVER allowed in the basement, so Pet-allergy people are welcome! Smoking is not allowed, EVER!

summary: This comfortable and private basement studio is just one block off Hawthorne and makes a perfect home base for exploring SE Portland! Walking distance to shops and restaurants and beautiful Mt. Tabor park.  It has a separate entrance, private bathroom and access to our beautiful deck.
space: Large and comfy with plenty of space to stretch out and relax. Separate, entrance and bathroom ensures your privacy. One double bed and a double air mattress if needed.  The bathroom is new with a spacious shower.  Shampoo, conditioner and body wash are provided and there is a blow dryer as well. There is a mini fridge for your cold drinks and food. There is also a stereo to plug in your iPod or enjoy our record collection. The TV has a ROKU box for using Netflix or other streaming services if you just want to relax and watch a movie. Like ping-pong or foosball? We have those tables set up and ready to play! Laundry? No problem! There is a laundry room available for your use with detergent. Allergies? We are a pet and smoke free home. A high quality HEPA filter is available to use during your stay.

transit: Three blocks from Trimet bus #14.  Car2Go, Uber and taxi are all options. Our neighborhood is great for walking!
access: Separate, keyless entrance for your privacy.
interaction: We will be available during your stay for questions and we will stay out of your way for your privacy. We may occasionally need to access the laundry room during your stay and will do our best to do this while you are out and about.
house_rules: -All guests (including children) must be included in the total number of guests.  -Check check out at 11am  (As a courtesy, we appreciate a message with your approximate arrival time and a text when you check out) -No candles or incense -Quiet hours are 11pm-7am -No visitors not included on your itinerary -Please be sure you can access the itinerary after booking so you have directions to let yourself in and the key code  -The door to the outside auto-locks upon closing, please memorize the code

summary: Centrally located minutes from Downtown, the Pearl District, U-District, Goose Hollow, 23rd, and the West Hills. The Portland Heights / West Hills neighborhood in which the apartment is located is filled with tree lined streets surrounding beautiful homes, making it a great place to relax and a great place to walk around for pleasant views and views of the city. But don't just take it from us, check out the reviews! Thank you! -Lee and Kelsey
space: We have a private extra bedroom in the apartment that is perfect for one or two guests. The room is tucked away at the back of the apartment for maximum privacy. High ceilings and large windows provide beautiful natural light, making it ideal for couples, business travelers or single travelers. Parking in front of the building is easy, plentiful, and free! Safe travels and see you soon!

transit: There is public transportation at the bottom of the hill and the apartment is surrounded by free street parking.
access: Aside from your room, you will have access to a shared bathroom and kitchen areas. Cook dinner in a fully equipped kitchen - store food in the fridge. Play games or read a book in the living room. The full size bed is very comfortable and fits 2; there is a pull-out twin mattress for an extra guest if needed. Just be respectful of the things, and communicate with us if you need anything else! Thank you.
interaction: Someone will most likely always be in town during your stay, but we're always out and about, so you might have the place to yourself a lot during the day. If you were to need anything you could call or text anytime! We're glad to help you with any arrangements you may need and love to offer suggestions of things to do in Portland.
house_rules: Guests are expected to be respectful of the space and leave things the way they came. Apart from the private room, you are free to use the living room and kitchen if you want to cook anything.  We would appreciate you being communicative and letting us know what your expectations are and we will try to accommodate any special needs you might have. Thank you :)

summary: Impressive city views from the edge of downtown with great access.  Walk to downtown's edge and it's transit options in minutes.  By car, hop on a freeway pointed in the direction of your choice with equal speed.  PSU, OHSU, NCNM, Farmer's Market
space: The room features a king-size Tempurpedic bed. Hardwood floors throughout. Gorgeous view of downtown, river, and mountains from  the living room. Children friendly home--kids are warmly welcome.  On street parking available in front of our home.  Guests are welcome to use the living room, kitchen and balcony. We have room in our refrigerator--feel free to bring your own food and cook your own meals.  My children aged 9 and 6, and I will be in the home during your stay. We are clean, polite, and easy-going. Our bedrooms are downstairs while the guest room, guest bathroom, living room, and kitchen are upstairs. The guest room is near the main entrance so you don't have to worry about waking us up when coming home late.  We have a lockbox so you can check-in at your convenience. Also, let me know if you would like to drop off your stuff before the check-in time. I will try my best to accommodate your needs.  Our neighborhood is safe and peaceful, yet so close to downtown. summary: Welcome to the lushest, greenest Portland!  My home sits within a cathedral of trees. But it's bright! Skylights and windows let the sun stream in. Modern furnishings/gourmet kitchen. 15 minute walk to NW 23rd and downtown (fabulous restaurants/boutiques/nightlife). Drive in 5 mins. Five minute drive to zoo/rose garden/arboretum. We have a large grassy yard, lovely gardens, outdoor dining, BBQ.  Lots of room for couples, families (with kids), and big groups.
space: Modern, bright, open plan house.
description: Welcome to the lushest, greenest Portland!  My home sits within a cathedral of trees. But it's bright! Skylights and windows let the sun stream in. We have a large grassy yard, lovely gardens, outdoor dining, BBQ.  Lots of room for couples, families (with kids), and big groups. Modern, bright, open plan house. I will help if I am in the cell zone! I will have back up if there is a problem... Neighborhood is so lush, perfect, and tucked away, it's on the hikers scenic walking route.  Notice folks with their water bottles and walking poles cruising by. The 51 bus takes you to the heart of town. Pick up is 5 minute walk away.
transit: The 51 bus takes you to the heart of town. Pick up is 5 minute walk away.

house_rules: Greetings! My home is in a in a lovely West Hills neighborhood just minutes from all the action of downtown Portland. It is most suitable for folks looking for a tranquil retreat -- not a booming, all-night, 'rager'. Thanks for your interest!

summary: Separate apartment in elegantly restored 1912 craftsman home in West Hills: quiet, cozy, smart decor on wooded lot w/view and private bird concerts. Full kitchen, claw foot tub with shower; wi-fi, close to town, major attractions and destinations.
space: The Grovian is vintage, quaint, art-filled and designed for comfort and relaxation. We make a great base from which to explore the delights of Portland.
description: Separate apartment in elegantly restored 1912 craftsman home in West Hills: quiet, cozy, smart decor on wooded lot w/view and private bird concerts. Full kitchen, claw foot tub with shower; wi-fi, close to town, major attractions and destinations. The Grovian is vintage, quaint, art-filled and designed for comfort and relaxation. We make a great base from which to explore the delights of Portland. Guest access is by coded lockbox. Check in 3 pm, check out noon. These times can be flexible, but often we are booked back-to-back so please ask first. Our hosting style is unobtrusive but helpful and we prefer contact by text or through airbnb messages. Always happy to make suggestions re dining, shopping or just having fun in Portland. We know all the best (and lesser known) spots. We are not close to public transportation so we recommend either a car or use of Uber or other car services during your stay. Convenient, free parking is available for our guests.
transit: We are not close to public transportation so we recommend either a car or use of Uber or other car services during your stay. Convenient, free parking is available for our guests.

house_rules: The Grovian is peaceful, calm and bucolic, please help us keep it that way. Smoking tobacco or any other substances or vaping is absolutely prohibited.

summary: Relax in a two-story castle perched above the street. Watch hummingbirds flit through the trees, and hipsters pass on the street below. Sleep soundly in new beds and block the light with heavy curtains. Then dream of Blue Star doughnuts. Fantasize over Waffle Window fried chicken & waffles. Crave Tove cold-brewed coffee. Pine over fluffy Hazel Cafe biscuit sammiches. Walk out the front door of your 2,000 square foot home onto famous Hawthorne Blvd, your city-sized food court.
space: White-glove clean; walker's paradise; incredibly comfortable; ; hip design; caring and responsive hosts.   Please, come for a visit. Many calloused hands built this beautiful craftsman duplex, and with your help we will continue to preserve its hardy and delicate style.   A vibrant mural guides you up the stairs to your two-story home when you walk through your private front door. You will find sparkling cleanliness in every room, and complete comfort throughout.    In the front, we built a tremendous gilded room with massive windows on every wall. The comfortable furniture and an open-roof deck will beg you to lounge, read, and watch the show outside.   The bedrooms are in the quiet of the third floor, and in back of the second floor. Each has its own spacious character. And, for once, “character” is not Airbnb shorthand for “cheap shit we bought at a garage sale.” All new mattresses and bedding make it easy to hit snooze just a few more times before you head out to the street each mo

A vibrant mural guides you up the stairs to your two-story home when you walk through your private front door. You will find sparkling cleanliness in every room, and complete comfort throughout.    In the front, we built a tremendous gilded room
transit: Walk Score of 93! Walk! Do it in shoes, in boots, in flip flops and sandals. Do it on crutches or on stilts. Meander, wander, hurry, peer, and stroll. However you want to get around, this location clamors for you to do it afoot.  If you come by car, we have ample and free on-street parking for you to store it during your visit. If you need to go more than a mile, there is a bike sharing rack 50 feet from the front door, a bus stop for the #14 a block away and a veritable parade of Uber drivers going past the front door at all times. We’re about a mile away from the nearest stop on the Portland Streetcar or the Max light rail line.
access: We offer self-guided 24-hour check in! Our home is set up with a Schlage lock electronic key pad entry system. We provide you with a personalized code to enter at the door and you're in. This 4-digit code will be yours to use to access the house for the duration of your stay. It's super easy and no keys to lose. You will have access to everything in the house including the kitchen and the outdoor areas.
interaction: We will be there if ever you need us, and invisible when you don't. We will send you a quick message to check in after you arrive, and otherwise want you to enjoy the space with tranquility. If ever you have a question or a need, please call us, text us or email us and we will come running!

summary: Come stay in hip Southeast Portland! The room is peaceful and comfortable, tucked away in a very green setting, yet the location is super close to all the hip spots: Belmont, Laurelhurst Park, Mt Tabor park, restaurant row, organic grocery stores, coffeeshops and those cool vintage thrift stores. You will feel like you have a home here in Portland, with so many cool attractions and neighborhood hotspots right at your fingertips. And I'm a nice person. :)
space: You'll have a furnished room that's very quiet. We are way back off the street so it's peaceful here. The apartment is truly charming, a classic 1930's building with warm hardwood floors and old school cabinetry and woodwork. [The outside of the building is not pretty though, lol]. I keep it warm for comfort. You control the heat in your bedroom via a radiant space heater w/remote control. The kitchen is sweet - a bit small yet efficient. And what a great location! Laurelhurst Park, Belmont, Hawthorne, the library, restaurants, coffeeshops, all very close by. Bus lines are within 2 blocks. Great temporary place while you're waiting for your new digs here in Portland.

Laurelhurst Park, Belmont, Hawthorne, the library, restaurants, coffees
transit: Plenty of free street parking for my building. And you can walk just 2 blocks to catch the local bus, called Trimet. (Download the app, if you're going to be here for awhile: (URL HIDDEN) I can help point you in the right direction!
access: You can feel at home here, with the usual respect for my privacy (and vice versa) of course. We have to share the bathroom so consideration as to schedules will apply. Your room is quite spacious and is already furnished; please, there's no room for storage, except for your huge deep closet with French doors (and a cool storage area overhead, approx. 2' deep and 6' wide, above the closet). Washer/dryer in basement (takes quarters). The grounds are nicely landscaped and the flowers are starting to bloom now!
interaction: I can help with bus information or where to go for what, if you are new to town. I do have a very busy work schedule (I have multiple jobs, and work inconsistent hours - often late at night). You must be okay with me coming in sometimes at 2am after work, or having to leave early. And I will respect same for you.
house_rules: Please respect the space and respect that other tenants live in the apartments upstairs and across the hall. It's pretty quiet here, though, which is lovely for sleeping. Please, no pets, no 420, no kids, no couples. This is for one person only. (You can smoke out in the parking lot if needed).  Preferred check-in is before 4pm, as I often have to leave for work at 5pm. But ask, because my schedule often changes.

summary: We live in inner Southeast Portland in a restored 1889 Victorian with an extensive yard, gardens and outdoor studio. The house has 5 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms, and faces south for great light all year.

summary: This ground level studio with private entrance is in a beautiful turn of the century home in the heart of the Sunnyside neighbourhood. It is so quiet here you forget that you are only 2 blocks from the bustling Belmont St. where you'll find a variety of restaurants, bars, coffee shops and boutiques.  Enjoy a stroll in the pastoral Laurelhurst Park, a 5 minute walk from our house. Or checkout downtown Portland, 5 minutes by car/10 minutes by bus or bike.
space: This is a cozy studio below our house. It is a peaceful refuge with a private patio and garden.  Inside there are comfortable sitting areas, a desk and television, and a piano.  The bathroom with large shower (no tub) is next to the studio.  There is also a closet and small dresser for clothes. The studio comes with a mini fridge, toaster oven, hot water pitcher, and French press coffee maker.  We supply ground coffee and tea bags.   We also supply all linens and towels.

The ground level studio with its private entrance is all yours.  O
transit: The #15 bus east-west route on Belmont takes you downtown.  The #75 bus is the north-south route.   The closest MAX stop is the Red Line which stops at NE 42nd St. in Hollywood. Car to Go is an option if need a car.
access: The ground level studio with its private entrance is all yours.  Our living area is completely separate with no common areas except the basement.  We only enter the basement to do laundry and will consult you before entering. You have a private bathroom and a closet space situated  next to the studio.  A screen separates the studio from the basement.  There is a small patio with a table and chairs at the entrance to the studio where you can enjoy a cup of coffee in the morning or a glass of wine before dinner.  Laundry is available upon request.
interaction: We have lived in Portland for over 25 years and know the city and surrounding areas well.  I will be available throughout your stay to answer any questions you might have about where to go or what to do.   Once a day I will pick up dirty dishes and replace them as I do not want food particles in the bathroom drain.  This can be arranged for a time when you are away from the room.
house_rules: It' a quiet neighbourhood.  Be respectful and keep noise to a minimum before 8am and after 9pm.

space: A cozy second floor flat with quaint neighborhood views, excellently located in SE Portland. Within walking distance of the cute and quirky neighborhood main streets of SE Belmont blvd, NE 28th and Burnside, and SE Hawthorne blvd. Bike shops, bookstores, food carts, brew pubs, restaurants and cafes galore. Also nearby is Laurelhurst Park & Mount Tabor Park and the beautifully landscaped Laurelhurst and sunny-side neighborhoods.  Easy access by bike or transit to waterfront park, downtown and the many popular neighborhood destinations throughout Portland.   The flat is quiet, private, and cozy with a SE Portland arty flair. Wireless internet, on street parking, easy bike access, well appointed kitchen and living room, clean sheets & an extra comfy bed. Great water pressure too! Your stay comes with a complimentary tea bar.  Your host: Me, a world traveler who has always called Portland home and is happy to share her home town with other friendly explorers. summary: This cozy apartment has hardwoods throughout. There is a fully stocked kitchen as well. Located just a few blocks from the Hawthorne district. This area has shopping, cafes and lots of entertainment.
description: This cozy apartment has hardwoods throughout. There is a fully stocked kitchen as well. Located just a few blocks from the Hawthorne district. This area has shopping, cafes and lots of entertainment. I will always be available through phone, text and email. Hawthorne is a historical district of Portland. There are a wide variety of shops and places to see a show. There is a Powells Books located blocks away. Around the corner you can get amazing tacos at Porque No. This is a very walkable neighborhood. Grocery stores near by include New Seasons, Fred Meyers, and Pasta Works. Close by is the beautiful Laurelhurst Park, this has horse shoes, tennis courts, basketball, an off leash dog area, and a duck pond. This is a highly walkable neighborhood with a lot of public transportation. To get downtown you can take one of two frequent service buses, the #14 located on Hawthorne or #15 located on Belmont. For more info please visit (URL HIDDEN) or plan trips.

summary: One of three clean, quiet and cozy bedrooms in this cute European Style Guest House. Located in the heart of the walkable Hawthorne Hood, right opposite "New Seasons Market" and many small shops and restaurants. Bus to down town every ten Minutes.
space: Please read through the entire listing to see if this is the right place for you, hosted by a British husband, his Yankee wife as part of but separate from their Holistic Health Center This ground floor “green” apartment has been converted into a European Style Guest House. There are 5 steps down into the Guest House.  It is extremely well located in the Heart of Hawthorne District just across from New Season’s Health Food Store and shares the building it is in with a Holistic Health Center, but has it’s own entrance.  There are three bedrooms (don’t be confused that they are called 7, 8 & 9) all with luxurious queen size beds, closets, windows that open and lock and adjustable heating.  It is naturally very cool in the summer months. The three bedrooms can be rented together for the entire space or separately with a shared lounge, fully equipped kitchen and bathroom.  There is an outdoors courtyard with tables and chairs..  The owners are not a resident on the premises, but lives 4 bl

transit: Getting to us from the airport if you don't want to hire a car is easy for $2.50 you can catch the MAX light rail to the Hollywood Transit Center, then a 75 bus to Hawthorne and 39th, get off at Fred Meyers and walk east to 41st Ave The bus to downtown runs along Hawthorne and comes every ten minutes and takes that long again to reach downtown. Portland is really bike friendly and there are two good rental shops on Hawthorne, Veloce at 3202, Near the intersection of SE Hawthorne Blvd and SE 32nd Ave. AND Clever Cycles (voted the best bike shop in Portland) at 900, Between SE 9th Ave and SE 10th Ave
access: You need an ACCESS CODE for the front door this will be sent to you when your booking is confirmed. DO NOT FORGET to bring this with you or you will not be able to get in! Seriously! Parking is easy, on the street right behind the Guest House in this quiet and safe walkable neighborhood. Although the rooms are called 7, 8 & 9 don't be misled there are only three rooms! You have shared use of the bathroom, fully equipped kitchen and small lounge area. There is an iron and ironing board and you can use the washer dryer. There is outdoor seating, cafe style for good weather days.
interaction: This is a small European Style Guest House with three rooms, recently refurbished from the vacation apartment that it was for 8 year previously. The entrance is separate from the rest of the house so you will only see us when we come down to clean each day, however if you have questions we are available most of the time via text.
house_rules: Most of these have been covered previously and it just leaves a few points so that we are all on the same page. No smoking in the Guest House or on the front porch, if you need to smoke please go for a walk around the block. Please don't bring other people into the house without first checking with us. This is for your safety as well as the other guests. Please take off your outdoor shoes when you enter, you and others will pass along the common spaces when going to the bathroom and kitchen and may well be barefoot. We clean meticulously you will see but, please help us by tidying up after yourselves and leaving the place for other guests as you would like to find it.

summary: Fragrance-free 700 sq.ft. private 1 bed/1 bath/kitchenette apartment on ground floor. Easy-access - 30ft from the curb with private front entrance into locked courtyard and apartment. No lugging luggage upstairs or downstairs, or around the back in the dark. Located in SE Hawthorne/Belmont - quiet neighborhood. Free parking on street. Queen bed, 2 new queen sleeper-sofas. Coffee/tea bar, TV-Netflix. Ideal for people with allergies.
space: The separate entrance for the apartment through a locked gate is located at the front of the house at street level. Ample free parking is available in front of house and across the street. The apartment is spacious, and daylight windows in every room make this apartment feel open, yet cozy. It tends to stay cooler in the summer (two fans help cool it down) and warmer in the winter. Non-toxic cleaners are used. High-quality 100% cotton sheets. Memory foam pillows. Down comforters. The Living Area — has a TV with a Netflix subscription. Two sleeper sofas each contain a queen pull-out bed (extra bedding and towels are available for additional guests).  Master bedroom — has a closet and queen bed with new mattress, pillows, and 100% cotton sheets.  Kitchenette — is newly remodeled and has a toaster oven, microwave, and small refrigerator. There is a coffee bar with fresh coffee to use with a french press and pour-over style fixings as well as a drip coffee-maker. We have several choices of

transit: Walking — Walk score of 86! Lots of walkers in our area. Parking — Yes, there is street parking available around the house. Biking — Our street is a designated bicycle path - a biker's paradise! Transit — Very close to N/S and E/W bus lines. Ten minutes to downtown!
access: Guests have exclusive access to the apartment — bedroom, bathroom, living room, and kitchenette/dining area. There are NO shared areas. In the photos you will see a stairway, which goes up to a separate laundry room on the back porch, but that door is dead-bolted for your security and privacy.
interaction: There is a convenient combo lock on the apartment door (and gate into courtyard) to minimize coordination and for your privacy. My wife and I live upstairs where we also have an office. We are available for questions, assistance, or any needs as they arise.
house_rules: NO smoking & NO drugs — inside or outside the house. NO pets  — apt is maintained pet-free for guests with allergies. NO guests — the apartment is for airbnb renters ONLY. Contact me if someone who wants to stop by and see you. This is to prevent additional liability and noise. LOW noise — please be respectful after 10 p.m., out of consideration for our neighbors and especially for others in the house. NO children unless you personally contact us about your situation and who you are bringing with you.

summary: Short walk to 3 of Portland’s most popular neighborhoods - Hawthorne, Belmont, and Laurelhurst! Wonderful tap-houses (beer), shops, and top restaurants are quickly accessible. The suite includes bedroom, bathroom, TV area, small kitchen. Bus is 1 block away and a 15 min. ride to downtown.
space: The downstairs is your private suite while you are staying with us. This includes the bedroom, bathroom and TV sitting area. The bed room is cozy with a large bookshelf. The bed is a Full Extra-Long which is as long as a queen bed but a few inches narrower.  (Accommodates 2 adults.) The TV sitting area has a large comfortable couch and flat screen TV with Netflix.. The space includes private tea and coffee service, a hot pot, microwave, refrigerator, and plates/silverware. In case you've forgotten toiletries - the bathroom is stocked with supplies (toothbrushes, hair dryer, brush, shaving products, feminine products, etc.) Please feel free to use any of the supplies in the bathroom. (Behind the mirror and under the sink.)   There is closet to hang your clothes, a luggage stand to lay out your luggage and a full length mirror in the bathroom.

transit: The bus stop to downtown is less than one block away.  The number 15 bus goes directly into downtown. The ride to downtown Portland is approximately 15 minutes. A 2-hour ticket costs $2.50. A one day pass costs $5, and a seven day pass costs $26.
access: Feel free to use the main kitchen - a chef's dream - complete with Wolf gas range and lots of counter space. The main floor sitting area has a beautiful antique fireplace and is a cozy place to relax. (If you're interested in a fire - just ask and we'd be happy to show you.) Additionally, the main floor has an open space, with garden view, which can be used for yoga.  The outdoor patio, with both a covered and uncovered space, is private and a wonderful place to relax on a warm evening.
interaction: We would be happy to chat and offer any insights / suggestions for your Portland stay. Or, since the suite is private - feel free to get away and not worry about interacting with us. It is all up to you, your comfort level, and your desires. An owner will be present during guest stay so feel free to contact us with any questions, requests, or if there is anything we can do to make your stay more enjoyable.
house_rules: 1. The cat is an indoor only cat. Please do not let the cat outside. For the comfort of future guest - please do not let the cat into the guest bedroom.  2.  Check out time is 12 pm. Please touch base with the host if you need to discuss a later check out time. 3. This is a no smoking home. (For all items - cigarettes, vapor, marijuana, pipe, etc.) Feel free to step outside to the back patio. 4. If using the kitchen please clean up after yourself. There is a dishwasher so please stack anything you use in it. No need to start the wash.  5. Please do not use any food or drink in the kitchen which you have not purchased.   6. Please do not use the fireplace when the owners are not at home. Also, always use the fire-screen when the fire is lit. 7. The top-floor of the house (2nd story) is off-limits. If you need something just yell up the stairs from the main floor and (if we are home) we'll be down in a jiff to help you.

summary: Built in 1909, visitors say our home has an open and friendly feel. We are in the heart of inner southeast Portland in a very popular artsy area within steps of many locally owned restaurants, food carts, and unique shops. We hope to meet you!
space: THE ROOMS: Guests stay in one of our 2 upstairs bedrooms - EAST or WEST - and they must be reserved separately. The two rooms SHARE ONE BATHROOM and there are NO COOKING FACILITIES.  The EAST room has a queen bed and a street view.  The WEST room has a double bed and a garden view.  NOTE: If the room you were hoping to reserve does not show up for your dates, it's because it isn't available. We don't charge a cleaning fee, but a 11.5% hotel tax is added along with your Airbnb fee when you book. The rooms are meant for only 2 guests who share a bed, so it will feel a bit crowded with 3. If you register for 3, the third person has a single sized cot with an air mattress and a foam topper. Some folks find it comfy, others do not. There is an extra charge for a 3rd person or to set up the cot when there are only 2 in the room – a more thorough explanation of cot charges is under the heading, COT CHARGE below.  As mentioned above, these two rooms SHARE ONE BATHROOM with 2 pedestal sinks and

transit: If you have a car, free street parking is available across from our driveway. No city permit is required. We have two major bus lines within a few blocks of our home. Trimet is the bus system and you can plan ahead by looking at the trip planner on their website. The #14 bus goes downtown via Hawthorne/Madison and the #15 Belmont bus will take you downtown and directly to NW Portland including the Pearl District. Want to borrow a bike? (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) (URL HIDDEN) and download the app. There are 2 stations to p/u a bike just a few blocks from our home. Both Salmon and Lincoln are wide streets designated as bike friendly and used by local bicyclists. There is access to the Springwater bike and hiking trail about a mile from our home.
access: Guests are asked to remove their shoes while in the home; freshly laundered slippers are provided. We do not share our personal living space and there are no kitchen or laundry facilities for guests, but we do provide freshly brewed morning coffee in the front hallway. Tea is also available. For breakfast, the area is abundant with locally owned coffee shops, food carts, and restaurants, all within steps from our home, or you can have a cold breakfast in your room. Free street parking is available across from our driveway. No city permit is required.
interaction: We love meeting new people and we take pleasure in helping you make the most of your visit to our wonderful city. We have made a list of our favorite places to eat – all are close to our home, and we have loads of books, maps, guides, and brochures to help plan your visit to Portland. However, we can also let you explore and discover on your own if that’s your style.
house_rules: House rules  NOTE: We have listed lot of house rules because folks sometimes don’t read enough of our listing to get this information. Because guests must state that they have read the house rules when they register, I have added the critical information in our listing that sometimes gets missed. PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE LIST before submitting a reservation request. 1. First, because we've had guests who are surprised, I want to be sure you know that we have 2 guest rooms upstairs and both rooms share the same bathroom. We use our own private bathroom in our living quarters. 2. There is no smoking (of anything) anywhere on the property. Neither do our neighbors smoke, so we really don't want you standing and smoking in front of their houses. In fact, this listing is not a good fit for people who smoke, even part time.  3. We have 3 cats, so this is not a good choice if you are allergic to cats. 4. Please do not bring any pets into the house and do not leave pets in your car overnight. 5.

summary: We call our place Three Bears B+B, and we love hosting travelers in our quirky, colorful 1890's Victorian home! Our neighborhood is THE BEST for beauty, walkability, shopping, dining, and soaking up all that Portland has to offer. Enjoy hot porridge and baked goods in the morning, and delicious homemade cookies and tea any time!
space: Your room is light-filled, peaceful, and charming, with bay windows, high ceilings, and gorgeous vintage details. The adjacent bathroom with shower and tub is all yours during your stay. The bedroom's two twin beds can be used as such, or joined to create one king upon request.

Enjoy hot porridge and baked goods in the morning, and delicious homemade cookies and tea any time! Your room is light-filled, peaceful, and charming, with bay windows, high ceilings, and gorgeous vintage details. The adjacent bathroom with shower and tub is all yours during your stay. The bedroom's two twin beds can be used as such, or joined to create one king upon request. In addition to your private room and bathroom, you'll have access to the common living room/dining room area, where we serve breakfast and where you'll find games, puzzles, and books to enjoy on a rainy day. Your room connects to the common area through a pair of beautiful vintage pocket doors; they do not lock, but there is a digital safe in your room in which you are welcome to secure
transit: Free on-street parking in front of house. Easy bus access to downtown (15 min. ride). 20 min. drive to PDX airport. BikeTown hourly bike rental station 4 blocks away.
access: In addition to your private room and bathroom, you'll have access to the common living room/dining room area, where we serve breakfast and where you'll find games, puzzles, and books to enjoy on a rainy day. Your room connects to the common area through a pair of beautiful vintage pocket doors; they do not lock, but there is a digital safe in your room in which you are welcome to secure any valuables.  We serve breakfast each morning at your desired wake-up time between 8:00 and 10:00AM. We also have self-serve tea and cookies available at all times. Please let us know of any dietary restrictions at the time of booking; we are happy to accommodate your needs! The kitchen is Lauren's domain, but guests we do provide a little space in the fridge if you want to stash leftovers or drinks.
interaction: Your room and bathroom are private to you, but the common areas are shared with our family during the day. We will respect your privacy and follow your lead as far as how much chatting you like to do, but no matter what, we will be in close quarters, so we want guests who are comfortable interacting with us.  By the same token, because our guests become temporary members of our family, we require that all of our guests have verified ID's and look for positive reviews from previous hosts. We will respond to any breaches of house rules by immediately notifying AirBnB and voiding the reservation without refund.
house_rules: Guests may not invite anyone into the home at any time during their stay without our permission. Space may be booked by: A) 1 adult, B) 2 adults, C) 1 adult and 1 child. Guests must be fully-clothed at all times in the common areas, including shirts for men. Take off wet and muddy shoes/gear in entryway. Excessive profanity is not appropriate in our home. Comments that are racist, sexist, homophobic, transphobic, anti-Semitic or otherwise hate-based will not be tolerated. No weapons. No recreational drugs. No audible-outside-your-room sexual activity. Do not take photos or video in our home without our consent. Quiet hours between 10 PM and 8 AM.

space: There is enough room in this apartment to host 3 people comfortably with two in the bed, and one on the couch. The kitchen is fully stocked with cookware, plates and utensils. summary: Beautiful craftsman home in an ideal location. Just blocks from upper Hawthorne, Belmont, and Division. Wood floors and large communal space. This space is the perfect home away from home and ideal for retreating, sight-seeing, families, and groups.
space: There are wood floors throughout the home. Large sunny windows that let in the morning and afternoon light. Great communal area for dancing, yoga, meditation, or hang out time.  There is space to do yoga both upstairs in the "sanctuary" as many have called it, or downstairs in the sun in the communal area.  Or cozy up on the large comfy couch and read or hang out with friends and family.   There are two bedrooms downstairs, one magical fairy like room with a full size bed and one zen guest room with a queen bed.  We also provide an additional small sleeping pad if needed. Both beds are new and made of natural and eco-friendly materials- bamboo, latex and cotton. There is a large master bedroom upstairs, with a king bed, a luxurious bathroom and a meditation nook. Both bathrooms are remodeled with earthy and natural materials- tile floors, slate shower walls, deep bath tubs, dark wood vanities, and chrome fixtures. House includes a living area, dining area, kitchen, 3 bedrooms, 2 luxuri

transit: There is public transport just 3 blocks from the house and you will be within walking distance to countless shopping, food, and entertainment options.
access: Make yourself at home! You will have full and private access to the house. Spread out and make use of the full space. Enjoy all the community space- the dining area, the living area, the porch, yard and the kitchen. You can use the kitchen to store and cook food during your stay.  You will be given a house key. Please lock the door when you leave. You are welcome to use the kitchen to cook meals. Please clean up after yourselves.
interaction: You will have private access to the house while renting the full space. Please let us know how we can make your stay more comfortable!
house_rules: Remove shoes at the door and clean up after yourselves in the kitchen- wash all dishes after using. Please be respectful of our neighbors. No loud parties, unless you have received permission from us. Please treat our home with kindness and consideration.

summary: One of three clean, quiet and cozy bedrooms in this cute European Style Guest House. Located in the heart of the walkable Hawthorne Hood, right opposite "New Seasons Market" and many small shops and restaurants. Bus to down town every ten Minutes.
space: Please read through the entire listing to see if this is the right place for you, hosted by a British husband, his Yankee wife as part of but separate from their Holistic Health Center This ground floor “green” apartment has been converted into a European Style Guest House. There are 5 steps down into the Guest House.  It is extremely well located in the Heart of Hawthorne District just across from New Season’s Health Food Store and shares the building it is in with a Holistic Health Center, but has it’s own entrance.  There are three bedrooms (don’t be confused that they are called 7, 8 & 9) all with luxurious queen size beds, closets, windows that open and lock and adjustable heating.  It is naturally very cool in the summer months. The three bedrooms can be rented together for the entire space or separately with a shared lounge, fully equipped kitchen and bathroom.  There is an outdoors courtyard with tables and chairs as well as a BBQ.  The owners are not a resident on the premises

transit: Getting to us from the airport if you don't want to hire a car is easy for $2.50 you can catch the MAX light rail to the Hollywood Transit Center, then a 75 bus to Hawthorne and 39th, get off at Fred Meyers and walk east to 41st Ave The bus to downtown runs along Hawthorne and comes every ten minutes and takes that long again to reach downtown. Portland is really bike friendly and there are two good rental shops on Hawthorne, Veloce at 3202, Near the intersection of SE Hawthorne Blvd and SE 32nd Ave.
access: You need an ACCESS CODE for the front door this will be sent to you when your booking is confirmed. DO NOT FORGET to bring this with you or you will not be able to get in! Seriously! Parking is easy, on the street right behind the Guest House in this quiet and safe walkable neighborhood. Although the rooms are called 7, 8 & 9 don't be misled there are only three rooms! You have shared use of the bathroom, fully equipped kitchen and small lounge area. There is an iron and ironing board and you can use the washer dryer. There is outdoor seating, cafe style for good weather days.
interaction: vacation apartment that it was for 8 year previously. The entrance is separate from the rest of the house so you will only see us when we come down to clean each day, however if you have questions we are available most of the time via text.
house_rules: Most of these have been covered previously and it just leaves a few points so that we are all on the same page. No smoking in the Guest House or on the front porch, if you need to smoke please go for a walk around the block. Please don't bring other people into the house without first checking with us. This is for your safety as well as the other guests. Please take off your outdoor shoes when you enter, you and others will pass along the common spaces when going to the bathroom and kitchen and may well be barefoot. We clean meticulously you will see but, please help us by tidying up after yourselves and leaving the place for other guests as you would like to find it.
