summary: Built in 1909, visitors say our home has an open and friendly feel. We are in the heart of inner southeast Portland in a very popular artsy area within steps of many locally owned restaurants, food carts, and unique shops. We hope to meet you!
space: THE ROOMS: Guests stay in one of our 2 upstairs bedrooms - EAST or WEST - and they must be reserved separately. The two rooms SHARE ONE BATHROOM and there are NO COOKING FACILITIES.  The EAST room has a queen bed and a street view.  The WEST room has a double bed and a garden view.  NOTE: If the room you were hoping to reserve does not show up for your dates, it's because it isn't available. We don't charge a cleaning fee, but a 11.5% hotel tax is added along with your Airbnb fee when you book. The rooms are meant for only 2 guests who share a bed, so it will feel a bit crowded with 3. If you register for 3, the third person has a single sized cot with an air mattress and a foam topper. Some folks find it comfy, others do not. There is an extra charge for a 3rd person or to set up the cot when there are only 2 in the room – a more thorough explanation of cot charges is under the heading, COT CHARGE below.  As mentioned above, these two rooms SHARE ONE BATHROOM with 2 pedestal sinks and

transit: If you have a car, free street parking is available across from our driveway. No city permit is required. We have two major bus lines within a few blocks of our home. Trimet is the bus system and you can plan ahead by looking at the trip planner on their website. The #14 bus goes downtown via Hawthorne/Madison and the #15 Belmont bus will take you downtown and directly to NW Portland including the Pearl District. Want to borrow a bike? (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) (URL HIDDEN) and download the app. There are 2 stations to p/u a bike just a few blocks from our home. Both Salmon and Lincoln are wide streets designated as bike friendly and used by local bicyclists. There is access to the Springwater bike and hiking trail about a mile from our home.
access: Guests are asked to remove their shoes while in the home; freshly laundered slippers are provided. We do not share our personal living space and there are no kitchen or laundry facilities for guests, but we do provide freshly brewed morning coffee in the front hallway. Tea is also available. For breakfast, the area is abundant with locally owned coffee shops, food carts, and restaurants, all within steps from our home, or you can have a cold breakfast in your room. Free street parking is available across from our driveway. No city permit is required.
interaction: We love meeting new people and we take pleasure in helping you make the most of your visit to our wonderful city. We have made a list of our favorite places to eat – all are close to our home, and we have loads of books, maps, guides, and brochures to help plan your visit to Portland. However, we can also let you explore and discover on your own if that’s your style.
house_rules: House rules  NOTE: We have listed lot of house rules because folks sometimes don’t read enough of our listing to get this information. Because guests must state that they have read the house rules when they register, I have added the critical information in our listing that sometimes gets missed. PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE LIST before submitting a reservation request. 1. First, because we've had guests who are surprised, I want to be sure you know that we have 2 guest rooms upstairs and both rooms share the same bathroom. We use our own private bathroom in our living quarters. 2. There is no smoking (of anything) anywhere on the property. Neither do our neighbors smoke, so we really don't want you standing and smoking in front of their houses. In fact, this listing is not a good fit for people who smoke, even part time.  3. We have 3 cats, so this is not a good choice if you are allergic to cats. 4. Please do not bring any pets into the house and do not leave pets in your car overnight. 5.

summary: Beautiful, quintessentially Portland restored craftsman located in the heart of the Hawthorne neighborhood. Live like a local, enjoy a latte from the back deck in the morning and a glass of wine in the spa in the evening - gas fireplace. Walk to groceries, restaurants, bars and shopping. Grab a Lyft or Uber for a quick ride anywhere in town, take the bus that stops blocks away or enjoy the plentiful street parking nearby. My indoor/outdoor cat will enjoy your company and is very low maintenance!
space: Quiet and lovely restored Craftsman home in the heart of Hawthorne district. Architecture nuts, enjoy! Hardwood and fir floors throughout, original divided light windows and period details. A newly installed gas fireplace will keep you cozy in the rainy Portland winters! You'll be right next to all of the great things about Hawthorne without having all of the noise. Our favorites include: Hawthorne Theatre, Bagdad, Pastaworks, Powell's Home and Garden, Powells on Hawthorne, Apizza Scholls, Por Que No, Sapphire Hotel, Chez Machin, The Waffle Window, and one of the greatest Thai places you'll ever find at Pok Pok over on Division. It's also a short walk to the wonders of Belmont: Dick's Kitchen, Circa 33, Sweet Hereafter and more.  The house is on 2 frequent service bus lines with easy access to downtown and airport. Off-street parking is available, there's a zipcar less than 2 blocks away, and we're also well within car2go's home area.  The house, aside from the wonderful architectural

transit: You're at the corner of the 14 and 75 bus lines, which run every 15 minutes through most of the day. Plus, you're within easy bike access to most of the city, and there's always taxis, car share programs like Car2Go and Zipcar or Uber and Lyft. Street parking is never a problem near the house if you decide to drive.
access: You'll enjoy spending time in my home when I'm traveling so you'll have access to everything but the basement and a few closets.
interaction: If you're here, I'm traveling. I have a local management team available to make sure you have a wonderful stay. You can contact them anytime through the Airbnb system and will have their phone details as well.
house_rules: There's a wonderful cat that lives on the premises. He's indoor-outdoor and very chill. He loves lots of pettings and a can of cat food in the morning. No other pets allowed, it throws off the groove.  Quiet after 9pm - our neighbors are great but this is a quiet area of Hawthorne. No smoking of any kind. I am very allergic to tobacco smoke and cannabis, so it's not welcome inside or outside my home. Please treat my home as you would your own, okay maybe better.

summary: Come and stay! Relax, play and work in this business-travel ready condo.  Sleep deeply on new mattresses in well-appointed rooms with blackout curtains.  Work easily in a large living room with massive table for spreading out, and a cozy TV corner for curling up.  Eat lazily in the fully stocked kitchen, ready with coffee and candy. Before you check in, just let us know what other foods you'd like available and we will have them ready for you during your stay!
space: White-glove clean; walker's paradise; incredibly comfortable; cozy design; responsive hosts.    Please, come for a visit. Many calloused hands built this beautiful craftsman duplex, and with your help we will continue to preserve its hardy and delicate style.   A vibrant mural guides you up the stairs to your two-story home when you walk through your private front door. You will find sparkling cleanliness in every room, and complete comfort throughout.    In the front, we built a tremendous living room with massive windows on every wall. The comfortable furniture and an open-roof deck will beg you to lounge, read, and watch the show outside.   Two quiet bedrooms line the back of the house. Each has its own spacious character. And, for once, “character” is not Airbnb shorthand for “cheap shit we bought at a garage sale.” All new mattresses and bedding make it easy to hit snooze just a few more times before you head out to the street each morning.   You can cook (or reheat your leftovers

transit: Walk Score of 93! Walk! Do it in shoes, in boots, in flip flops and sandals. Do it on crutches or on stilts. Meander, wander, hurry, peer, and stroll. However you want to get around, this location clamors for you to do it afoot.  If you come by car, we have ample and free on-street parking for you to store it during your visit. If you need to go more than a mile, there is a bike sharing rack 50 feet from the front door, a bus stop for the #14 a block away and a veritable parade of Uber drivers going past the front door at all times. We’re about a mile away from the nearest stop on the Portland Streetcar or the Max light rail line.
access: We offer self-guided 24-hour check in! Our home is set up with a Schlage lock electronic key pad entry system. We provide you with a personalized code to enter at the door and you're in. This 4-digit code will be yours to use to access the house for the duration of your stay. It's super easy and no keys to lose. You will have access to everything in the house including the kitchen and the outdoor areas.
interaction: We will be there if ever you need us, and invisible when you don't. We will send you a quick message to check in after you arrive, and otherwise want you to enjoy the space with tranquility. If ever you have a question or a need, please call us, text us or email us and we will come running!
house_rules: Please let us know about your pets before booking so we can be sure we're able to accommodate them!

summary: Ranch house basement in outer SE Portland near Powell Butte park, near Gresham.  Includes a small kitchenette, tv /sitting area, and a pool table. Convenient for sightseeing to Portland (by public transit or car), Mt. Hood, PDX airport, and the Columbia River Gorge.
space: Spacious basement has plenty of room to relax or play. Cozy sitting area with tv and pool table to keep yourself entertained. Or just kick back and relax. Kitchenette with dishes, toaster oven, microwave, small fridge. Except for our occasional use of the laundry area, the basement is yours to enjoy. We may not be in the most trendy of neighborhoods, but it is easy to get around and I do my best to provide a safe, clean and affordable space.
description: Ranch house basement in outer SE Portland near Powell Butte park, near Gresham.  Includes a small kitchenette, tv /sitting area, and a pool table. Convenient for sightseeing to Portland (by public transit or car), Mt. Hood, PDX airport, and the Columbia River Gorge. Spacious basement has plenty of room to relax or play. Except for our occasional use of the laundry area, the basement is yours to enjoy. We may not be in the most trendy of neighborhoods, but it is easy to get around and I do my best to provide a safe, clean and affordable space. The door has a coded lock, so you can arrive anytime after check-in, which is 3pm. I will send the door code when your reservation is confirmed. I may or may not see you, there is a lock box key system. I am usually available by text or phone. Quiet residential neighborhood near Powell
transit: Getting to downtown Portland is easy and about 30 minutes by max train or bus. One block from public transportation, Powell Blvd bus 9. The Division 4 bus is also walkable. Driving to the max train takes about 5 minutes, its less than 2 miles.

house_rules: Quiet hours 8pm-7am (no pool after 8pm please) Please no tobacco smoking on the property at all. Marijuana is ok. We use natural cleaning products and soaps and do not use fabric softener in our laundry.  Washer/dryer use is available. Please ask. Laundry detergent is provided.  Please do not use the fireplace.  Due to sensitivities we maintain a scent free house as much as possible. Please don't spray perfume or cologne inside or use scented candles.  Thank you!

summary: Our daylight basement apartment is a cozy and spacious retreat after a day exploring.  You’ll appreciate the separate entrance, full bath, laundry, gas fireplace, premium sound system, and backyard garden.  We are close to Division Street restaurants like Pok Pok and many others. With easy access to bus lines, bikeways, and street parking.
space: Fully finished basement area with epoxy-sealed concrete floors,  new windows that provide plenty of natural light, and granite countertops. A gas stove warms the area and adds ambiance. There is a washer/dryer. Stereo and TV. We think that you will feel at home in this space. Please note that it is a basement apartment in a 100 year old home and so sound does travel.   Outside is a relaxing garden area.

summary: My place is close to Pok Pok Restaurant, Salt & Straw, Bollywood Theater, Stumptown Coffee Roasters, Ava Gene's, Night Light Lounge, New Seasons Market, Double Barrel. You’ll love my place because of the coziness, the high ceilings, the location, and the people. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
space: Big, bright apartment with original 1920s features all over. The high ceilings and abundant windows give the place an airy feel. Hang out on the front patio in the Adirondack chairs, sipping a drink, looking out over the courtyard. Then head out and visit any one of dozens of great bars and restaurants a short walk away. We're right near the Clinton neighborhood, Hawthorne Street, and Division — the new restaurant row of Portland.  The apartment itself is on a quiet, side street with lots of privacy. During your stay feel free to use the big dresser and half the closet (plenty of velvet hangers, included.) The kitchen is fully stocked, the living room is comfy, and the dining room can be used as an office or a dining space — your choice.  There is a smart TV and a Netflix subscription with a "subletter" profile that's ready for you to use. There's also Chromecast hooked up in case you want to watch something off your computer or phone.  The wireless speakers use Airplay, so only Apple

summary: You’ll love my place because of the quaint and walkable neighborhood! Take a stroll through the first historic SE Portland neighborhood with tree-lined streets, rose gardens, and popular coffee shops. Only 1.5 miles to downtown. summary: Private room with a queen-size tempurpedic and your own bathroom in a gorgeous, 1925 Craftsman, fully remodeled in 2009. Easy access to Hawthorne, Division, the Central Industrial Eastside, and Downtown. Your host is a work-from-home attorney, huge beer geek, and general gourmand. I live and work upstairs, but guests will generally have full use of the areas pictured inside and outside the house.
space: A beautiful 1925 Craftsman tastefully remodeled in 2009. Your bedroom faces the private backyard and is located next to the main floor bathroom. There is easy access to the kitchen (gas stove, refrigerator/freezer, wine fridge, microwave, toaster-oven), living room (comfortable couch, chair, 50" TV with full sound-system and cable), and dining room. The basement bar with another TV, fireplace, and beer on tap is just down the stairs. The washer/dryer is also in the basement in a separate room. When the weather is nice, the backyard is a beautiful, private, quiet place to relax. There is also a grill available for use.

summary: Handsome arts and crafts 3 + bedroom, 2 full bathroom, fully furnished 1916 Old Portland home in the heart of Clinton neighborhood in inner SE Portland Backyard tiny house, which sleeps an additional 4 people (2 beds) is available for extra charge.
space: Handsome arts and crafts 3 + bedroom, 2 full bathroom, fully furnished 1916 Old Portland home in the heart of Clinton neighborhood in inner SE Portland. Perfect for a family vacation, with plenty of common areas for reading, dining and relaxing. One queen size bed in master bedroom, a queen bed in second bedroom,  a full bed in third bedroom, and a day bed in attic studio space. Hardwood floors throughout, new appliances, yard, washer/dryer, and Japanese soaking tub. Includes Wifi, Apple TV, and all utilities. Two blocks from great restaurants (Broder, Savoy), cafes (Little Ts, Press Club, Roman Candle), bars (Dots, Clinton St. Pub, Richmond Bar), Bhaktishop yoga and Clinton St. Movie Theater. A few blocks from New Seasons, St. Jack, Pok Pok, Sunshine Tavern, Nuestra Cocina, Bar Avignon, Ava Genes, Block & Tackle, Sen Yai etc.  And the best artisanal ice cream at Salt & Straw. Three blocks from #4 Division St. bus, and 10 min. bike ride downtown. Elliott and Reiko are both History prof

summary: Cozy room w/ private entry, cooking, and shower.  First historic SE Portland neighborhood w/tree-lined streets, rose gardens, coffee shop. Only 1.5 miles to downtown.  Easy walk to unique shops, theaters, restaurants, grocery stores, & riverfront.
space: Your private space has its own entrance around the back of the house, and includes a private bathroom with shower, plus a bedroom with double bed and a large sliding glass door leading to a small covered porch for seasonal use only.  We close down the porch for the winter for temperature control.  The space has everything you need and more, including a small kitchenette (see photos) and access to shared washer and dryer. Comfort is priority, with an independent thermostat and underfloor heating.  In summer, the front yard is perfect for spontaneous happy hours around the firepit, relaxing in the hot tub, or enjoying a bamboo-enclosed picnic area for morning tea/coffee.  The home is in a quiet neighborhood, with small children asleep by 8pm next door, so all outdoor activity must be quiet after 8pm.  However, the neighborhood offers multiple places to socialize in the evening, all within walking distance.

transit: There are 3 bus routes within a few blocks.  Downtown Portland is a 10 minutes bus ride, and 2 miles for walking.  Ladd's Addition is in the center of bike paths, and is close to numerous  bike shops that rent bikes.
access: Guests have access to the large landscaped yard with hot tub, picnic area, firepit, and shady trees.  Also a shared laundry up a flight of spiral stairs.
interaction: Guest boundaries are respected -- some brief social interaction welcome but no pressure to socialize.  There are 2 of us managing this space:  Yanna who owns the house and Pamela who lives in the house and manages all the details of the airbnb.  Both of us would be delighted to meet and greet guests if possible, but our main priority is that you feel welcome and at home from your first interaction.  Guests will have complete privacy, but you may contact us be text any time for questions.
house_rules: This home welcomes all.  The ambiance is perfect for simple living, quiet lifestyles, and charm.  We appreciate people who share these values.  Quiet hours are 10:00pm until 8:00am, during which voices should be kept low. Laundry hours 9am - 8pm.  Hot tub for quiet relaxing.  No loud parties are allowed.  No smoking on premises.

summary: Say hello to Dotty the House!   A classic 1906 home in the center of a perfectly Portland neighborhood. City's best restaurants,  bars, breweries, concert venues,  and food carts within 10 min walk.    Portland local.  Green conscious, solar powered.  Family Friendly, dog friendly.    Not a hotel experience.  Charm and Cozy. Low gloss.  Helpful onsite host.   Free garden greens.  HBO, DVR, Xfinity onDemand, Netflix, Games, Puzzles Grill, Outdoor heating, porch swing, 420 friendly
space: Say hello to Dotty The House,  …..and wish her a happy late Centennial!  Dotty was born in 1906,  and has seen and heard so many different types of people make use of her.  Dotty’s current owner has been occupying Dotty for two years and has spent a lot of time and energy getting her all dolled up for a new chapter in both Dotty’s and her owner’s life. Dotty’s owner likes to change some things about Dotty’s structure from time to time and has been known to leave a little dust to gather in dark corners in favor of spending time with his two children who also call Dotty home. But he takes pride in Dotty and loves a clean, well-lighted place to enjoy his relaxation time in and to invite people over to gather.  Dotty spent most of her life without her current owner and is pretty excited to be a home for a batch of new people to live, play, work, and gather in.  Dotty has seen so many family celebrations and gatherings between her walls since she works throughout the day and night to shelte

summary: Spacious and comfortable 1905 house - perfect home base for your visit to Portland! This is the larger unit of a duplex and includes two bedrooms, living room, dining room, kitchen, and bathroom. Quiet street in a great location just a few blocks from SE Division St.  Minutes to downtown PDX by car or public transportation. Children are welcome! But please note that the house is not child-proofed.  There are a few cleaning products under the sink, knives in the kitchen drawers, etc.
space: Stay in the heart of one of Portland's most popular and walkable neighborhoods! This home is on a quiet street, easy walk to SE Division restaurants.  The 1700 square foot unit includes two spacious bedrooms with comfy beds (one queen and two twins) on the second floor, and a large living room, dining room, and small kitchen on the main floor. Easy walk to some of Portland's newest and best restaurants on SE Division and Clinton streets. Nearby restaurants, pubs, food carts, natural grocers, a farmers' market, and cafes include: Bar Avignon, Yama Sushi, Nuestra Cocina, Burasca,  Dot's, La Moule, Cafe Broder, Off the Waffle,  Tid-Bit Food Cart Pod, Roman Candle Baking, Ava Gene's, Cibo, Pok-Pok (award winning Thai), Whiskey Soda Lounge,  Salt and Straw Ice-Cream (amazing!),  Bollywood Theater (Indian street food),  Pine State Biscuits (fantastic breakfast),  Hopworks Brewery, Apex (over 50 craft beers on tap), People's Coop and New Seasons Grocery.

Bike trails and bike shops are also nearby.
access: You have full and private access to the entire second floor (where the bedrooms and bathroom are located), and most of the first floor, including the front porch, main entrance, living room, dining room, and kitchen. You're welcome to keep food in the refrigerator and do a little light cooking and meal prep in the kitchen, but it is really not equipped for larger meal preparation, frying foods, etc because there is no range hood.
interaction: As much or as little as my guests prefer. I live in the back unit and have a separate entrance, but I'm always available via phone/text or in person to answer any questions!
house_rules: You are booking this house for the number of people described in your reservation.   Please keep noise levels down observe quiet time after 10pm. No smoking or vaping in the house. No smoking tobacco anywhere on the property. The kitchen is for very light cooking and meal prep only. Please do not fry food as there is no range hood. Please wash your dishes and leave the house clean and neat.  Thank you!

summary: Amazing 1926 craftsman bungalow in the heart of Colonial Heights just above Ladd's Addition and the Hosford-Abernathy neighborhood - A perfect location to experience all the wonderful things that Portland Oregon has to offer and a short distance to the mountains or beach!
space: Our home offers 2 spacious bedrooms, 1 ½ baths, and 2000 square feet of living space on 2 floors.  The main floor is littered with ornate crown moldings and brand new oak hardwood floors keeping its vintage feel while still being modern.  The kitchen and main floor bath were remodeled last year, and for the movie or sports fan, the Sony projection TV with 100" screen is new to our main floor living and dining area.  Our famous puzzle wall bedroom with fireplace is on this floor as well.  Climb the original staircase to the upper floor and find soft fir flooring with high pitched, dramatic roof lines extending to a huge master bedroom and bath.  There is an additional remodeled living area on this floor with a doorway to the 3rd floor balcony.  Here, you will find our lush container Dahlia garden and a spectacular view of the city any day or night.   Relax and enjoy our peaceful, tree lined street in one of our cushy front porch chairs, OR head to the back of the house and the main floo

Climb the original staircase to the upper floor and find soft fir flooring with high pitched, dramatic roof lines extending to a huge master bedroom and bath.  There is an additional remodeled living area on this floor with a doorway
transit: Public transportation and the Bikeshare program are only a few blocks away

summary: Make our jazz musician's loft & roof deck home base for exploring Portland's nationally recognized local food & drink scene. We're less than 2 miles from city center & within easy walking distance of SE Division Street's exciting, new restaurant row.
space: Jazz Musician's Loft: Make our “zen-industrial" musician's loft your home base for exploring Portland's nationally recognized local food and drink scene. Our modern loft is less than two miles from Portland's city center and within easy walking distance of southeast Division Street's exciting new restaurant row. Architect-designed and built in 2010, our small and surprisingly spacious three-story loft was specifically created for the study and performance of jazz music. Second Floor:  Music Studio, Kitchen, and Bath: You won't find a great deal of traditional furniture here. It follows, the 1,000sf music studio remains refreshingly open until we unbundle the stacking chairs for the occasional house performance.   The music studio features:  - Salvaged barnwood floor and 12-foot ceilings - Cushy sofa - Compact corner kitchen with stainless steel table and stools (Guest access is limited to microwave oven, fridge, and sink – sorry, range isn't available) - Modern bathroom with roomy show

transit: We are less than one block from a bus stop. And we are five blocks from the new Clinton Street Max Station and light rail transportation to downtown Portland (Pearl District) via lovely Tilikum Crossing.
access: We - Morgan, Michelle, and Cooper (dog) - have private quarters on the first floor.  We all share access via the front door, but the top two floors are all yours.
interaction: While we have private quarters downstairs, you'll see us only as much as you care to.  We're always nearby for assistance or available at all hours day/night by phone or text.
house_rules: - No Smoking. - No Candles - No pets. - No additional guests  (Please do not invite additional people to the loft without permission). - Play piano only via special arrangements with host. - No food or drink on piano. - Close all windows & doors before playing piano, radio etc.. - Wash and dry dishes and put trash/waste in inside bins before checkout. - Kitchen range is off limits. Sorry!  Microwave is yours to use. - Backyard access is not permitted.  - Exterior areas including roof deck are whisper quiet zones beyond 9 pm. (Please minimize volume of music and other audible activity in the studio and loft spaces after 9pm).  - Dishes/utensils/coffee maker available in the kitchen guest cabinet. - Please respect our kind neighbors! - New Members: Adding a description of at least 50 words highlighting why you decided to join the Airbnb community, your interests or hobbies, or anything else you think your host-to-be might like to know about you to your Airbnb profile helps Michelle and I

summary: Amazing home located in the historic Ladd's Addition neighborhood (SE Portland). It is a short walk or bike to downtown and just minutes on foot to theatres, and heaps of the city's top restaurants, wine bars and some fantastic brew pubs.
space: This is a bright and sunny 1928 tudor home on a quiet street close to the best of Portland.  Located in the unique historic neighborhood of Ladd's addition renowned for its numerous rose gardens and triangular street plan. Over 1800 square feet, with a large double lot backyard, private terrace with gas grill, garden room, and media room in the basement, this house provides a quiet home base to explore the city.

The whole house is yours, with the exception of the upstairs office. Off-street parking for 1 mid-size car available, and ample on street parking in front of house is available for guests with additional needs.  Garage available if you wish to store bikes inside. I am an Oregon native and can help provide ideas for things to do. I also hike re
transit: 1 block off the city bus line. Easy walk to downtown (30 minutes) or 10 minutes by bike. Just 5 minutes by foot to New Seasons grocery store and many other options.  Ladd's is also a very bike friendly neighborhood.
access: The whole house is yours, with the exception of the upstairs office. Off-street parking for 1 mid-size car available, and ample on street parking in front of house is available for guests with additional needs.  Garage available if you wish to store bikes inside.
interaction: I am an Oregon native and can help provide ideas for things to do. I also hike regularly and am happy to assist with information about outdoors or any other types of activities. I live in Portland and this is my primary residence when it is not rented. During your stay I will be living nearby with my partner and available for assistance if needed.  For extended stays, I will need to visit the house to have garbage and recycling out each week, and to water the indoor plants, but would coordinate any visits in advance with my guests.
house_rules: I'm looking for guests who will take be careful of, respect and enjoy my home which I have restored carefully.  No smoking, no pets and no additional guests. No parties. Keep the house locked and secure. The fireplace can't be used (sorry, for liability). Please help preserve the hardwood floors by not wearing your shoes in the house. Check-in is 2:00 p.m. or later and check out by 12:00 p.m. If you require additional accommodation please do inquire, I may be able to accommodate.  On confirmation of booking I will send additional details about the house.

summary: We have owned this cozy, two-bedroom sanctuary for more than 25 years. Over the last decade, we have been excited to see our neighborhood transform into a premier destination for food lovers, beer aficionados, and cultural adventurers. Now we want to share it with you. Casa Contenta is half a block off of Hawthorne Blvd. and walking distance to popular spots such as Pine State Biscuits, Jam, Cartlandia, Powell’s Books, and Pok Pok, among so many others. We wish you a great stay in a great city.

summary: Downtown is a short walk, bike ride, or drive from our vintage home. Nearby D-Street awaits with restaurants, bars, food trucks, dance/yoga studios, boutique shops and more! Enjoy our quaint upstairs with a queen bed, private bath, claw foot tub, private living room and HOT TUB!!  (cot is available upon request...)
space: Your cozy bed awaits you at the top of our quaint, vintage staircase.  You will have the entire attic space of our 1908 Victorian Farmhouse including your own private bathroom.  Feel free to take a long, hot bath in our claw-foot bathtub or take it one step further and enjoy a soak in our outdoor hot tub!  You can also unwind (or wind up) by doing some yoga or meditation in the adjoining, spacious lounge. This room has a nice view of the west hills through the dappled sunlight of our ever growing Mimosa tree--a perfect place to set your mind at ease.   This space is best for two people.  Private Bathroom with claw-foot bathtub Hot tub Wireless internet for your laptop Lounge / yoga room / living room Coffee maker / tea kettle Mini fridge Microwave Queen bed Bob and Stacey are busy during the day with work and school and will be in and out during the week.  We would be happy to point you in the direction of some yummy places to eat or you can explore the city autonomously.   Our house i

Private Bathroom with claw-foot bathtub Hot tub Wireless internet for your laptop Lounge
transit: Easy access to the interstate (I-5, I-205 and I-84) and several bus lines, (#9, #10 and #4) it's easy to get to everything from our house.   The Orange Line MAX (light rail train) just opened and it's only a 7 minute walk to the nearest station.  It will take you downtown and all the way to/from the airport!  It's located at 12th and SE Clinton. If you are have a car, you are welcome to park across the street--it's free! The best way to get to our house from the airport is either by cab or Uber (about $25-40), MAX/MAX or MAX/ bus combos.   MAX/MAX:   Take the RED LINE MAX downtown, transfer to the ORANGE LINE, get off on SE 12th and Clinton, then walk 7 minutes to our house.   MAX/Bus: Take the RED LINE MAX downtown, transfer to #4, #9 or #10--they all get you a few blocks from the house (#9 gets you the closest).  Public transit will take some time (about an hour), but it will be economical.  (less that $5.)  It's pretty cool that you can get all the way to/from the airport by the MAX
access: You will enter the front door! Key will be in lock box and needs to live in the box--please do not take it with you, thanks!  (Code must be punched in to open AND close.  It's easiest if you punch in code, place bottom edge in first and then top edge.) If you need to use the backyard to store a bike, please enter through the NON-driveway side gate. (the otherside is tricksy and may lead to an Abbey escape, which is well known for.)   Feel free to enjoy the hottub at any hour, just keep voices down.   Fires in the firepit are welcome as long as you provide your own wood! Sorry, no kitchen or laundry facilities offered at this time.
interaction: Bob and Stacey are busy during the day with work and school and will be in and out during the week.  We would be happy to point you in the direction of some yummy places to eat or you can explore the city autonomously.
house_rules: Our home is a shoe-free and tobacco-free area! Please wipe your feet with a towel before entering the hot tub and no lotions please.  Also, press the "clean" button when you are finished soaking.  No glass in hottub...use the plastic drinking vessels provided.  We do enjoy having parties and having people over, however this is not an after-party place.  Please turn off all fans/AC/lights when you leave your room. For maximum privacy for everyone, please close your door when you are home and leave it open when you leave so our music volume will be at an appropriate level.   Please leave the key in the lockbox. Please be mindful of food items purchased and try to consume what you buy so there are no leftovers for me to handle. Prior to check out, please prepare recyclable items (empty liquids, etc) and place in paper bag (located next to fridge.)  Dispose of food in compost receptacle and garbage in bathroom garbage.  If you need something from the kitchen, please feel free to ask!   Sor

space: Our apartment is the top floor unit of a 3-unit home. It has been recently remodeled and is charming on the outside and updated inside! There is also free steet parking for those driving into town.

summary: Our Four Square home is in a beautiful and historic neighborhood close to downtown &  public transportation in inner SE Portland. This room has a brand new Queen size Beautyrest bed.  It is painted in soothing blue good for sleep and relaxation.
space: The Zen Room has one window and is cozy.  It has a queen size bed (beautyrest), dresser, bookcase, chair and room to stretch.   If your guest is NOT someone you plan on sharing the bed with we do have a twin air mattress with bedding that is comfortable and yet this room will be a tight fit with the extra mattress. All 4 bedrooms (including ours with our own full bath) and our 2 Airbnb rooms are on the 2nd floor of the house. There is either a fan or sound machine if you need or want in each room.    **Our Airbnb rooms are legally permitted through the City of Portland and we pay the appropriate lodging taxes and fees to operate through Airbnb in Portland, Oregon.   We are LGBTQ welcoming.  *Since we have 2 Airbnb rooms it is likely you will share the bathroom with other guests, but there is a half bathroom downstairs.   We live in a historic neighborhood in a historic home in Ladd's Addition.  It is a Foursquare Craftsman that was photographed for This Old House Magazine 7 years ago.

We are LGBTQ welcoming.  *Since we have 2 Airbnb rooms it is likely you will sh
transit: You can avoid renting a car to get around Portland as we have quick access to various forms of public transportation and Clever Cycles is a few blocks away to rent bikes.    The neighborhood is perfect for walking, riding bikes, and exploring (even on rainy days).  It is an easy 35 minute walk to downtown, 15 minute bike ride, 20 minute bus ride (many nearby stops) or ten minute drive.    If you are driving a car or motorcycle know that our home is in a unique area and the streets are on angles, so it is best to use your GPS to get here.  Parking is only on one side of the street, so you may have to turn around to park facing the correct way.  And I will need to take down your license number whether your own vehicle or a rented one, per City Of Portland regulations on short term rentals.  We have a parking space (usually) in front of our home if you are driving.  From the airport you can take the MAX train to Lloyd Center, then the #70 bus to 11th and Clay, 1.5 blocks left to Mulberry.
access: Please do read the House Manual before clicking to accept the Pre-approval or the reservation.   AND please do print out your confirmation sheet which will have our address and phone number on it.   *Remember we keep all communication through Airbnb, so if you have a question or concerns after arrival do text thru Airbnb.  Or if you have a problem getting to the house, or a flight is delayed, etc. again text through Airbnb.  Feel free to use the breakfast nook, front porch/back porch, or livingroom; no need to feel confined to your room. FYI: The dining room is my project room, so it is not 100% tidy.  And at times I have privacy screens up for clients. Kitchen use: If you want to reheat leftovers, make soup or sandwiches or simple meals we can coordinate the use of the kitchen.
interaction: If you need anything or can't find something PLEASE ASK US, as we usually have it. If your guest is NOT someone you plan on sharing the bed with we do have a twin air mattress with bedding that is comfortable. We value you having a great experience, and we value great communication, so don't hesitate to message or find one of us if you need something.   We look forward to hosting you and chatting as both our schedules permit.  If you want solitude and little or no interaction that is just fine; AND do let us know how we can make your stay more pleasurable.   ***Please note that we keep all communication through Airbnb. It is best if you have a smart phone (iphone or android) and know how to write text messages, as this will get you a response if you have a question or concern. The phone listed, is for an emergency or questions while you are staying with us; the email listed is for all the Airbnb email that is generated and monitored infrequently.
house_rules: The House Rules are about consideration and respect.   Please read all of this, as there is a question you must answer, and send to us in order for us to accept your reservation.    Quiet hours: 10pm-to 630am.  If you come in after 10pm we ask you to remove your shoes before coming up the stairs.  The stairs are old and carry sound. If you arrive after 10 pm during the week we may be in bed and will greet you in the morning.  A light will be on in your room and a card on your door with your name to guide you.  ;) Only you and your guest who are on the reservation are able to enjoy to be in the house, unless you ask us to make special arrangements (friend, kids, grandkids).  We are allergic to animals, so they are not allowed.   Smoking anywhere, of any type is not allowed in, on, or near our property; even sidewalks or the alley. This includes e-cigarettes or vaping; cigars, clove cigarettes or medical marijuana.   We enjoy organic food, but are NOT vegan or vegetarian.  Kitchen use: I

summary: Located in the heart of SE Portland's famed Hawthorne and Division Street Districts, the RestWell Room is a soothing space overlooking a verdant backyard. The private room is perfect for an individual or a cozy pair.
space: The RestWell Room is a spacious and quiet bedroom (queen bed) with a back garden view. True to its name, the room offers visitors an excellent night's sleep before heading out to explore the town.  Located in a garden-rich SE Portland neighborhood that is perfect for visitors who want to park their car (for free), or not have a car at all, and set off on foot to explore the best food and drink Portland has to offer. The house is situated on a quiet street smack in the middle of the enormously popular Division Street and Hawthorne Boulevard business areas. Food, spirits, music, books, and parks abound. summary: Spacious private room with double bed, easy walk to bustling Division. Very close to bus and MAX. Sunny home with kitten, garden and chickens. Sit on the porch swing and sip your coffee or snuggle by the fire. Street parking, wi-fi, shared bathroom.
space: We love our house! There are tons of places to sit and read, inside and out - a huge window seat, a hammock, comfy lawn chairs and a porch swing. The house it bright and airy with a sweet kitten and tons of charm. The yard is sunny and filled with raised beds of flowers and vegetables. Come on the right day and you just might get some homemade bread!

I have chickens in the back yard and I cannot control when they will cluck...;)  Sometimes one of the girls lays a BIG egg and they talk about it....!

space: From your private bedroom, perfect for a single person or a cozy pair (queen bed), you will enjoy a garden/street view in a quiet city neighborhood with coffee shops, gourmet markets, restaurants and bars within easy walking distance. summary: Our 106 year old Four Square home is in a beautiful and historic neighborhood close to downtown &  public transportation in inner SE Portland.  The room has a new queen bed and is firm.  Enjoy walks among the tall canopy of trees, roses, & alleyways.
space: This room has 3 windows and is bright and sunny. It is on the outside corner of the house.  There is a small table for laptop or writing, a rocking chair, a queen size bed, floor lamp and end tables.  Some furniture can be removed when the Air Mattress is used for another person.  All 4 bedrooms (including ours with our own full bath) and our 2 Airbnb rooms are on the 2nd floor of the house. There is either a fan or sound machine if you need or want in each room.  **Our Airbnb rooms are legally permitted through the City of Portland and we pay the appropriate lodging taxes and fees to operate through Airbnb in Portland, Oregon. transit: You can avoid renting a car to get around Portland as we have quick access to various forms of public transportation and Clever Cycles is a few blocks away to rent bikes.  The neighborhood is perfect for walking, riding bikes, and exploring (even on rainy days).  It is an easy 35 minute walk to downtown, 15 minute bike ride, 20 minute bus ride (many nearby stops) or ten minute drive.    If you are driving a car or motorcycle know that our home is in a unique area and the streets are on angles, so it is best to use your GPS to get here.  Parking is only on one side of the street, so you may have to turn around to park facing the correct way.  And I will need to take down your license number whether your own vehicle or a rented one, per City Of Portland regulations on short term rentals.  We have a parking space (usually) in front of our home if you are driving.  From the airport you can take the MAX train to Lloyd Center, then the #70 bus to 11th and Clay, 1.5 blocks left to Mulberry.
access: GUEST ACCESS Please do read the House Manual before clicking to accept the Pre-approval or the reservation.   AND please do print out your confirmation sheet which will have our address and phone number on it.   *Remember we keep all communication through Airbnb, so if you have a question or concerns after arrival do text thru Airbnb.  Or if you have a problem getting to the house, or a flight is delayed, etc. again text through Airbnb.  ONLY guests included in your reservation are able to be in or on our property, unless you ask and make special arrangements with us in advance.   You have access to the living room, basement for laundry front porch or back porch and yard as weather permits. FYI: The dining room is my project room, so it is not 100% tidy.  And at times I have privacy screens up for clients. Kitchen use: If you want to reheat leftovers, make soup or sandwiches or simple meals we can coordinate the use of the kitchen.  Feel free to use the breakfast nook, front porch/back
interaction: INTERACTION WITH GUESTS We look forward to hosting you and chatting as both our schedules permit.  If you want solitude and little or no interaction that is just fine; AND do let us know how we can make your stay more pleasurable.   ***Please note that we keep all communication through Airbnb. It is best if you have a smart phone (iphone or android) and know how to write text messages, as this will get you a response if you have a question or concern. The phone listed, is for an emergency or questions while you are staying with us; the email listed is for all the Airbnb email that is generated and monitored infrequently. Fred works outside the home and I have two other businesses that keep me working fulltiem; and sometimes I have Reiki or coaching clients at the house, which I work with during the day.  During the summer and fall months we are often gone on the weekends, but we will make arrangements with you before you arrive if we are out of town.  I may be able to have a friend to
house_rules: The House Rules are about consideration and respect.   Please read all of this, as there is a question you must answer, and send to us in order for us to accept your reservation.    Quiet hours: 10pm-to 630am.  If you come in after 10pm we ask you to remove your shoes before coming up the stairs.  The stairs are old and carry sound. If you arrive after 10 pm during the week we may be in bed and will greet you in the morning.  A light will be on in your room and a card on your door with your name to guide you.  ;) Only you and your guest who are on the reservation are able to enjoy to be in the house, unless you ask us to make special arrangements (friend, kids, grandkids).  We are allergic to animals, so they are not allowed.   Smoking anywhere, of any type is not allowed in, on, or near our property; even sidewalks or the alley. This includes e-cigarettes or vaping; cigars, clove cigarettes or medical marijuana.   We enjoy organic food, but are NOT vegan or vegetarian.  Kitchen use: I

summary: Private bedroom with brand new full bed, just off a bustling section of Hawthorne! Just a minute walk away from many restaurants, bars, and other entertainment and easy bus access to downtown. Close to all the action, yet quiet with a large yard. space: Our home was built in the 1940s but has plenty of modern touches. Our bathroom was recently remodeled with a spacious shower. transit: There are a variety of bus routes near us that will take you downtown or to other Portland neighborhoods. We are about a 20-minute drive from the airport, and taxis/Lyft/Uber are all available at the airport terminal. Public transportation takes ~50 minutes total via the light rail with a transfer to a bus. Parking is relatively easy to find in front of our house and there are no restrictions on how long you can park, so feel free to street-park your car for your entire visit! We also have a private driveway if needed. Zipcar and car2go are both popular in Portland and a great way to get around the city.
access: The private bedroom shares a bathroom with our bedroom. Guests are welcome to share our first floor living space which includes a kitchen, dining room, living room, and porch/sunroom. You will have access to high-speed wireless internet.
interaction: We love meeting people but are also very busy, so guests can determine how much interaction they'd like. We are very happy to give advice on things to do and see in Portland!

summary: Please enjoy our private room in the heart of the Hawthorne District. Private entrance on a guests-only floor with king bed in a great family home. 2nd bed available for 3rd guest. We love meeting new people and hosting! Your comfort is our goal.
space: Ours is a welcoming family home in Portland's close-to-everything Hawthorne District.  Guests enjoy their own floor of the home. To ensure both your comfort and productivity we provide a luxurious locally crafted, eco-friendly king-sized memory foam hypoallergenic bed, bamboo sheets, LED reading lights, wifi, desk, printer, bathroom and private entrance in an ideal (quiet yet convenient) location. An additional twin sized air bed is available for a third guest. Across the street from Sewallcrest Park and Community Garden, you're just a short stroll to the great commercial streets of Hawthorne, Division, Belmont and 2 minutes from transit to take you anywhere. Super convenience makes your stay a breeze and a blast. The listing is one of two in our home. transit: Our location is extremely convenient on foot or by bicycle. As noted, bikes are available for rent.  Transportation Network Companies such as Lyft and Uber are ubiquitous. Car2Go, Flexcar, and GetAround (peer-to-peer car share) and others are readily available. TriMet's bus #14 provides frequent service, every 15 minutes or better, on Hawthorne Blvd, two minutes away by foot.  If traveling between the airport and our home, many of our guests choose a TNC ($20-25). Cabs cost about $35. To save money, you can also take TriMet's light rail to the Hollywood Transit Station ($2.50/person) and transfer to a TNC ($10).
access: Guests enjoy a private keyless entrance into their own floor with a private bedroom. The bathroom is shared between our two guest rooms. Kitchen, laundry, living room are yours to share. Bike rentals are available on the premises. Iconic Hawthorne Blvd and frequent bus service are just steps away. Our home is an extremely convenient location in one of America's great cities.
interaction: We honor our guests' privacy and let you determine your level of engagement with our family. We love meeting and hosting folks from all over the world. We are longtime Portland residents and love sharing our knowledge and insights about the city, region, and state. Tom is a former political and administrative leader for the City of Portland; he is a wealth of information and perspective.
house_rules: Ours is a family home. Please respect and enjoy the vibe.  We are a shoes-free home to help keep it clean. Please remove footwear at entry.  We provide details on wifi, etc. at arrival.

space: Clean, cozy, and private tiny house/garden flat with lots of natural light and lush plant life. Conveniently located 1 block from Division and 3 blocks from the original Stumptown coffee/Woodsman Tavern. Nestled between the food district and Mt. Tabor park, there is plenty to enjoy within walking distance in our  desirable SE Richmond neighborhood.  The space is a single level separate dwelling unit adjacent to our house. You will have access to your own fenced garden nook complete with a large wooden bench covered with grapes. In the spring and summer you can also enjoy fresh fruit from the fig and pear tree located in your private garden nook.  Inside the space you will find your own bathroom complete with a heated floor, brand new tile shower, and plenty of counter space for toiletries. summary: Our home is beautifully situated across from a quiet park. We are located just a couple blocks walk to restaurants, coffee shops, boutiques and bus stops on trendy Hawthorne and Division streets. Our home is family friendly!
space: Our location is ideal for foodies who want to walk to popular restaurants on SE Hawthorne and SE Division streets.   Our neighborhood is very family oriented, so it's ideal for people with children. We are directly across the street from a park and playground.   The Hawthorne bus (#14) is just 1.5 blocks away and will get you downtown within 10 minutes.  We also are walking distance to grocery stores, movie theatres, shops, breweries and pubs.  Our neighborhood is quiet at night, so we ask that there be no noise after 10:00pm.  We are very strict about this, and our neighbors will report to us if there is excessive noise.  So, please respect our neighbors.  Otherwise, enjoy the quiet area.  It's a perfect place to have a relaxing get-away.   :-)

summary: Tranquil retreat just 5 blocks from "restaurant row" where we've thought of everything for your comfort and enjoyment including a sauna to beat the chill. A leisurely stroll from some of Portland's best spots - Pok Pok, Salt & Straw, Ava Gene's, Xico, Little Big Burger, and countless food carts. You'll love the location, ambiance, and high end modern amenities. Ideal for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
space: This charming craftsman was built in 1913 and has been lovingly restored and remodeled to bring out its original character with modern comforts and sophisticated style. From the old-growth fir hardwood floors, custom leaded glass windows, crown molding, coved ceilings, and built-ins this home is a rare jewel and perfect for people who appreciate quality and attention to detail. Situated on a rare over-sized lot on a tranquil side street, we enjoy lots of privacy and more quiet than most in this super popular neighborhood. As audiophiles, we love to share our passion for music and will gladly show you how to use the state of the art, reference quality hifi system we've painstakingly optimized on the main level. Downstairs in the basement media room, enjoy an immersive and comfortable movie night with our Meridian hifi system connected to a giant 65" 4K LCD TV. And of course we're set up with Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu Plus, and HBO accounts for your streaming pleasure. As art lovers on

Situated on a rare over-sized lot on a tranquil side street, we enjoy lots of privacy and more quiet than most in this super popular neighborhood. As audiophiles, we love to share our passion fo
transit: There's tons of street parking and easy access to public transit. I recommend renting a Biketown bike from one of the kiosks just a few blocks from the house or walking when the weather is nice. A quick Uber or Lyft into downtown usually costs just just a few dollars or so and we're about a 15 minute drive from the PDX airport. We also have easy access to major arterial roads (Hwy 99, Cesar Chavez, and Hwy 26/Powell) so you always have a couple options depending on traffic.
access: You'll have access to one or two two bedrooms depending on how many people you have or how much space you prefer (additional fee for second room if it's just two people). We don't book more than one at a time so you will not have other guests coming and going, just us! There's a shared bathroom on the main level that will become private as soon as our master bath is done (we've cut our prices in the meantime for you!).  We invite you to make yourself at home in the living room, dining room, kitchen, front and back porches, basement media room, sauna, laundry room, and large fenced yard. You'll also have plenty of street parking right out front.  Keyless entry and super fast WiFi along with use of our multiple streaming services including Netflix, HBO, and Tidal.
interaction: Lee and I often work from home and will be around much of the time should you need anything. We're also available at all times by text. We love meeting new people and would enjoy sharing a glass of wine and listening to your fav tunes on our hifi system but also happy to let you do your thing. We'll obviously help make recommendations for our go-to local haunts and as experienced outdoorspeople we can help you plan all sorts of Pacific NW style adventures! Our dog, Chaucer, a 70lb German Shepherd/ Standard Poodle mix is non-shedding, gentle, and very obedient.  He will be excited to meet you and makes a great therapy dog if you're in need of some puppy cuddles.
house_rules: -Please remove your shoes (we'll lend you some slippers!) -No more than 2 people per room. If you are a party of 2 and would like separate rooms there is a $40 charge per night for the second room. -Do not feed people food or unapproved treats to the dog -Do not spray strong perfumes or aerosol products in the house (allergies and asthma!) -Do not touch the hifi without a quick lesson from one of us so you know how to use it and never set anything on top of the speakers  -We do not have specific quiet hours as long as you do not disturb the neighbors and are generally respectful -Try to park on the street in front of our house instead of a neighbor's property whenever possible -Our master bathroom is being remodeled so we have to share the downstairs bathroom, just give us a heads up if you're going to be in there for awhile. Our prices are discounted for now until we can provide you with a private bathroom.

summary: Beautiful, clean and private new garden studio in the bustling Hawthorne neighborhood. Walk to restaurants, coffee, music venues, theaters, bars and food carts. Quiet street across from a city park. Sauna, kitchenette, comfortable queen bed, tile shower and wifi. Tons of FREE street parking!
space: This beautifully remodeled basement apartment is clean and comfortable. Enjoy a stroll through the front garden to the apartment's private entrance. The perfect place for morning coffee is at the top of the stairs. Brochures, maps and guidebooks featuring Portland neighborhoods and attractions are available. In the main room a comfortable sofa in front of the television provides a relaxing place to watch a DVD or log on to your Netflix account. There is no cable or other channels. The kitchenette includes a sink, coffee press, electric kettle, popcorn popper, toaster, dishes, flatware, microwave and mini refrigerator. There are also growlers to use at the taproom on 34th and Hawthorne (4 blocks away). The bedroom has a queen size bed with luxury linens, two nightstands and two dimmable sconces. There is a small dresser, hat rack with hangers and a shoe rack. The bathroom features a large, tiled walk-in shower, fluffy towels and a private sauna large enough for two adults. It's the ulti

transit: The apartment is one block from the #14 bus that will take you directly downtown.  A Lyft or Uber ride will take 10 minutes to downtown. This is the best place to go on an urban hike! Try it and take a Lyft home! Zip Cars and Car2Go Smart cars are close by if you need wheels of your own. There is a new shuttle bus, the Columbia River Gorge Express, that runs every Friday, Saturday and Sunday from May 27th through Sept. 25. The bus runs 12 times daily between the Gateway Transit Center in northeast Portland and the Multnomah Falls visitor center, with one stop at Rooster Rock State Park on the way. A great way to visit the gorge!
access: You'll have a key to the apartment's private entrance so you can come and go as you like. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy. The sitting area is your private space to use. We share the metal table in the front with guests. The back yard is a work in progress that is closed off right now.
interaction: We are busy but responsive! If you need some recommendations or assistance just text.
house_rules: Absolutely NO SMOKING inside the house. Don't try it, please.  Quiet time is from 10 PM - 8 AM. Low volume talking/movies are OK.  No unregistered guests after 8 PM. If you've registered as "1 guest" on Airbnb, anyone else in the studio will need to leave at 8pm. If you'd like to change your reservation to include the second guest please do so through the Airbnb website.

summary: Beautifully restored, immaculate house on a charming street in the epicenter of SE Portland restaurants and coffee houses. Oriental rugs, leather furniture, and built-ins give this house a speakeasy vibe.
space: This charming house is one block away from the best coffee house in Portland (Albina Press) and arguably the best happy hour in Portland (Sapphire Lounge.) It is a few blocks away from an organic grocery store. Walk down Hawthorne to Bagdad Theater and up Hawthorne to gorgeous Mt. Tabor park. Bring your running shoes to hit the beautiful trails around the reservoirs. On-street parking is easy, the neighbors are friendly, and life is good in SE Portland. Tattoos and skinny jeans optional. All are welcome!

summary: Cozy double bed in a fully finished, large master bedroom (lots of natural light) w/closet space and dresser and half bathroom with private toilet and sink. Access to rest of house include living room with beautiful piano, kitchen, large deck and fenced grassy backyard!! Excellent location! Short walk away from bars, breweries, coffee shops, grocery stores, restaurants, shops, and public transit. Location, location, location!!
space: The house is spacious with a beautiful open floor plan, and raised up above the street so it gets loads of natural light and makes for comfy sitting on the large front patio. We are fun, artsy, playful folk, so the home has a cozy yet artistic decor. I have two medium size dogs that are really friendly and will probably beg you for food and snuggles. If you don't like dogs, you probably won't like my house.
description: Cozy double bed in a fully finished, large master bedroom (lots of natural light) w/closet space and dresser and half bathroom with private toilet and sink. Access to rest of house include living room with beautiful piano, kitchen, large deck and fenced grassy backyard!! Excellent location! Short walk away from bars, breweries, coffee shops, grocery stores, restaurants, shops, and public transit. Location, location, location!! The house is spacious with a beautiful open floor plan, and raised up above the street so it gets loads of natural light and makes for comfy sitting on the large front patio. We are fun, artsy, playful folk, so the home has a cozy yet artistic decor. I have two medium size dogs that are really friendly and will probably beg you for food and snuggles. If you don't like dogs, you probably won't like my house. You will have access to the whole house including large kitchen, spacious cozy living room, large front deck, and sunny backyard! Laundry and drier available
transit: public transportation is a BREEZE! not to mention there are loads of places within walking distance (see neighborhood overview above).  If you're looking for exercise, you can also walk to several natural areas (Reed campus) and parks in the nearby neighborhoods (Laurelhurst Park, Mount Tabor). If you have a car, parking on the street is almost always accessible.
access: You will have access to the whole house including large kitchen, spacious cozy living room, large front deck, and sunny backyard! Laundry and drier available for bookings that are longer than 3 days.
interaction: I am in and out of town a lot! And when I am in town, I'm often in and out of the house. So we might not see a lot of each other depending on my schedule, but this gives you a lot of freedom in the house! And I'm always available to communicate via text or phone if you need anything at all. When I am free, I'm always happy to take guest out for a bite to eat or to go see a show in town. I also love to cook in the house with new guests if you're into it :). I generally make sourdough pancakes on Friday mornings and can make a special breakfast for guests on Wednesday morning when I'm around.
house_rules: Be respectful, tidy, and have FUN! No smoking inside. Pets are negotiable, but you must check with me first. I have two dogs and an outdoor cat!! No late night jams on weekdays. Portland will show you a good time!

summary: My home is just a block to the original Stumptown Coffee on Division, and a short walk to Hawthorne. The backyard garden has two private seating areas. Close to Pok Pok and Salt & Straw.  My place is furnished with quirky shabby chic antiques (including a piano) and original art. I offer organic cotton sheets, an organic healthy breakfast, and organic lavender soap, shampoo and conditioner. I love hosting, and welcome you to my garden! City of Portland registered/queer friendly/hate free zone.
space: My home was built in 1924 and retains its vintage charm. Kitchen and bath are fully updated, and I've added solar panels too. Your room is on the ground floor and is spacious, light, and airy with three windows, hardwood floors and a view of the garden. It is very private, as my bedroom is upstairs and on the other side of the house. Feel free to play the piano in the bonus room adjoining yours, which affords your bedroom an additional buffer from the common spaces.

summary: Located in the heart of the Hawthorne neighborhood, this second floor private apartment with full kitchen, bath and private entrance offers a unique setting from which to explore the city of Portland. Walk to shops, restaurants and public transit. 4 blocks to the vibrancy of Hawthorne and 6 blocks to burgeoning Division.
space: There is a private upstairs deck under a massive walnut tree. Plenty of books to browse and read in living room. Some of the artwork is done by Ben Rosenberg one of your hosts. If interested in inquiring about his work, please don't hesitate to ask. All the other art has been collected by the Rosenbergs, and their families.
description: Located in the heart of the Hawthorne neighborhood, this second floor private apartment with full kitchen, bath and private entrance offers a unique setting from which to explore the city of Portland. summary: Close to South Waterfront, OHSU and NUNM.  Perfect space for folks who are looking for a quiet and peaceful space in Portland. Room was recently remodeled and has a new memory foam bed with 300+ thread count sheets.   The Room is on the top floor of the house and you have this floor to yourself and it includes a private bathroom (shower and claw foot tub) and mini fridge.
space: The space is a mish-mash of new furniture and antiques.  There is a view of Mt Hood out the windows and there are black-out curtains for those who do want to wake up with the sunrise.  Magazines in room vary- usually: The New Yorker, Saveur, Harpers Review, New York Review of Books, Vanity Fair, Lucky Peach, Gastronomica, Kinfolk, etc. Bathroom is stocked with towels, washcloths, bath towels, natural soaps, shampoo, conditioner, make-up remover and lotion. Hair dryer with styling wand in bathroom.

summary: This peaceful, quiet condo is perfect for couples and solo travelers. The Willamette River trail is right outside which is great for walking and biking. It is close to OHSU, downtown Portland and all major Portland boroughs (Pearl District, NW and SE Portland). It is within walking distance to many restaurants, a grocery store, and public transportation. The bus line directly to the city center is a 20 min walk.

It is within walking distance to many restaurants, a grocery store, and public transportation. The bus line directly to the city center is a 20 min walk. All areas of the condo are accessible to guests. I will be available for questions throughout your stay. My condo is in John's Landing which is a suburb type area just south of the city center. There are great restaurants (Thai, Indian, Hawaiian, burgers, Italian and a growler shop) all within walking distance, as well as an up-scale grocery store and gas station. The bus line directly to the city is right outside my door step. The OHSU tram is also within walking distance, as well as the OHSU south waterfront campus. An Uber to the city center is about $8. summary: Enjoy being in the heart of it, Lair Hill/Ross Island neighborhood in SW Portland, a short walk or ride to downtown. High ceilings, smooth fir floors, claw foot tub, covered back porch with quaint garden patio. No car needed here. Just a 10 minute walk to downtown, Portland State University, Willamette River, South Waterfront and Center for Health and Healing/ Oregon Health Science University. Just a 5 minute walk to catch tram to Marquam Hill/OHSU. Home has 3 bed/2 bath total
space: The room is large and has a very comfortable firm king bed. There are black out curtains on the windows if you need them. The room opens out to a back patio garden with hammock and table/chairs for relaxing. There is a fountain and comfortable furniture for lounging on.

summary: The house is a spacious 1913 craftsman with a convenient location. It is filled with natural light, hardwood floors and original charm. Make yourself at home in the comfortable living room, dining, kitchen and two bedrooms with queen size beds.
space: Tons of Portland bungalow charm at this great close-in location.  The bedrooms have queen size beds, a closet for your use, and guidebooks.  Relax by the gas fireplace, the front porch, or in the backyard depending on the season. Two resident cats will greet you when you arrive.  They are friendly, and love having visitors. Within walking distance to coffee shops, brew pubs, pizza, and one of the best sushi restaurants in town.  A great park is only a few blocks away and several grocery stores are nearby.  Within a mile are: Division St., Clinton/26th, Reed College, and the Crystal Spring Rhododendron Gardens, and it's just a bit more to Hawthorne St.  Parking on the street is readily available. Bus lines covering Portland are easily accessible and especially convenient with TriMet's trip planner found on the TriMet website or using their mobile App. Downtown: 10-15 mins by car, 25-30 mins by bus Airport: 25 minutes by car

interaction: I enjoy chatting with guests and learning about their travels as well as sharing tips on Portland, but I'm just as willing to give guests privacy if that is what they're looking for.
house_rules: I love my home and ask that you treat and respect it as if it were yours.  I also love my pets, and ask for your help to keep them indoors, as much as they want to explore the great outdoors.

summary: Our little urban farm sits on a ½ acre surprisingly close to Portland’s downtown. Our home has been described as the perfect blend between a luxury hotel & hostel. It does have a certain ineffable quality & we can't wait to share it with you!
space: PLEASE NOTE: To save everyone time & frustration, please complete your profile with a picture of yourself, a bit about who you are and at least three verifications before requesting a reservation. This is a trust based community, and we all like to see the human that we are conversing with. Reading the entire listing (by clicking on "more" below) will likely answer most of your questions, and prevent misunderstandings. In the event that this room is booked, we have other listings at the same property here: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/3510642 https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/3563052 THE HOUSE - Our large old farmhouse is surrounded by ever expanding gardens, an entertaining flock of chickens, a growing herd of silly goats and grassy knolls perfect for a lazy picnic. There are lots of great communal spaces to enjoy, WiFi throughout, a fire pit in the back, porches to hang out on. description: Our little urban farm sits on a ½ acre surprisingly close to Portland’s downtown. Our home has been described as the perfect blend between a luxury hotel & hostel. It does have a certain ineffable quality & we can't wait to share it with you! In the event that this room is booked, we have other listings at the same property here: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/3510642 https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/3563052 THE HOUSE - Our large old farmhouse is surrounded by ever expanding gardens, an entertaining flock of chickens, a growing herd of silly goats and grassy knolls perfect for
transit: We are a block away from a #9 Trimet bus stop which will take you to the city center in just 20 minutes. We are also just 5 blocks from the #75 stop which traverses the city north to south. Trimet (our public transit) has a great trip planner on their website and we highly recommend you check that out if you will be using public transit. Uber has started operating in our city and we have heard great things from other guests about using the service. Spinlister is also a great website that allows you to rent bikes from peers....not unlike this service.
house_rules: A few requests & some additional relevant information - The entire house is cleaned top to bottom every week. The guest rooms are of course cleaned and prepared before each guest arrives. Please remember that we are a working urban farming family, not a full time hotelier with staff so if something is not up to your expectations please let us know and we will make every effort to accommodate your needs. - It isn't easy keeping an urban farm house clean. Leaving your shoes at the door, just inside or on the porch, helps immensely (and makes it more comfortable, we'd say). - Please no smoking on the property. - You can make noise in the house, but PLEASE keep noise to a bare minimum after 10 pm until 7 am. We share our house with guests from different time zones, and it’s hard to know when someone is trying to sleep. Farm chores are part of our daily ritual, so you may hear us up and about earlier than 7.

summary: A quiet, cozy bedroom & bathroom on the ground floor of a beautiful, modern new home in a verdant, friendly Southeast Portland neighborhood.  Enthusiastic greeting by very friendly dog & cat comes standard!
space: (PLEASE NOTE: This listing highlights the primary guest bedroom available, but for parties of 3 or 4 people, we do have a secondary bedroom that also features a queen-sized bed.  All guests share the same bathroom, but the second bed shown on the listing is NOT in a common space, it is in its own private bedroom.) There is almost an entire floor available in our brand-new home smack-dab in the heart of fun, accessible Southeast Portland!  This means that our guest(s) get not only their own quiet bedroom, but also a private full bathroom AND their own nicely-appointed living room (please note: the first-floor living room is NOT private, as it does not have a ceiling and is the way between the front door of the house and the stairs to the second floor).  We are steps away from a frequent-service bus line, a terrific sandwich shop that's open for breakfast, lunch AND dinner, a pizza joint, a Starbucks, and, best of all, a Trader Joe's! The house is about two miles south of the trendy Hawt

Enthusiastic greeting by very friendly dog & cat comes standard! All guests share the same bathroom, but the second bed shown on the listing is NOT in a common space, it is in its own private bedroom.) There is almost an entire floor available in our brand-new home smack-dab in the heart of fun, accessible Southeast Portland!  This means that our guest(s) get not only their own quiet bedroom, but also a private full bathroom AND their own nicely-appointed living room (please note: the first-floor living room is NOT private, as it does not have a ceiling and is the way between the front door of the house and the stairs to the second floor).  We are steps away from a frequ
transit: Public transportation in Portland is excellent!  Not only does the light rail line run all the way to our wonderful airport, but the buses are all clean and on time, and the drivers are quite friendly and helpful.  If you want to have wheels of your own so you can explore areas outside the city, that's great, but you don't have to have a car in town to get around comfortably and conveniently.
access: You have a floor of your own, where your bedroom, bathroom and a sitting area are located.  You are also welcome up a level, where the kitchen and our living room are situated.  Bikey guests are welcome to park their rides in our garage.
interaction: We interact with our guests as much or as little as they want - we've connected brilliantly with guests who've had the time and inclination to chat us up, and we've had quite a few guests we never even met face-to-face!  We are perfectly content to allow our guests to determine what kind of relationship they have with us.
house_rules: We enjoy getting to know our guests, but we understand that most people who stay with us have plans that keep them occupied away from the house most of the time during their stay.  What you can expect from us: we are pretty quiet and mellow and when we do entertain, festivities usually wind down by 11:00pm on the weekends.  You are always welcome to hang out with us when we're relaxing at the homestead, but we will not be put out if you choose to do your own thing.

summary: ***Stay 2-3 days and receive $5 off per night.** Be a local in this fresh and friendly close-in SE neighborhood. space: Your bedroom is on the 3rd floor of my townhouse. You will have the floor to yourself. The bedroom has a comfy pillow top queen size bed.
