The bathroom and beverage station are right outside your bedroom door. You will be sharing the townhouse with me but I will be living on the 1st and 2nd floors while you visit.
description: ***Stay 2-3 days and receive $5 off per night.** Be a local in this fresh and friendly close-in SE neighborhood.  Make yourself at home while enjoying access to great food (pub grub, pizza, Mexican, coffee, subs and more) - all right outside your front door. Bus or MAX downtown in minutes or walk to the popular Division and Hawthorne areas. Your bedroom is on the 3rd floor of my townhouse. You will have the floor to yourself. The bedroom has a comfy pillow top queen size bed. There is a small TV with cable access available in your bedroom. The bathroom will only be used by you. It has a double vanity with a bath/shower combo. The bathroom and beverage station are right outside your bedroom door. You will be sharing the townhouse with me but I will be living on the 1st and 2nd floors while you visit. You should feel free to come and go as you please via the front door, which is on the 2nd floor. You will be sharing the 2nd floor living area with me during your stay. You may store food o
transit: Getting downtown is easy with public transportation or by car.  There is also a lovely walk nearby along the Willamette River on the Eastbank Esplanade. There are several bus lines close by. The 75 bus is less than a block away and takes you places north and south, especially if you've walked yourself silly for the day. The 9 bus zips you downtown, as does the Orange MAX line. Or if you like to bike I have an extra bike and helmet. You can get here from the airport by taking the MAX Red line train (access it from the lower level baggage area) to the Hollywood Transit Center and transferring to Bus 75 but it does take about 55 minutes. Let me know if you have specific destinations in mind and I can give you an idea about proximity and transportation options. Uber rides are available in Portland if that's your preference.
access: You should feel free to come and go as you please via the front door, which is on the 2nd floor. You will be sharing the 2nd floor living area with me during your stay. You may store food or beverages in the fridge and use the kitchen for minor snacking or heating up something in the microwave. Please plan to dine out for your main meals at one of Portland's numerous foodie locations.  The townhouse and your room is for booked guests only. No additional overnight visitors allowed. No pets, no smokers, no exceptions.
interaction: I'm happy to help you plan your visit, whether you need assistance with dining choices or public transportation or anything else that comes to mind. Just let me know what level of interaction you want. I always enjoy meeting new people and hearing their stories. I have no set daily schedule so I may or may not be around during the day but texting usually will reach me (unless I’m at work).
house_rules: Relax and enjoy yourself but be considerate of our shared living space and my neighbors.  No overnight guests - your room is just for you.   I keep a pet free and smoke free house, inside and out. Generally, I call it a day around 11 or 12 p.m. and I'm not a crack of dawn morning person by choice ;-)

There is a comfy queen sized bed with linens and towels.

transit: Public transportation in Portland is excellent! Not only does the light rail line run all the way to our wonderful airport, but the buses are all clean and on time, and the drivers are quite friendly and helpful. If you want to have wheels of your own so you can explore areas outside the city, that's great, but you don't have to have a car in town to get around comfortably and conveniently. If you have a car you will have to park on the street and have a short walk in to our complex.

summary: I am excited to be able to open my house up to people who are visiting Portland Oregon.  Your bedroom is located on the main floor in my comfortable cozy household.  There is a shared bathroom located next to your bedroom.  The house is close to exciting southeast attractions including beautiful Tabor Park.      It's quiet, safe, neighborhood street, close to public transport.  You can park in the driveway if you have a car.
space: Beautiful, bright windows in open living space fill the main floor with warm light.  Open kitchen is available for those of you who need to store items in the refrigerator .  Trader Joe's, Safeway and New Season's Market are nearby.  Plug your ipod or music device into the living room receiver to listen to your favorite songs while relaxing on the large comfortable couch.  The office is adjacent to bedroom and available for those of you who need to get a little work done while visiting the Rose City.  Your bedroom has a comfortable king size bed and faces the backyard.

transit: The 17 and 71 Bus stops are located about 2 minutes walking distance from household.  This is also a bike friendly area with wide bike lanes.  Beautiful Springwater Corridor trail is near by for runners, walkers and bikers alike.
access: Guest have access to main floor office space, bathroom, kitchen and living room, back yard patio furniture and front yard deck.
interaction: I work a regular 9-5 job and am busy with personal creative projects most nights around town.  I am available to assist you whenever I'm at the house (I'll be staying in the upstairs bedroom) or you can always call, text or email me with questions if you are looking for suggestions on what to do during your visit to Portland Oregon.  If I am out of town during your stay I will still be available by phone and email.  I will also make sure someone else is available in case of an emergency.
house_rules: This is a non-smoking household, but you can smoke in the backyard or walk around the neighborhood for your smoking desires.  Sorry, no pets.  Feel free to come and go as you please remembering to lock the door behind you.  The environment in the house is super relaxed, all I ask is that you clean up after yourself (please no eating in the bedroom) and communicate if you need help with anything.

summary: We named our B&B The Fig Tree because of the 25 year old Fig Tree in the front yard.  Neighbors and their kids and dogs sit on the bench on the corner of the lot to rest and chat.   We have lived here for 26 years.  Many things have changed, but it is still a neighborhood of small, locally owned businesses.  The neighborhood has been around long enough to benefit from the time when Parks were planned as part of neighborhoods.   Rest in a comfortable bed, enjoy our home and explore!
space: You are welcome to share our living space including a covered porch and hot tub, garden and pond.   Your room has a comfortable double bed.  We use cleaning products that do not have perfumes.  There are USB ports and WiFi in your room.  It is quiet.

Central location. Walk to Division St. one of the 10 top Food districts in the U. S.  Fully equipped Kitchenette. Your own bathroom with claw foot tub. Free WiFi of course. Street parking & easy bus access. Check in anytime after 4 p.m.
space: We invite you to enjoy this  wonderful, light filled space in our old nicely redone, funky(in a good way), 1909 house. We have your comfort in mind.  Colour and light combine to make this your own private and restful haven full of good reads and soft delights. We keep our price low because we enjoy providing an affordable place to stay that is simple, beautiful, and comfortable. We like things clean and orderly with touches of colour. the  room that we offer is a huge, light filled, 600 sq ft, newly carpeted room, which has it's own separate entrance, and bathroom.  Kitchenette with small fridge, microwave-oven, traditional coffeemaker, french press and tea pot. Foldout table and chairs for comfortable dining & work space.  There are dishes and glasses, silverware, and dish towels as well as a microwave, fridge, and a toaster. interaction: WE love being hosts! We enjoy meeting you as soon as possible after you check in, at your convenience, but then you are welcome to be as private as you want. We live in the house, downstairs, and we can interact as much as a guest desires, and are available for questions and suggestions about great walks and eateries, concerts and where to get other info about events and goings on around town. we can also need our privacy at times,  and respect a guest's needs to be alone as well.  we will be around downstairs, or available by phone, if you need us.
house_rules: Please have a profile with a picture and verification before you make a request. No other guests than what you have mentioned when booking.  Smoking outside of the house only. No burning of candles, incense, etc. Drinking excess alcohol should be done at the pub. Quiet appreciated after 11PM. No pets please. In the winter, or cooler weather, please close the heat vents and turn off the lights if you are leaving the house for a number of hours. City of Portland rules say i need your residence address, so please get me that before you actually check in. While we are children friendly, we cannot provide free accommodations for children OF ANY AGE.  We welcome your children into our home but all fees and total number of guest limits apply.  We love and welcome children but at the prices we are offering, we cannot afford to have extra people of any age here, without compensation for our labor and resources. summary: Super convenient to both interstates by car and the airport on public transit, "Pixie" snuggles into a quiet nook off of the intersection at SE Powell and SE Foster. walking distance to Hawthorne, Division, Woodstock, Reed College, Mt Tabor, Montavilla, and 3 major bus lines.  Guests have a driveway parking space.  Secure keyless entry to a private 500 apartment. It's got a living room with dining table and kitchenette,   Note, the kitchenette has no sink.
space: The house is a single-level 1960's Ranch with unique and quirky original features.  The apartment is private, colorful, comfortable, quiet 3 room space in front part of house. A spacious living room with kitchenette, dining nook, Q sofabed & entertainment. The bedroom has a Full bed, plenty of storage and hanging. The private bath, parking, laundry, bike storage. 2 major buses & foodcarts just blocks away The kitchenette is perfect for a light breakfast or snacks. It has a coffeemaker, microwave, mini fridge, toaster, dishes and utensils. Complimentary coffee, teas, cream and sweeteners. There is no sink or stove.  Each bedroom is lockable and the front door is keyless. Check-out the Guest book for more local information like: police non-emergency, (URL HIDDEN) etc...

interaction: I will be there to greet you, get you checked in, answer any questions, and show you a few house quirks. Please message, text, or call me anytime with any concern. I know a lot about Portland and love sharing secrets of my own neighborhood and happy to help you in anyway I can. Optional busing service I remove any dishes or trash as arranged. Three social cats live on the property. They’re not allowed inside the apartment. Cheddar, Merlin will greet you and hang out with you if you want them to. Feel free to soak up their cat-ness; that’s their job. We do not rent to third parties, at least one guest staying with us needs to be verified with Airbnb. It is important to show the website to everyone in the party staying here to avoid any confusion about what to expect.
house_rules: Enjoy and respect the house and neighborhood as you would your own. Check-in between 4 and 8 pm. Check-out is 12 noon. This is a no smoking or burning in the house (pot, too). Ashtray provided on porch Communicate any damages or safety concerns immediately. This space is only for registered Airbnb guests. No third-parties in the house. This space not suitable for parties. Do not share house information with unregistered guests. All guests must be know house rules. No bit torrenting or illegal downloading :( This space is not suitable for pets or children under two. Maximum occupancy is four people. Regrets that early check-in and late check-out are often not possible. Early luggage drop-off is probably possible.

summary: Overlooking the heights of OHSU, across treetops our corner unit apartment rests on the 7th floor of the most modern apartment building in the area. Within a stones throw of Portland's majestic OHSU and VA hospital complex, our space is the perfect base camp for any short and extremely convenient visit. A clean modern space with full kitchen, bath, king bed and three large windows evoke the serenity of a peaceful natural environment all within 5-10 min to anywhere on OHSU's main hospital campus.

summary: My place is close to Downtown Portland, Lair Hill park, SW Waterfront, Salmon Spring Fountain, OHSU, PSU, and Ross Island Bridge. You’ll love my place because of the amazing view of Mt. Hood and the natural light that floods the apartment which makes it feel very cozy and instantly like home. Best of both worlds as it's a very quiet place in a safe neighborhood but also only one mile away from the heart of downtown (URL HIDDEN) place is good for solo adventurers, business travelers, and couples.

summary: South Tabor neighborhood is a short walk to beautiful Mt. Tabor. Minutes from downtown by car, or you can hop on a bus! Grocery stores nearby are Winco, Fred Meyer, Safeway, and New Seasons. You’ll love our place because of the quiet neighborhood and comfortable setting all around.   My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids).
space: A tasteful and modern remodeled basement with one bedroom, living room, bathroom and kitchen.  The bedroom locks, so you will have complete privacy.   Bedroom and Living room have Egress windows for increased safety. You have a queen sized bed in the bedroom.  A couch which folds into a double bed and an Aero bed available to use. The living room has a full dining room table, a television and wifi ability with HDMI-so you can watch off your smart phone.  We have a DVD player available and DVD's available as well as a flashback atari.  We supply a bluetooth speaker, so you can also hook up your music device. The kitchen has a full size refrigerator/freezer, full stove and oven, coffee maker, microwave as well as all basic eating/cooking utensils.  Olive oil, salt/pepper, grapeseed oil and coconut oils provided.  Some coffee and tea.   I am also happy to provide pantry items or groceries and meals upon request.  I am happy to provide a menu of my specialties. Our spacious tiled bathroom

transit: We are near several major bike routes that you can access after you rent your Portland bike at one of the SE kiosks.  We are very close to bus lines, (9, 14 and 15) and you can rent cars by the hour-- at Car2go or Smartcar. We have ample on street parking.
access: You'll access your private apartment from our back gate. Please remove your shoes once inside the door. Our laundry and store room is a locked space, but you are welcome to do a load of laundry if the need arises while you stay.  Please let me know. We have a private hot tub available for an additional $10 fee per use.
interaction: I'm an interactive person, but busy with two businesses.  I'm happy to help, can guide you... and am generally here if you need me.
house_rules: There are stairs -- about 12 of them to get down into the unit and out of the unit.  Although there are also egress windows... in case of fire or emergency. Please remove your shoes upon entering back door. Please do not use perfumes/colognes.  We strive to be an allergen free home.  We don't use dyes or perfumes in laundry products.

summary: Welcome to a peaceful and private apartment in South Tabor, Portland! You will enjoy the entire basement floor, (about 750 sq. feet) of our updated 1949 cape cod home. The apt. features: a separate entrance; private bathroom- toilet/sink/shower with luxury shower head; two bedrms. with queen beds; a large common room with a big leather couch (which can comfortably sleep one adult or 1-2 children; air mat. also avail.); fridge, micro, coffee, tea. Hot tub and two hammocks wait for you!
space: -This gorgeous basement apartment is totally updated with great lighting, dimmers, and windows in bedrooms and bathroom  -Please note that there is not a full kitchen and that there is an added fee for guests after the first person -Please note that there when we are home there is sometimes low noise like footsteps or low music audible from upstairs from time to time as we live above the apartment in the house; we do our best to be quiet, and we ask the same of our guests. It has not been a problem yet. -We are legally permitted as a Type A Permitted rental property with legal alarms and fire exits by the City of Portland: Permit (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)HO -there are two separate bedrooms, each with a closing door and a separate deadbolt with key, an operable window and a closet -there is a separate large common room -there is a private bathroom with a shower/toilet and sink -there is a flat screen tv with a VCR for you to have fun with our HUGE collection of art house VHS tapes in the ba

Hot tub and two hammocks wait for you! -This gorgeous basement apartment is totally updated with great lighting, dimmers, and windows in bedrooms and bathroom  -Please note that there is not a full kitchen and that there is an added fee for guests after the first person -Please note that there when we are home there is sometimes low noise like footsteps or low music audible from upstairs from time to time as we live above the apartment in the house; we do our best to be quiet, and we ask the same of our guests. It has not been a problem yet. -
transit: Easy access to downtown and North Portland. Buses that connect to the entire city are located on Powell blvd., two blocks from the house. Powell also connects to major highways I5 and I205. We are a 12 minute drive to downtown Portland. We are a 5 minute drive to the most happening area of Division street at 20th.
access: We live upstairs and park our car in the driveway, but you won’t see us much as we are busy professionals. We never enter the private basement apartment while you are there. House is well-built and so there is not much sound penetration between the floors. You may hear us walking, talking, watching a movie or playing a record from time to time before 11 PM. -entrance to garden and hot tub is through side yard gate Guests will have full access to private basement floor (750 sq. feet). Owner will not enter basement. -Hot tub and Garden hours (shared with both of us) limited to 3-8:30 PM    - Quiet hours 11 PM-8 AM -Guests do not have access to a full kitchen; i.e. no cooking available
interaction: Check-in and out is self check in/out. We will not see you when you arrive. In fact, you may not see us at all during your stay! We will only be available through messaging on air b n b, or by phone.  We may not be on the property when guests stay and will not plan to say hi unless something comes up.
house_rules: -we want you to have an awesome time, so our rules are really minimal -No groups larger than 4 people   -Park on Street please, near our driveway -Entry is through side door -No smoking anywhere on property -No pets anywhere on premises -Hot tub and Garden hours (shared with both of us) limited to 3-8 PM  - Quiet hours 11 PM-8 AM -no cooking anywhere on premises -no candles or incense -Children under the age of four are not allowed in hot tub. Children of all ages are not allowed in hot tub alone. - Children play in backyard, on hammocks and in hot tub at their own risk. Please be careful. -there is an extra fee for personal laundry- we ask that you leave cash in the apartment if you are going to be doing personal loads of laundry throughout your stay

summary: This 1910 charmer is a comfortable, clean, stylish and cozy home base for your Portland stay! Nestled perfectly off the ever popular Division Restaurant Row and a short walk to  beautiful Mt Tabor Park...and much, much, more!
space: This house is my home part time and located in a quiet and nice SE South Tabor neighborhood. It has old bones but new upgrades throughout and  is set against a beautiful garden backdrop. I offer the following amenities for your comfort. This is a typical 1900's floor plan with 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom. *Comfortable yet modern furnishing and decor make for a cozy space. *Central heat and air are a rare find in Portland homes, but run very well here. *Many large windows look out onto the expansive yard where you'll be able to spot native northwest plants and wildlife. *One bedroom is in the rear of the house and has a private sliding door to the enclosed courtyard and has a newer pillow top queen bed with clean 100% cotton coordinating linens for a restful sleep. *Second bedroom is now a yoga studio/space, and has the option of a Deluxe pillow top raised blow up air mattress with a nice and very comfortable mattress topper - creating a "Zen" like sleeping space. *Upstairs Attic Room/Den
description: This 1910 charmer is a comfortable, clean, stylish and cozy home base for your Portland stay! Nestled perfectly off the ever popular Division Restaurant Row and a short walk to  beautiful Mt Tabor Park...and much, much, more! This house is my home part time and located in a quiet and nice SE South Tabor neighborhood. It has old bones but new upgrades throughout and  is set against a beautiful garden backdrop. I offer the following amenities for your comfort. This is a typical 1900's floor plan with 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom. *Comfortable yet modern furnishing and decor make for a cozy space. *Central heat and air are a rare find in Portland homes, but run very well here. *Many large windows look out onto the expansive yard where you'll be able to spot native northwest plants and wildlife. *One bedroom is in the rear of the house and has a private sliding door to the enclosed courtyard and has a newer pillow top queen bed with clean 100% cotton coordinating linens for a restful sleep. *
transit: Conveniently located to the airport - approx 20 min and a $25 cab ride. You are  5-15 min to downtown, Pearl district, Hawthorne district, Belmont neighborhood, Clinton neighborhood, Woodstock, the waterfront.  There are ample uber services and Car to Go  everywhere here. Clinton Bike avenue is blocks away and a fun/safe way for you to cruise through the neighborhoods, sipping,  nibbling and sight seeing your way around.
access: You have full access to the entire property, except for the gated driveway, basement  (unless laundry arrangements have been made) and my mailbox.
interaction: Most of the time I will be meeting you to give you keys and show you the space and for your check out. On occasion I will leave the keys for a self check in.  I do stop by to retrieve my mail, so no need to go into my mailbox I want you to have the perfect stay and are happy to assist with any questions you have. Otherwise no interaction, unless you need something!
house_rules: Check-in time is 4-7pm, but I can accommodate earlier with request and if you need a later check - that can also be arranged upon request. No additional overnight guests will be allowed after you check in. Please care for the house as you would your own. No parties with more than 10 people and no outdoor partying activity after 10 pm.  No pets inside house. NON SMOKING HOUSE- please note if you smoke anything inside your security deposit will not be refunded.  CONSIDER REMOVING YOUR SHOES.  Portland is a wet, muddy, fun city, so I would be grateful if you would remove your shoes when inside. - CONSERVE ENERGY.  I want to be as low-impact as possible, so please conserve energy by turning off the lights, heater/air conditioner when you go out. - LOCK DOORS & WINDOWS. Please make sure the doors and windows are locked when you leave the house. - HOUSEKEEPING. While linens and towels are included and sheets and towels changed before the arrival of each new guest, daily housekeeping is not i

interaction: This depends on the guests preference and my schedule.  I am here if you have questions or have time for some conversation.  I love Portland so ask me questions!

summary: Our room is ideal for the solo, adult traveler.  We are easily accessible to the airport and convenient to downtown.  The guest room has a comfortable double bed, wi-fi, and plenty of daylight.  Relax with us while you enjoy Portland.
space: The upstairs room is quiet, bright and very comfortable.  There is a computer table available for use just outside the room; the bathroom is just steps away.  The bathroom is for our guests except for occasional showers taken by us.
description: Our room is ideal for the solo, adult traveler.  We are easily accessible to the airport and convenient to downtown. There is a computer table available for use just outside the room; the bathroom is just steps away.  The bathroom is for our guests except for occasional showers taken by us. There will be coffee available in the mornings and limited space in the refrigerator for your snacks ~ which can be prepared in our roomy kitchen. The living room is a wonderful place to read and relax at the end of a busy day. We are friendly and willing to chat but will certainly give you your space if you just need to unwind.  On work days we get up before 5:00 a.m. so appreciate a quiet house by 9:00 p.m. We are in SE Portland, a nice family neighborhood, close to Mt. Tabor.  If you like to walk, there are restaurants, a m
transit: Portland public transportation is very convenient; there are three bus lines within short blocks of our house.  Uber is alive and well in Portland and if you bring your bike, we are known as being one of the bike friendliest cities on the West Coast.

summary: Our yoga room is sunny, with a clean, comfortable bed and plenty of floor space for your yoga practice.  Our home is on a 3/4 acre lot with 21 Fir trees. Hosts are Portland experts and welcome families and travelers.
space: Our yoga room is sunny and warm, with a comfortable queen size bed and stylish furnishings.  Includes a spacious closet, dresser and desk.  You can use our high-quality Manduka brand yoga mats and props, along with our extensive yoga library.  We will even throw in a free yoga class at our family-owned yoga studio, Yoga Refuge, which is a 10-minute drive from our house in the popular Montavilla neighborhood.  Your bathroom is just down the hall, and is shared with 1-3 other guests, depending on who is booked in our other listing. Please note--we recently upgraded to a larger bed, so the room will be arranged slightly differently than pictured in the photos.
description: Our yoga room is sunny, with a clean, comfortable bed and plenty of floor space for your yoga practice.  Our home is on a 3/4 acre lot with 21 Fir trees. We offer guests moderate use of our kitchen, dining area and
transit: From our house you can easily walk to get groceries and other basic amenities, and we are also close to the freeways, the airport, public transit and bike paths.  If you have a car, you can get to the best shopping districts in Portland in 10-20 minutes from our house.  Joel is a very committed bike commuter and can give you directions to anywhere in Portland from our house on a bike, though you will get a workout!  If you don't have a car, you should check out our local public transit site, Trimet, to get a sense of how long it will take you to get around.
access: Off-street parking is plentiful in our large driveway.  We offer guests moderate use of our kitchen, dining area and laundry if needed--please let us know in advance if you will need a little bit of room in our fridge or kitchen, and if/when you will need to use the laundry.  Bathroom is shared with our second Air BnB listing, so there may be between 1-3 other folks using it during your stay.  You are welcome to enjoy the outdoor space on our 3/4 acre lot, but please no smoking on our property.
interaction: We have lived in Portland for over 10 years and would happily direct you to some of our favorite spots for eating, shopping and enjoying the unique flavor of our great city!  We are a busy working family, so we tend to be in and out, but we love to meet new people and will be friendly hosts for your visit.
house_rules: No smoking in or near the house.  We are somewhat sensitive to strong perfumes and colognes, so please keep those to a minimum during your stay.

Near Spring Water Corridor, East Esplanade, and Rhododendron Garden. This is an obviously well-loved house.  We are in a quiet neighborhood in the center of everything on a tree lined street. The entire first floor of the house is available, front and back porches, washer/dryer in basement. I will be mostly unavailable, but you can ask me anything ahead of time and can email me questions. Five minute drive to downtown (when there's no traffic).  Plenty of on street parking available.  Two blocks to bus. The dishwasher is broken.

summary: This apartment in the main house has all you would need, plus the added benefit of walking distance to all the rich culture of inner SE Portland.  Quiet safe neighborhood with village ambiance, only 1.5 miles from downtown.  Completely private entry
space: Everything you need in the main floor of the house, with a home ambiance and lush yard to enjoy.   The location is ideal -- walking distance to everything you could possibly want.  The space has its own completely private entrance, and the host will not impose after the initial greeting.  .   Families welcome.  Sorry no pets.

Outdoors there is a picnic table, BBQ, hot tub, firepit... all of which are available to guests.  Only quiet voices outdoors after 8pm (quiet neighborhood with small children asleep next door after 8)
interaction: Guest boundaries are respected -- some social interaction welcome but no pressure to socialize.  There are 2 of us managing this space:  Yanna who owns the house and Pamela who lives in the house and manages all the details of the airbnb.  Both of us would be delighted to meet and greet guests if possible, but our main priority is that you feel welcome and at home from your first interaction.  Guests will have complete privacy, but you may contact us be text any time for questions.
house_rules: This is not a party house, although there are plenty of places to party in Portland!  The most important rule is quiet time in the house between 10 and 8, so other guests and owners can sleep.  The hot tub is outside and the neighbors have small children, so we also require quiet (relaxing with quiet voices) in the hot tub, especially after 8pm.  Otherwise I am pretty easy-going. Respect sums it up, and my experience with guests is almost all positive.  Laundry hours 9am - 8pm.

summary: Escape from the ordinary with a stay in our urban lodge! You will find a truly unique log building located right on a major boulevard! You will feel like you are staying in a ski chalet, even though you are only a stones throw away from all that the Portland metro area has to offer! Our place is an easy 12 min. drive to downtown Portland or a 20 min. ride on the Tri-Met public bus system. It is close to Hillsdale & Multnomah Village, and a 3 min. walk to the IBU Public House brew pub.
space: All of the natural log walls, the paneled vaulted ceilings, the pine floors and the large windows and skylights make this building truly unique! The Northwest style often incorporates an element that has a natural "live edge". Well, this whole building has a "live edge", including an 18 ft tall tree trunk with a 2 ft diameter in the front entry! At the lodge, you will have the best of both worlds! Although you will be staying in a "log cabin", you will still have all of the comforts of home. There is a wet-bar with a full-size refrigerator, a microwave, toaster and Keurig coffeemaker with complementary K-cups. There is a pub table in the dining area, as well as one out on the back deck. There is a queen size bed and a flat screen TV.

It is about a 20-25 minute ride depending on time of day. The bus comes roughly every 12 minutes and it costs $2.50.
access: You will have full access to the front and top floor of the building.
interaction: Either we, or our daughter, will meet you to give you the key, and our long term renter in the back of the building is very helpful and knowledgeable about the area as well.
house_rules: At least one of the guests must be 21 or older. Please be quiet and respectful of the tenant in the attached unit by keeping noise level down.

summary: Welcome to your private room in a creative feng shui consultant's home with an incredible view to the southwest.  Hardwood floors,  fireplaces, skylights, big windows.  Personal bathroom with shower and drawers for your supplies.  DIY continental breakfast with homemade granola, fruit, toast, yogurt, tea,  coffee, juice. Please advise if you have allergies or preferences. In the southwest hills, near Multnomah Village, OHSU Hospital, Zoo, and Hillsdale. Walking and cycling are common.
space: Warm, private room with bathroom across the hall. Comfortable bed, writing table and large closet. It is a simple, elegant, relaxing home with a cottage garden and a beautiful view. A "green belt" on one side of the property is peaceful and full of birds. We are close to downtown Portland, the zoo and OHSU...a great place to visit and to live.

interaction: I enjoy conversations with people about their lives and I also like my privacy. I've found most people who stay here feel that same way.
house_rules: Please follow these rules: Welcome to Rose Cottage, located in the quiet southwest hills about 15 minutes from the city. Please note: Buses are on weekdays, rush hours only. Uber or a taxi if you have no car.   Smoking outside of the house only.  Drinking excess alcohol should be done at the pub. Please leave your strong chemicals or perfumes behind.  Shoes off in the bedroom. Meals in the dining room only, please. Quiet appreciated after 10:30 PM.    A list of helpful ideas and books about Portland and Oregon are available for guest use. A heater, hair dryer and a fan are also available. There are many books, games, & cards  for your use.  Enjoy your stay! Annie

summary: Private entrance to 1320 sq. ft. (122.6 m^2) gorgeous, self-contained basement apartment in Portland hills with large bedroom and two queen beds. Separate living area has gas fireplace, private patio, and kitchenette with microwave, mini-fridge, no stove.
space: Our spacious daylight apartment surprises everyone who enters. It's big yet cozy, private yet perfect for a family or group of friends. Please note that the two queen beds are in one large bedroom. We welcome guests from all over the world and are LGBT lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender friendly, of course. This is a new listing for us and we expect approval of our Portland permit soon. A small puppy lives upstairs and does not have access to the AIRBNB.
description: Private entrance to 1320 sq. ft. (122.6 m^2) gorgeous, self-contained basement apartment in Portland hills with large bedroom and two queen beds. Separate living area has gas fireplace, private patio, and kitchenette with microwave, mini-fridge, no stove. Our spacious daylight apartment surprises everyone who enters. It's big yet cozy, private yet perfect for a family or group of friends. Please note that the two queen beds are in one large bedroom. We welcome guests from all over the world and are LGBT lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender friendly, of course. This is a new listing for us and we expect approval of our Portland permit soon. A small puppy lives upstairs and does not have access to the AIRBNB. Although we list check in times, please inquire. If we do not have guests before you, it might be possible to have an early check in. Check out is flexible depending on the next guests' check in time. The basement is a good-sized apartment with two private entrances. The locks ar
transit: The streets are steep here. Walking is great, but you may want a car to maximize your time in Portland. Downtown is 10-15 minutes by car. We use Uber and Lyft frequently. There is no bus stop on our street, but the 55 bus runs a few streets away, a seven minute walk to that stop. If you are willing to walk 15 minutes to SW Capitol & Sunset, there are 8 bus lines that stop there. The buses to downtown are frequent and fast. It's also possible to hike to the Portland Tram, which is free to take down to the river. There is a cost to return (going up) on the tram.
access: Although we list check in times, please inquire. If we do not have guests before you, it might be possible to have an early check in. Check out is flexible depending on the next guests' check in time. The basement is a good-sized apartment with two private entrances. The locks are keypad, so there's no need to worry about losing your key. The glass doors open to a private covered patio, a good place to hang out, even in the rain. There's a bedroom with two double beds. If you have more than four guests, we can provide an air mattress. Just let us know if you'll need it. The kitchenette has a small refrigerator, microwave, and toaster. There is no stove or oven. Please wash dishes after use.
interaction: If we are in Portland, we will try to meet you on your first day with us. If we are going to be out of town, you can always contact us with questions and we will provide information to contact local friends who can help.
house_rules: Quiet hours are 10 pm to 7 am.  Please do not wear shoes inside. Shoes worn outdoors must be removed upon entry at the door, especially if wet or muddy. Clean slippers, socks or bare feet inside.  No smoking inside or anywhere else on the property.  Do not invite guests not included in original reservation.  Please wash dishes after use.

summary: Private. Super Clean. En Suite Bathroom. Parking. This quiet, spacious Master Suite is just 15 minutes to downtown Portland! Perfectly situated in the Hillsdale, Multnomah Village area, close Lewis and Clark and 30 minutes to wine country!
space: The entire 650 sq ft second floor is all yours in a very clean and private room with full bathroom in this beautifully remodeled 1945 Craftsman home. Queen size bed with new firm mattress. There is also a convertible couch that could accommodate a third person/child. Room, bathroom and the house has amenities to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Relax in the morning on the front deck and at night enjoy a beautiful fire in the fire pit in the private back yard. If you are a garden lover, you will love this house! Off street parking.

Should there be requests for renting the entire home or use more of the space, we can discuss details at time of reservation.

summary: Share our vintage, comfortable home on a quiet street in the Hillsdale neighborhood of Portland.  Off-street parking, private guest entrance and apartment with living room, private bath, and two bedrooms with queen beds.  Partial kitchen in closet with small fridge, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, and dishes.  Shops, restaurants, services only 3 minutes away in Hillsdale Shopping Center.  Short 15-minute drive to downtown.  No smoking in house or on porch.
space: Our guest space is the front half of our house.  We do share walls with the space, but block off the French doors that separate us, adding a sound buffer. We do not have access or go through the guest area when it is occupied.  Vintage touches include hardwood floors, a gas fireplace, bead-board wainscoting and pedestal sink in the bath. Original artwork hangs throughout.  The living room has a seating area, plus a table/desk with four chairs.  One bedroom closet conceals a microwave, small fridge, coffeepot and some utensils.  Our ASTR permit for Portland is (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)-HO.

The living room has a seating area, plus a table/desk with four chairs.  One bedroom closet conceals a microwave, small fridge, coffeepot and some utensils.  Our
transit: We have parking spaces for two cars.  Downtown Portland is a fifteen-minute drive.  Our location is best for guests who have a car or use Uber and taxis.  There is a bus downtown that is a fifteen-minute walk away, and the trip takes another fifteen minutes, so public transportation, while possible, requires time and a sense of adventure.
access: Guests have private access to the entire front part of the house.  We enter through the garage or back door and occupy the rooms in the back. The host area is completely separated, leaving the living room, two bedrooms, and bath for guests on their own to make themselves at home.  Bathroom essentials and Wi-Fi are included, but no TV or full kitchen (partial kitchen in one bedroom closet).  The front porch is also available, but is not rain-proof.  NO SMOKING IN HOUSE OR ON PORCH!  No unregistered guests.  Quiet hours: 10 pm to 7 am.  Be warned if you have pet allergies, we do have an indoor cat.  And please be respectful of our great neighbors!
interaction: We enjoy meeting our guests at check in, but any further interaction is up to them.  I am an artist and work at home most of the time.  My husband is semi-retired, and we're happy to answer any questions and recommend our favorite places in Portland.  We have separated the space so we can all enjoy our privacy.  Our cat stays in our part of the house.  Please let us know in advance if you have other allergy issues that might come up.
house_rules: No unregistered guests.  No pets.  Quiet time: 10pm to 7 am.  No smoking in house or on porch.   No more than four guests allowed.  Must register the names and addresses of all guests (required by City of Portland.)  Please no oily products on the sheets and towels.

It's just a short bike ride, drive, or public transit trip to get to all of the greatest east side hot spots.

summary: Located in the up incoming SE Foster-Powell area that is 5 miles from downtown Portland and is walking distance to the Portland Mercado, numerous bars, max/bus lines, grocery store, restaurants and more.  We have a great outdoor space that is fabulous for BBQs and gatherings; it's the definition of the Portland yard. We are a short 15 minute drive to the airport.  There's also a community center down the street for your work out fix.

The elephant ears and churros there are amazing! Arleta Library which is about a ten minute walk serves breakfast and lunch, using local produce. Their coffee cake sells out on Sunday's! Don't forget to try their outdoor seating. If you have to wait there is Space Monkey coffee next door. In the evening there is an Irish like pub! End your evening with a beer and locals. (Even a tattoo parlor in the same block...you never know!) 82nd street has everything you need just in case you forgot kids shoes or even a camera. Fred Meyer, Walmart, Target within a mile or two away. Clackamas Town Center - a huge mall, is 2 miles away.
house_rules: - Our house is not large enough for parties but is perfect for family/friend dinners. Please let us know how many guests and we can help set up the table to accommodate.

summary: This tiny house has been my full time home for several years and I am making it available periodically for others who want to experience tiny house living. It has everything you need - hot shower, stove, queen size bed, composting toilet, and more.
space: The house is 8 feet wide by 14 feet long and has all the things you would need for a comfortable stay. There is a small kitchen with a stovetop and toaster oven for cooking. There is a bathroom with a shower and composting toilet. The sleeping loft has a queen size mattress and can comfortably fit two people.  There is also a reading nook with a big picture window where you can sit and read or drink a cup of coffee. Or, if you prefer, a small desk where you can sit and write or work on a computer.  The house is very private and is located in a .5 acre yard with one other tiny house on the property. There is a small front porch and a chimenea for an outdoor fireplace and a patio table with four chairs.

Or, if you prefer, a small desk where you can sit and write or work on a computer.  The house is very private and is located in a .5 acre yard with one other tiny house on the property. There is a small front porch and a chimenea for an outdoor fireplace and a patio table with four chairs. Guests have access to the entire house
transit: Free street parking is available. Car2go operates in the area and the closest TriMet bus stop is about a block away. From the airport, guests could take the Max line to a nearby stop and then walk to the house or take a bus to get closer.
access: Guests have access to the entire house and the yard immediately surrounding it where there is a chimenea for a fire and a patio table with chairs for outdoor dining, reading, or working.  Please do not disturb the other people who live on the property. They will know when guests are staying in my house and will not disturb you in return.
interaction: I will be available to greet guests upon arrival in most cases and will always be available by text messaging and email (sometimes by phone as well) in case of any questions or issues.
house_rules: Please no smoking in the house. Please do not disturb the tenants of the other living quarters on the property.

summary: Our two floor, 3 bedroom spacious home is perfect for a family.  The mainfloor has an open living plan with a large living room, dining room seating for 7, large kitchen with a dining counter, a kids' playroom full of toys, and the master bedroom with its own bathroom .  Upstairs there is a queen room, kids room with a single bed  + crib, and a sleeping nook with a single bed.   There is a large fenced-in yard with a grill, garden, lit patio and kids' toys.  It is 3 minute walk to bus line 17. Downtown is a 15 min drive or 30 min by bus. The green line Max is 20 blocks away.  Typical Portland residential neighborhood with all conveniences within walking distance.  There is also a driveway for off-street parking. My easygoing 30 yr. old brother lives in the basement.  He works a LOT, plays sports 4-5 nights a week and often stays with friends on weekends.  He also travels.  You may not see him, but if you do, he is outgoing, loves people and can answer any questions you have about Portl
space: It's a big house with a big yard and a very relaxing living room. Bus lines are very near.
description: Our two floor, 3 bedroom spacious home is perfect for a family. Upstairs there is a queen room, kids room with a single bed  + crib, and a sleeping nook with a single bed.   There is a large fenced-in yard with a grill, garden, lit patio and kids' toys. Typical Portland residential neighborhood with all conveniences within walking distance.  There is also a driveway for off-street parking. My easygoing 30 yr. old brother lives in the basement. transit: The are three great bus lines within a few blocks:  17, 9 and 14.
access: Laundry, kitchen, yard, grill, bikes if you set it up with us, crib, high chair, toys, Oregon guidebooks, comfortable chill space
interaction: A quick checkin once you get here. A neighbor might say hi. My brother uses the main door to get to his living space in the basement. He is rarely home but might occasionally use the kitchen.
house_rules: - Please treat our home as if it were your own.   - We have a chicken coop in the backyard and you are welcome to gather eggs.  There will also be someone who will stop by to check on them and make sure that they have food and water. - You are welcome to smoke, as long as it is outside.   - If you are visiting Portland for the recreational marijuana industry, please just smoke outside.  Our neighbors are cool with it, too. - We do have numerous bicycles in our garage.  If you want to use them, you need to bring a bike lock.  Bikes are frequently stolen and should not be left unlocked anywhere. - We prefer shoes to be taken off at the door, but we do not allow shoes upstairs on the carpet at all.  - The basement is only to be used for laundry.  The rest of it has our personal stuff that we request you to leave undisturbed. - no pets or animals. We are extremely allergic.

summary: With 1200 sq feet of downstairs space, you get your own bedroom, bathroom and large comfy TV room.  The fenced-in double lot allows your furry kid to run free with no worries.  Don't leave your dog at home when you visit Portland, stay with us!    I'm one of few PDX AirBnB hosts that are fully short-term rental permitted including passing a city inspection and have paid all fees to short-term rent.
space: You get a spacious private bedroom, private bathroom and private living room area.  Feel free to use the kitchen or laundry room and be sure to hook up to the free high-speed WiFi.   Your rented bedroom has a comfy queen bed with a remote for lifting your tired feet or propping your head/back to read in bed.  It also has a wonderful massage feature.  Cold sleeper?  Your bed is equipped with a heated mattress pad.  Crank up your side for warmth while your mate’s side can be off.   Your bedroom has a personal fan, heater and a white noise machine (we all struggle with "new noises" at unfamiliar places). Your bathroom has a complementary set of basic toiletries and a blow dryer is available for your use.    Your living room area has a large HDTV with surround sound entertainment.  You even get your own microwave, coffee maker, toaster oven, induction cooktop and mini-fridge to keep leftovers and your drinks cold!   Your basement suite is close to 1000 square feet in space!  So much room!

transit: My house is a 1 minute walk to Bus #17 on Holgate.  Only 3 minute walk to Bus #9 on Powell to access downtown Portland.  It is a 1 mile walk to the Holgate Green Line.  I live only 6 miles from downtown and close to great food places on Hawthorne.
access: My house is open to my guests.  The large downstairs area is very private and spacious.  Guests have access to DirecTV and free wireless internet.  Your backdoor entrance allows for easy access downstairs.  Oftentimes my guest come and go and I never see them the entire time they are staying with me.  If guests want to come upstairs to use the kitchen, fridge and dining area, they may.
interaction: I very rarely go downstairs when I have guests.  The space is yours and I respect your privacy.  I like meeting my guests near the beginning of their stay, but don't need to interact throughout your time with me.   Come and go as you please!  If you need anything, please come up and ask or text/call.
house_rules: Nobody likes rules.  The only two expectations is to have respectful guests and for you to enjoy your stay.  I want you to feel at home and be comfortable.  Leave your chaotic and crazy world behind and come enjoy Portland!!

summary: Our sweet little cottage is close to Lents Town Center, Lents Park, the MAX Green Line, Zoiglhaus Brewery, and Mt. Scott Park. The house is easily accessible no matter what your mode of transportation. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and furry friends (pets). While the place is small, it's well-appointed, clean, and would be a great landing pad for your visit to Portland!
space: Our sweet cottage includes one bedroom with a queen-sized bed, and a living room with a comfortable couch if you need space for a third person to sleep. The house also has a backyard that's partially fenced and that includes a covered patio.

space: Set in a beautiful neighborhood with views of the surrounding mountains this reservation is for one of two rooms that we have available.  There are two parks within walking distance, one with a playground for kids and one with walking trails.

summary: This awesome 750 sf space is the private lower level of a house and sleeps up to 4. High ceilings, huge windows and nice neighborhood that is near a park, 2 great food pods, Woodstock village, 80 walk score, 2 bus lines, Car to Go and a mall!
space: This space is the lower level of a house that has a private entrance. It has high ceilings, huge windows and is beautifully appointed. The kitchen is stocked with coffee set up and basics but if you need anything just ask. The bedroom has a king bed in the and a queen pull out bed in the living room. For some reason the head of the bed of the pull out seems a little lower than the foot but it has an adjustment to raise the head of the bed but it then shortens the bed length. You could sleep the other way but you wouldn't face the tv. This bed may be best for children or smaller adults. There's a queen air mattress alternative. There's a heavy mirror in the entry. It's well-mounted on a bracket. But just fyi.  Also, there's front knobs on the gas stove and a glass coffee table. Other than that ought to be pretty toddler proof.  We don't have a child's eating table/chairs or toys/games yet but working on it. Also no tub, just a shower. However the kitchen sink is big enough for a baby.

transit: The walkscore here is 80.  There is a crosstown bus a block and a half away which goes by a huge food pod (VooDoo Doughnuts!) within 10 minutes and a shopping mall within 20 minutes. The downtown bus is about 4 blocks away and takes about a half hour to 45 minutes depending on traffic to get to downtown Portland. It goes through fun Hawthorne district halfway in between. The bus system here in the Portland area called Trimet charges 2.50 per adult for 2.5 hours, $5 day pass and $26 weekly pass. You can pay cash on the bus or download payment on your phone to show the driver. Car to Go cars are generally within a block sometimes right in front of the house! Lyft and Uber are extremely close by and very available.  Free street parking and there's generally parking in front of the house. Depending on time day the airport is usually 15-30 minutes away. It's 10 miles away. Always check traffic conditions to have enough time to get to the airport.  The train station and Greyhound bus station
interaction: You can check in and out by yourself and there may or may not be people in other parts of the dwelling.
house_rules: Please do not park within 5 feet of any driveway; it makes it too difficult for neighbors to get in and out of their properties. To be permitted by the city we need the full names and addresses of all adult occupants staying and also the license plate number if driving even if a rental.  Please no smoking of any kind inside the residence. There's a bench outside at the entrance. No candles, incense or plug-in air fresheners.  Please no loud noises after 9. If coming and going after 9 please be mindful of the neighbors.  Be careful of the outer door to the unit slams easily.  Please no red wine or dark juice inside unit.  Please no berries on the couch.  Please no rough-housing inside unit.  Please don't move couch or bedside tables. Events will be decided on a case by case basis. We reserve the right to change any information here at any time for any reason.

summary: My roomy, private one bedroom (entire top floor) is cozy and quaint!
space: Our quite and roomy one bedroom apartment is the top floor of our 1908 bungalow. I live downstairs in the duplex and part time in the apartment. Both spaces share the same front door and a foyer. Our guests walk up a very safe set of stairs with a banister to the apartment door. The bathroom has a large shower, towels, a hair dryer, and a basket of courtesy items like shaving cream, q-tips, nail polish remover, hair care product and other goodies. The kitchen rocks. We have everything you  need to make some serious food. We keep everything clean and organized. We have the usual pots, pans, and utensils.  This is actually one of Portland's really ethnically diverse neighborhoods. My family is mixed race and we welcome all into our home. Down the street are food cart pods,  Russian bakeries, art studios, Asian grocery shops, noodle joints, a mostly Vietnamese library branch, two coffee shops, and American brunch spot Bar Carlo, and Red Castle Games (nerd table-top game mecca) all within

transit: Free street parking.  Uber, Lyft, peer-to-peer car share city! Downtown Portland and the PDX International Airport are both easy 20 minute drives in non-peak traffic from here (in opposite directions) Hawthorne is a 7 minute drive and the Woodstock neighborhood is minutes away by car or bike. Reed College is less than 10 min drive. Trimet's #14 bus line (SE Hawthorne to downtown) picks up every 15 minutes from Foster Rd. should you not have a car during your stay.
access: Keyed lock box to makes any arrival time easy. I try to leave the upstairs apartment door open for your convenience when you arrive with luggage.  The backyard is not available to guests. It is an emergency only via the back stairs.
interaction: Whatever works for your needs! Most people like privacy, a few recommendations, and a run through if requested.
house_rules: Don't be evil.  Smoking tobacco in the house is a deal breaker. The bathroom is in the house.  We don't compost for allergy reasons. Recycling is great and much less stinky.  The Murphy bed is retired. Any kinetic activity on the 100-year-old, metal bed frame is an instant and noisy deal breaker:) Rulz Rule! DEAL BREAKERS... OVERKILL COMMON SENSE EDITION!!! I've been a host for many years and met tons of really great people. Unfortunately, lately, people new to the community have hotel expectations. If you need a great deal of flexibility, staying at my house may not work for you. So here's a really detailed breakdown of what you agree to before booking. I really encourage new folks to (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) "what to expect staying at an Airbnb rental" too for etiquette and to answer common questions. summary: Clean, spacious apartment, tastefully decorated with your comfort in mind.   Located in a quiet area of a great neighborhood with easy access to all the fun that southeast Portland and the Columbia Gorge has to offer.  Family friendly.
space: Nestle down in your own private apartment in our sunny, spacious, clean and newly constructed Portland foursquare home.  Spread out in your king sized bed in the bedroom or the queen pull out couch in the living room.   Sun blocking curtains for privacy and sleep ins.  Enjoy cooking in your fully equipped kitchen.   In addition to stove, microwave, full sized refrigerator, and coffee pot, there are appliances like slow cooker and rice maker.   Coffee, tea, honey, sugar are provided as well as growlers (glass containers) for local beer and kombucha purchases which is truly a Portland experience.    For those with children, there is a pack and play and cot in the unit so you don't have to travel with them.  We also have kids books, train set and games for kids of various ages.   We also have a fenced back yard and easy access to an amazing park.  Nicole is in an out of the main house with various hats she wears (mama, gardener, massage therapist) and is available via text or call for any
description: Clean, spacious apartment, tastefully decorated with your comfort in mind.   Located in a quiet area of a great neighborhood with easy access to all the fun that southeast Portland and the Columbia Gorge has to offer.  Family friendly. Nestle down in your own private apartment in our sunny, spacious, clean and newly constructed Portland foursquare home.  Spread out in your king sized bed in the bedroom or the queen pull out couch in the living room.   Sun blocking curtains for privacy and sleep ins.  Enjoy cooking in your fully equipped kitchen.   In addition to stove, microwave, full sized refrigerator, and coffee pot, there are appliances like slow cooker and rice maker.   Coffee, tea, honey, sugar are provided as well as growlers (glass containers) for local beer and kombucha purchases which is truly a Portland experience.    For those with children, there is a pack and play and cot in the unit so you don't have to travel with them.  We also have kids books, train set and games for
transit: You are welcome to park directly in front of our house, including in front of the driveway, or around the corner on 69th.  We try not to park in front of neighbors house out of courtesy.   Ten minute drive to Hawthorne, Belmont, Division, Ladds Addition and other east side destinations.  Three minute drive or fifteen minute walk to grocery, bars, restaurants, hardware store ,etc.  Forty minutes to Multnomah falls and other destinations of the Columbia Gorge.   Biking is amazing in Portland.  Bike maps are available in the unit.  If you bring bikes we can secure them on the property.   Walking distance to bus line.  Two miles to light rail.  Sixteen minutes to airport.
access: The gate to the left of the house opens to the walkway to the Nest entrance.  The door has a keyless entry which will be provided to you before arrival.
interaction: Your host, Nicole, is available to answer any questions.  She will interact as much or as little as you want to make your stay enjoyable.  Nicole loves Portland and helping you get the most of your stay.
house_rules: Common courtesy.   No parties or events.  Let us know if you'd like to have a guest or two over to visit before you invite them. Otherwise please arrange to meet with friends, who are not registered guests, at one of the many nearby establishments. Quiet hours from 10pm -7am.   Absolutely no smoking or pets allowed.   If you need something, don't hesitate to ask.

summary: A small, updated home, situated on nearly one-quarter acre in Mt. Scott. The yard is amazing, and the house is full of charm, good taste, and light.
space: The space is peaceful and tasteful. There are large windows surrounding the two main rooms, the living room and bedrooms have gorgeous antique hardwood floors, the bathroom is small, but fresh and recently remodeled.
description: A small, updated home, situated on nearly one-quarter acre in Mt. Scott. The yard is amazing, and the house is full of charm, good taste, and light. The space is peaceful and tasteful. There are large windows surrounding the two main rooms, the living room and bedrooms have gorgeous antique hardwood floors, the bathroom is small, but fresh and recently remodeled. Guests have full access to all rooms, the 1/4 acre yard, the basement, and the laundry room. I will leave space in the closets with hangers for your clothing. This is my year-round home, but I love sharing it when I am out of town for vacation or work. I am available via text if guests have questions. The house is walking distance to pubs and burger joints on Foster. The Irish pub on Foster (Mc-somethings) has surprisingly good pizza. Slingshot bar--a bit further up on Foster--has really good food (burgers, pork stew, etc.) and a super nice staff.  On Woodstock Blvd, there is a small, modern Mexican restaurant tucked in next t

summary: You will feel at home in this bright, clean, newly refinished daylight basement apartment. Features include bedroom with gas fireplace, full kitchen, bathroom/shower, bonus room with work desk, and access to laundry room with washer/dryer. Located on a quiet residential street, you have a private entrance through the garden gate, on-street parking, and a 5-minute walk to restaurants, shops, and public transit downtown.
space: You will have a separate apartment in the lower, daylight basement level of our home. The apartment has been recently remodeled and includes new carpeting throughout, bedroom with queen-sized bed and gas fireplace, completely equipped kitchen with complementary coffee and tea service, private bathroom with shower, and a bonus room with work desk.  You have access to a shared laundry room with washer and dryer.  The apartment is cozy, quiet, neat and clean, and has plenty of natural light through large windows and doors opening onto the secluded, fully enclosed back garden.
description: You will feel at home in this bright, clean, newly refinished daylight basement apartment. The apartment is cozy, quiet, neat and clean, and has plenty of natural light through large windows and doors opening onto the secluded, fully enclosed back garde
transit: The city bus stop is one block from our house, providing easy access to downtown within 25 minutes (Tri-Met 44).   From the airport a taxi costs about $40 USD. Alternatively, the MAX light rail runs from the airport to downtown for $2.25, at which point you can use the same ticket to transfer to the city bus to our neighborhood.  Contact us if you would like details.
access: You will have your own private access through the gate at the north end of the house, leading via a lighted path to the back garden and apartment entrance, with key-box.  There is on-street parking on the quiet street in front of our house.
interaction: Your hosts are Earl and Hien. Normally we will arrange to be present and greet you when you arrive and show you to the apartment.  During your stay you will be able to contact us at any time via phone or by knocking on our front door.  We will be happy to take care of any concerns you have to make your stay a pleasant and comfortable one, and to visit with you and share information about our favorite spots in Portland, based on our love of food, hiking, and music.

summary: Come stay in the little village of Multnomah within the city of Portland! Renner's bar in a stone's throw away, Marco's cafe, food trucks, Thinker Toys, and more!
space: Walking distance to everything and small town feel with the convenience of easy access to Portland!
description: Come stay in the little village of Multnomah within the city of Portland! Renner's bar in a stone's throw away, Marco's cafe, food trucks, Thinker Toys, and more! Walking distance to everything and small town feel with the convenience of easy access to Portland! Washer/dryer, parking spot, wifi, TV, kitchen things, linens, dishwasher. My sister and I typically rent out our condo while we're away. We have friends in the area, so if you need anything, please let us know and we can contact them if we are out of town. Hablo español, si tiene dudas o preguntas, mandame un mensaje. In the heart of the village: grab dinner at Journeys and sit around their fire pit. Have a beer at Renner's and play their Wednesday night bingo. Sit on the back porch at O'Connor's. Walk to coffee shops, Gabriel Park, catch a bus downtown. My favorite coffee shop is Maplewood which you can walk to through Gabriel Park. Yes, everything is in walking distance! Bus 44/45/64 stop is super close for easy downtown acce
transit: Yes, everything is in walking distance! Bus 44/45/64 stop is super close for easy downtown access. I have a parking spot in the back of the building (#9) if you need it. From PDX: take the Red Line MAX toward downtown Portland. Get off at the Rose Quarter Transit Center and switch to bus line 44. If will drop your off right in front of my condo. Cost: $2.50 Time: 1.2 hour. Buy your ticket before you get on the MAX (good for bus as well) at pay station in airport for $2.50. Or download the (EMAIL HIDDEN) where you can buy your ticket online.  Lyft/Uber available at PDX: (URL HIDDEN)

summary: A modern yet earthy 900 sq. ft backyard Cottage, located in "The Heart of Portland," the historic Multnomah Village neighborhood!  Featuring radiant heated bamboo floors, two bedrooms, full bathroom, full kitchen, and a dining area. The upstairs bedroom loft has one queen bed, and one twin bed, with a heating/air-conditioning unit. The downstairs bedroom has one queen bed. Main room has a full sofa-bed, a couch, coffee table, and an entertainment cabinet with games, puzzles, books, and more.
space: ☆The Secret Garden Guest House is a 900 sq. ft Cottage featuring: * Bamboo floors with radiant heat, warm board feels amazing! * High ceiling downstairs, and cozy loft ceilings upstairs.  * Four skylights, two are venting.  * Reclaimed fir beams and fir trim. * White paint with Color House Zero-Voc paint. * American Clay in bathroom. * Decopoz earth plaster in kitchen & shower. ☆ Kitchen appliances & amenities: * New samsung range with stove and oven. * New samsung dishwasher, with ecover dishwasher tablets (under sink). * New microwave. * New toaster over with convection.  * New sink, faucet & garbage disposal with ecover dish liquid, and doterra onguard handsoap.  * New flatware, dinnerware, and glassware. * Refrigerator. * Cuisinart coffee maker. * Oster hot water kettle.  * Crock Pot. * Paper towels. * Breakfast is NOT included, although you may find tea, coffee, instant oatmeal packets, coconut oil, wine, etc... And you are welcome to it! :)  ☆ Dining Area / Main Living Room: * Ik

Featuring radiant heated bamboo floors, two bedrooms, full bathroom, full kitchen, and a dining area. The upstairs bedroom loft has one queen bed, and one twin bed, with a heating/air-conditioning unit. The downstairs bedroom has one queen bed. Main room has a full sofa-bed, a couch, coffee table, and an entertainment cabinet with games, puzzles, books, and more. ☆The Secret Garden Guest House is a 900 sq. ft Cottage featuring: * Bamboo floors with radiant heat, warm board feels amazing! * High ceiling downstairs, and cozy loft ceilings upstairs.  * Four skylights, two are venting.  * Reclaimed fir beams and fir trim. * White paint with Color House Zero-Voc paint. * American Clay in bathroom. * Decopoz earth plaster in kitchen & shower. ☆ Kitchen appliances & amenities: * New samsung range with stove and oven. * New samsung dishwasher, with ecover dishwashe
transit: Via Car: ☆ PDX Airport is 17 miles distance via freeway. ☆ Driving from PDX Interstate-5 South, take exit 296 B/ Mulntomah Blvd. Turn left onto SW 37th Avenue, Portland, OR; 97219. Our address is 8133.  ☆ Via Max Stations (aka light rail):   * Washington Park is 3.1 miles * South Waterfront/ SW Moody is 3.4 miles * PSU South/ SW 5th & Jackson is 3.4 miles ☆ Via Bus Service, Portland Trimet * 45-Garden Home to Mulnomah Village at 37th & Capitol is 0.3 miles.
access: ☆ Free street parking, and there's ample space. ☆ Please do not block gate. Park temporarily in front of the large garden gate to unload/load only. ☆ Enter through the large garden gate, located on the right side of the house address 8133. Beyond the gate in the backyard is your cottage just straight ahead. There is an airbnb lockbox with your house key located to the left of the french door. We will message you the code when your arrival time nears. ☆ Night time arrivals will see cafe lights above the large side gate, enter here. The string of lights leads you to the cottage's french doors, where there is a farm light over the entrance. We are always available if you have any questions or need anything, so don't hesitate to message us via your airbnb app. :)
interaction: ☆ We are a family of four, and live in the main house. We share a backyard with your cottage guest house. We are usually here and readily available if you need anything, but we very much respect your privacy. Your place is in the backyard, through the large garden gate located on the right side of our house ( at 8133 SW 37th Ave. PDX, OR; 97219). You should have everything you may need, but don't hesitate to message us if you need anything, or have any questions. ☆ We have a gray-brown cat named Lily, and an American Shepard (aka Mini Aussie) named Jasmine, but I doubt you will see them since they access the front yard only.

space: We live in a unique neighborhood. The picture on the cover is from our block. While you are here you'll want to walk around and explore. There is so much to discover

space: Beautiful modern space with privacy in Sellwood section of Portland, Oregon.Features include oak floors, Queen size Murphy bed, HDTV with Blue-ray player, heated tile floors in full bathroom with glassed in shower stall. Kitchenette with refrigerator, inductive stove top, microwave and filtered water.  Antique shoppers delight in very walkable neighborhood with grocery store, restaurants, coffee shops, antique stores, galleries, bars, bike stores, etc. Nearby is Springwater Trail which connects walkers, cyclists and joggers to downtown Portland and beyond. Sellwood Park has swimming pool, playground, tennis courts and playing fields with wooded trails to Oaks Bottom for bird watching and other wildlife.  Near to the park is Oaks Park Amusement Park, a Coney Island-like amusement center with rides ranging from carousels to roller coasters. It also has a roller skating rink and also hosts Roller Derby matches at various times of the year.  For golfers, beautiful Eastmoreland Public Golf

transit: There is a bus line that stops a block and a half away. I also recommend that visitors try Car2Go, as it allows them to pick up a rental car in the neighborhood and drop off at their destination within the Portland area. There is also a very convenient set of bike trails that connect all around the city within a block of our residence.
house_rules: We live in a quiet neighborhood, so we ask that you please keep the noise to a minimum. We also ask that you please respect our neighbors and our privacy as we will respect yours. Please take care of what is in and around the property and if you run into any problems with any of the amenities, please notify us at once. Finally, please turn off heat/air conditioning when you go out to save electricity.

summary: Private room in a two bedroom house with a highly-rated luxury mattress that always delivers an amazing night's sleep! The bedroom window overlooks a green backyard and our vegetable garden for a peaceful awakening. My boyfriend, Adam, and I are young professionals and are excited to have you stay with us in our humble home. We live in a quiet residential neighborhood and welcome guests looking for a comfortable base during their visit to Portland.
space: Our extra room works great for an individual or couple; unfortunately, it is not suitable for children.  The TV in the bedroom has a Chromecast attached that you can connect to through your smartphone and play your own Netflix, etc. A white noise sound machine to use if you'd like. One closet and dresser provide plenty of room to store your belongings during your stay.   You will be sharing the bathroom with just the two of us and it is equipped for a warm shower. We provide soap, shampoo/conditioner, and clean towels for our guests. There are extra blankets and a space heater, as well as a fan, to make the room as warm or cool as you need. We have central heating and double pane windows to keep the room comfortable during the winter months.

We provide soap, shampoo/conditioner, and clean towels for our guests. There a
transit: Lyft and Uber a great way to get around town. We're also a 5 minute walk to both the Orange Line MAX light rail and the bus line. Our house is also within walking distance of many great activities, food, and drinks.
access: Guests will be given a key to the house at check-in, which they can use to come and go as they please.  You are free to use the kitchen to cook meals and we can clear fridge space without a problem. It's a little small, but sharing is caring! We have all kinds of cookware/appliances that you're also welcome to use, and of course, ask that you respect them as if it were your own. On most days we will only be using the kitchen to cook dinner, so we'll usually be out of the way. We have a kegerator in the basement that is typically stocked with a local fresh beer and you are welcome to fill up a pint whenever you'd like.  Come hang out in the living room! We're glad to have you and love making new friends.
interaction: We've lived in Portland for a collective 12 years and have experienced and explored much of what the city has to offer. We're always available to give tips or suggestions, all you have to do is ask.  We are generally home in the evenings and are away at work during the day. We love to engage in conversation, but are more than happy to give you any amount of privacy you'd like.

summary: A cozy and comfy 4 bedroom, 2 bath home in one of the most desired neighborhoods in Portland. Sellwood-Moreland is a quaint little town with shops, restaurants and other activities. We have a large yard for the area.  It can get a little noisy during rush hour with McLoughlin Blvd/99 not far away but it is close to downtown and is convenient to get to public transportation.  Perfect for large families or groups. We enjoy our home and we hope you will too!
space: Very spacious and cozy! One bedroom with a king bed, one bedroom with a queen bed, one bedroom with a double bed & twin on top (bunk bed), one bedroom with a twin day bed and a pull out double bed in the basement couch. We also have an air mattress if needed.

One in upstairs and one in fully finished basement. Only spot not for guests are closets upstairs and office downstairs.  You have access to 2 TV'
transit: Close to the Orange Max line with direct access to downtown Sw Waterfront. About a 15 minute walk to Sellwood shops & restaurants. 10 minute drive to downtown PDX.
access: Have access to the entire house including Washer/Dryer, full kitchen and feel free to park in the driveway. There are 2 family rooms. One in upstairs and one in fully finished basement. Only spot not for guests are closets upstairs and office downstairs.  You have access to 2 TV's and Free Wifi. There is a grocery store (QFC), banks (Wells Fargo, Bank of America, etc.), tons of restaurants, frozen yogurt (Nectar), and a park all within a 15 min. walk.  There is so much within a 10-15 min. drive from our home also.

description: This space is one or two bedrooms in a craftsman house in southeast Portland's Westmoreland neighborhood. The house is near the Sellwood/Moreland commercial district with a vibrant restaurant and shopping experience. Reed College and the Alladin theater are nearby. This listing includes an upstairs bedroom (the red room) with a queen bed, drawers, lamps, chair, closet with shelves.  Also included is a private bathroom.  In addition, a second bedroom (the blue room) is available for an additional fee. The blue room has a queen size futon.  There is a simple desk, chair, and light for computer use. The space has wifi. space: This space is so cozy and private and is located in 2016's 2nd best Neighborhood Sellwood-Moreland on the West Coast by Sunset Magazine.  (URL HIDDEN) Walk-in access to the room and bathroom in fully finished basement. Incredible neighborhood that includes fantastic dining, an amusement park, 5 parks within a 2 miles including dog off leash park, Sellwood Pool, EastMoreland Public course is a five minute walk, Rhodadendrum Flower park and much more.  Bike trail connecting to Spring Corridor, and Oaks Bottom Grocery and Moreland Theatre within a mile. All walking distance in 10 minutes.  You'll experience Hospitality at its finest and be able to get great advice about the city from restaurants to must see places. 15 minutes from Downtown 15 minutes from Moda Center - Home of the Portland Trailblazers. yes we have Blazer tickets available  inquire before or after booking if interested.  10 minutes from OMSI
