summary: Our home is a 1920's bungalow in the heart of Sellwood. A short walk to restaurants, parks, bike trail, breweries, pool, antique malls and the Willamette River. Very private, well-lit mother-in-law basement suite with kitchenette, en-suite bathroom, & laundry room! King size bed is super comfy. 2nd bedroom if needed. Can accommodate 4 guests. Separate access and outdoor patio with BBQ. Ample parking and quite family neighborhood. Close to public transport TRI Met bus line and light rail.
space: What makes our apartment special is that it is very private you have your own entrance and most of the amenities you need while traveling. Most stores, coffee shops and restaurants are walking distance from the apartment. We have a super comfy king size bed which promises you a good nights sleep. We are mostly on the property each day and can accommodate your needs while traveling. We have the ability to host 4 guests (2 bedrooms) and possible 2 more on a super comfy inflatable bed if needed. The apartment leads out to a small patio with a BBQ and patio furniture and a lovely garden.

There are car rental offices 3 miles from our home, and Enterprise Car rental will pick you up if you need a rental. Downtown is about 10 minutes north of our home.
access: You have a separate access to the main house and a lockbox provided for anytime check-in.
interaction: We are always home and can help you with any tips or suggestions of places to visit during your stay. Well really enjoy meeting our guests during their stay and their comfort is a top priority to us.
house_rules: We are a non-smoking home but have no problem with smokers smoking outside the house on the patio or in the garden. This is a drug free home. No recreational drugs allowed on the property please including marijuana. No pets allowed. Please let us know if you damage anything before you check out.  We are fine with noise but request that all loud music be turned down after 11 pm.  Check in at 3 pm and check out at 11 am.  We do charge $25 for any guests after 2, so please be sure to mention this in your booking. Thanks in advance for respecting our house rules.

summary: The best thing you can possibly do if you are considering staying with us is to stop reading this right now, scroll down, and read the reviews from 196 of our past guests. If you're seeking the complete Portland experience, this is the place to stay.
space: This private bedroom with a ceiling fan has a queen-size bed. Please note: our house isn't well suited for small children. Kids over the age of 12 are welcome! We are cannabis friendly, but we ask that you use the side porch and fire pit area to enjoy it. No smoking in the house, please. **Please note***There is construction going on next door. They work M-Saturday from 7am-6pm. We have no control over this, but we do supply earplugs. The shared bathroom is right across from the bedroom.

summary: Welcome to our gracious, art-filled home, built in 1892 and located in historic Sellwood.  You will have the entire second floor with your own private entrance,  living room & 2 full bedrooms, spacious bathroom and kitchenette.  See photos for detailed descriptions.
space: Welcome to Portlandia!  You will enjoy an authentic Portland experience in our wonderfully walkable Sellwood district.  Over 25 restaurants, coffee shops, tea rooms, gastropubs, as well as natural food grocery and deli, vintage and antique shoppes, movie, puppet and live theatre -- all within 10 blocks.  Many outdoor recreational options, and still close in, 12 minutes from downtown Portland.
description: Welcome to our gracious, art-filled home, built in 1892 and located in historic Sellwood.  You will have the entire second floor with your own private entrance,  living room & 2 full bedrooms, spacious bathroom and kitchenette.  See photos for detailed descriptions. Welcome to Portlandia!  You will enjoy an authentic Portland experience in our wonderfully walkable Sellwood district.  Over 25 restaurants, coffee shops, tea rooms, gastropubs, as well as natural food grocery and deli, vintage and antique shoppes, movie, puppet and live theatre -- all within 10 blocks.  Many outdoor recreational options, and still close in, 12 minutes from downtown Portland. You will have your own private entrance to second floor.  There is a covered patio seating area in the front for your use. We work in our studio on the property and are usually available if you need something.  If we are not home, you can easily reach us by text or phone.  We value your privacy and tend to meet you at check in, if poss
transit: We have offstreet parking for one vehicle.  Bike rentals available in the neighborhood.  Buses available crosstown and to downtown.  Bus anda light rail with transfer to light rail for airport.  Ask us if you need further information on transportation options.  Uber is quite good in Portland. (possible discounts available for new Uber user).
access: You will have your own private entrance to second floor.  There is a covered patio seating area in the front for your use.
interaction: We work in our studio on the property and are usually available if you need something.  If we are not home, you can easily reach us by text or phone.  We value your privacy and tend to meet you at check in, if possible, and then typically you won't see us during your visit unless you seek us out.
house_rules: This is a peaceful and relaxing haven and not a party spot.  We live on the first floor so expect reasonable quiet after 10 pm and we will reciprocate! (that said, our home is wonderfully quiet from floor to floor and it is unusual to hear anything from one floor to the other)  No pets or smoking.  We also appreciate quiet voices when entering and exiting, as our neighbor has an office on the property line where she sees clients on weekdays.  Please park in driveway during your stay.  We provide a bistro table for eating and drinking in the living room.  Please no food or beverages in bedrooms.  Please read info book when you arrive.

summary: Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. Located in Westmoreland, near Sellwood you will have no shortage of places to eat, visit and shop! Downtown portland is only a quick bus, train or Uber ride away. You can even get to the airport on the MAX in about an hour! The house is 1917 with original wood floors, a beautiful back yard with patio furniture and BBQ Grill. The private room has access to a dedicated, private full bath with a clawfoot tub.
space: Your 146 square foot room is fully furnished with a queen sized bed, dresser and night stands. You will have clean sheets, towels and a Nespresso machine, snacks and a water pitcher with fresh, filtered water for your use. The 66 square foot bathroom will have; washcloths, body wash, shampoo, conditioner and other extra necessities such as; hair dryer, hair straightener, bath salts, toothbrushes, mouthwash, toothpaste razors and shaving cream, just in case you forget yours!

summary: This listing is for your own private basement suite including a full kitchen in our recently remodeled 1945 Cape Cod cottage. 4 miles to downtown Portland, 1.1 miles to Double Mountain Taproom on Woodstock, 1.4 miles to the heart of Division/Clinton, a short walk to Reed College. Our space is private, quiet, and centrally located for ease of exploring all that Portland has to offer. Fully inspected and legally permitted!
space: Explore the Rose City from our centrally located home in Southeast Portland. Perfect for a solo traveler, a couples' getaway, or a road trip with your best friend, our updated retreat is close to popular restaurants and boutique shops yet far enough from the noise that you can enjoy some rest and relaxation at the end of the day. Located in the Reed neighborhood, our home is within walking distance or a short drive to Trader Joe's, Reed College, Kenilworth Park, and to Division/Clinton and Woodstock shops and restaurants. This listing includes one bedroom, a full bathroom, and a separate living area/combined kitchen area in the basement of our house--all private just for you to enjoy. Clean, modern furnishings fill the space, including a futon for lounging and a small dining table to enjoy a meal prepared in your full kitchen or for spreading out your goodies from one of Portland's excellent casual dining/takeout restaurants. We have several board games, books, magazines, and a televis

transit: The bus stop for the #17 Holgate/Broadway is a 5-minute walk from our house. This bus goes into downtown and up north to Saratoga Street and the Concordia neighborhood. Max Orange Line at 17th and Holgate is a 20-minute walk from our house--you can take the #17 bus to get there too. We are a 20-30 minute drive to/from Portland International Airport. For more specific directions or help with travel plans, please ask!
access: The entrance to the apartment is located on the south side of the house. Our home is also accessible from this door, but there is another door that closes off our house, so your entry and the apartment is private. The bedroom sleeps two guests on a full-sized bed in a separate bedroom from the living area. If you have a car, you should find plenty of street parking in front of our house. Feel free to park in the driveway behind us for check-in and unloading if you’d like. Weather permitting you are welcome to wander in our backyard, have a picnic under the trees, or join us at the fire pit if you're feeling friendly! Access to a washer/dryer can be arranged--typically for longer stays.
interaction: We love meeting people and chatting but if you prefer privacy we are totally fine with that. We do like to meet you when you arrive but if you're going to be late or would prefer to just access the apartment on your own, let us know.  The BEST way to contact us during your stay for anything is to message us through Airbnb; we try to respond instantly. We have cats; they may try to interact with you! They're not allowed in the apartment but cats aren't big on following the rules--we have one who is very social and will probably want to meet you. If you really don't like cats, this might not be the place for you.
house_rules: House Rules/Info: Thank you in advance for treating our home with respect! We are flexible on check-in/out times, please just ask if you need different arrangements We appreciate quiet time from 9:00 pm to 6:00 am (10-11 pm to 7:00 am on the weekends) Please, please--please. Lock the outside door behind you when you come in, even if it's during the day. We've had a few instances of the door remaining unlocked overnight. We have two cats! They're old and will likely stay out of your way but please do be mindful of opening/closing doors and make sure they don't escape--if they do, please message us immediately Portland can be very wet—please remove your shoes when inside and wipe up any large drips on the floor, there are towels under the sink for this Communicate any damages or safety concerns as soon as possible Please place used towels and bedding in the laundry basket in the bedroom before you leave If there are dishes in the dishwasher, please start it before you leave--detergent is

My place is good for couples and solo adventurers who want a good amount of space ~800 sq feet, easy access to downtown, and clean, comfort at an affordable price.  Gas fireplace and great kitchen make this a super base camp for your Portland vacation.

summary: Easy walk to Reed College and the Woodstock district. Spacious room in tastefully remodeled 1915 Craftsman Bungalow. Commons room for relaxing and reading has mini fridge and Keurig. Cozy queen bed with fresh white linens bath down the hall. Comfortable, clean and quiet for a relaxing stay in Portland!
space: Plenty of room to spread out on the second story in my comfortable, warm and inviting home. This is one of two rooms I am making available to my guests. Both rooms are private but please keep in mind that there may be another guest down the hall and also sharing the bath. Both rooms have closets and dressers so feel free to unpack and get comfy. The commons room is a nice spot to relax and read. There is a mini fridge for your cold beverages and also a Keurig in the commons plus a copy machine and printer/fax should you need to work on business. Hi speed Wi-fi available for watching Netflix etc. but no access to cable television or even a television! So please bring your laptop. Both rooms have queen beds with mattress toppers, cotton sheets and warm blankets with lots of pillows.  The bathroom has been completely remodeled and wait until you get in the shower with its multiple shower heads and shower bar!

transit: There are three bus stops five minutes from the house another just a bit further that will take you to light rail which runs downtown.
access: Entry is through my front door with parking in the driveway or street. The kitchen will be available from 7 a.m. To 9 p.m.and is fully furnished with cooking utensils. Front porch is available for relaxing as well as my large living room. Please feel free to cook and use the dining room. I have a small Weber in the backyard and table and chairs on the deck for my guests to use.
interaction: I will be available to answer any questions you may have during your stay and if I don't know the answer I will find it for you.  Should you need a lift to or from the airport I'm available for a small fee, just let me know when you schedule your reservations.
house_rules: Smoking is allowed on the front porch only. Please leave your key with me upon check out if I am available, if not leave key in mail slot. I have dogs which are always either in my backyard or contained to the kitchen or my bedroom. They never go upstairs into my guest bedrooms areas. Parking is in the driveway or street. Please, always close and latch the front gates. Please be courteous and remove your shoes just inside my front door. Your consideration is appreciated! My kitchen is fully supplied with cooking utensils and my guests have space in the cupboards and a spot in the fridge for food storage. Kitchen use hours are from 7 a.m. Until 9 p.m. Please, always clean up after yourself and place dishes in the dishwasher. My dogs do bark from time to time, but all in all they are very friendly and pretty quiet. Quiet after 10 p.m. but no worries about coming in after that time as long as you are quietly respectful. Fire extinguisher is located under sink in kitchen and in hall linen

summary: A dream place to land in Portland!  This daylight basement apartment is spectacular. Brand new construction, 3 blocks from New Seasons, Eastmorland, and Reed College, 1 block from cafes and bus stop. Great dining and location--come and stay with us!
space: A newly constructed home with a separate entrance for this apartment. Tons of privacy with a family living above the space.  Gotta keep it real--we have small children who love to play chase.  The nearly 800 sq/ft apartment is spectacular. We are delighted to have people enjoy it as much as we do!
description: A dream place to land in Portland!  This daylight basement apartment is spectacular. Brand new construction, 3 blocks from New Seasons, Eastmorland, and Reed College, 1 block from cafes and bus stop. Great dining and location--come and stay with us! A newly constructed home with a separate entrance for this apartment. Tons of privacy with a family living above the space.  Gotta keep it real--we have small children who love to play chase.  The nearly 800 sq/ft apartment is spectacular. We are delighted to have people enjoy it as much as we do! The entire apartment will be yours. There is a full kitchen stocked with cook ware, dishes, glasses, silverware and the basic: salt, pepper, olive oil.  The entrance has a push button lock--code will be provided before your arrival. No key necessary. -- We are fully available if you need anything during your stay. -- I want to make sure you know up front: We have 2 active children -- we will do our best to keep the stepping light while you are sta
transit: -- We live right on the 19 bus line that will get you straight into Portland--about a 30 minute ride.  -- The light rail is about a 20 minute walk through Eastmorland--a beautiful neighborhood that begs you to walk longer. There is tons of street parking. It's a dreamy location.
access: The entire apartment will be yours. There is a full kitchen stocked with cook ware, dishes, glasses, silverware and the basic: salt, pepper, olive oil.  The entrance has a push button lock--code will be provided before your arrival. No key necessary.
interaction: -- We are fully available if you need anything during your stay. -- I want to make sure you know up front: We have 2 active children -- we will do our best to keep the stepping light while you are staying downstairs. We will be quiet for you between 9pm - 7am.  -- The water pipe runs along the SW corner of the downstairs living room (inside the wall). When water is used upstairs you will hear it slightly through the wall. Shouldn't be a problem, just want you to know. -- We will have breakfast available between 6-8am upon your request with an additional fee of $10 per person. -- We will be able to provide light grocery shopping if desired for an additional fee of $15 + the cost of groceries. -- Upon your arrival we will have a small welcome gift: a gift card to our favorite coffee shop or local grocery store. -- We have a dog who is not dog friendly--he loves people:)
house_rules: -- Need to ALWAYS lock the entry door. -- Need to ALWAYS close and lock the windows. -- We have white carpet--it's super helpful to remove shoes. -- We have small children and will be mindful of our guests. Between the hours of 9pm-7am -- we will not be walking overhead.

summary: Our Woodstock home has easy access to parks, restaurants, shops, bars, coffee shops, food trucks, grocery stores, and public transportation. The basement guest suite has plenty of room for 2-3 people to hang out and rest comfortably while enjoying Portland!
space: Our guest suite has its own entrance and includes a bedroom with queen bed, living room with tv, private bathroom, and breakfast nook with microwave, mini fridge, electric kettle, and coffee maker. We provide tea, locally roasted coffee, and snack items.  There is a futon in the living room  which can be converted into an extra bed. The door to the guest suite locks in addition to the outside door. A privacy curtain separates the bedroom from the rest of the suite. There is also access to our back patio for lounging with a book or enjoying your morning coffee.

There are several bike shops in the area where you can rent bikes or take advantage of Portland's bike share program. Uber and Lyft are convenient ways to get around as well. Andy and I are always happy to recommend bike routes, restaurant recommendations, and sight-seeing ideas!

summary: Our 1922 craftsman home rests on a quiet street walking distance to Woodstock neighborhood's restaurants, cafes, grocery stores, and dog friendly parks.  Our spacious basement suite has a private entrance and includes amenities for your comfort while in Portland-good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and furry friends (pets).
space: We've filled our space with treasures collected while traveling and guidebooks for the Pacific Northwest. A cedar wall, brick and handmade Guatemalan tapestries create a warm, calm space. We hope that you feel as comfortable and at-home as possible. The suite has a two piece bath and access to a utility sink. You are welcome to use the shower on the main floor anytime, as well as the refrigerator.  The basement suite keeps cool in the summer, and the furnace heats the space in the winter; you are welcome to use the windows, fan and extra blankets.

access: You're welcome to enjoy the fenced in, landscaped backyard with a large grass patch, and pick up after your pets as needed.  Your access to the suite is through a private outside door. Use Caution when opening the door and descending the 6 steps to the basement suite. You will access the main floor through a mudroom.
interaction: We can interact as much or as little as you'd like. A text, call or knock on the door will be a helpful "heads-up" when you're joining us on the main floor.  We enjoy sharing our joys of Portland, outdoor travels, and of our practice in design and healthcare.
house_rules: - If your pets are enjoying our space, please be respectful of the yard and clean their paws before entering the suite.

summary: VIEW! Funky, fabulous private unit has lower level patio entrance, faces S/SW toward a wide, beautiful view and lots of light. Tucked away in deep SE Woodstock, this is a perfect combo of urban & rural, close but removed, gracious style & free form.
space: This is a fresh, new guest room created in a recent remodel. Within the room is a private toilet/shower room with pocket door. Sink and vanity contained within room. Lots of color. Queen size bed. Desk and ergonomic chair. Refrigerator and Microwave. Coffee/tea/hot water and breakfast bars. Private entrance. Access to yard and garden. On premises, off-street parking. Easy access to bus lines.
description: VIEW! Funky, fabulous private unit has lower level patio entrance, faces S/SW toward a wide, beautiful view and lots of light. Tucked away in deep SE Woodstock, this is a perfect combo of urban & rural, close but removed, gracious style & free form. This is a fresh, new guest room created in a recent remodel. Within the room is a private toilet/shower room with pocket door. Sink and vanity contained within room. Lots of color. Queen size bed. Desk and ergonomic chair. Refrigerator and Microwave. Coffee/tea/hot water and breakfast bars. Private entrance. Access to yard and garden. On premises, off-street parking. Easy access to bus lines. All guests are invited to share the backyard gardens and may have access to laundry facilities on request. Host and owner, Kate, and other household members are often on site and available for consultation about local cuisine, entertainment, and nearby fun. You can have a lot of interaction or maintain your complete privacy - as you wish. This property
transit: Onsite parking in the drive! 2 frequent service bus routes within a few blocks of the house. UberCab and several traditional taxi services available. Go for a walk in the neighborhood and you'll find a mix of early to mid 20th century houses aside brand new structures. This is an evolving part of town with a new vibe. You'll find wide streets, narrow, streets, and streets that bear signs saying "roadway not improved." On these lanes you may find gravel or deep ruts/potholes, a tree in the middle, or maybe just a foot path! No worries though... plenty of ways to get through. The new Orange Line Max train stop is just over a mile away- a beautiful walk through lovely Eastmoreland to access. Very close to the Springwater Corridor Trail, Crystal Springs Rhododendron Garden, Reed Canyon. Off the beaten path but close to it all. Respite and rockin' fun combined. A great spot to watch the clouds or rain or sunlit sky, to relax and chill, as well as to be the jumping off point for any in town
access: All guests are invited to share the backyard gardens and may have access to laundry facilities on request.
interaction: Host and owner, Kate, and other household members are often on site and available for consultation about local cuisine, entertainment, and nearby fun. You can have a lot of interaction or maintain your complete privacy - as you wish.
house_rules: Please no smoking or cigarette butt disposal in the guest room. There is an ashtray at the back table where you can smoke. Please be respectful of other guests and residents on site. No pets in the room/no on-site place for guest pets.  Quiet please between 10p.m. and 7 a.m. Limit visitors to 2 extra persons unless prior arrangement has been made. Guests and their visitors are welcome to use outdoor spaces.  Room accommodates 1 or 2 people. No additional guests overnight. Children are welcome, including infants and toddlers, but you must provide your own crib or sleeping unit if that is needed for your circumstances.  Please respect the property and use with the care a well-created space deserves.

summary: I live part-time with my partner and would like guests to take advantage of a private full apartment. Mona the Cat will be slumbering away in the corner while you visit, so no other pets allowed.  My place is close to Woodstock Neighborhood, New Seasons Market, Clackamas Town Center, Downtown Portland, Division/Hawthorne/Belmont Neighborhoods. You’ll love my place because of the location. My place is good for couples, families (with kids) and big groups. 420-Friendly Neighborhood.
space: Large, open common space with full kitchen, dining room table, reading corner, chef's bar for entertaining, couch/tv (Netflix/Hulu), and fun art on the walls. 2nd Queen Bed is a tall Air Mattress.  If you're into cooking, there are plenty of cooking utensils/pots/pans with basic cooking necessities such as olive oil, s&p, spices. I do live here 50% of the time, so you'll see my personal food in the cupboards and fridge. There will be an open shelf in the fridge for your food. Complimentary coffee beans with grinder and french press provided. If more than 2 people are staying, you'll need to provide your own bedding and towels.  Please bring your own personal showering items.

Inside, the space is colorful, warm, and welcoming with a cozy large nesting chair to tuck yourselves into for a relaxing read, Chromecast session, cable TV show, or a bit of music in front of the fire.  Capacious bathtub/shower, vanity and sink contained in room. Private toilet in a separate space with locking door.  Queen sized bed. Desk. Small table and chairs. This space is designed for luxurious delight. It's an awesome respite after your Portland exploration, but it's so sweet you may not want to go out!

summary: Nestled below the up and coming SE Woodstock neighborhood my farm style house sits on a quiet unpaved road with loads of sun and backyard birds. There are nature trails, a local community garden and free roaming peacocks on this quiet road! I am a traveler, home cook and lover of the outdoors and my space reflects the influence of my adventures abroad. I live here with my son, dog and cat. This is perfect for solo travelers, business travelers and couples wanting a quiet getaway.
space: This is a spacious and bright room filled with lots of windows and your own private entrance to the backyard deck and patio. The secluded  back deck is a perfect place to have coffee or sit and read in the afternoon.  The room is decorated with a Moroccan feel and has a queen four poster bed with fresh linens and lots of pillows.  A mini fridge, coffee pot with local coffee and teas, a fruit bowl, sitting chair, TV and nightstand with salt lamp and chocolates are all things you will enjoy in this room.  There is a newly remodeled shared bathroom with a tub/shower and earth- friendly essentials provided. We are active people who love our city and are happy to share our favorite hikes, bites and fun spots with you.

summary: Your room is small but cozy and it has it's own entrance and own bathroom with a stall shower.  French doors open onto the shared deck and lovingly landscaped yard, great for listening to the birds and soft sounds of the city. We are on the SE side of Portland, close to Reed College and all forms of transportation. Woodstock Ave has many shops and restaurants and is only a few blocks away.  I do have a pack and play available if you have an infant.
space: It is small but cozy. The bed is a double with bamboo or cotton sheets. The shower has organic shampoo, conditioner and lavender body wash. There is a small drink station with your choice of french press organic fair trade coffee or local teas, fresh fruit and snacks.  A small refrigerator with filtered water is available. A desk is in the room if you  need to do any work and free Wifi access. Please let me know if there is anything you need and I will most likely be able to accommodate. We are in the Woodstock area and my place is just  a few blocks from coffee shops, bakeries, restaurants, grocery stores and just about everything you need. I am 48 blocks east of downtown with easy access to interstates. Bus lines are a few blocks and the orange line max train is 1.5 mile.

description: Southwest Portland is good for couples, solo adventurers, and furry friends (pets). Travelers, healers, yogis, and free spirits welcome! This listing includes two rooms (4 people can sleep) and a living space, patio and one and a half baths. This is great for a group or personal venture and the neighborhood is peaceful with a 10 minute drive to downtown or southeast. We are 5 minutes from Lake Oswego - walking distance to all necessities - grocery, dispensary, beauty salon & nails, coffee. A beautiful open space with good energy, art, and peace and quiet. Play your music, dance in the open space or nestle into the garden on a blanket with a favorite book to watch the butterflies intermittently. You have a kitchen, open space, downstairs den and living area that connects to the garden patio, washer and dryer. I will be meeting you and available throughout your stay! Beautiful, quiet, family neighborhood with 10 minute access to downtown and 25 minute airport ride, 5 minutes to Lake Oswe
transit: There are two buses on weekdays, bikes, although I don't have any to offer yet, will get bikes for  guests soon! Otherwise, Uber is great.
access: You have a kitchen, open space, downstairs den and living area that connects to the garden patio, washer and dryer.
interaction: I will be meeting you and available throughout your stay!

summary: My place is close to 1 Block from Marijuana Dispensary, BBQ Grill, Subway, Nails, Hair, 3 blocks from Grocery Market, Coffee, Gas, convenient to I-5 and 10 minutes from Downtown.. You’ll love my place because of the ambiance, the comfy bed, the outdoors space, and the neighborhood. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and furry friends (pets).  It is a friendly family neighborhood and a great place to land  for a few days with friends.

summary: Quiet, casual and comfortable, this peaceful room with a queen bed is in a beautiful SW Portland home and residential neighborhood.  We are within walking distance of Tryon Creek trails and Nature Center, Lewis and Clark College and minutes from downtown by car.
space: My home is at once serene and filled with vibrant color.  The house is surrounded by gardens and set back off the street in a safe, quiet neighborhood.
description: Quiet, casual and comfortable, this peaceful room with a queen bed is in a beautiful SW Portland home and residential neighborhood.  We are within walking distance of Tryon Creek trails and Nature Center, Lewis and Clark College and minutes from downtown by car. My home is at once serene and filled with vibrant color.  The house is surrounded by gardens and set back off the street in a safe, quiet neighborhood. Bedroom, bathroom, kitchen for breakfast and refrigerator for food storage, deck, garden Minimal Beautiful, safe, quiet neighborhood, close to nature as well as the city. Bus stop with service to downtown is 3 blocks away.
transit: Bus stop with service to downtown is 3 blocks away.
access: Bedroom, bathroom, kitchen for breakfast and refrigerator for food storage, deck, garden
interaction: Minimal
house_rules: Quiet hours are between 10:00 pm  and 7:00 am. Smoking is not allowed anywhere on the grounds.   We wear shoes in the house, but request that you remove shoes in the bedroom during rainy months.   We have a cat and two friendly dogs, therefore, we request that guests not bring pets.   Guests need to provide their own food and can have access to the fridge.   Guests should plan to keep their personal items in the guest room, however, they may leave toiletries in the bathroom for the duration of their stay.  We are child friendly and would love to welcome kids of any age (a seven year old lives here!).   No parties or events, please.   No drugs.

summary: Permitted and licensed.  Originally built as an all-season cottage retreat for a businessman's family in Portland in 1938.  Beautiful 2nd growth wooded lot.  20 minutes from downtown by car.  Bus service at end of the street.  Friendly residential neighborhood.
space: Morning light from the East.  Quiet room.   The bed has three layers:  box spring, firm matrress, and memory foam top layer.  Most folks like it, but if it is too soft, we can adjust it. Shared bathroom.
description: Permitted and licensed.  Originally built as an all-season cottage retreat for a businessman's family in Portland in 1938.  Beautiful 2nd growth wooded lot.  20 minutes from downtown by car.  Bus service at end of the street.  Friendly residential neighborhood. Morning light from the East.  Quiet room.   The bed has three layers:  box spring, firm matrress, and memory foam top layer.  Most folks like it, but if it is too soft, we can adjust it. Shared bathroom. Relax in the warm cozy living room.  Cook in the efficient, well equipped kitchen.  Breathe deeply in the private wooded grounds. Shared bathroom. I'm an older professional musician and theatrical designer.  I really love this town.  Let's go sightseeing? I have the first house on the street.  The old growth trees in this neighborhood were logged off in the early 1900s.  Then it was cow pasture.  All of the large trees are second growth, and we take care of them.  Beautiful urban parks nearby.  Barbor World Foods is walking dist
transit: This is a good neighborhood for vigorous walking.  I bicycle, but we're up on a hill, so it's easy to go somewhere, harder to come back up.  lol. Busses on the #44 line go right by at our corner, and can take you to the Barbur Transit Center less than a kilometer away.  From there the #12 takes you straight into downtown and connects with the MAX light rail. And Uber/Lyft is on your phone. Parking in our driveway.
access: Relax in the warm cozy living room.  Cook in the efficient, well equipped kitchen.  Breathe deeply in the private wooded grounds. Shared bathroom.
interaction: I'm an older professional musician and theatrical designer.  I really love this town.  Let's go sightseeing?
house_rules: Yes, smoke somewhere else. Yes, leave your pets at your place. Yes, ask me first before allowing overnight guests. Yes, we're pretty quiet after 10pm. Yes, recreational marijuana is allowed in Oregon.  But you'll want to smoke it somewhere else.

summary: 20 minutes from Downtown Portland but peaceful with lots of space for relaxing. Off street parking, safe neighborhood, large yard, close to Tryon Creek Park, 5 minutes from Lewis and Clark College, fruit trees, laundry/kitchen available.  Private bathroom.
space: Whether you are exploring the city or the beautiful region around Portland, you will find a calm, relaxing haven at the end of your day.  In summer there are few better place to rest than on the deck in the warm air as the sun sinks behind the trees and the light fades in the rustling of the trees.  In winter, a wood fired stove as the sitting room comfortable and cozy. There is high speed internet. There are plenty of books!   Microwave and tea kettle available. Use of the kitchen for evening meal preparation is  an additional $5, laundry/drier is available for occasional use. Dry British humor lurks around every corner, so beware!

transit: The house is about 2 miles from regular bus services.  Cars can be parked at the Barbur Transit Center and you can take the #12 bus into downtown Portland.
access: Access is through the door in the carport, and we leave shoes on the tile to preserve carpets.
interaction: I hike a lot so know the area mountains well and can provide ideas on where to hike and also ideas on day trips.  Restaurants, Portland has so many, however I not much help as I tend to cook at home.  There is a BBQ available for guest to use at no charge, please just clean up after yourselves.  Business travelers welcome, there is a slow but functional printer for emergencies and printing boarding passes. High speed wireless internet.
house_rules: We remove shoes before walking on carpets, slippers are provided.  Quiet time is from 11 pm to 7 a.m.  Kitchen use (other than microwave and tea kettle) is available for $5 a day, please wash up all items and keep the kitchen clean.  Washing machine and drier are also available.
